Author: kirilcvkirilov
Review_Title: Too much miss, too little hit
Review: The overall idea of the plot was good, but the execution not so much.

Author: cinistersynthicate
Review_Title: Not only is this not a good Thor film. It's not a good film.
Review: With review I'm going to try and not speak about anything to do with comic book accuracy, mainly because in short you can definitely throw any of that out of the window with this movie, and instead I am going to just focus on the film itself and why I don't like it. First of all I just want to say that Thor Love & Thunder is the first ever comic book film I watched where there felt like there was nearly zero at stake. The tone of the movie is just so all over the place, the dialogue was something that my 8 year old nephew could come up with, the story seemed good on paper but was not executed well and that could be because there might be a lot of things removed, the pacing just made me feel like I was watching this for almost three hours when in all reality it was among one of the shortest of the Marvel films. Wrap up all of these issues into one big bow and you got a product that feels like actually two separate films in one movie. I briefly scrolled through some of the other reviews on here and saw plenty of complaints this time around on Thor's personality, and how he's just in a full on idiotic form. In recent years, I have been feeling very strongly about this matter and it is in full effect within Love and Thunder to the point that it is blatantly obvious. As someone who did not care for Ragnarok I was not expecting a majority the humor to resonate well with me, I wont lie and say it was totally and purely awful, I think Waititi definitely nails the Guardians of the galaxy's humor well, not as much the Thor humor though. I didn't find most of the jokes in the movie funny and I think its safe to say that it appeared that my screening did not find most of the jokes funny either between the friend I attended with actually expressing to me he felt like he was almost "forced to laugh" at many of the jokes and the lack of the audience expressing a sign of laughter on most of the jokes. As it is, for whatever reason it may be, the runtime was restrictive enough as it was in a movie with a lot to accomplish, If only more time was focused on developing certain plot points, relationships, characters (especially Gorr the not-so-God butcher), and adding necessary details instead of focusing what joke they could nail next, I believe the impact that the audience was supposed to feel walking out at the end would have been greater, made more sense, and maybe even I would have liked it more.

Author: triadne
Review: First time in my life I've ever walked out of a film half way through.

Author: beornmatt
Review: Love and Thunder tries way too hard to capture the same humorous vibe as Ragnarok (one of my top MCU films, btw) while telling a very dark story about Gorr the God-Butcher and it misses continually. Hemsworth is great as Thor and did the best he could with what he was given. Christian Bale was head and shoulders above the rest as Gorr, and I wish we'd seen him as a real threat in a serious movie. He could have been a good sympathetic villain like Thanos and I wish I could have seen him in that capacity.

Author: prbessette
Review: With such star power and serious acting ability how on earth didn't somebody yell STOP? This isn't working! Write a script worthy of the actors who clearly did their job in preparation for this mess. All the blame for the much anticipated and highly hyped Thor: Love and Thunder lays at the feet of its director/writer Taika Waititi and I can't believe I had to write that. Often brilliant, all I could think of was why he didn't pass if he didn't want to make another Thor movie! I'm actually worried that someone will get the wrong impression that there isn't a story to tell about Thor when I'd pay to see this one again with a good script and with proper use of the available talent. These movies are made for young teens and enjoyed by adults and this turned me back into an early teen stomping my feet and yelling in my head at the screen for the lame jokes, the pitiful use of Russell Crowe, the tragedy of the lack of use of Christian Bale, (he finally has been given the right role to bother with a Marvel movie and you butcher his story?), the very indifferent story given to Natalie Portman to address the situation she is living in, and on and on. Why were The Guardians even there? Another complete waste! How do you manage to waste Chris Pratt and Brad Cooper too? Not to mention the star!! Hemsworth worked unbelievably hard to prepare for this movie and even he was wasted in this nothing burger, poorly conceived and genuinely indifferent direction with no story, certainly not one worth telling, of what could shoulda woulda been THE blockbuster of the summer! WHO LET THIS HAPPEN!! I'm very worried that the wrong people will get the idea that there isn't a Thor story left to tell when this actor, who has basically dedicated his career to playing him and cares every bit as much as Benedict Cumberbatch does about portraying Dr. Strange, won't get credit where it's due because so much trust was placed in the wrong director because he had a hit with Ragnerok. He keeps saying he didn't want to make it again when that's exactly what he did! This story called for a script that took the material seriously, including humour that hit the target instead of lame 6 year old jokes! And mostly it needed the time, that extra 40 minutes given to Dr. Strange, to fully give Gorr the time he needed to show us his rage and anguish becoming the God Butcher, there's never been an actor better qualified to play a character with the depth of this one (think Oscar Isaac as Moon Knight, where was Christian Bale's chance to bring his incredible performance out of the shadow because he was robbed of story time?). And also time to truly let us feel that Natalie's Jane Foster was the love of Thor's life who this all powerful god could do nothing to save? Where was their moment? Honestly Mr. Waititi, I don't think you wanted to make another Thor movie period and you should have been big enough to pass on it or get help when you knew your script wasn't nearly enough to properly serve the characters in a movie that clearly WASN'T Ragnerok but an epic tale which you admittedly said you filled with every single suggestion received by 6 year olds. How could you? How do you sleep? You're the king of comedy in New Zealand but you're more than that, you can be overly silly but you're extremely intelligent and must have known this was headed off the rails early enough to save it from a near complete disaster! WHAT WERE YOU THINKING???

Author: dupregalaxy
Review: Unfortunately the film itself seems to be quite underwhelming.

Author: BandSAboutMovies
Review: This is a movie of weird inconsistencies and you're either going to be forgiving or you're going to hate it. Or maybe you're a Marvel fan and will just love anything they put on screen. I'm predisposed to enjoy comic book movies because I remember an era when all we got was Ron Ely as Doc Savage -- and we liked it -- and fake Iron Man TV movies like Exo-Man, so I always wonder when people dislike these movies for reasons -- that I'll get into -- it kind of makes me wonder how filmgoers went from being so afraid of the train in The Great Train Robbery and then a few years later didn't think motion pictures were dark magic and started saying, "Oh, this is kind of boring."

Author: spikeybwoy
Review: Got to see this at the UK premier last night and have to say I thoroughly enjoyed it. The narrative reminded me of a fairy tale and the way stories are passed from generation to generation, while Ragnarok is still my favourite Thor movie cudos to Marvel Studios for giving Taika Waititi the chance to make a super hero movie for kids of all ages.

Author: abhibnlcs
Review_Title: These people need to stop and take some rest to come up with a proper movie
Review: I do not understand who's coming up with these stupid ideas and what's more baffling is that that someone's approving these and actually making a movie out of it.

Author: eddidvd
Review: I really wanted to enjoy it, but it made me want to leave after 20 minutes. I am actually appalled at the amount of good reviews online. I know the movie is supposed to be light hearted and a comedy, but it still fails in an astonishing fashion. IT IS SIMPLY NOT FUNNY. I was not the only one to think so either. It was really painful to hear the silence in the cinema after most of the supposed "jokes". The pacing was terrible as well, with most of the movie not driven by plot points but by what jokes Taika Waititi found funny; some were rehashed old jokes as well. There are good actors in this movie but their characters are stupid and too goofy for us to appreciate them. Thankfully, Anthony Hopkins' character is dead, otherwise we would have heard him tell fart jokes. The dialogue is the worst part by far, with most lines sounding like they were written by 4th graders. Bale is an amazing actor and his character was one of only good things about the movie; however, his ark was also understandably limited and a little superficial. The random cliche cgi monsters did not help the movie either.

Author: netflixry
Review: At best Thor: Love and Thunder is a 4.out of 10. I'm a HUGE fan of Taika Waititi, and of the Marvel Universe. Thor: Ragnarock is my favorite Thor movie, and one of my top five favorite MCU movie, but Love and Thunder is just an absolute train wreck. A total swing for the fences, and a miss. Unfortunately it seems they were swinging for fences which most likely border the Three Stooges Universe, and nowhere near the MCU. Is Love and Thunder worth watching? Yeah there's some entertainment there, but don't go expecting a top notch MCU experience. Lower your expectations a lot. Otherwise you're in for a big dissapointment.

Review: I have been a fan of the thor films, me and my fiance in our early 30s have stayed up to date. But this just lost it way. There was a lot of potential here for a fun Thor movie but it came across as more silly than anything else. The plot was there but the script seemed like it was written by a 14 year old who likes fart jokes. It could have been worse but it also could have been a lot better. Overall disappointed hopefully Marvel can recover from this one.

Author: roaches_97
Review: Yeah I said it, this film is worse than Dark World. It's painfully unfunny, the visuals are over saturated, and the plot is dumb. If Gorr's plan is to kill all the gods by wishing them out of existence, then why did he make himself known to them instead of staying under the radar and sneaking in to the magical bs wishing well? Why didn't Thor use his lightning powers that he had in Ragnarok to fight Gorr instead of risking losing his axe? There are tons of inconsistencies like this throughout the film. The performances are generally okay. Hemsworth does well as Thor, Natalie Portman is alright as Jane Foster, Tessa Thompson gives a terrible performance, and Christian Bale is the highlight of the movie. The movie just feels empty overall. It means nothing, there is no emotional payoff to any of it. And the sad thing is, this is one of the better post-Endgame Marvel movies.

Author: dibnah-1
Review: Well they have finally destroyed yet another franchise. I love these types of films when done well, but lately the marvel universe seems to be written as a terrible 1970s parody of a big budget film. The writing is poor and vacuous. It's like a school year 7 drama lesson on improv. I seem to be writing a lot of reviews like this these days. So why is Disney running all its franchises? All the lead actors in this are playing it as though they are in a low budget children's TV series. Thor is bad enough, but when e get to zeus, I can't believe how far both actors have fallen. I am so glad I didn't see this at the cinema. It seems to me the special effects budget outstripped the budget for a script. Save yourself some misery and don't watch this.

An hour because there could of been scenes to make to movie better like Scenes with Christian Bales Gorr the God Butcher killing 1 or 2 more over gods and other worlds would of made him a lot more menacing and it was so much potential there with the actor he is he did well with what hes had but the run time of the movie felt to short it done that with Doctor strange MoM now Thor love it but give us a longer movies in future 2 hour Marvel films are to short to tell a full on story.

Author: VinsendVega
Review: Although I realy enjoyed Taika Waititi idiosyncratic style in Jojo Rabbit, It doesn't work for a movie like Thor. Previous Thor movies where never too serious and already had plenty of humor. Making a parody of a character like this just feels fake and turned the whole movie into a somewhat childish joke. The relationship between Thor and jane is very different from previous movies and I should probably tell you the director has taken a lot of artistic liberties with their back story. Thor is turned into a goofy Homer Simpson-type of loveable Idiot and the entire first half of the movie feels very empty. Some parts do get a good laugh but for me the whole movie was far too silly and childish.

Author: UniqueParticle
Review: I saw in IMAX a few hours ago which was mostly great, the action is top notch, surprising amount of comedy, along with so so writing although Christian Bale is one of the best things about the movie! Very enjoyable Thor despite anything Love and Thunder is epically entertaining should be praised a fair amount. Well directed fun Marvel experience that has the right elements a bulk of the time! Author: frank-71651
Review: Love and Thunder is a glorious misfire, a tone-deaf amplification of the first movie dead set on delivering more of everything that made Ragnarok such a welcome change at the time. Most of the time it's a painfully unfunny screwball comedy where Thor's role as the village idiot is amped up to eleven, while a running joke involving screaming goats and Lady Thor's search for a suitable catchphrase make up the rest of the movie's many, many moments of levity. This is juxtaposed with serious moments involving terminal illness of a character the producers thought needed some sort of undercooked closure. The budget, which could eradicate hunger in a small eastern European country, is mostly wasted on achingly blinding CGI that gives the film the sheen of a Saturday morning cartoon. Most of the supporting cast is utterly wasted, including Russel Crowe's buffoonery as Zeus and Tessa Thompson's Valkyrie, who the writers couldn't find anything noteworthy to do but is in the move anyway. Christian Bale turns in a stellar performance as the movie's villain, and his backstory would've made for a more interesting movie than the one he's in. Taika Waititi is clearly having a blast but others should steer clear of this over-indulgent mess.

Author: jtrascap
Review: As this series goes on, it leaves the idea of nobility behind and makes the cast a bunch of rambling fools in search of a quest. The first Thor film may have been over-serious, but it pulled at the character in different ways and gave it depth; Thor had a genuine soul. This one reduces the character to a running joke about incompetence in anything but fighting - it's as if Marvel (Disney) made the series for a younger and younger audience each go round. All the characters are slight and one-note, the is plot thin and moves fast but randomly, like a drunk on a country road. It's such a shame - the original was about family, trust and honor - there's absolutely nothing honorable here. It just feels like a quick cash grab.

Author: horacioreyes
Review_Title: The irreverent fall of Thor and Marvel
Review: Undoubtedly the Marvel Universe has nurtured us with many interesting and entertaining movies. But it's already been months, if not years, that each production is worse than the previous one including TV series. Rehashes, threadless plots and increasingly meaningless. They had already given us an irreverent and, for me, unpleasant line from Deadpool, but this installment of Thor is really falling into a pit of mediocrity; I was tempted several times to leave the Cinema. The film has a great collection of great actors who I don't know how they agreed to participate in this fraud (They are only reason I gave one more star). It had a lot of potential, especially with the return of Jane Foster, I think that if Mr. Stan Lee came back and saw what they were doing with his "Universe" he would send them all to an alternate one. I had already promised myself not to see more of Marvel, but I thought Thor is Thor, I never imagined that they could do something so bad and without head or tail. RIP Marvel!!

Author: JackCowart34
Review_Title: An Unrefined, but Occasionally Creative Film
Review: Thor: Love and Thunder didn't seem interested in distinguishing itself as its own movie; instead, it acted as a continuation of the wildly well-received Thor: Ragnarok. I imagine Waititi felt that movie performed so well, critically and financially, that it was an open invitation for him to make the fourth entry in the Thor series even more zany. It's true that he has his own aesthetic, but it's an aesthetic that feels calculated rather than one that has naturally manifested itself as his career has progressed. Love and Thunder was overloaded with hit-or-miss jokes, while the dialogue felt obnoxiously simplistic, as though it had been dumbed down to a level appropriate for a children's book. Still, there were certain scenes that worked to perfection, like the cinematically blissful battle in the shadow realm. And although he didn't have as much screen time as I would have liked, Russell Crowe emanated pure likeability as Waititi's rendition of Zues. There is no doubt it would get my attention should they decide to pursue a Zues spinoff movie. As for another Thor movie, I'm indifferent.

Author: Erlik_Han
Review_Title: Can't believe I wasted my time watching this
Review: It feels like a bad imitation of a Waika movie / show. Like someone was a huge fan of "what we do in the shadows" (brilliant show) and decided to make a marvel movie. Idk what happened. The other Thor Waika did was great. To be fair the whole plot of his literal prop girlfriend (Portman) taking over the franchise, is hilariously bad. Hemsworth has become a iconic Thor. I'm sorry but you're replacing him with a a girl who looks like she's straight out of a romcom or period drama with CGI arms designed by an artist who doesn't understand proportions. Wonder woman was buff.. no need to enhance her physique to look more masculine. It's not like the hammer works on muscles lol.. it is magic that allows them to wield the hammer.

Author: halit_sener
Review_Title: This is a huge joke; disappointing
Review: If i take back Christian Bale from the movie; below 0. I can not believe in that. Thanks Mr. Waititi for destroying the whole Thor journey. I can not handle anymore funny things in the Marvel.

Author: nirvairsr
Review_Title: Not as funny or as good as Ragnorak
Review: This film is ok but nothing special. It doesn't feel as funny or as well made as Ragnorak and has that rushed sequel feel to it. There are some decent scenes but nothing that will stay in the mind once you've watched. It. Christian Bales performance is good and he makes the rest of the cast seem like weak actors. Worth watching but don't expect to be blown away.

Author: mr_animal
Review: Bad acting, terrible CGI, cringe humour and WAY TOO MANY JOKES, weak writing, lazy story line. I think you get the jist. This movie is an absolute miss. So disappointing.

Author: Millbags09
Review_Title: Too much of a good thing?
Review: I really wanted to like this movie. Thor Ragnarock is a great film, this isn't. I love the comedy of Guardians and Ragnarock, but this movie tries too hard, and too often to be funny but it doesn't land often enough and gets in the way of the story. It feels like a bit of a missed opportunity with some great characters and performances wasted. Having said that, I'm still looking forward to the sequel, I just hope that balance is restored and many of the weak jokes get left on the cutting room floor next time.

Author: kerrclaire

Review: Poor jokes. Poor story. Poor marvel circling the drain. Poor me who wasted 2 hours of my life on this hot garbage. I'm officially done with marvel. Sorry not sorry.

Author: kal_el27
Review: I would rather watch Thor: The Dark World on repeat for the rest of my life, than sit through that disjointed attempt at comedy ever again. 90% of the "jokes" (if that's what you want to call them), of which there are entirely WAY too many, fall flat.

Author: lorinmihaib
Review: This movie is a parody, a poor one. The storyline is too simplistic. There are way too many LGBT references. It seems like a manipulative propaganda. The movies is most surely targeting children, but it's better to keep it away from kids.

Author: ScoobySnacks66
Review: While a touch of Taika's farcical "What We Do In The Shadows" humour was splendid in Ragnorak, there's too much of it in this film. It's a non-stop corn-ball comedy hour full of jokes that could have been funny if I wasn't annoyed that they just didn't stop. All the corniness made it really hard for me to get invested in the characters. I just didn't care what happened to anyone in the film, I looked at my watch at least three times and was happy when it was over. Also, stop shoving the WOKE nonsense down our throats. It's so bloody annoying now. Thor was the best, most powerful and most thrilling marvel character and now he's the butt end of a joke, looking stupid so that everyone around him looks much smarter. Sad.

Author: krzysiektom
Review: It's awful. I kinda enjoyed the first 15 minutes, because it does not take itself seriously and is a bit meta, but then it lost me, I got bored and I didn't care. It also looks cheap. Poorly written and poorly directed. Basically this movie is a boring mess. Very disappointing.

Author: joeski50-1
Review: I had low expectations going into this, but when the film began my hopes lifted. I knew I was in for some goofiness and I can swallow that from this director, but he flushed all his bathroom humor he could while still garnishing a PG-13 rating. Marvel films have been family friendly for the most part with battles earning the -13, but this is every bit for the sexual innuendos as it is for the violence.

Author: jscott-57466
Review: Another silly silly film filled with woke nonsense - give it a miss. Do better next time. Written and directed by someone with the mind of a 7 year old... drink at least 2 bottles of jack Daniel's before watching...

Author: gimlisbeard
Review: Should go down in the annals of one of the worst movies made. The humour is bland. The only reason I gave it a 1 - is because Christian Bale was great - despite the writing and directing. Mr. Bale was the only good part of this movie. If the humour was smarter, the writing had more depth, and let Portman and Bale do more - it may have been redeemable. I watched it on Disney+ and wouldn't be willing to spend money in the theatre for this drivel. I love Marvel - but this movie was not up to par compared with any of the main Marvel movies and definitely not even close to any of the Black Panther movies.

Author: Iluvgoodmoviez3
Review_Title: Absolutely one of the worst films I have ever seen
Review: How this movie ever got made or was released is beyond me. It was absolutely horrendous. There were at least two or three times I wanted to just get up and leave because it was so bad. What a waste of time money in town. AWFUL movie. I would give it a zero or negative rating if I could.

Author: ivanmessimilos
Review: I can't believe how this turned out to be such a mess of a movie with so much talent in it. Great director, top proven actors and we still get this as the final product. The only thing I liked about the movie was Bale as the villain, and everything else was bad or mediocre at best. That's interesting because usually most Marvel movies like this have everything good except for the villain, as a rule. The film looks like it was made by a 12-year-old child, a lot (too many) of bad and forced jokes, I was embarrassed and cringed at some scenes that are supposedly funny, and I haven't heard this much Guns and Roses since I was probably twelve year. Hmmm, what a coincidence!

Author: sambatur-abhi
Review_Title: Lots of lovely action, thunderous fun & romance in this Thor
Review: As Chris Hemsworth says early in the movie "another classic Thor adventure", the movie does provide the cozy feel of a breezy fast paced action rom-com. The stellar background music and stunning visuals add to that aesthetic and promote the overall 80s cosmic adventure vibes that Taika seems to be going for.

Author: itsmekon
Review_Title: A Complete disappointment - not even a joke anymore
Review: Honestly, I don't know where and how to start .

Author: navjotjsingh
Review: Kevin Feige needs to re-evaluate the direction of their Cinematic universe and the quality of the content they are churning out. Because it looks like they have shifted their strategy from quality to quantity. It's been not even two years into Phase 4, and I have lost count of how many shows and movies they have released. And looking at the upcoming slate, there seems to be no slowdown.

Author: abirchy-96827
Review_Title: This is not a bad product!!
Review: The story of this movie may not be the best we have seen in the MCU till now but the movie will definitely entertain you.. For like first 40-50 minutes I thought this was a joke. But later it got better. Especially fight scenes with Gorr-The God Butcher were top notch. Visuals were also pretty good. Although I wanted some kind of different ending but it's not bad either. Some scenes will definitely make you cry for sure. For MCU fans this will a good piece for entertainment otherwise if you are not a marvel fan you may not like this movie much.

Author: liorisraelov

Author: thisismyemailmichaelstein
Review_Title: I TRULY enjoy 'superhero' movies & TV shows but I only have 1 word for this 1
Review: "REFUND!!!" (NOW an afterthought (so yes, more than 1 word).... WOW! That was so **SO** bad! SUCH a disappointment. OMG! OH...MY.... GOD!!!! I cannot believe I wasted 2 hours of my life waiting.... HOPING....(& I'm not religious)...***PRAYING!!!*** that it would pick up....... I guess I can stop now...WHAT A LET DOWN!! I am however SO VERY happy about 1 thing.... IT'S OVER & I can begin my long...my...VERY long road to recovery from being subjected to watching that POS!!! Here's another "P"...PS.... I am 55 years old and I have never,,,EVER in my entire life felt....well...compelled to add my opinion about a movie, TV show or anything...never...ever. But if I can save just ONE person from WASTING....*THEIR* 2 hours then I have done my good...no,,,my EXTREMELY good deed for the day. All joking aside. Do what you want. Make your own decision(s) but if after reading this you still choose to waste YOUR 2 hours, just remember you could have NOT knocked off a couple of years of your life by the AMAZING1, SHEER disappointment you'll surely be experiencing for not heeding this/my warning. Author: ugesh-54950
Review: The Latest instalment of the MCU, Thor: Love and Thunder is a delightful and fun movie which pushes the limits the silliness and at times feels like the movie is making parody of itself. The Comedy at the very beginning is really good and slowly as we enter the end of first act, it becomes goofy and there follows the silliness. That being said I laughed at 60% of the jokes and they were really good and at the other 40% the whole theatre was silent and gasping and it felt really Awkward. All the weird sounds made by Thor in the trailers have been cut as they might have realised it was too silly. Also at times I really didn't like the editing of the movie.

Author: mintycodm

Author: Shabrese
Review_Title: How the hell can you like this movie!?
Review: What was Marvel thinking? This movie totally baffles me. It wasn't a comedy. It wasn't a good action movie. It had no pulse, no emotional connection, disconnected plots, The acting wasn't good, it felt nothing like the last Thor which was great. I thought about walking out a half a dozen times but held out hope...wasted. I can watch a bad movie, but this made me look around like I was in the twilight zone or something. Marvel movie as long This might be the worst MCU movie made. I don't get how it has a 7/10. The same people who somehow liked the trash movie WW84 would probably like this and don't care about quality or continuity or purse, just a fake laugh (aka Tik Tok). Just a stupid movie. Waste of time.

Author: Jonathanb-97
Review_Title: Good if you like funny Thor
Review: If you enjoy funny thor you will enjoy this movie. This movie is similar Style to Thor Ragnarök as it bye the same director and similar characters. If you did not like that movie you won't like this. Now too why I rated it a 6 out of 10 and not higher. I liked how each thor movie and each appearance had a new version of thor and was kind of disappointed that this Thor was sorted of the same as his previous movies in endgame and thor Ragnarök. I would have preferred like an older version of him maybe they will do that in another thor movie or a cameo. I just thought also some of the jokes and action's scenes were all from the trailers and promos and nothing really big or funny came out during the movie that I did see from the trailers. Some good stuff though I did like that they brought back Natalie Portmans character Jane Foster and Valkyrie and Korg which I loved but overall that's why I gave it a 6/10.

Author: ferguson-6
Review: Greetings again from the darkness. With a steady stream of Marvel movies and TV serials, maintaining coherent and connected storylines has become challenging. In fact, it's probably best if fans take these at face value, rather struggling to connect the dots, only to end up frustrated. Perhaps no one understands this better than Taika Waititi, the director behind what many (including me) consider the best MCU film, THOR: RAGNAROK (2017). Waititi and co-writer Jennifer Kaytin Robinson once again embrace the blend of quick quip comedy and expected action sequences, supplemented this time a love story.

Author: sflanagan-47676
Review: Well it certainly wasn't the best, but definitely the weirdest Thor movie so far. Not as good as Ragnarok, better than Dark World and on par with the first one in my opinion.

Author: ravisuman-78641
Review: Watched Thor Love and Thunder with/for my 10 year old. He seemed to enjoy it. Movie was boring but coffee kept me awake. Parental guidance: The film has nudity (male) for a few seconds and occcasional kisses and several sexual references - I don't know why it was necessary in a children's movie.

I love Taika Watiti, but I feel like someone should have reined him in on this movie with the question of 'really?' That's what you want to do in this scene? So your audience is five years old?

Author: mesaxi
Review: No that's not a sexual commentary. I mean to say, everyone was funny and that's why it didn't work.

Author: marioma-51780
Review: Forced jokes, zero chemistry between thor and jane, seemed like a movie written by kindergartners! Longest two hours of my life, marvel lost its superpowers.

Author: Energon1
Review: As the film begins, the opening scenes look slightly promising, but that illusion is quickly dispelled and it descends quickly into the typical MCU pantomime / comedic farce of bad jokes and cliches we have now come to expect.

Author: TBJCSKCNRRQTreviews
Review: Gorr finds that his god refuses to save his daughter, doesn't care that the rest of his people are dead, and only cares about himself. So it is no wonder that he grabs the Necrosword and vows to kill all deities. Christian Bale gives his best performance since American Psycho, and at the risk of being blasphemous, I believe it's actually even better than that one. No, really. For more than two decades, I didn't think that would ever happen. While he has too little screen time, he's probably the best thing about the entire film.

Author: marveller-66
Review: ...but still kinda enjoyable, personally. There's no build-up for the event or anything. It's so straight-forward. At least they got the theme of the movie right, Love & Thunder. Not enough exposition to care for anyone. I know people hate it, for instance, Eternals. But I loved it. The humour. Some hits some doesn't. Same ol' MCU jokes but over-the-top, in this case. But it was expected since it's a Taika movie. It was great to see Natalie returning, love her. And so was Hemsworth, Tessa & Bale. The acting was great. Visuals, the usual for an MCU movie.

Author: SallyWilliams
Review_Title: Our Gang really had fun watching this
Review: We all know now that the hardcore Marvel fans hate it when the MCU films don't take themselves too seriously. But for us it was a fantastic experience, lots of humour, good action and still, big emotions, regarding the couple and the villain. The story was interesting, and we'll obviously see a much darker side of Zeus in the future. The cinematography is excellent as well. Great Entertainment

Author: matrixmistro
Review: This was average. For me it was all over the place and I was expecting better but Marvel films have gone down hill for me and I prefer DC. Could be due to Disney. It tried very hard to be funny but failed for me. It was stupid funny which I don't find funny. Nothing really stood out that you can talk about afterwards. Bale was excellent. He usually is. Crowe was also great but nothing could save this. Script was dreadful. Everything else was average for me. Eternals was far worse and Black Widow also poor just as poor with cheap production. However, they got good reviews which makes no sense to me. I'm glad, at last, people are starting to realise Marvel is in the decline but it took them too long.

Author: mhackett_
Review_Title: Natalie Portman: "Chris didn't eat meat before kiss because I'm vegan."
Review: What did you people expect? I hated Ragnarok, after coming off of playing God of War which had a dark, serious tone with still incorporating Greek and Norse mythology characters, Ragnarok had no weight to it. Ragnarok was filled to the brim with childish jokes therefore nothing felt serious despite you know, Ragnarok being the "final destruction of the world". Yet, EVERYONE seemed to love it and praised its humor. So what did the folks that made Ragnarok do? They heard all of YOU just like they heard all of YOU when people complained about the first two movies being slightly darker. Then of course they cranked up everything I didn't like with the previous film to an 11. Hallelujah. Holy $#!+, where's the Tylenol?!

Author: wayabovecomics
Review_Title: Probably the biggest waste of money ever
Review: I am not saying this is the worst movie of the year. I am not saying this is the worst superhero movie. It is just a big waste of money and absolutely no reason to make a fourth movie about a loved character.

Author: ThunderKing6
Review_Title: Thorpool: Thor keeps losing more things he loves
Review: About: Thor trying to stop the God Butcher through an undeveloped Fued. As I was watching by the middle of the movie this movie made me think I was watching a Thorpool movie because of all the "jokes" and juvenile behaviour. This Thor world really mesh well with Ryan's awful Deadpool.

Author: pieterspriet
Review_Title: The perfect mix of light and dark
Review: When making a movie, many directors struggle to find a good balance between a serious, dark tone and some lighthearted humour. Taika Waititi managed to add both without one overshadowing the other. This movie managed to be everything it needed to be: funny, emotional, action-packed and enjoyable to watch. This is the funniest movie in the MCU by far and the action was great. I loved the villain as well. This movie definitely had some great horror elements. Keep it up Marvel!

Author: denzildas
Review_Title: Very well, nice film but some issues with direction.
Review: Yes, the movie was amazing but didn't reached up to the level of my expectations. Its Just Thor's opportunity to show of his overpowered skills, but yeah, where and why, is there an importance of Jane foster? Making her weak and killing her in the movie was the exact moment where i jumped out from my seat hell no, i still cant believe this happened! Its been like many years Thor Ragnarok have released and this one didn't came up to tbe level of thor Ragnarok but, its a good visual treat to watch, the second thing is Zeus is like a Banana in this movie, why? Zeus cant even touch thor, why marvel? Why Taika? Atleast a bit more advanced skilled zeus we, expected But this was a bit far, not gonna lie. Yeah the Third is Gorr, the god butcher. Ok thanks for not destroying that character's spirit or his power it was well made, and yeah the point is my dear Christian Bale! Hats off to your acting most of the emotional scene made me crying and the terrorism of the character and the build up was pretty good, i loved it, but Not gonna lie, let me be honest, Thor Ragnarok was 3 times better than this movie, or is it me Who had this thought? Ok, then Guardians of the Galaxies, they are kinda having a cameo role! Frankly they dont have screen presence for more than 14 minutes i guess. But if Taika Waititi had made the movie's direction bit more cool, then this movie will be an all time entertainer, and folks thor part 5 will be there as he digs a hole in zeus's chest with Zeus's Thunderbolt weapon, Zeus's son Hercules seeks for Revenge against thor, and the next good news is Thor is a Dad to a girl. Because the last of Gorr the Good butcher was, 'Thor, look after my love, look after my love of my life´ which is Gorr's Daughter when she got Reborn. And still hate the fact that she calls him 'Uncle Thor´Lol. And Atlast movie refers to Love as Thor's adopted Daughter which is Gorr's own Daughter and Thunder for Thor Odinson, and atlast movie concludes with the post Credit scene of Zeus Asking his son to seek Revenge against thor and Jane Foster finally Landing up on Valhalla which is the place where Asgardian Gods and people live for the rest of eternity on their Life after Death where she meets Heimdall. I wished she met Odin, TBH. So thats it, Grab some popcorns and enjoy the show!

Author: rannynm
Review_Title: Unlike Anything That MCU Has Shown Us Before; Matched With A Rocking Soundtrack
Review: Marvel Studio's Thor: Love and Thunder officially redefines the definition of film and on-screen art. Taika Waititi's background as a painter can be seen throughout the film, through the use of a vibrant color scheme and specific tint isolation. This is incredibly aesthetically pleasing and, quite frankly, nothing that the Marvel Cinematic Universe has shown us before. Matched with a rocking soundtrack -- Appetite for Destruction from Guns N' Roses, Thor: Love and Thunder is quite literally an "appetite for destruction."

Author: sojkaprokop
Review: It's like no Marvel movie before. It is most likely going to upset many hardcore fans of the MCU. If you accept the theme however, you will find something very fresh. If you're tired of every Marvel movie being the same and you like the idiosyncratic style of Waititi, you will enjoy it. If you are a fan of the more traditional superhero movies, this one will probably make you furious at times.

Author: irishmonster
Review: What an absolute craptastic movie. Thor has become a joke, Bale's talents are wasted, the CGI is horrible, and the entire storyline is pathetic. Whoever green lit this film should be run out of town on a rail.

The character development that does take place is almost in reverse of what was done before. They took ragnarok and turned it into a cartoon like candy covered world. Why do these reviews need to be soo long.

He plans on visiting the god Eternity who will grant him one wish. Thor with the aide of Natalie Portman, Tessa Thompson, a cheap Zeus prop, and GnR go save Axl and the kids.

Author: leescottbrown-19978
Review_Title: Waititi can make some horrible movies... This is one of them
Review: It looks very pretty and the few scenes that have Christian Bale in are watchable. Otherwise it's a car crash. Ragnarok worked because it was a good comic hero story with a clever thread and it didn't take itself seriously in a good way. This movie quickly becomes a parody of Ragnarok which is saved only from oblivion by the performance and character of Bale who is the only character the audience is able to get any empathy for. Oh, and if that wasn't bad enough, it is crass in is attempts to throw the now obligatory-for-Disney dollop of wokeness into the plot also. One to avoid.

Review: I love it very much. I liked the first three movies but I always thought it wasn't perfect. The first two are too serious and the 3rd is too funny. There are fight scenes that are very fun. There are a new adventures that open up new worlds. There is a lot of humor and a very sweet and bitter romance. Smile and cry along with the story. It's a movie with a great heart.

Author: daveholt-32555
Review: It's hard to know where to start. The storyline is woeful, the dialogue is trying for humour but misses by many country miles, the cast are trying hard I feel but even they can't breathe life into this utter mess of a movie. Watiti is I believe trying for humour with emotion but fails on both. The key emotional moments just left me cold, the overwhelming barrage of attempted humour completely strips away any emotional connection with the film and the poor plot/story undermines everything. By far the worst Marvel film to date, this was an utter car-crash of a movie. Please reconsider letting Taika Watiti direct a Star Wars film, on this evidence he will ruin it.

Author: samog-98289
Review_Title: Worst Thor movie of all time and worse than the trilogy which looks so much better than this!
Review: Spoiler-free; let's talk about the good parts and my experience when watching this film here we go; I enjoyed Christian Bale's Gorr the God Butcher it's nice to see him return to the superhero world since The Dark Knight Trilogy, the song choices are outstanding, the action scenes are cool and in the cinema, there was this woman who was laughing at every scene that was supposed to be funny and not once did I laugh during not once! That's all I can say about the spoiler-free stuff let's jump right into spoilers; the problem I have with this movie and Last Jedi (I agree with Angry Joe on this one) is way too much humour! The comedy did not work for me and they ruined it with Lady Thor AKA Mighty Thor so it's more bait and switch M-She-U. Overall it's marvel at its worst worse than the Thor Trilogy which looks so much better than this and that's why I'm giving this one a Thor out of 10 Ha Ha LOL!!!

Author: reece-94254
Review: After ragnarok, I was pleased to hear that taika would direct love and thunder the man redefined and redeemed Thor's character. Christian bale's gorr is one of the most sympathetic and yet chilling villains in the MCU but I was disappointed by the screen time he had in the movie. If there was one thing I would improve about the movie is that they would take more time with the script. Overall the movie feels more like a redux from ragnarok but the performance of the cast make the movie worth while as well as enjoyable considering phase four has with led with many controversies.

Author: Enricohendrix
Review: When Russell Crowe looked for inspiration for the accent of Zeus, surely he looked no further than Con the Fruiterer. (Google it). Russell hams it up with his mock Greek accent but sadly every joke falls flat. And that accent is symptomatic for the rest of the film. Wrong in tone and trying hard to be funny but nobody is laughing. Ragnarok somehow nailed the right amount of action and comedy but this movie misses the mark.

Author: gadfeal
Review_Title: Producers, SHAME ON YOU! All the magic is GONE by this infernal Hollywood neverendum sequel machination!
Review: Not even the attractive actors, spectacular but completely over-trodden special effects, and top notch cinematography could save this from utter futility and waster of funding that could have done so much more in a thousand more original creative projects.

Author: firefighter_pat
Review_Title: Stan is rolling in his grave
Review: Hard swing and a miss. You know when you watch a B movie and an actor is over acting so bad that you feel embarrassed for them? This is what it felt like watching this film. It brings quite a bit of shame to Thor and the Marvel universe. The jokes are forced and often childish, the CGI is poor and the emotional parts are empty and ineffective. I mean, God of dumplings? This was obviously made as a comedy and not a serious film, but they failed hard at that too. I feel bad for everyone whobare real fans and had to watch this. I don't know if it's because disney unfortunately owns the rights to Marvel but if it is, they should be ashamed. They've taken a Marvel movie and turned it into Space Jam. Stan must be rolling in his grave.

The main one of these is an individual called Gor, also known as the God-butcher because of a) his god-slaying sword and b) a propensity for using it. In his search for allies, Thir encounters a reconstituted Mjolnir and its new adopted patron, a second Thor in the unlikely shape of Jane Foster.

And you really belong there and it was the perfect spot for whatever line of comedy it was. This movie felt more like a comedy than an action film the comedy was very force which really hurt the movie. Christian Bale did a great job but they did not give his character enough lines and they didn't explain him really well at all they could've given him a lot more meat. Natalie Portman and Chris Hemsworth their chemistry is awful she looks like she doesn't even enjoy working in the movie. The chemistry between Tessa Thomas sorry Thompson and Chris Hemsworth is golden. Even know what they did was Zeus making him like a fumbling idiot. Who is scared was awful I love marvel movies don't get me wrong and I'm huge comic fan Watch the movies from the beginning was so excited and loved that they finally made a really good captain America movie and they really made soup good superhero movies but I don't know where phase 4 is going I don't know they gonna but it's reminding me a lot more of DC which DC was a mess in the beginning marvel was phenomenal with their movies so I don't know what is going on I think it's because they're growing too quickly so they don't have the same quality.

Author: coltonjaneckeofficial
Review: This film felt like a parody to me... there were things I did enjoy; however, it was a mess. This was probably the choppiest Marvel Movie I've ever watched. I wish we saw more with Gorr the god butcher. Christian Bales performance was absolutely outstanding. Altogether, I think this movie was okay. It's a movie for the mass, to please everybody. Nothing about it is groundbreaking in the world of film and cinema. At least kids will now have a cool Thor skin to play with in Fortnite. This was definitely made for kids/ adults with low attention spans.

Review: It was ridiculous, even for a superhero movie. That is two hours of my life that I will never get back again. Author: allanmac-05661
Review: Let me start off by saying I absolutely loved Thor Ragnarok - it was pure entertainment from start to finish. I enjoyed the first 2 movies too.

Author: holdenharris
Review: Martin Scorsese was ridiculed for saying Marvel films are not "cinema" and more like "theme parks." I thought his comments were a bit harsh at the time, but after watching this movie, I see his point.

Author: Ltufano23
Review: After the last few appearances of Chris Hemsworth (Thor) in the MCU, I could not wait to see where his epic tale would take him next. I could not be more disappointed to find out that it took him here. With so much trauma, growth, and development being thrown out the window, this film turns our hero into a simplistic fool that cannot possibly have stood toe-to-toe with the Mad Titan and lived to tell the story. With a great director and great actors, you have to wonder how no one stopped the ridiculously childish humor, the unnatural pacing, and the story that goes from drama to comedy and repeats faster than you can blink. There are some redeeming features, such as some of the visuals and the little we see of Christian Bale (Gorr), but they are wasted underneath the burned memory of screaming goats. Everybody makes mistakes, unfortunately, Taika made this one.

Author: exiton3

Review: Two stars just because great performance of Christian Bale the rest is poor weak movie even in the Marvel genre! If no Christian then 1 star! Waste of time!

Author: kevin_robbins
Review_Title: This is worthwhile addition to the super hero genre that's a must see for fans of the Marvel Universe
Review: Thor: Love and Thunder (2022) is a movie my wife and I caught in theaters last night. The storyline follows Thor post Thanos searching for meaning. Meanwhile Jane Foster, his one true love, is back on Earth, dying. In her research she discovers Thor's hammer has healing effects and she tracks down his shattered hammer. The hammer, recognizing Jane, rejoins and turns her into a female Thor. When a God killer emerges in the galaxy destroying worlds and religions everywhere what better to stop it than two Thors?

Review: This is a Guns and Roses concert sponsored by Skittles. With a slugfest of bad storytelling, bad acting, bad jokes, senseless cameos, and terrible costumes, it's an unintended parody, and not a good one at that. It's a clown show monster mash on a Celestial Viking ship. This rotten apple will surely spoil the whole MCU barrel if not disposed of properly. I feel the pain of this breakup but my Thor love is over with this recent infidelity. What a shame that I waited this long for this bloated celluloid LSD trip.

Author: thajose
Review_Title: This Was Too Silly, Left Me Disappointed
Review: Thor has always been a tough character to pull off (in the film and in the comics), and I feel like the MCU movies figured out a way to do this really well in previous movies. The first two, are a lot darker, and the humor is peppered here and there. With Ragnarok, they cranked up the humor, and in my opinion made one of the best movies in the MCU. All the elements really worked in that instance. The balance of comedy and seriousness was perfect. With "Love and Thunder" I feel like the film makers said "People loved the humor in Ragnarok, let's do that all movie long!" Unfortunately this just made for a silly movie. This is a two and a half hour comedy, that just comes across as cheesy and silly. Some really intense events happen to the characters and the universe as a whole, but none of these events feel like they have any weight because of the onslaught of silly jokes before, after, and occasionally, during them. This is really unfortunate because you have an absolutely amazing cast (Christian freaking Bale as the antagonist!) that is pretty much wasted on a goofy movie. My wife thought this was one of the worst movies in the MCU (and one of the worst we have seen this this year) and she has previously loved the Thor movies (mostly because of Chris Hemsworth being shirtless and Idris Elba). Not even a super jacked Hemsworth made this enjoyable for her. I enjoy comedy, and think the MCU typically does a great job of finding the right balance. There were some elements of this film that I really enjoyed however, that balance is totally absent in this film. I had been really looking forward to seeing this movie since I saw the first trailer, with Guns N Roses blasting in it, and I was really disappointed in the final product. The film makers just went too hard with the humor and it made for a silly, weightless movie.

Author: dlagarry-95740
Review: There's no question that Disney or one of its affiliates paid for this films 7/10 rating, and in spite of the countless negative reviews, that rating hasn't changed. This film is atrocious, and an intentional insult to Stan Lee and his legacy. It's literally the equivalent of drawing a mustache on the Mona Lisa because "someone" thinks it's "funny". Film, like all art, is forever, and permant contribution to our culture. Pity Disney didn't consider that prior to releasing this.

Author: mozziecat
Review_Title: Enjoyable but all over the place movie
Review: This is a good popcorn movie with a lot of comedy and a little emotion thrown in. Where is loses points for me is the rushed plot line. The movie relies a bit too much on comedy and not enough on telling a really good story. Although featured prominently in the ads, the Guardians of the Galaxy are barely in this movie. Christian Bale gives us a great villain, but not present enough. Way too much time is spent with Zeus, and not enough with Jane Foster. There are some great moments in the film, but at 2 hours it needed another 20 min. To really round out the story. Then there are the 2 scenes mid and after credits. 1st one really makes no sense, but liked 2nd one (but even that felt rushed)

Review: Why did Ragnarok and GoG work but Love and Thunder didn't? Ragnarok balanced the humour with the seriousness. A juxtaposition is needed with these things. The jokes were just better too. Love and Thunder devalued it's dark side by never actually giving the severity of their situation land. Every opportunity they had for a serious moment to get the audience (us) to take it seriously, they made another mediocre joke or just had a screaming goat. They had a romance with no real romance, again we didn't believe it because it was all too "funny" it needs some seriousness to balance out the comedy

Author: webslinger-00280
Review_Title: Passable, But Not Sure What It Wants to Be
Review: I came into the movie with such high hopes with Lady Thor and Gorr finally making their debut. But all we got was a tone-deaf mess that never knew when to be funny or serious (and honestly forcing most of the comedy). And not only that, neither Jane nor Gorr got enough time to flesh-out their characters in a more meaningful way and have them just be another throwaway Marvel villain and a disposable side character. And at this point, I'm honestly sick of Valkyrie and Korg since she's just annoying and he's trying way too hard. By the end, I felt the same way the Guardians felt in the movie, sick of Thor and wanting to leave as soon as possible.

Bale does an awesome job with the minimal screen time , he chews the scenery up. Theres a bunch of tried and test Marvel formula jokes ans japes. Was this film all it could be ? Sadly not , it didnt fully hit the mark , the plot kinda zig zags all over the place from "Asgardians of the galaxy" , to How Thor got fit again , to finding himself , To gorr to the gods and so on. It feels very much like this coulda been a 6 ep disney+ run of "what Thor did next ? " in lill 40-45 min slots per week. Author: gitapar
Review_Title: Poignant story ruined by cheap jokes
Review: What could have been a poignant story dealing with grief and loss was ruined by too many cheap jokes. Tone it down. Less is more. The soundtrack was underwhelming. Also, Jane deserved better and Natalie Portman is better at drama than comedy. I think the only thing that was good in this movie was Christian Bale. But, because this is a Marvel movie and he's playing a "disposable" villain you already know how this ends without me needing to tell you. For shame. Why does Marvel have the tendency to kill of the three-dimensional villains that are actually interesting? They should keep pumping out complex and flawed villains, same as heroes. Otherwise, what's the point? For us to be bored to death? Mission accomplished. Marvel: Please do better.

Author: scolaighe-1
Review: I couldn't finish it. I liked the opening but Waititi's "humorous" retelling of Thor's saga was unpalatable. That was followed by a flat, dull, and corny "action" scene with the Guardians and I was done. Waititi shouldn't be behind the camera, in front of it, or in the writer's room...apparently I need to fill this out a bit so I'll just point out that also in my era Marvel retold the Volsung Saga (Wagner's Ring Trilogy) with Thor as Siegfried. It was excellent. I wish they had gone there instead of going with the god slayer story line.

Author: buttkrieg
Review_Title: Thankful for Waititi's departure after this...
Review: I went into this movie hopeful, but was left disappointed. This movie starts out strong with an introduction to Gorr and his daughter. It's a good, simple set-up for his tragic motivation as the villain. There's tension and emotion. Unfortunately from here, Waititi takes every opportunity to undercut any tension or drama from every scene. He saw that his trademark silly humor worked for Ragnarok and he dialed it up to 11 for Love and Thunder - to the detriment of the entire movie. Gorr kidnaps a large group of children from New Asgard, and considering the magnitute of this act, Thor and Valkyrie coming off as entirely unphased and jokey about the situation absolutely destroys any sense of urgency or consequence that should be present. And despite the potential Bale had as Gorr, he comes and goes and is entirely wasted instead of remaining a lurking threat among the MCU. Despite losing a significant Thor character by the end of the film as well, that outcome is predictable at every turn and the plot as a whole seems totally inconsequential in the long run. While Ragnarok was able to portray some weight to the loss of significant characters, Love and Thunder can't take itself seriously for even a moment. The visuals, while very much the kind of over-the-top comic book visual style I enjoy, come off as significantly cheaper than it's predecessors. The green-screen is horrendous and the CGI characters and creatures stick out sorely as if they were made 10 years ago. The action and wirework is much sloppier and obvious this time around. The only graphically stand-out moment is a brief battle sequence in black & white.

Author: ruelshepperd

Review_Title: Chris Hemsworth Should Sue Whoever Was Responsible For This POS.

I understand the need for humor, and have quite liked most of it in the previous films. It's a nice take on the character, but oh my god, this was just boringly stupid. It wasn't just me either. I was sitting there watching this, being privately disgusted, when my wife asked me "Are we gonna watch the rest of this?". I didn't say anything, just clicked it off. So glad I didn't see this at the theater. I'm not going to see another Marvel movie that I have to actually pay money for after this.

Author: jojunno
Review: Honestly, most actual fans will find this film to be a frustrating disappointment if they are being honest with themselves. It's completely shallow and as badly written as a comic book movie can get. Thor is nothing but a mindless buffoon and for a character of his consequence that is inexcusable. Jane Foster is handled well enough but is also shallow as her story arc is undercut by joke after joke after joke. You can say the same thing about the entire movie itself. Author: theedeer
Review: With Chris Hemsworth's incredible acting ability and with all the other work he has been involved in, we are a huge fan; regarding this ridiculos take on the role of a once well loved character (a fan for literally decades) the Thor of Stan Lee is nowhere to be seen even in dreams of yesterday. Stan Lee would have died if he were still with us, to see such a travesty on such a beloved character made to be a joke, a Very Bad Joke. Chris.... get out while you can.... this will make Marvel fans really label you as a pun to be associated with what NOT to be and with such talent outside of this and in the past roles as Thor as well of yesterday, please don't do this anymore if this is all someone is making it out to be. I am so disappointed in Disney (happens all the time now) and what Marvel has become... I'd hate to see you in such things anymore and would even rather them kill Thor than do this to him. Kat D. Is wonderful, but they gave her no parts, yet in the couple minutes I was still glad to see her and hear her. Christian B. Did wonderfully amidst such a travesty. Natalie... it was good to see her back, but they did her no justice. Great to see the GoftheG cast. Russel's role was a joke (bad). Melissa (Nope) Luke Peter Matt ... always good to see them... so many with great talent reduced to a bad script bad directing and producing and lack of respect and insight into the Marvel Stan Lee and company created and we all loved. Seems DC is switching roles and starting to take it all more serious while Disney's Marvel (Daredevil hopefully still excluded and remainin,g great with the team who made it all and with Jessica, Luke, Frank Danny and the great support cast of each Shades, Claire. John, Rev (R. I. P.) Malcolm.

Author: eagandersongil
Review: "Thor: Love and Thunder" is a film that constantly seeks to combine action and humor, and it misses both, the jokes are shallow, poorly executed, there is no punch and at a certain moment it seems that we are seeing "everyone in panic" but Thor doesn't have the same wisdom as the classic comedy anthology, because it still tries to take itself seriously and still tries to preach a totally infantilized humor, even the development of the characters is null, the construction of Thor as Natalie Portman is non-existent, the construction of the villain is done in three minutes - it's serious - we don't feel attached to any character, nothing works in terms of script here and to complete the action scenes are with a terrible CGI, we have a constant use of dark scenes to disguise the mediocre effects, with a weak choreography and poorly rendered movements, bringing in great actors like Natalie Portman, Christian Bale and Russell Crowe does not save the work, on the contrary, it makes everything just a little more embarrassing, as they all do their part. Cartoonish and poorly written soundings, not even the direction of Taika Waititi saves, the good director has some glimpses of originality, especially at the beginning of the third act, otherwise it seems that the feature was made in 30 days. The soundtrack is very good, but its sound design in the use of scenes is also poorly used. Grade 5/10.

Author: erickenehan-790-917123
Review: One of the stark differences between this movie and Ragnorak is the absense of Loki. Thor's character seems to need that competitive dynamic. Also the writing for this movie just isn't working. Major moments are simply glazed over in order to quickly get to the next scene. At one point all the heroes do something incredbly cowardly and we aren't supposed to notice. A lot of attempted comic relief is not landing. And the film score is very "blah." The GnR tracks are also not motivated, and pretty obviously an attempt to hit on a trend. While the villian has some backstory, his power has basically none, just another glazed over detail. That being said Christian Bale brought it. He's so good everyone else's performance seems to dwindle. If we're keeping score here the Loki series blows this out of the water.

Review: I really enjoyed this movie. It was a fun adventure and also a sweet love story. Jane had a really good story and I'm glad that she got to become Thor. This was the best Thor movie in my opinion, and also the best phase 4 movie (not including Spiderman: No Way Home). It was true to the characters and moved the plot forward in significant ways. I'm also glad that the focus didn't drift onto the Asgardians of the Galaxy, keeping the plot simple and focused.

If you enjoy Thor, Jane, and Valkeryie as characters you will enjoy it even if the film doesnt quite reach its full potential.

Review: Its not a 1 but why not? I had fun with it, what makes me sad is that they dont care anymore, its like events generated at random. Author: drqshadow-reviews
Review_Title: Where Ragnarok Came Easily, Love and Thunder Tries Way Too Hard
Review: Fresh off saving the universe in the climax of that last Avengers movie (doesn't it seem like three lifetimes ago?), our mighty Thor is stricken by a heavy case of ennui. Granted, he's spent the past however-long running around the cosmos with his new friends in the Guardians of the Galaxy, righting wrongs and soaking up the adulation, so it's not like he's completely listless. He just wonders if, maybe, there mightn't be more to life as a living thunder god than cheap thrills and easy wins. That's where the villainous "God Butcher" Gorr comes into play. Having violently ended a great number of minor deities already, his vengeful blade now points squarely at New Asgard. Where, coincidentally, Thor's old flame Jane Foster has just taken up a form of godhood.

Author: lraczy@juno.com
Review: The first four phases of the MCU seemed very strategically and often brilliantly developed, devised, and directed into a cohesive whole. But now, between "Dr. Strange and the Multiverse of Madness" and this mess of a movie, it seems like producers and writers are simply throwing ideas against the wall to see what sticks. And what stuck kind of stinks. Thor has become like Ross on Friends: He started out cool and interesting, but the writers have turned him into a total goofball. Thor's humor is great, but not when goofiness becomes his chief defining characteristic. The basic plot had potential, but the development of it is mostly ridiculous. To avoid spoilers, I'll simply say that some of the new gods introduced in this film left me scratching my head. The backstory that is included about Thor and Jane is poorly conceived and lacks any compelling substance. While the woke content in this film is relatively minor, what little there is feels entirely inorganic, like it was forced into the film in order to appease political activists. And, while there is a never-ending barrage of jokes in the film, very few of them are very funny. There was very little laughter in a rather-full theater (especially after the first 20 minutes or so). The film still features beloved characters, and the action sequences are good, so 5 stars.

Author: Anry126
Review_Title: Could've Been Better, But Not Terrible
Review: Thor's definitely been my favorite in the stand alone characters so far and maybe Ragnarok set the bar too high but this one just felt like it missed some attention detail and the quality that Ragnarok possessed. It started strong enough but quickly started pouring on the corny a bit too thick and that went on throughout. Background and development of the villain was good (as usual) but felt like they fast forwarded a bit through Jane's development/story along with other characters that seem like will be around in the future. Good acting and some great cameo's like Luke Hemsworth playing Thor during a play in the movie. Finally, felt like it was a bit lost as to the age of target audience they were targeting as it was a bit of a hard PG-13 but at the same time it had a bit too many childish moments for adults. I like that they make these movies fun for adults but think they should keep the PG-13 rating closer to PG.

Author: blackeyed0225
Review: The Marvel Cinematic Universe juggernaut rolls on, but instead of returning to the well with the same formula designed to maximise box office and make truckloads from licensed merchandise, 'Thor: Love and Thunder,' breathes new life into the clichéd genre. It's polarised audiences, thanks in no small part to the surreal vision of director Taika Waititi, that re-imagines Thor more as a goofy layabout than as an omnipotent deity.

Author: lolakleebihf
Review_Title: Undoubtably one of the funniest movies this year

And the insanity of Taika Waititi comes through greatly in this masterpiece of a super hero comedy. The jokes are so on point, from the over the board goats to Russell Crow's unexpected accent. Waititi manages to surprise us in many ways in every production he does. Thank you so much for reminding me why I love moves. I didn't think once about all the negativity that is surrounding my life right now, while watching this nor for the rest of the evening. Action, comedy, directing, dop, everything was just on point here.

Author: marin-77678
Review: The MCU Thor is completely different from the comic book version. While the comic book version is a well respected, epic and powerful character the MCU version is the complete opposite. Kevin Feige has allowed Taika and Chris to run-a-muk with the character to the point where he is clearly being mocked. It is unfortunate because Thor could have been Marvel's Game of Thrones sans the f-bombs and sex scenes. Love & Thunder was difficult to watch. The ill timed, drag on, and eye rolling gags spoiled an epic story from the comics. It was also not necessary. Man of Steel reintroduced Superman without forcing the humor. As is the problem with the MCU, Kevin Feige needs to accept that not everything has to be funny.

Review_Title: Bad Writing, Awful Jokes & Destroying Thor's Legacy
Review: Thor: Love and Thunder has to be one of the worst films that Marvel has ever produced. There are so many jokes and I didn't laugh once. Btw what's up with all these goats screaming every 5 minutes? I agree with most people when they say that Korg should have been used much less in this movie, it was very annoying. I think Christian Bale did a good job playing Gorr but they didn't give him much to do. His character has such an interesting backstory and I expected them to do much more with him. Also isn't he supposed to be ''the God butcher''? All I remember is him killing one God, if im not mistaken, made no sense to me.

Author: Leofwine_draca
Review_Title: Too much of a good thing
Review: While I really enjoyed the last THOR film, RAGNAROK, LOVE AND THUNDER proves that you can have too much of a good thing. Waititi goes all out to make an absurdist comedy here and inserts himself into the film way too much, not only co-starring but narrating the darn thing too. And a little of his trademark humour goes a long way, as it turns out. The storyline's okay, Hemsworth is very funny too, but Portman's return is mishandled and her character arc so serious to be completely at odds with the overwhelming goofiness elsewhere. Good CGI and a great Christian Bale can't disguise the all over the place nature of the storyline.

While the other TV shows are exploring many new characters and storylines, we wonder how much of them will get integrated into the big screen releases. Amidst all this, Thor Love and Thunder somehow comes off as an unexpected breeze in the midst of a multiverse storm.

Author: flicklover
Review_Title: Very much a self parody.....But better on 2nd viewing.
Review: 5 years ago when Thor: Ragnarok came out it was received very well. It was a more comedic but very sharp Thor film. Director Taika Waititi brought his very peculiar sense of humor to the MCU and it was refreshing. With Love and Thunder Waititi goes even further into comedy. So much so that the film feels like a self parody. I am all for silliness in superhero films but if you want an audience to be emotionally invested in a story you have to take it at least a little seriously. The film starts off as a full on comedy and the 3rd act gets serious but again, the shift in tone is jarring. Chris Hemsworth I'd good again as Thor and Natalie Portman is back as Jane Foster Thor's love interest. They have a good chemistry but again it's all so silly that when the film gets serious we should care more. Christian Bale plays Gorr, the God Butcher. He is the villain and is the best part of the film. A really good performance that is taken seriously but the rest of the characters are so busy being funny that it seems he belongs in a different film. Bale's great villain is sort of wasted. Is it entertaining? Yes. There are some really cool visually touches and yes some of the comedy works but I wish that the film would have been more of an adventure and less self parody....

The soundtrack is repetitive, the script is absolutely poor, simple, empty, full of inconsistencies, conveniences and jokes that don't land well. It's a disaster.

Author: A_Different_Drummer
Review: This period of history will be remembered by those who survive it as a time when the Rule Book was thrown out the window and chaos reigned. A hundred years ago, monopoly laws prevented the concentration of media in corporate hands. Beach movies in the 1960s always included at least one lonely millionaire wandering around in the cast -- lonely because he owned a TV station or radio station or newspaper and could only sell it to another lone millionaire. The Clinton era changed that. Four conglomerates today own 99% of the western media. Disney buying Marvel was arguably the coup de grace. You now have companies creating markets for content rather than content for markets. Sometimes it works (WANDAVISION). Sometimes it does not. (THOR LOVE & THUNDER). But it is now their game. The rest of us have become merely players. ((Designated "IMDb Top Reviewer." Please check out my list "167+ Nearly-Perfect Movies (with the occasional Anime or TV miniseries) you can/should see again and again (1932 to the present))

Author: GusherPop
Review_Title: Funny as hell, but not as good as the first 3 Thor Films
Review: 'Thor: Love and Thunder" is, like most of the Marvel films since Iron Man died, only intermittently amusing, a bit wobbly in its storytelling, thin in its emotional impact and more geared toward spectacle than coherence. Thor's latest planet-skipping adventures are built around the party-rock atmosphere of several Guns N' Roses tracks, notably "Sweet Child o' Mine," but, alas, the song's refrain "Where do we go? Where do we go now? Where do we go?" is all too apt for the movie's directionless, make-it up as we go along style. Here are a lot of things I love about Waititi's approach to Thor, but my favorite is that they are now comedies. While "Ragnarok" was packed with jokes, I think "Love and Thunder" embraces the comedy aspect even more. The trailers let us know there would be plenty of laughs, but it also felt like it may try to be a bit more serious. Well, thankfully, that was the trailer, not the movie. "Love and Thunder" is listed as an action, adventure and comedy. What it actually is, is a comedy with some action and adventure. I laughed out loud so many times and just when you start feeling like things are getting serious, you get a perfectly timed gag and the tension is released. Often times when a movie is trying to be funny or full of action, the filmmakers tend to sacrifice story and emotion for spectacle. This is not the case with "Love and Thunder." Waititi understands in order to make the jokes land and the action hit, you have to care about what is happening. I don't want to give anything away, so I'll be vague here, but there is a rich story filled with love, wanting, loneliness, heartache and sorrow. These heavier elements create a story we're invested in as an audience, but it's balanced expertly with humor, adventure and plenty of spectacle. I cared about Thor, Jane and even Christian Bale's Gorr. Waititi and his team created relatable characters, strong storylines and plenty of drama. We've had a few opportunities to see this, but Hemsworth is a brilliant comedic actor. His timing and delivery are pitch-perfect and make for an egocentric Thor with a heart of gold, and you can't help but love him. Hemsworth was the perfect choice for this role and it's ever more evidenced in "Love and Thunder." We all know Natalie Portman is a fine actress, but her chemistry with Hemsworth is palpable and she brings a certain sense of humanity to the film that is essential to its success.

Author: bastille-852-731547
Review_Title: Serviceable "fourquel" has Waititi's style but lacks purpose
Review: I've always found Thor to be one of the weaker A-list MCU characters, but I appreciated Taika Waititi's vision for "Thor: Ragnarok." His quirky humor, great soundtracks, and attention to deft pacing and comedic timing made that film, while far from perfect, a unique standout that helped create a fresher vision of Thor as a character that not only would ultimately set him up for "Infinity War" and "Endgame," but provide a blueprint for how directors could still put at least a somewhat unique stamp of their own on the Marvel formula. I'm not necessarily a hardcore fan of Waititi ("Jojo Rabbit" was not for me,) but still appreciate his idiosyncrasies and interests in using humor and irony to pepper stories in unexpected and distinct ways. With that said, given that I enjoyed "Ragnarok" and also love Christian Bale (who plays Gorr, the film's villain,) I was hoping this sequel would deliver. While it's not terrible by any means and a fine way to kill two hours on a hot summer day, it's much more forgettable than its predecessor and adds vanishingly little to the MCU as a whole.

This is actually a good mockery of the people in power or authority, and those who follows them blindly without questioning, well as the people who worship false idols. Of course the movie is full of bad actions, silly conversations and costumes with cgi quality of commercials with bad composing, which was quite the result of changing endlessly by marvels directions which has ridiculously little time for the artists to execute, but actually by the meaning of it this movie deserves a better review and credit, which was way better than soulless and empty ones like shangchi and black panther.

Author: george.schmidt
Review: THOR: LOVE AND THUNDER (2022) *** Chris Hemsworth, Natalie Portman, Christian Bale, Tessa Thompson, Taika Waititi, Russell Crowe, Jaimie Alexander, Chris Pratt, Dave Bautista, Karen Gillan, Pom Klementieff, (voices of Vin Diesel & Bradley Cooper) Frequently entertaining Thor vehicle in the MCU with the still-nursing-his-heart Avenger facing an intergalactic crisis with the threat of Gorr The God Butcher (scary good Bale) hellbent on a vendetta to wipe out the gods that be and kidnapping the children of Asgard as collateral damage. Enlisting the help of his ex, the cancer stricken Jane Foster (Portman in a welcome return to the fray) who has embodied her own version of The Mighty Thor in the process, they team up with their old cronies Valkyrie & Korg (Thompson & writer/director Waititi) to do justifiable ass-kicking battle. While the visuals are still triumphant buoyed by a Guns'n'Roses jukebox the film labors until its final (and surprisingly poignant) act.
