Author: deltasingh
Review: Disappointing to say the least. Visuals were great as usual. Fight scenes were stale and there was little done to keep them fresh, mostly typical Taika Waititi's use of children in strange settings. Humour was significantly more forced in this movie than Ragnarok's more natural flow. Story-wise it was pretty cookie cutter except even more empty. The audience felt no connection to Jane Foster as she's been absent from almost every marvel movie thus far. Other emotional connections happen abruptly, characters decisions are made on a whim with no reflection. I'm not looking forward to Taika Waititi's direction on the upcoming Star Wars after seeing this disaster unfortunately.

Author: Jithindurden
Review_Title: My favourite among the four Thor movies
Review: I never understood the love for Ragnarok and don't understand why people are getting underwhelmed by this one. Ragnarok had a better story than this one but the style undermined that story even though it was still better than the two Thor films that came before, both of which were also good imo. Here the style and the story meshes so well together. The ending felt genuine and touching, something that I felt missing in Ragnarok. Chris Hemsworth and Natalie Portman were a treat to watch in this action rom-com.

Author: cjonesas
Review: Another average nonsensical Thor movie, defying realms of intelligence, love, romance, action, adventure and of course science fiction. It has nothing to offer besides cheesy action, rosy skins, make-up and Zeus beautiful entourage.

Review: Who would've thought that Marvel's movie universe elaboration is starting to entangle itself?

Author: nasostsoukalas
Review: This is not garbage like other reviews suggest, as watching garbage is so much more fulfilling than this.

Author: wuzupman500
Review: 'Thor Love and thunder' is the most perfect movie to check out if you are someone who personally despises this character. I was in a screening with a few friends who LOVED Ragnarok to pieces and after the film THEY turned to ME and asked me why Thor is such a moron now? The jokes, were plenty, and 90% of them were either cringe, timed poorly, or just fell flat. I asked myself at a certain point during the movie if I'm actually watching the latest spoof film that was the newest entry of the 'scary movie' franchise. The runtime is way too short to accomplish anything it needs to do and I'm not even so sure I blame that one on Waititi as much as the studio. So much is wasted here and it's kind of sad, Lady Sif's return was being hyped this whole time all over the place and she shows up for probably 3-4 minutes of the whole film and half of that is a joke, The content of the ending makes no sense to me maybe because it was so short lived that it felt very random and weird? Bale's Gorr The God Butcher and the threat that he is supposed to be really amounts to nothing. Waititi had knocked a home run out of the park with me regarding 'Jojo Rabbit' with his emotional scenes and good storytelling, it's really too bad he just doesn't bring that side of his filmmaking to Thor.

Author: HollisWoods
Review_Title: Not as good as Ragnarök, but I'm still hoping for more!
Review: First of all, did it live up to Ragnarök for me? No. Ragnarök was just the perfect movie for me - it had the perfect balance of fun action and humor and had the greatest cast. This movie was lacking a bit. But was it better than Dark World? Hell yes. Was it better than the first Thor? Meh, I go back and forth. Honestly, I expected it to be worse, so I enjoyed it more than I anticipated. It's just the MCU in a post-ENDGAME world is not the same. We've had some great projects, like WandaVision, but the vibes... they're just different.

Author: timotiyong
Review_Title: Disappointed in this movie and it's director
Review: Thor: Ragnarok was almost the best movie in the whole Marvel series, but this time it's a huge disappointment. It's a cheesy parody without any weight to what's happening, and it's not even funny. Disappointed in the movie itself and it's director, who looks like can only direct a decent movie, if there are skillful writers behind the script. What the heck did they think?

Author: rosshasreturned
Review: My theater was quite throughout the whole movie: no one was laughing, no one was cheering, and no one shed a tear over moments that were supposed to be sad. The movie Love and Thunder is to Thor (the first movie) and the super hero genre as Spaceballs is to Star Wars and the sci-fi genre. It felt like a parody of super hero movies, not once taking itself seriously. I like jokes as much as the next guy, but to have one every minute that undercuts the moments of the scene is ridiculous to the point where it was no longer funny. For the sake of being a comedy it lost sight on world building and actually presenting a plot worth the price of admission. Marvel has been on a decline during phase 4, with movies like Thor: Love and Thunder now seaming to be a quick cash grab that people will buy into because of the name Marvel; a name that used to be fun and exciting, knowing how to balance the different tones of both its own individual movie and the cinematic universe.

Author: Wililjam
Review: This movie felt like a filler episode of a show that's had too many seasons, and they just filled it with some cool shots.

Author: bandre89
Review: A disappointment to say the least. Thor who, from what I've felt so far, has been a serious but funny dude comes off as stupid and childish in this film. In the beginning I hoped that it was the narration by Korg that we saw completely over exaggerated and over the top. But it was the actual events of the film; over exaggerated and over the top. It's a silly movie that misses out on every moment that could've been impactful. Looking back at the earlier films with genuine moments and seriousness makes this a joke towards itself.

Author: tonygaming-19067
Review: "Thor: Love and Thunder" is more or less a victory lap for all that director Taika Waititi achieved with his previous Marvel film, the often hilarious, rousing, and plainly refreshing "Thor: Ragnarok." And while it has too many familiar flourishes and jokes, this entertaining sequel is still a force for good, with enough visual ambition and heart in front of and behind the camera to stand on its own.

Author: impendingdd
Review_Title: Marvel is releasing garbage these days
Review: Taika is a bigot whom cares more about making himself laugh than making a coherent film. The man is a joke and should be banned from Hollywood. I'll even go further to say that Feige is a crook whom lately has been rushing out these movies with CGI that looks like it was done in 2005 and approves scripts so cheesy and lazy that I'm shocked only the VFX artists have whistleblown about their treatment on set. Surely, this puts a strain on every crew member, including the actors. They must be getting paid handsomely enough to still be able to smile during their interviews. Terrible movie and shame on Marvel for their efforts as of late. It's 2022 and a company as HUGE as Disney is releasing this kind of stuff. Let that really sink in and if you're one of those people who thinks, "oh we should be happy and not complain", then you're part of the problem because if they're able to do the bare minimum and still sell tickets, what makes you think they're not going to continue to do so?

Author: toprakcienfal
Review_Title: Yes Zeus, this wasn't fest of nudity but it was fest of foolishness.
Review: When the first scene came up, i thought we were still watching ads for other movies. When i realised this is the Thor movie, i said, this is going to be bad. The first 30 minutes is the worst Marvel has ever been. The dialogues between the GOTG and Thor felt like so strained. Also their jokes was just a bunch of cliches and mostly I didn't laugh. But as the movie continues, the stupid jokes somehow got better, the rythm of the movie went better and i started to get into the movie. And then, once again; goats. Whose idea was the put those stupid goats into the movie? They were really so annoying, every 3 seconds, they were just screaming. It was never funny and it was overused. They used goat screams like 10 times and all were bad. It made funny scenes cringe, it made serious scenes a foolishness. I never thought we won't see a worse Thor after the Endgame but writers made him so bad. Even if i want to i can't give you any spoilers because this movie don't have a story. It was just a compilation of unfunny jokes and Gorr was just a dissapointment. I really want my money back, this movie is far worst of Phase 4. I don't think i will be watching next movies of Phase 4. I never liked one, and if they try to sell these unfunny and boring movies, i won't be either.

Author: ConnerHidebrant
Review: I was super excited for this movie, Thor 3 is one of my favorite MCU projects and hearing that there was gonna be a 4th made me happy but it didn't work very well, the jokes were pretty flat and the only ones that made me laugh were the Stormbreaker and Hammer jokes. The chemistry between the cast is amazing, Chris Hemsworth is amazing as thor and you can tell he loves playing Thor. Gorr is one of the best MCU villains in a long while and i cant imagine anyone else playing him. Korg is my least favorite character, i liked the montage of Thor and Janes falling out and all the emotional value was ruined by Korgs Narration, Korg should've died when his body fell apart and pushed Thor to find Gorr and save those kids. Overall couldve been alot better. I know this movie could've been so much better because of the directors past films and Tv Shows.

Review: I am a massive Marvel fan. Our whole family is. I never ever thought I would leave a cinema after watching a Thor movie wondering what the heck I had just watched. I just hope they realise their mistakes and do a ton better job of it when it comes to writing their script!! I for one feel like I'll be questioning whether to even go to the cinemas to watch any more if they continue to go down this path. Very very disappointing.

Author: stsorrell
Review: When you've got three highly successful films in a franchise, plus the numerous Avengers films, a precedent, and expectations, have been set. While Thor did have a humorous side in all the films he had previously appeared in, he never came across as ridiculous as he did in Love and Thunder. The jokes were lame. His ego was childish. And talking to his axe and hammer repeatedly, even giving Stonebreaker a beer...pure rubbish. I couldn't believe I was actually watching an MCU movie. It was more like a B movie spoof, much like Hot Shots was to Top Gun.

Author: graykatana
Review_Title: Too campy and stupid. Dumbed down too far.
Review:
Very disappointed in this. Too campy, stupid and not really true to the characters as they were in previous movies. Jokes should augment a story not replace it, and this just felt like a medium for Taika Waititi's one-liners to the detriment of everything else. Didn't deal with serious issues, just made bad jokes that felt wrong. It had some funny moments and some interesting action scenes but overall
a disservice to what had gone before. I honestly didn't like where they went with it. Just dumbed down too far and now appears to be targeted to 8 year olds.

Author: rkeilitz-19-537915
Review_Title: Have we gone from Marvel fatigue to Marvel exhaustion?
Review: Disney is really draining that formula dry. "Marvel fatigue" is an expression people were using long before this particular bumpy movie in the studio's history, but it's especially applicable to a time when no more than a month or two passes without some new Marvel story hitting the market that now closes the gap between movies with television spinoffs beamed straight into people's homes via Disney+. What hope do these movies have to feel fresh or exciting when they're arriving at a pace to rival the clockwork release of their comic-book source material? This one feels like a parody of itself,childish and insignificant.

Author: Imalone_Dik
Review: Mediocre, even for a popcorn flick. The "humor" is... beyond cringe and almost always out of place, dialogues in a bunch of scenes are overly dramatic and it feels way to forced (lady Sif scene for instance), the not so subtle forcing of "The Message" is irritating to say the least (diversity is always welcome if its natural and organic, not forced upon) and so on and so on... The ONLY redeeming aspect of the movie is Christian Bale as Gorr who plays a masterful role as a deeply broken, and although his goal is simple, a very complex villain. Kind of worth a watch, but only if you dont pay for it.

Review: I only gave it two stars for the two times I laughed. The humor was baboon type humor. Again, Disney cares more about being woke than they care about the actual script. Author: reynaldojavierlorenzo
Review_Title: Thor: No Love, Mid and Thunder
Review: Thor: Love and Thunder does attempt to explore themes of love and loss whilst introducing the Mighty Thor and putting Thor on a journey of self discovery. However, it sadly doesn't work as well as it should due to a rushed pace and way too many jokes that are not funny. It has a childish humor which the Director seems to be over reliant on. It could be Taika Waitit's first ever bad movie. What Everything Everywhere All At Once did was expose Dr Strange and Marvel for being the creatively bankrupt "content" providers merely interested in profit over art. Scorsese's prophesy being fulfilled.

Author: koltonbrett
Review_Title: Thor...What have they done to you?
Review: I don't want to hear anymore about The Dark World being the worst Thor movie. Love & Thunder clearly takes that position. This really makes me sad because I've always loved Thor as a character and all three of his previous films. This fourth one is a mess though. It tried so hard to be funny, but ended up just being silly. It honestly felt like a parody of itself at times. I couldn't take anything seriously because it didn't take itself seriously. The whole Zeus scene is just dumb. I miss the Thor we got in the first two films, and while Ragnarok was a big shift away from those, at least it was successfully funny.

Review: We've been waiting for this, Streamers. Thor: Love and Thunder has finally been released in theaters. The MCU is back before us with more content that we've been clamoring for. Author: bechbo
Review_Title: Sadly a bad and forgettable movie
Review: Taika Waititi's Thor Ragnarok is one of the best MCU films, but this successor should never has been released in that state. It is bad in all departments, be it love story, drama, distress, action or special effects. One of the main reasons is the fact, that there is zero chemistry between Chris Hemsworth and Natalie Portman. There is chemistry between Tessa Thompson and both of them alone, but we are not talking about a Jane Foster-Valkyrie love story. So basically the "Love" foundation of the movie doesn't work at all.

Author: smawdsley30

Author: tracyh-11228
Review_Title: Christian Bale and Guns N Roses saved this movie.
Review: Ughhhh so disappointing!! My family & I are huge Marvel fans and were super excited to see it. We loved Thor Ragnarok, so we couldn't wait to see what followed it. There were sooo many cringey attempts at humor that this movie came off as embarrassingly hokey. Almost as if they were trying too hard. Pros: Christian Bale and the movie's soundtrack. Also, Tessa Thompson. Kick ass actress and character. Cons: Silly attempts at humour and Natalie Portman's over acting. Her scenes were pretty painful to watch. Aside from Black Swan, I can't even with her. In summary, I'd wait for this movie to become available on Disney+ rather than spend a small fortune on it at the theatre.

Author: classicsoncall
Review_Title: "So, how you feeling with the old stab wound?"
Review: I don't feel so bad now about missing this film in the theater. I generally enjoy the humor that goes into a Marvel Comics movie, but this one just didn't let up with its parody of everything it touched. It was about a half hour into the story when I finally realized that's the way it was going to be for the duration. It was too much, and interfered with what should have been the intensity of Thor's (Chris Hemsworth) mission to take down Gorr, the God Butcher (Christian Bale). Cinematically, the picture was on a par with prior films in the franchise and the special effects were fine as always, so no problem there. But the business about Jane Foster (Natalie Portman) receiving chemotherapy for Stage Four cancer and the jokes associated with it hit me the wrong way, since I personally know three people undergoing that treatment for different forms of the disease and it's really no laughing matter. The Guns n' Roses soundtrack seemed appropriate for the story with the driving beat of each song that complemented the action, though given the resolution with Jane entering Valhalla at the finale, they could have included 'Knockin' on Heaven's Door' for the windup. Wonder why they didn't think of that. Overall, somewhat of a disappointment for this viewer, as I see it was for so many others offering their comments.

Author: Avwillfan89
Review: The first part of this sequel is full of jokes, is zainy, wacky and has a light tone. And that works. The second half of it is more serious, with extra stakes, action sequences added and a few emotional moments. And that works too.

Author: torrascotia
Review: The reviews of this have been mixed and its obvious why. This movie doesn't really sit well within the MCU and it doesn't work well as a movie.

Author: kathanrshah
Review: Full of lazy writing. Scenes with Gorr had some substance, especially his monologue with the hero trio and final scene with Eternity. Rest of the movie could only be enjoyable by kids under the age of 4.

Author: lph-83641
Review: Poor taste! Many expletives, inappropriate contact for children AND youth. Bad comedy and writing ruined this Marvel movie. The only good thing about this movie was Christian Bale as the bad guy. What a way to continue to ruin a character like Thor. Will not EVER buy or watch this one again.

Author: antony-69
Review: This could, and should, be the film that ends Marvel. We all know that the franchise has been in decline for a while but this latest offering plumbs new depths. MCU was one hell of a franchise but the emphasis is firmly on the word "was". There have been occasional mid-steps along the way but no one has done as much damage as Taika Waititi. He has completely destroyed everything that he touches. Stop letting him be in films. Stop letting him write films. Stop letting him direct films.

Author: harithi23

Author: odysseasphilopoulos

Author: chris-b-welch
Review_Title: A very fun yarn in the spirit of Marvel comics
Review: I knew nothing about the storyline or this film, but I thought it was brilliant tbh. Natalie Portman and Chris Hemsworth reprise their on screen relationship superbly, and Taika Waititi did Marvel proud. Not to mention that soundtrack! I kept waiting for Jack Black to appear tbh. Hilarious cameo's and lots of fun make the film great for parents and kids to enjoy side by side, although Russell Crowe was awful and seems like a shoe in because of his name, so many better choices for Zeus out there, what were they thinking!? Overall it is a great addition to the Marvel universe, and the door is of course left open to continue adding to it. Let's just forget about Russell Crowe please. Think Green Lantern vibes Marvel.

Author: dimitri_jason
Review_Title: The king of worst marvel movies
Review: Just the worst movie I've seen this decade. Trying to be funny this film becomes a joke of the joke and brings down Thors character with it, the guardians of the galaxy and any other character that is included in this film including the marvel franchise in a whole. Absolutely rubbish. Well done Christian Bale for giving this film a bit of quality though, but even he isn't able to save this. Every thing is treated as a joke. I loved Ragnarok, it was great even if that was pushing the limits of silliness at times. But Love and thunder is a film made for the age of 9 maximum. I miss the days of the original Thor and Antony Hopkins as Odin.

Author: marcattaneo

Author: haes70
Review_Title: Could of be SOOOOO Much BETTER
Review: Could of been so much better. It should of been more dark with the Gor story line vs the Fraggle Rock RomCom it was.... Thor/Hulk/Rogue my favorite Marvel Heros so yes mostly disappointment for me.

Review_Title: Less godly to Ragnarok but still great

Author: nathanchasewomack
Review: Like Ragnarok, this Thor outing is yet again the comic book come to life on the silver screen. It's cheesy, it's corny, it's colorful, it's lighthearted & completely over the top...hey, it's Thor, baby. You want an Oscar caliber movie then go see The Dark Knight. This hits all the right notes. Chris as Thor is more jacked than ever. Jane as lady-Thor surprisingly worked for me. Christian did all he could w/a lame, generic villain. Tessa stole every scene she was in. So, Thor has 4 solo movies now...I better see Enchantress AND Beta Ray Bill next time! No excuses! Oh, great music choices as well.

Author: randykrus
Review_Title: It's a joke. A bad one.
Review: This movie is a complete joke. There isn't a shred of seriousness taken in any part of this movie save for the first few minutes. It's actually impressive how little care was taken with this property. It's like Marvel gave Taika Waititi free reign and Marvel clearly didn't care what the end result would be. And it's hard to actually critique any one element of this movie because it's all so stupid. Acting, action, plot...it's all very meaningless in a movie such as this. Even the actors deliver their lines like they could give two sheets. I'm writing this as I'm watching it-and it just gets dumber as it goes-it really is shocking how silly and bad this movie is.

Author: jesternz
Review: I'd like to say this is the 'Airplane' version of the Avengers series, but that would be unkind to Airplane, even the sequel. The humour is forced and unnatural. An absolute car crash of a movie. Wait till it's free on terrestrial TV.

Author: ksteevens

In this case the silly humour was relentless and tiresome and conversations to long. The acting was sloppy and almost purposefully amateurish. Could not help but roll my eyes at the writers insistence to introduce a woke message into every movie and series. The Big let down. Worst movie in the franchise.

Author: monol22
Review: What a sad unfortunate slap in the face this movie was. Everything was there for it to be great. I think it could even be easily edited into greatness with a directors cut. Too much humor, unfunny cheesy humor. Hamfisted woke messaging shoved down the viewers throat. Korg has two dads, Heimdall's daughter is a boy now... Changed his name from Astrid which is a traditional female name that means divinely beautiful to Axl. If that wasn't intentional, that's certainly what it came across as. Also Valkyrie made several loud hints to her attraction to the ladies. None of this would matter or be a problem if it felt organic and not like the producers forced it all into the movie at gunpoint. Dint get me started on poor Christian Bale. He gave this movie his all and they sharted in his face. I'm about done with the MCU. On a scale from 1 to 10. NO WAY HOME being a 10, this would be a 4 at best. I'd give it a 2 if not for Christian Bale. He gets a 10. I doubt he will ever work with Disney again after this.

Author: mike-kennedy2012
Review: Bale is good. Screaming goats dumb. Lady Thor was not interesting though she should've been. Thor granting others his powers was a nice touch if you want to just make stuff up for laughs. Author: willengland-30544

Author: ryantgray-53572
Review: The writers should give their money back, and the producers and director should be forgoing salaries while begging the studio for fogiveness....if this was a moderate to low budget movie, it would be passable, but with the a slew of big names, 250mil budget, tons of back story to work with and decades of Marvel comics to draw from, this should have easily been a fun popcorn flick. But it was flat, jokes were tired, actors uninterested, accept Bale and Hemsworth, both tried hard, but were given play-dough and told to mold the David. I went expecting black widow or capt Marvel average movies...but so much worse...sad that it Ragnarok was followed by this...don't even know what to call it. UGH! I'll settle with Ugh. Don't waste the tix, wait to stream online.

Author: OlderThanYou
Review: I would say that the writers of this farce were definitely overpaid. This is evidenced by the amount of hallucinatory drugs they could afford to ingest while coming up with this movie. The dialog was dreadful, the plot silly and the plot twists were, well, twisted. The Mighty Thor has been reduced to a "Cartoon" character...he ranks right up there Daffy Duck and Elmer Fudd. The list of otherwise excellent actors in the film is long and distinguished. If they continue playing these types of gigs they will soon be relegated to the scrap heap of "B", no, make that "C" movies. I thought that having Loki move on was a positive. Now I kind of miss him. Overall the highlight of the film was...well, there were none. Why 2 stars? Well some of the music was not too bad.

Author: Review4U

Instead of BEING influential, they're being influenced... in the worst ways. The shark has been jumped.

Author: yoshbuck

There are lovely visuals like the Gorr planet and some jokes I wanted, like the dumpling god. Initially, Gorr was such a delight; you felt sorry for him and understood his motivations. Now let's get to why this movie sucks.

Author: meissotruey
Review_Title: What to say, what to say...
Review: My general impression of this movie is that i've just lost 2 hours of my life. It seems like Marvel's conveyor clearly lost and doesn't know which direction and side to go, after they failed everything with multiverse, after they released the worst TV series, that i've ever seenz with the worst dialogues, lore and plot called Loki, and failed amazing sitcom parts of WandaVision mixing it with ungodly MCU lore... Gosh. Latest SM movie was also disgusting. New DS just average. What was the last the can be even called not bad? Black Widow? Eternals? Well, MAY BE! The last good were i'd say Avengers? MCU never had lots of good movies. I'd say Iron Man and Homecoming are the best, solid, last 2 Avengers movies are good(well, i suppose Age of Ultron and Civil War are not that far, but the first Avengers if you look and them now(personally i was in cinema on premiere in 2012, being 13y.o, Avengers entered theatres 1 day before my birthday) have bad dialogues, like they were written by some young schooler and spoils it all) and probably i'd say that i like most of all other Thor 3, though it failed in the end, and couldn't decide either it wants to be an epic action or entertainment. What's about this movie? It just sums it up what we already saw before: whole thing turns into a toothless child cringe "comedy". Remember when we had that epic feeling before, like in Avengers, that something big is happening, that heroes are cool? Forget it! All main cast just turned into clown and "celebrities" of the show. And you could miss it but, it started back at the Iron Man 3, that idiotic direction and vision. I'm tired of all this feigned fun, pathetic wink to the viewer and circus, yeah this movie feels kinda average but this is just over the top. Oh, wait, what do we have here? The most sickening and infantile ending in history of the cinema? Thor does superstupid thing in the most important moment? And then uses his TALKING SKILLS ? Thor? Yeah, this guy is know for his speeches... And how... Just no comments. Movie ends with a note like "next time you'll finally get what you wished for" and you know people, i never dreamed of gachi fight in MCU(sure it will be, after seeing how this movie looks like), it is such a shame. Go to hell, Marvel Studios!

Review: Yesterday evening I watched "Thor - Love and Thunder" in the cinema. Here is my personal impression of the movie (minimal spoilers to the initial situation of the story).

Author: zain_ahmed
Review_Title: I really don't understand the negative reviews
Review: This movie is so refreshing to watch. There are three parts really. Comedy, love and some amazing fights! Love and Thunder seems very appropriate name when you finish watching the movie. The only element I found missing was Loki. It would have been a perfect 10/10 if he was there. Nevertheless, it's still a lot of fun to watch. Oh and the score! I had my eyes watery and had goosebumps several times! I like how they kept Thor at the center of the whole movie. Also, we finally see why Jane and Thor grew apart. It's basically just a classic Thor adventure(like an average Rick and Morty episode). If you're taking it to seriously, you're doing it wrong.

Author: benmutton
Review: Absolute Crap!!! Why the constant bad jokes???

Author: silversurfer1288
Review: Let me start by saying that this movie won't be enjoyed by all equally, however, for those, like me, who are a fan of Taika Watiti's other work, you will love this movie!

Author: villain-16905
Review: The jokes wearing thin. Too many gags, cartoonish characterisations and dull one liners.

Author: myblueblazer
Review: Review: Takia Watitti and Chris Hemsworth do a good job again but I felt that the movie was unrealistic. Even though I liked some of the funny parts here, I felt that the hilariousness was becoming overkill for this series. Thor 4 is an action packed, hilarious, and heartfelt movie, with an emotional love story, and a killer 1980's Soundtrack that rivals GOTG's. It does steer towards maybe "too cheesy" at times, but it is still much better than Thor the dark world. I did love the soundtrack!!

Author: ericstevenson
Review: This movie's plot is fairly straight forward, with Thor teaming up with his ex, Jane who now has the power of Mjolnir to stop Gor. I'm so glad I don't have to learn how to pronounce Mjolnir. Anyway, I can completely understand why a lot of people don't like this film. It may be because we were waiting to see more of Thor with the Guardians of the Galaxy. At least we get like ten minutes of that in the beginning! We also wanted to see more of the Gods team up to fight Gor, but instead, they choose to be arrogant and not do that.

Author: cathiiannii-20405
Review: Loki did the right thing pulling the pin before this train wreck was released!! Will forever be known as the movie that destroyed Marvel.. cheesy,immature and a disgrace to the franchise.hiw did this even get approved as a valid Marvel movie? Everyone asleep at the wheel and the best part was Christian Bale who should have been the main feature not a cameo type role..Thor was ridiculed and torn down in the whole debacle... Just dreadful....cannot see many of these actors signing on again after this 😔

Author: mpyner
Review: I'm obviously not the target demographic for this film. It was just awful.

Author: taker-81289
Review_Title: Doubled Down On What Made Ragnarok So Good... and It Was Too Much
Review: Horrible pacing and drawn out, unfunny, overblown jokes ruin some cool aspects of the story. They just took everything good about Ragnarok and blew it up x1000.

Author: liorkorobeynikov
Review: The character of Gorr the god butcher as presented as a concept is very interesting but heavily squandered in a film that only does humor and visuals right.

Author: SnoopyStyle
Review: After suffering a devastating lost, Gorr (Christian Bale) seeks to destroy all the Gods. Thor (Chris Hemsworth) must save the children of New Asgard who have been kidnapped by Gorr. Jane Foster (Natalie Portman) is dying from cancer. She is chosen by Mjolnir to be the Mighty Thor. They are joined by King Valkyrie (Tessa Thompson) and Korg (Taika Waititi). Russell Crowe makes a memorable appearance as Zeus.

Author: jboothmillard
Review: The first Thor movie was good, The Dark World was very good, Ragnarok was fantastic and my favourite so far, this next sequel featuring the Marvel Cinematic Universe hero picks up from the events of Avengers: Endgame, written and directed by Taika Waititi (What We Do in the Shadows, Jojo Rabbit). Basically, in a barren desert, Gorr (Christian Bale) and his daughter Love (India Rose Hemsworth, Chris's daughter) are the last of their people, and struggle to survive. Despite praying to their god, Rapu, Love dies of starvation. Close to death himself, Gorr discovers an oasis and encounters Rapu (Jonny Brugh) himself, who possess an ancient weapon known as All-Black the Necrosword. Rapu makes fun of Gorr for his helplessness and refuses to help him. Feeling betrayed, Gorr takes the Necrosword, beheads Rapu, and vows to kill all the gods. Gorr is granted the ability to manipulate shadows and produce monsters but is cursed with impending death and corrupted by the sword's influence. Elsewhere, Thor (Chris Hemsworth) has lost the weight he gained during the Blip and has joined the Guardians of the Galaxy on many adventures to bring peace to various worlds throughout the universe. But, following the destruction of his home planet Asgard, he is going through a midlife crisis, trying to figure out his purpose. After leaving the Guardians, Thor responds to a distress call from Asgardian warrior Sif (Jaimie Alexander), his childhood friend, finding her injured and warns him of Gorr, and that he plans to target New Asgard. Meanwhile, Dr. Jane Foster (Natalie Portman), Thor's ex-girlfriend, has terminal cancer and has been going through medical treatment which has been proving ineffective. Reading books about Norse mythology, Jane reads about the power of Thor's fractured hammer Mjolnir, and travels to New Asgard hoping that it might heal her. Due to an enchantment Thor unknowingly placed on it years earlier to protect Foster, Mjolnir reforges and bonds itself to her. As Gorr begins to attack New Asgard, Thor arrives, and they fight. During the battle, Thor is surprised to see Jane has become the Mighty Thor wielding his hammer. Nevertheless, they team up with New Asgard King Valkyrie (Tessa Thompson) and Kronan gladiator Korg (Taika Waititi) to fight Gorr. The group thwarts Gorr, but he escapes, kidnapping several Asgardian children and imprisoning them in the Shadow Realm. The group travels to Omnipotence City, a realm that is home to many gods, to warn them and ask for their help. The leader of the gods, Zeus (Russell Crowe), fears Gorr and refuses to help, thinking that they will be safe remaining and hiding in the city. Zeus orders the group are captured to prevent them from exposing the city's location, but a fight breaks out, during which Korg's body is destroyed but his face remains alive. Thor impales Zeus with his own thunderbolt, which Valkyrie steals before they escape. As the group continue their journey, Thor and Jane rekindle their romantic relationship and she reveals her illness. The group arrives at the Shadow Realm but are unable to find the children. Jane deduces that this is a trap for Gorr to take Thor's axe, Stormbreaker, which can summon the Bifrost, so he can enter the realm of Eternity and make a wish to destroy all gods. Gorr overpowers the group, severely injuring Valkyrie. The group retreats to Earth, while Gorr manages to steal Stormbreaker. Jane has been drained of her strength each time she uses Mjolnir, Thor warns her that using it once more will likely kill her and persuades her to let him fight Gorr alone while she recuperates. Thor finds the kidnapped children at Eternity's altar and, using Zeus's thunderbolt, gives the children powers to fight against Gorr's monsters. While Thor fights Gorr, Jane sense him, and when Gorr is about to kill him, she chooses to join the battle with Mjolnir to save him. They destroy the Necrosword, freeing Gorr from its influence, but he, Thor and Jane are brought into Eternity's realm. With Gorr ready to make his wish, Thor implores Gorr to revive his daughter instead of destroying the gods. Thor leaves Gorr to make his decision and holds Jane, who succumbs to her illness. Gorr is moved seeing Thor and Jane together, and wishes for Eternity to revive Love, which is granted. As Gorr dies from the curse, he asks Thor to take care of Love. Back in New Asgard, Korg's body is restored, and he has started a family, Jane's sacrifice has been honoured with a stone statue, and Valkyrie and Sif train the children to become future warriors. Thor adopts Love, who joins him in his adventures, with Thor wielding Mjolnir and Love wielding Stormbreaker. In the mid-credits scene, Zeus is recuperating and sends his son Hercules (Brett Goldstein) to kill Thor. In the post-credits scene, Janes arrives at the gates of Valhalla (a realm like Heaven), where she is welcomed by Heimdall (Idris Elba). Also starring Chris Pratt as Peter Quill aka Star-Lord, Dave Bautista as Drax (as David Bautista), Karen Gillan as Nebula, Pom Klementieff as Mantis, Sean Gunn as Kraglin, Vin Diesel as Groot, Bradley Cooper as Rocket, Ben Falcone (Melissa McCarthy's husband) as Asgardian Stage Manager, Luke Hemsworth (Chris's brother) as Actor Thor, Matt Damon as Actor Loki, Melissa McCarthy as Actor Hela, and Sam Neill as Actor Odin. Hemsworth is still likeable being the muscular space Viking, Portman is likeable as his powered-up ex going from cancer-stricken brown hair to blonde super warrior, Bale is a reasonably menacing villain playing the "God Butcher" (being chalk white he looks like the Nun from The Conjuring series), and there is good support from Thompson and Crowe. The attempts by the makers to be knowingly funny or clever don't all work, with Jane trying to "find a catchphrase", Thor missing his treasured hammer, and the two screaming goats, some of the catchy rock music is a little distracting, and the special effects aren't completely up to scratch, but there is enough spectacle and exciting sequences, an alright superhero fantasy action. Worth watching!

Author: Wolverine1990
Review_Title: Thor is destroyed.. Marvel is not interesting anymore.. with increase in no of weak characters and old characters losing their charm.
Review: Thor is more like a clown, you won't be able to believe he is the same guy who sttabed thanos in chest. Who fought hulk twice. Iron man once. I mean, wtf. It's just comedy with seldom fighting scenes. Russell Crowe, such a big actor plays another clown like character, with you won't believe such a small role in such a big movie, perhaps he has more to continue his funny clown like villain role in coming marvel movies. You see, Marvel has grown to become just another big brand with nothing interesting left to offer the audience coming to theaters with high expectations, bcz of what I said in title, increase in number of weak characters and old main league characters losing their charm.

Author: fahadjalil
Review:
Character Assassination, Great actors wasted in such insulting plots,no storyline, just a joke , such a capable plot turned into a joke and the facts that hurts most is that it's a freaking 200 million dollar film
Why would they even do that?

Author: Muelko
Review: I am speechless. Taika, are you out of your mind? The director of the Oscar movie Jojo Rabbit, a very overrated one, but a good movie for sure, and one of the most entertaining movies of the MCU, Thor: Ragnarok, filmed this... how I put this right... just a big pile of mess, atrocious CGI, and the screenplay? Was he high or something? Absolutely nothing worked here, not a single pay-off or joke. It's literally an SNL skit or something. I would've written a better script - in a freaking day. Thor is just a clown here and when in Ragnarok, there was built a beautiful balance between dumb fun and epic fantasy comic-book movie, here? Here are those obnoxiously unfunny goats. Thank God those were in like 3 scenes. Some dialogue was so bad I felt sorry for the actors and for the whole movie. This movie should've been the standout of phase 4 and this summer, but it's literally the worst movie of the year, I cannot believe I'm writing this. I just. I'm. Nah whatever, let's watch some real cinema.

Author: ohroonoko
Review_Title: The most fun I've had since Thor: Ragnarok
Review: This was the most fun movie I've watched, maybe since Thor: Ragnarok. This is an unabashed laugh out loud comedy, but with a lot of heart. And it ends on very high notes (including the final post credit scene) unlike Ragnarok does. (Not saying L + T is better than Ragnarok because that film was epic in scope and I possibly prefer it, if only slightly more so).

THOR:

Author: Buckster69
Review_Title: Highlights A Problem with the Whole MCU Project
Review: After 'End Game' essentially drew a line under 'Phase 1' any subsequent movie featuring those characters, really is just a frippery, or worse, a cash grab.

Author: amarsamlal
Review: The constant sarcasm and jokes in this movie are tiring. Filmmakers (especially Marvel) are hesitant and afraid to make meaningful, serious movies. Instead, Marvel has opted to try and entertain the audience by bombarding them with jokes every three seconds. The result is an excruciatingly dull movie that drags on for two hours.

Review_Title: The funniest entry in the MCU

Author: luisq05
Review: The movie it's just cringe from beggining to end. It saddens me how low Thor has fallen, in the first movies I remember him having and arc, becoming a responsible guy, someone one could call king worthy and now, he's just a manchild doing silly stuff.

Author: mstrhwy
Review_Title: THIS MOVIE SHOULD HAVE A 100% RATING
Review: Honestly, if you didn't enjoy Love and Thunder then you either haven't been paying attention or are truly dead inside.

Author: wahidabumansour
Review: Absolutely a trash movie , by far this is one of the worst movie produced by marvel ...

Author: icanstilldigit
Review_Title: Hardcore Marvel fans will not like it.
Review: Wow. After watching this movie I really didn't know what to think. My 13 year old and his friend loved it. It was very strange. It was a Thor and Gorr movie, then it was a rom-com, then a journey movie, then back to Thor and Gorr. Bale was wasted with not enough screen time. I wanted so much more from Crowe. There was some woke stuff mixed in unnecessarily which seems to be Disney's MO these days. There was a lot of forced jokes, and an axe was the funniest actor. After Ragnarok I would call it a disappointment, but I didn't hate it as much as a lot seem to.

Author: nkishudak
Review: After rewatching it J still think this is a misunderstood movie. Taika himself is misunderstood genius. Although he's got a great sense of humor his creation like this and Jo Jo Rabbit, recently Our flag means death are not comedies. Everyone expected this movie to be something like Ragnarok. This is a great drama with some action and comedy. I think he did a great job as always. Don't understand the hate at all. I really enjoyed in the cinema and now owning it on digital as part of my collection. I took one star off because I cannot stand Melissa M, annoying, untalented not funny.

Author: TRIDENT1745
Review_Title: The Punch That Marvel Movies Needed
Review: Never before has a Marvel movie existed that contains all the elements of a Marvel Movie while being so fun, witty and laughable. Taika Waititi has made a movie which brings together the epic nature of Thor with a ridiculously funny and unbelievable script. Yes, it might seem childish and offensive to the franchise, but let yourself like it, this movie is really a work of art.

Author: louiepapp
Review: I get that people didn't like it being silly a couple of places. However over all it was really entertaining. I really enjoyed watching it. If you go into it realizing it is an action comedy movie you will enjoy it more.

Author: snapeseverus-65135
Review_Title: a Thor movie without Loki? at least give us a good script.
Review:
Cheap humor terrible script, bad direction
Even if the quality of the movie was not so bad, I still could not be satisfied. Bcz Personally, I don't think you can have a Thor movie without Loki
You can't remove Thor's best feature, his brotherly relationship with Loki, and expect to not lose the audience that often loves Loki.

Author: leigh-69651
Review: Ragnarok was amazing, easily top 3 for me when it comes to Marvel movies. Love and Thunder...I don't even know where to start. First, what a complete letdown. At times I couldn't even believe I was watching a Marvel movie. It felt like a parody movie. The jokes weren't funny and felt so forced. I was literally cringing in my seat. For the first time in my movie going experience, I left to use the bathroom. I have never done that for any Marvel movie. The dialogue and even the plot was just so bad. I don't know what happened but man do I hope they change it up because I can't sit through another movie like this.

Author: mattandlaura-81465
Review: I read all the bad reviews but watched this movie anyway. Christian Bale was brilliant. He was on point all the way. Sadly everything else missed the mark. Why do they keep making Thor sound like a moron? Too many attempts at comedy throughout the movie. Disney, please stop injecting lgbtq references into movies. It's blatant, unnecessary and didn't add anything. A well written script would be a better option. Stick to the story and make it action packed and entertaining. In all I think it was an extremely disappointing portrayal of a movie.

Author: trounce-19858
Review: This movie is comical and falls into stupidity.

Author: dsuda-73903
Review: Although I think the lead actors put on a great performance, this movie fell flat for me. The plot wasn't very deep. I really liked Christian Bales performance, would have liked to learn more about his character. I don't get why Thor has become such a dad joke character...they did the same with Zeus. It's just dumb. This could have been so much better.

Review: The movie had no substance, the movie only seems to have some depth whenever christian bale is on screen add to this his extremely small screen time.

Review: Christian Bale is Legend. But Rest of Movie is Not much Enjoyable as expected. This time Thor is Much like Mickey Mouse that Thor. There is Still time save MCU. Please don't Destroy thor Character, thor was my once Favourite character. But now he is just Babysitter who's Weapons can be lifted by anyone even kid WTF. Please don't Spoil Thor.

Author: dasarimadhu-36093
Review: Superb comdey and action movie fan of MCU and gor the god buchar is very well vilain and Jan faster is superb just love it movie .........................

Author: Taaneekaa
Review_Title: The least impressive in the Thor series
Review: The worst Thor movie factually and objectively. Even my LGBT friends weren't wowed by the movie. People are saying that it contains forced humour and they're right. At times, the humour was nonsense. I love me some humour and really loved Ragnarok but definitely Taika wanted to trigger some people instead of inclusivity. He wasn't making this movie for artistic and story purposes but to fulfill his agenda. Taika made Nebula scream and turned her character into someone who's just one scream away from getting slapped. The movie is only making money because it already has a huge fan base (people like us). Also Valkyrie calling herself king sounded stupid. Korg was extremely boring. Thor was annoying. Bale was so so good but overshadowed by forced humour and making Thor look well like Thor who could take anyone down but he couldn't even kill him himself alone. Natalie was actually really good too. I was impressed. Her actions were spectacular to watch. It was refreshing to see her wield mijolnir and she acted good. I enjoyed her Thor scenes more than Chri's Thor scenes. The children couldn't act besides the kid who plays Heimdal's son. It was a bit cring worthy to see them act. Valkyrie doesn't go to the final showdown with Gorr because she gets stabbed and says to Thor "well I think I lost my kidney so you'd have to go alone". Imagine saying this when a god butcher is hell bent on killing every god. This made absolutely no sense at all. A Wasted opportunity.

Author: jmpusateri
Review_Title: I expected better from a Marvel Movie
Review: The worse Marvel adaptation so far, since Stan Lee passed away. The quality was much better when he was involved with the production of Marvel movies. The Marvel movies after 2019 just keep getting farther and farther away from his vision. In Thor, Love and Thunder, there just is not an adult in the room. It focuses too much on children ages 4 to 9 years old. What made all the other Thor movies enjoyable was that they targeted the generation that grew up reading the 1960 and 1970 comics. An adult has trouble understanding the theoretical physics of the time space continuum and quantum mechanics, so how is a child going to relate to these complex theories? Yet the movie is targeting young children as the demographic with these themes. At times I was waiting for the Muppets to dance across the screen and a romper room sing-along. The dialog lacked considerably and the acting for the most part was one bad liner after another. Christian Bale put in a great performance, only to be surrounded by characters that had no substance. What a waste of talent. Is this what we can expect from Marvel in the future; Marvel movies with the look and feel of Saturday morning Power Rangers? What was Taika Waititi thinking.

Author: tjbrian-78643
Review: I was really hoping we would be treated to something like Thor 3. This one didn't quite live up to that hype. I'm not sure what the difference was, it just didn't have that magical feeling to it. The jokes seemed less funny, the effects didn't look as good. It was alright, just missing a lil' razzle dazzle.

Author: keithfmanaton
Review_Title: Even worse than the last one, they really made the effort here
Review: OK Chris can't act, his great to look at and a really nice gut but... Don't put him in situations where the story &script are awful and the supporting cast dont know why they're there. The las 8 or so MCU films have slid fats. Probable starting around the time of GotG II. Lack of creativity, comfortable position that everyone;'s going to lap it up etc, whatever. This really is the lowest of low point so far. Cringeworthy lines form the outset. Everyone just going through the motions. Even the visuals are uninspired and formulaic. Why, why, why... didnt it just bomb at the box office and send a message?

Author: dustinjeffersonmitchell
Review_Title: Horrible movie, Disney continues to ruin things.
Review: Worst MCU movie to date and one of the worst movies I've ever watched.

Author: adrenilinmatt-56062
Review_Title: When humor and politics are dominant we get... this
Review: A relatively terrible movie. The ending being its only saving grace. Forced humor and overbearing politics yet again. Marvel and Disney are on a losing streak here. With this and she hulk, we see what really matters to these "artists" now. Sacrificing artistic vision and story and atmosphere in the name of "inclusion". Of course they're calling Valkyrie 'king'. Of course she had a girlfriend. Of course korg has a boyfriend. Of COURSE. It's all just so forced and entirely unsubtle. This is not even bad compared to she hulk. So I'd still say watch this instead of that, but the major question here is this;

Author: Nagitokomeda
Review: I'll keep this short. This film was clearly two and a half hours long, but half an hour was cut out so they could have more showings. As a result, we are left with a rushed film that was weak writing, bad CGI and some painfully unfunny scenes.

Author: JohnCritic
Review: If you are a fan of marvel movies you will probably like it. Confusing parts of movie tho. Who is this super villian, why is he suddenly taking on his daughter? Not a lot of important stuff going on but some cool fighting scenes.

Author: marcusmaroo
Review_Title: To Much zany not Enough Story
Review: Where Ragnarok's humor led to places and felt well placed Love and Thunder was zany for the sake of being zany. It felt like every scene had to have a dose of zany shoved into it because..well it had to be more zany. I think that just because you can doesn't mean you should. And Love And Thunder shouldn't have. The heavy storyline that starts the movie is underwhelmed by the humor that is smashed into the story for what sometimes felts was funny for funny sake. Christian Bale is a massive bright spot in this one and the music is outstanding if you are a Guns and Roses fan. Over all not a bad film but if you have seen one scene with a screaming goat the you have seen them all.

Author: petresebastian
Review_Title: I cant believe how people are so critique with this movie, but not with MOM
Review: It was an awsome movie. Like all Thor movies, it was a comedy combined with his road to become a better person and the understanding of himselfe and his place in the universe. It wasn't boring at all.

Author: ezyja
Review: Let's just say this was very average and had way too many cringeworthy bits, I wanted to like this but on multiple viewings I just found it gets worse. Bale is not on screen for long enough, Hemsworth is less to blame but I feel it needs new direction as Takia has outstayed his welcome and did anyone else find the goats annoying....? Bland just bland. Tries to be way to funny and just isn't and I didn't like how there's a new Thor in town which makes our Thor seem less important cos anyone who's deemed worthy can be Thor, I mean it makes Cap wielding the hammer less important and the bloody goats, what's with them,.......

Author: dean245
Review: Big fan of the MCU, big fan of Thor, Hemsworth and Taika, Bale but this was just meh.

Author: Burg1993
Review_Title: Movie feels incomplete, could have been a tv show episode
Review: This movie felt more like watching a tv show than a movie. It was rushed, had poor pacing and the story had little time to develop. Christian Bale did great as the villain, with the little screen time he got.

Author: athirn
Review_Title: Like a fart on a funeral. Taika what was that?!
Review: I heard that Taika Waititi was a big joker, and I like that. But this time something didn't happen at all. "Love and Thunder" has way too high contrast between drama and jokes. Like Taika shot two movies at once--a drama about Thor and his lost love and a parody on Thor movies; and randomly mixed them together. And the jokes? Jesus Christ, reasoning the jealous axe with tickling it for relaxing the tense were awful. If it was a complete parody in Mel Brooks style, that would work, but this is a part of the official Marvel Cinematic Universe, Taika! What have you been thinking about?! And why the hell did the studio allow you to make THIS?!

Author: lord_orsum
Review_Title: Too much comedy, not enough peril
Review: It is possible to put humour into a superhero movie without undermining the gravity of the threat being faced. This film fails to do that.

Author: abamlanbhoi
Review_Title: It's ok if you are not a marvel fan. Otherwise disappointing.
Review:
1. The jokes should be limited
2. Thor didn't get any wow moment in the whole movie to remember.

Author: Silver5963
Review_Title: All's Fair in Love and Gorr
Review: This movie is overhated. There. I said it. There is a lot to love about this film, and here's what I think:

Author: paul-ayres-60784
Review: I cannot emphasise enough how disappointing I found this comedy. I call it a comedy but I did not find it at all amusing. It has nothing in common with the original comic book character of Thor that I used to read as a child. I was a great fan of the Marvel comics but the latest Marvel movies are nothing but ridiculous. Why do they keep turning them into bad comedies?

Author: MamadNobari97
Review_Title: Too Short and Fast-Paced and Too Much Komdi

I was really excited back when I first heard the news of Christian Bale joining the movie, but just as I expected, he had little screen time and the script focused more on the comedy and throwing jokes at us every second than give us a good story.

Author: jay632
Review_Title: love the cast, hated the sillyness
Review: Its always nice to see the guardians cast and the thor cast. But this movie abandoned any good story telling and infused it with tonnes of sillyness. I mean i expect a few from taika waititi, but there was an overload of it. There were barely any scenes where he didn't try to make it silly. Good for a young disney audience, but for a seasoned mcu fan, this film isn't up to par.

Author: zarehkasraa
Review: How can you make a movie so much dumb?

Author: Wapucho
Review: I wanted to enjoy this film but it was almost unwatchable after the first scenes with Gorr. So many cringe jokes, over and over again. There was some potential with the Mighty Thor scenes and other Gorr scenes, but those were quickly forgotten due to the overindulgence in silly quips, forgettable lines, and some really bad CGI (computer generated images/scenes). The first half to two thirds of the movie are some of the worst I've seen in a superhero movie, while the last third was better. Overall, I just didn't appreciate how low Thor has been brought down. I almost didn't finish the movie but I figured I'd at least give it a chance. 3/10 for me!

Disney please stop making movies and trying to groom kids. Apparently my review is to short so I will continue. Story line was lame Russel Crowe who I usually like is a putz but I think that was the intent. I don't know I'm over this.

Author: jrgoebel

Thor was a bumbling fool the whole time and the plot was ridiculous and jumpy. Loved the idea of Jane becoming a Thor but it didn't need to emasculate Thor to do it.

Author: mephisto2424
Review_Title: The movie feels to be very rushed
Review: This movie could've been good if it wasn't plagued with pointless, over the top childish and dumb humor that creeps in every 2 minutes and completely ruins the story. After a very promising first 20 minutes the movie falls apart into stupidity. The movie feels to be very rushed. Director is over reliant on unnecessary and childish humor. Also some of the ideas Waititi plays around are fun and enjoyable, such as the 80s inspired rock-costumes and the designs of many aliens. The score and soundtrack are really well implemented. The soundtrack is really good, all the songs are classics that fit the tone and style well but some could have been used better. The only good thing about the movie is the soundtrack.

Author: Foreverisacastironmess123
Review_Title: It's fun but too much stupid attempts at comedy big it down and stop it from really hitting its stride!
Review: Yeah too much of everything kind of, like for example the screaming giant space goats, it would have been funny as a one-off joke but it's something that pops up throughout the whole movie! And this movie really assumes you must love Korg a whole lot because he has not one but three patronising narrations that open and close the movie and bring you up to date with what happened between here and Endgame, and I didn't like those scenes very much as they just didn't do it for me and felt like a lazy attempt to condense the story and get it moving faster, one would have worked at the beginning of the movie but it's overdone, and so is Korg grossly, I thought he worked much better in Ragnarok because he and the schtick approach was new and was done much better and just enough for it to not be to obnoxious in that movie, but here I felt sick of him within moments and he way overstayed his welcome and was just annoying as fk!! Urg it's like the movie was made for severely attention deficit people who can't sit still and take in a movie for like two minutes, it was terrified of slowing down even just a little and just letting the story breathe for a while, the rapid fire jokes were for me having a bad effect on the more serious aspects and the pathos, I thought it clashed horribly when it would go from her as the lady Thor to sick and dying in the hospital, you simply cannot plonk something as deadly serious as freaking cancer in a movie like this and expect it to work, it's like having Billy get a brain tumour in Gremlins 2! It felt like there was a really good movie in there somewhere, just between Thor Jane and Gorr but it didn't focus on that enough, I really didn't think Natalie Portman and Chris Hemsworth has any chemistry at all in the original movie but here I thought the opposite, they're a little older and things have changed a lot since that picture and she seemed more relaxed than before and I liked her as a warrior woman I thought it was cool, I was surprised by how she ended up at the end I thought it was surprisingly sad, don't worry about her coming back in any sequels folks! Christian Bale was surprisingly awesome and very creepy as the villain, I thought he came off as genuinely insane and lethal, I wanted more of him, he was probably the most threatening villain in a marvel movie yet. I also loved how his story ended as well, never expected to see one of the biggest cosmic entities of the Marvel universe in one of the movies, kudos to Taika for not having Eternity crack some goofy joke, although I'm sure it was severely tempting! There was definitely some awesome things in it, I loved the visuals and some of the huge locations, and the hall of the gods and the silly Zeus was where I thought the comedy did work really well and I liked that scene a lot with Thor declaring the gods cowardly and ticking off the most lazy Zeus ever, look forward to see where that leads in the future. I was overall slightly disappointed with this, it took what worked for Ragnarok and cranks it up to eleven and for some that might work but for me the comedy was mostly just annoying and obnoxious, frequently stopped the movie dead and prevented it from really ever taking off in a big way, this overstuffed cosmic mess of a film proves that Mr Waititi is capable of overestimating his strengths as a director and also that he could really do with learning a little restraint! X.

Author: ChrisBeaken
Review: Thor is one of my favorite characters in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. Although not all his films were perfect, the direction that has been decided to take with his character has been an emotional and awesome reinvention of what used to be a character that lacked an interesting personality. This film builds upon the events of the previous films that Thor has appeared in and develops a character study of a man who has lost everything and is now in the midst of an identity crisis. This is brilliantly illustrated through the black comedy approach brought upon by director Taika Waititi who is able to balance the sillier aspects of the story as well as the dramatic undertones that breathes life into this film. The visuals are stunning, injecting the world of the Marvel Universe with color and life that is the equivalent of candy for the eyes. The performances are amazing with Chris Hemsworth owning his role as Thor by injecting an admirable balance of comedy and tragedy. Natalie Portman's return as Jane Foster was perfectly handled with her character arc being an emotional beat and justification for the previous films that she appeared in. However, Christian Bale as the antagonist, Gorr the God Butcher, was undeniably one of the film's greatest strengths. His performance was an artistic approach never fully explored in the MCU, delving into an emotional and sinister angle that makes him easily the best villain Marvel has produced. Although some may argue that the film is too silly for its own good, the comedy is brilliantly balanced with drama that will leave the audience in amazement at what it was able to accomplish throughout. The implications of what can happen next in the story of Thor left me in anticipation of what can come next for this hero, and I cannot wait to be there to see it throughout.

Author: j-saenz1900
Review: If Key and Peele had taken on Thor, this move is what they would have come up with.

Author: lschouder-04582
Review: I don't know why they keep letting Waititi turn Thor, royal prince of Asgard, into a quirky goofball but I'm sick of it. I don't want a "fun" Thor movie. I need Jon Favreau Iron Man realness. This movie had me rolling my eyes at how utterly dumb, silly and ridiculous it was from start to terrible finish. Disney is ruining Marvel movies by making them childish. This film is wonderful if you're 6 years old. For an adult Marvel fan it's a train wreck. Films like this will kill the superhero genre which people are already getting tired of as it is. I'll bet Hemsworth and Waititi are dying laughing when they think about how much money they were given to make such a stupid movie. Where's Christopher Nolan when you need him? I've seen less silliness in a Bugs Bunny cartoon. Bring back serious Marvel movies. Stop catering to little kids.

Author: andrew_wiggin_cluj
Review: It's so stupid and moronic, it's almost beyond words. Zero acting, awful jokes, not-so-subtle-hints at lgbt political correctness that simply has to be present these days in (almost) every movie. The gods travel on the rainbow ('cause traveling on a white beam doesn't help anyone), Korg teaching us how two dads can give birth to a child ('cause one dad and one mom giving birth to a child is just too mainstream these days). I was sad to see once great actors (Russell Crowe, Natalie Portman, Christian Bale) being involved in this awful, awful joke that stands for a "movie".

Author: mukarram-82466
Review: Well it's a marvel movie but this one particularly is kinda weird i mean you have a person dying of stage 4 cancer and people being brutally killed everywhere which is shrugged of as a casual Tuesday by the cringe comedy and exaggerated confidence of the cast. It felt like the scenes for gorr the god butcher(which were amazing) were written and directed and intended to target a different audience than the rest of the movie. There was so much wasted potential for the gorr character that it was frustrating to watch. The movie also felt like a cluster of so many different ideas and messages that each character is trying to personify which took the sparkle out of watching it. Even though the gorr character was done dirty in the end atleast we got a phenomenal performance from christian bale but it's though not the mention the injustice they did to him. I feel like people will understand what im saying after they watch it. Anyway let me get to the worst part.....thor the title itself i mean who thought it would be cool to give everyone the opportunity to be thor like bruh what's the point of being a godly character if anyone can pick your weapon up and use it. Like kids...your ex...even gorr was able to use its power his daughter was even able to be thor like everyone gets to be a powerful god for christmas and with that the movie gives extreme amounts of plot armour to everyone too. Last thing tho it's a reoccurring thing in marvel movies where a character comes from being an average person and as soon as they get superpowers they are able to be on par with the villain or a thousand year old god. Even the kids shown in the end can suddenly fight shadow monsters with great efficiency like it's nothing and it's a good thing they decided to train them at the end of the movie. (valkyrie should've died).

Author: crom-dubh
Review_Title: A definite step or two down from Ragnarok
Review: Waititi's humor worked really well in the previous film, but here it's just too relentless and forced. Some it lands, but a lot of it doesn't. The worst part is that every character seems to basically behave differently from how we know they should be acting, because every line is delivered as though it's part of the same joke. The effect is rather bizarre and it's often difficult to tell if we're watching what's actually happening in the film's present tense or if we're seeing some re-imagined and embellished past tense, like the Korg narration that periodically crops up in the film.

Author: harry-34518
Review_Title: When it's good it's so good but when it's bad it's quite frankly awful
Review: The comedy here is a mixed bag and at points it feels the team are sacrificing story for comedy to the point where the film feels almost like a parody. Gorr has some awesome sequences in the film but ends up being wasted and falling to the mcus victim curse, Jane is also a waste here. Choosing to adapt two of thors best comic storylines was bold and sadly it fails. The cgi and cinematography are great, there are some hard hitting moments but the movies structure is it's worst enemy. The pacing is all over the place at points you'll feel like you've just missed a whole scene. The action here is great and if you can look past the story issues it is a fun, comedic somewhat emotional ride. But it does make one wonder what is marvel doing?

Author: bill-2158
Review_Title: More like a spoof of a Thor movie
Review: This movie should have been named, "Thor: Stupid and Ridiculous". This seems more like a spoof of a Thor movie, rather than a real Thor movie. For starters, Thor is pretty much a bumbling idiot throughout most of the movie, especially in the beginning. I guess Taiki Waititi is trying to make this into a comedy movie? Deadpool is a good, funny superhero movie. He's funny, but only because of his sarcasm and wit. He's not running around like a moron. If this is supposed to be a comedy, it's not funny. If it's supposed to be a serious superhero movie, it's not. It's just stupid.

Author: RussHog
Review_Title: Don't get the hate - this was excellent!
Review: Thor: Love and Thunder is an excellent film. It's hilarious, has a great villain, and Chris Hemsworth delivers, as usual, as Thor. The movie once again deals with Thor looking to belong to a family that cares about him, and in doing so he has to rescue a bunch of missing children and reconnect with the old love of his life who now wields his Hammer and has become a new version of Thor. Thor evolves in this film to a father figure, and it's beautiful and funny and heartfelt.
