Author: cs_rahul_kumar
Review_Title: Chris Hemsworth and Natalie Portman's Chemistry Saves You Throughout the Movie !!!
Review: A lot is happening in Thor: Love and Thunder. The premise is two-fold, with Thor (Chris Hemsworth) waging a war with the Gods to save a bunch of kids from the hands of a butcher named Gorr (Christian Bale). At the same time, he is also navigating his rocky love story with Dr. Jane Foster aka The Mighty Thor (Natalie Portman). Along the way, Thor encounters some old friends, makes some new ones and goes from flexing his big guns to doing a full Monty in a matter of minutes.

Author: ksharath1999
Review: Despite the promising desert opening sequence, Thor Love and Thunder is a complete mess. Although Christian Bale tries to be an engaging villain there is nothing enough to support him except the black and white sequence. Natalie portman too tries to make her part interesting with two type of performances but fails to impress. Coming to visuals, the golden temple sequence, black-white sequence are the only things to cherish.

Author: catschasemice9594
Review: At last a Marvel film that's comic book centric. Loved that few scenes took place on Earth. New Asgard was off the hook just like the comic version that was set in Oklahoma. The best part of Marvel for me was always the creative settings, creatures, and crazy story lines. I want more alien planets and civilizations. Love and Thunder captures decades of Thor and auxiliary Thor stories. The battle in the shadow world flipped between B&W to pure old time comic colors. Also found the Thor/Jane story line satisfying with an excellent resolution. I had a great time with the film. If you are looking for deep meaning in a film this isn't going to be your thing. It's July. It's hot. Think of this film as a beach read.

Author: dellamorte-82282
Review: Without a doubt the worst in the Thor franchise. That unfortunately speaks volumes because as it's common knowledge at this point THOR TDW is too comedic as is. Thor 2 was the worst until this was created. I'm sure on paper it was brilliant. But as is now? The execution of this tale is horrendous, and without a doubt now the new fabled WORST of the series. The character Bale attempts pales in comparison to the character's comic counterpart; instead of referring to him as GORR they should have just created a new villain with aspects of GORRs identity. That at least would have organically justified the difference. GORR coulda been a palindrome or anagram heck the title the "necro-sword bearer" becomes; similar to a Kurse characterization. I don't know, something. The story itself is thin and weighs itself down by the family comedy. At times this can be the most serious of Thor films then it flips and has a bunch of improvisational jokes and humor. It undercuts the tone, jarringly so. It's an odd mixture and doesn't work in any cohesive way. The direction is well done and looks supremely crafted but that's all. The director was given too much creative control or freedom after the success of the previous Thor installment (speculation). This movie is the director literally IMO without any reigns. Can I validate that belief? No I cannot. But the humor detracts the viewer rather than endearing them to the story. It's a shame bc it's apparent the cast (all stellar no need to single anyone out) is having a great time. You as the viewer though will not (speculative) have the same great time all involved clearly are having. Worst MCU film to date. That being said the surprise post credit cameo is cool and cast well IMO.

Author: arthur_tafero
Review_Title: Pricey Cartoon Not Worth Your Time - Thor: Love and Thunder
Review: If this had been the cartoon movie it should have been, I would have given it four, and maybe even five stars. But actors acting like cartoon characters do nothing but make the final product.....cartoonish. A marvel comic book from the 60s is more entertaining than this film. Every sequence is overdone; every line of dialogue is painful to listen to. Everything is a joke, so no one takes the plot seriously. I felt pretty much the same about the original film, but it was certainly much better than this exercise in the obvious. I could not recommend that anyone spend their hard-earned money on stuff you could see on TV reruns of cartoons. Pass on this one.

Author: asifakberali
Review_Title: The mighty Thor has done it again!
Review: I absolutely LOVED it. It was well put together with lots of comedy, action and love.

Author: gunsgunsguns
Review: After the pure joy that was 'Thor Ragnarok' I was really looking forward to this instalment, but it just ended up being a disappointment. Christian Bale, who I thought was his usual excellent self, could not save a film that had way too many jokes, cheesy, cringy special effects and the huge overuse (which isn't necessarily a bad thing) of GNR songs. It appears that someone also thought it would be really funny to have massive goats who make constant screaming noises, and these noises became very annoying, very quickly. Russell Crowe as Zeus was quite forgettable, and Korg is in danger of becoming the Jar-Jar Binks of Marvel. I have been a borderline MCU fanboy since the original 'Iron Man' film right up to 'Shang-Chi' but unfortunately it feels as time goes on, everything the MCU is churning out is becoming weaker and weaker.

Author: tjoldor
Review_Title: A joke, but not a good one
Review: This movie is a joke. And it shouldn't be. Taika Waititis humor is (I have to say it) childish and it ruined "Thor Ragnarök" for me as well. And Thor has eventually the IQ of Homer Simpson.

Author: kamranRa
Review: Everything is a joke and nothing is important. I have seen kid shows that were more serious. The only reason I give it a 3 is Christian bale otherwise it was a fat 1.

Author: mikeyguns
Review_Title: One of the worst, most inane movies I have ever had the misfortune to watch.
Review: Unfortunately it is not possible to give a 0 out of 10 rating, otherwise I would have rated this movie 0/10. If it is supposed to be a comedy, it fails, not a single person in the theater laughed once for the entire, agonizing length of this dreadful movie. If it's supposed to be an action movie, it isn't. If it's supposed to be a love story, it is incredibly weak. If it's supposed to be a superhero movie, it tarnishes the genre. Just do yourself a favour and don't watch this movie. 2 hours of my life that I will never get back.

Author: plsn-76680
Review_Title: NOT GOOD AS RAGNAROK BUT ITS FOOD
Review:
The action the comedy the humor it's a good movie
I RATE IT A 7.9 U CAN SAY 8 CHRISTIAN BALE AS GOR WAS A GREAT CHOICE. THERE WAS THUNDER AND LOVE.

Author: brianmlucas
Review_Title: Better than the 1st 2 but still the same problem
Review: Chris Hemsworth is an Aussie beau hunk, maybe THE Aussie beau hunk. And that's a good thing. Natalie Portman is an Ivy League Academy Award winner. And that's a good thing. The two don't mix. At all. The whole Ragnarok redux wasn't a problem. It worked just as well this time as last. It can't fix two leads that have no chemistry. Zero. Still, they are both great individually, the rest of the cast and crew deliver excellent work, and I'm still faklempt over the end / post credits. That new intro music is terrible. Tear Rib Bull. THAT'S gotta go..

Author: briancham1994
Review: This film left me wondering, "is that it?" There weren't many things that were explicitly bad about Thor: Love and Thunder, but it simply felt disappointing and lukewarm. The film draws from previous efforts by Marvel and Taika Waititi to present the Thor franchise in a more quirky and comedic way, but it falls flat due to overuse and repetition. This style was pioneered mainly by the predecessor Thor: Ragnarok, when it had novelty value compared to the first two Thor films, but now the effect has worn off and Waititi feels like he's retreading the same territory. For example, there's a scene involving stage actors that appears to be almost exactly the same scene as in Ragnarok. The positive aspects of this film include the serious elements like Christian Bale's performance as Gorr the God Butcher, the stark monochromatic palette, the realm of the gods and Natalie Portman's character development, but these are juxtaposed too heavily with the constant comedy, making the tone very inconsistent. Besides that, the glaring flaw is that the stakes are just not that interesting - some children are kidnapped (but they don't seem to be in that much mortal peril) and some gods are also in danger (whom we barely see anyway) - making the protagonist's quest feel not so compelling.

Author: OfficeMan1229
Review: I try to not be overly critical of movies, and generally I'm able to just sit back and enjoy movies but this one was very mediocre at best. If you've ever had the experience of being around someone who's insecure with themselves and is trying way too hard to be funny and entertaining so people will like him/her and they just come across as obnoxious and annoying. Well, this movie is something like that. Now, there are a few scenes where I laughed, but overall I didn't enjoy the movie very much and I wouldn't recommend it.

Author: alreadyseenbeentaken
Review_Title: Silly, often cringy, and even annoying sometimes
Review: The worst Thor movie and the worst MCU movie so far. Good CGI, music, pictures, sound. As usual. And the fight scenes are good. Even the idea of a god killer is decent. And well done. Dark, slightly scary. But way too many flashbacks with narration. Especially about unimportant and uninteresting stuff. The cast does its job despite the awful dialogs. A humourous approach to the Jane & Thor topic was OK. But the uninspired, cringy humor is really killing the movie. Wasted money and potential. Should have been a bit more mature. Good thing I didn't waste money in the theatre for this one. The last 5 minutes were good. Watch and decide for yourself, but be warned.

Author: Aixa_0009
Review:
Christian Bale delivers a perfectly justified villain, perfect as always
I dare to say, he's the only one who actually acts in this movie, I already forgot everyone else.

Author: monika-urbon
Review_Title: A big joke with no punchline
Review: I'm sorry?? I was flabbergasted at how this felt like a very bad fanfic written by children who literally put any and every joke they could come up with. Thor did not feel like the authentic character he is, he was himself for maybe 20 minutes in the movie. Valkyrie was made a joke, Jane was maybe okay but still had bad moments. And seriously, Christian effing Bale is in the movie and they did him so dirty? It felt more like a bad sitcom than an amazing MCU movie. And not to mention Zeus portrayed as a "old fat pridefull guy" who did not made me think he is an amazing new character at all, nor funny. And why the joke of having a play of Thor, Loki, and Odin had to include Hela as the joke of being fat. Lots of very distastful jokes. And even the jokes that are funny were so saturated that the movie literally forgot to have a decent plot. And the ending? Killed any last hope it will at least end in a Marvel like way. I would probably score it 3/10 but I just cannot, it's a 1/10 because this movie does not deserve to be named Thor and I'm sorry for all the actora because I have no clue if any of them actually would feel proud of the final production.

Author: IQ42
Review: The huge success of Thor's last movie was due to the great comedic scenes it provided which at least made me laugh and smile. It's a no-brainer to continue with this concept.

Author: tolnayf-97958
Review: They dont even try to do something slightly for grown ups. They completly butcher the character Gorr, the god butcher. They could have made this into bit of a horror. The god butcher is not even butchering gods. There is not one scene where he is doing it. Almost all the main actors had their own children in the movie. It is a childrens movie, from dads to their children. Just too many jokes, which then are reused again and again and again and again. It was painful to watch. After Endgame the MCU is just going down. The movies have no soul, no conflict, no purpose, no main enemy. So why bother and watch?

Review_Title: Fan of MCU not of this
Review: Few laughs here and there. Thors character is okay here other then this I have to mention Christian Bale is definitely the best performance. Not worth paying to watch it at the theatre.

Author: nidhunmoviebuff
Review_Title: A sparkling visual spectacle to be experience in theatres!
Review: Oscar-winning film-maker Taika Waititi's approach to superhero movies is directly in contrast with the edgier, darker turn most franchises have taken off late. While Robert Pattinson's smash hit "Batman (2022)" showcased a grittier, more ground-level caped crusader, "Spiderman: No Way Home (2021)" and "Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness (2022)" ventured into the multiverse, opening up psychological thriller and horror elements for the MCU. Taika's unique blend of colorful storytelling and quirky comedy had single-handedly revived the Thor franchise which was down in the doldrums after the disastrous "Thor: The Dark World (2013), infusing fresh new life and zest into the character with his quite fabulous "Thor: Ragnarok (2017)".

Author: galtevet-16807
Review: Ive waited so long for a classic marvel movie. So good. Beautiful. Funny and exciting! I must say i think its one of my favourite marvel movies - loyal to the characters and the spirit of marvel. Thank you.

Author: rlstienstra
Review: Bad jokes nobody laughed in the cinema too. Actors tried to make jokes but it didn't come across at all, in fact it sometimes seemed uncomfortable for them to do. Very messy story line and imagination. Sorry this one was really bad.

Author: mpjicgnr
Review: It was enjoyable overall, but a little corny and slapstick. The cast is amazing but I think the script could have been much better. I did find myself laughing out loud to a few scenes but many of the jokes weren't funny. Leave it to Disney to turn the Asgardian fishing village into an amusement park! Christian Bale's character arc and acting were superb. He should have been in more of the movie. They should ask Christopher Nolan to direct a future marvel movie. That would be awesome!

Author: jandc-32215
Review: Thor: Love and Thunder stars Chris Hemsworth as Thor, teaming up with Natalie Portman as Jane Foster to take down the God Butcher played by Christian Bale. Seeing as this movie was directed by Taika Waititi who seemed to have taken more creative liberties with Thor: Ragnarok, I was expecting succeeding films to continue in the spirit of exploring different artistic directions. Unfortunately, this movie ended up being very standard Marvel fair. Initially interested by Bale's casting, I was baited into spending money at a movie theater only to realize he was painfully underutilized. Moreover, whatever drama/tension the movie manages to scrap together is severely undercut by an excessive amount of jokes that didn't manage to resonate with general audiences. It was nice seeing Jane Foster again (it must've been for somebody, at least), but her arc is totally unnecessary and only really serves to market the movie by having "Lady Thor" in it. Nothing her character did in the movie was interesting; even her death was uneventful. Overall, Thor: Love and Thunder is boilerplate Marvel schlock with not many moments of notice.

Author: rajitecture
Review: Somehow they (the director) turned a can't lose big budget Marvel film into a goofy movie that destroyed characters and Marvel history. I had to watch this in four separate segments because I got bored and had to turn it off a bunch of times. I finally made it through the whole movie and I'm pretty disappointed. I thought the new Dr. Strange movie was bad, but this is worse. The only redeeming part of this movie is that the special effects were still decent. Anyone who paid full price to watch this at the movies theaters must be mighty Thor pissed. If you are still waiting to watch this I'd advise waiting for it to come out on cable, so toy can watch for free.

Author: JurijFedorov

Author: oscarpaz-45921
Review_Title: Half baked campy comedy with Marvel characters
Review: Taika is a creative guy, and I appreciate hos sense of humor, however, he was not the guy for this movie. It was a badly stitched together bag of gags with a fever dream storyline. The only acting that shone was that of Christian Bale, (not for lack of a talented cast). Bale was absolutely brilliant. He was a wasted talent in this trash fire of a movie. Now, if you have pot and cookie dough handy, you'll get some giggles. Natalie Portman does what she can with the material. The characters from Guardians of the Galaxy are of no relevance to the story, Jamie Alexander seems to phone it in, in her brief appearances. Watch it if you have nothing better to do.

Author: kjproulx
Review: Being a huge fan of the Marvel Cinematic Universe, I must say that the first two instalments of the Thor franchise haven't been anywhere near my favourites. When Taiki Waititi was brought in to direct Thor: Ragnarok, he injected some much-needed life. Since then, Thor has been a much more enjoyable character to follow and I now look forward to seeing him every time. Hearing that Waititi would once again be back for the fourth film excited me a great deal, but I also knew it would be a very hard task to top the third film. Thor: Ragnarok is one of my favourite Marvel films, and while there are more than a few moments in Thor: Love and Thunder that harken back to what made Ragnarok great, it's not quite on the same level for me. Still, Thor: Love and Thunder is a genuine blast at the movies and here's why I recommend checking it out.

Author: johntwatterson
Review_Title: It's bad when I give my favorite hero five stars
Review: It's bad when I give my favorite hero five stars. Even the best soundtrack in three decades could not with me over with this movie. It is so much worse than "The dark world". The campiness that marvel is treating Thor with is a disservice to Chris Hemsworth. This character in this context, could easily be played by a young Tom Hanks. They were aspects of the film that were fulfilling and rewarding. I kept hoping that they would continue to drag that film up by its bootstraps, but each time it turned back into Barney's Playhouse. The treatment of "King Valkyrie "was ludicrous... I was under the impression that the Valkyrie identified as, It?, Shim? Or whatever name those people call themselves. Shouldn't there be an appropriate title for those folks of a different gender? Sex, Or whatever?

Author: sam-baig73
Review_Title: How not to make a sequel
Review: I don't usually write reviews. But God it's so terrible. Perfect example of how not to make a sequel.

Author: eddie_baggins
Review_Title: Thor's latest outing is an easy if forgettable watch
Review: In 2017 Kiwi writer/director Taika Waititi changed the direction of the up until then po-faced Thor in surprising and commercially beneficial ways with the wild and inventive Thor: Ragnarok but proving once more that you can't always capture lightning (thunder?) in a bottle, Waititi's return to the solo Thor universe with Love and Thunder provides a carelessly fun few hours while also continuing Marvel's recent trend of feeling like a brand that is at present slightly aimless.

Author: IMDBozo

The most appealing part of the film (gorr) could've used more screen time for proper development. The overutilization of levity has truly become quite annoying in marvel movies lately.

Author: itsanace
Review: Beautiful special effects with some humorous punchline as expected.

Author: jace_the_film_guy
Review: The first two Thor films were dark, one note and a little dull. All that changed when Taika Waititi took over the director's chair for "Thor: Ragnarok". Full of bright colors, poignant humor, and a complete reinvention of the character, "Thor: Ragnarok" is one of the most beloved stories in the MCU. Similarly, this film is bright, cheerful and flashy. It falls more in the comedy genre than action, which is both positive and distracting at times.

Author: galahad58-1
Review: Marvel Cinemas have lost their magic. The studio has become so greedy and it has flooded the superhero movie market with garbage not worth watching. Each movie has been worse than it's predecessor and the quality has been lacking.

Author: subxerogravity
Review_Title: I loved it! Not as good as Ragnarok, but I loved it!I
Review: T's a bit nick picky, but it is not as good as the last Thor movie. I always expect these marvel movies to get better and better to the point that they put the movie before it to shame. Still, this sequel to the Thor branch of the Marvel cinematic universe franchise did not exceed expectations. It had action, adventure, and humor, which I was expecting from Taika Waititi, who also directed Ragnarok, and that was great. Still, in Love and Thunder, the humor outshined the action-adventure. Not necessarily entirely a bad thing because the humor was so on point. Never did I feel a joke was dropped that did not deliver the laughs it expected, but I do feel these laughs came at the price of the action-adventure, which was lacking. The visuals in the movie were epic. Waititi knows how to film a sci-fi Fantasy, especially one that pays homage to the 1980s (although the constant use of Gun and Roses songs was not as spectacular as using Immrgant song by Led Zepplin twice in Ragnarok). As the movie progressed, the visuals got better and better to the point where a complete introduction of a marvel comics character making his first full appearance in the cinematic universe was breathtaking. Waititi was working that camera. The performances from the whole cast were good. I could go on about how great Chris Hemsworth is as Thor and his fantastic chemistry with Tessa Thompson as Valkyrie but what impressed me was Natalie Portman's return as Jane Foster (AKA Thor). I was not expecting much from the actress who seemed bitterly glad to end her ties with the franchise, but from the moment she appeared on the screen, she was dynamite in my book. I love every minute of her. Also, Russel Crowe's run as Zeus was enjoyable. It solidified everything this movie was about, and you can tell he enjoyed his role. Well done! Overall, Thor: love & Thunder was laid out like a comic book. As easily as I sat in the theatre watching, was easy as if I had sat in my living room reading it. I don't think any of these movies ever did a comic book story arch as great as Love and Thunder did, and that's what it got going for it! Worth taking a look at!--

Author: kthngm
Review_Title: The story's lighting that couldn't even spark
Review: Given the previous Thor, I thought it was going to be a good movie, but it wasn't.

Author: vivek-47552
Review: Complete waste of time , money and patience .. this movie is a parody of itself , taika waiting has ruined the franchise. No plotlines , all good scenes ruined with unnecessary attempts of what they think is humor .. thor made to look like a bungling bafoorn , Bale tried his best to bring something into the movie but didn't get enough screen time or dialogues to make a difference.

Author: kmc498
Review: The people that hated this movie came in with expectations. I intentionally didn't read spoilers and never read the comics. I was just happy to find out Jane was back. I'm tired of all the cliched dark superhero movies that only focus on the action. This one had a lot more heart and humor. It was just enjoyable to watch. Thor is just a lovable loof. Great chemistry onscreen with Jane and Thor. Great fun!

Author: kyrodavid
Review: For a 4th thor movie, it was pretty amazing. It has some fresh ideas (great humor!) and some linked to the past mcu movies. Definitely fun to watch. Dont listen to the bad reviews, they're too critical.

Author: steveneli
Review: It's not winning an Oscar but it's a good time! Great action sequences, funny moments throughout, good performances from the entire cast and THE BEST post credit scene in quite some time!

I just enjoyed it fully cz after watching dr Strange i lost my all hope from mcu movies

Tonaly it may have not met some people's expectations but where else are you supposed to go with a thunder controlling God. Fantastic villain with Christian Bale also.

Author: thebricks

Natalie Portman shockingly pulled her weight in this film and did a great job. The last film she did a great job acting in was The Professional, which is a shame. She's coasted off that film ever since and it was cringe-worthy.

Author: cbradxl
Review: Everyone including me- came for the cast, and the return of Jane Foster

Author: philgowers001
Review_Title: The end of times for MCU
Review: So Thor 4 is (Love & Thunder blah blah) the latest offering from MCU, and IMO it spells the end of MCU's dynasty. Taika Waititi, a clearly over-rated and unoriginal director, has basically prepared the coffin, polished the brass fittings and even dug the hole. Now all we need is the next Marvel film to push it all into the black abyss...

Author: Moonstrike9
Review: I think they took the reaction to ragnarok as an all-seasons pass to wacky, resulting in a strange mishmash of good and nonsensical, and arriving at whatever this is. Ragnarok was great, but this movie just confused, waffling between internet memes and a very compelling but not fully fleshed out (cuz of all the jokes shoved in) villain, and a compelling story of love and loss in Jane Foster's character. Jokes are great, too many jokes just ruins the very serious and compelling parts of a movie and cheapens them for the audience.

Author: gjw

Review: Ironically, Thor was always one of the most dignified of all Marvel superheroes. (Perhaps only Namor (Sub-Mariner) came close in nobility.) Thor was, after all, a literal god, and the son of Odin.

Review: This is two film mashed together. One is a terrible rom-com, the other one has Christian Bale and is kinda cool.

Author: dk777
Review: Disappointment is the first word that comes to mind when this movie is mentioned.

Author: davidpaezb

Author: parksiet
Review: It's no secret that I loved what Taika Waititi did with "Thor: Ragnarok"; he made me fall in love with Thor again after really getting bored of the character in "Thor: The Dark World". And I am so happy to report that he has done it again with "Thor: Love and Thunder"! I still love his comedic take on Thor so much, it still works so well for me, and I was thrilled to see that he finally was able to make the Jane Foster character, as well as her relationship to Thor, work so well and come off as so likable! I finally cared about the relationship between Thor and Jane as well (for the first time in the MCU); I was so happy to see that the elements that didn't work for me in the past were able to become something so much more in this film, and I fully attribute that to Taika's skills at writing great characters and great relationships! He is especially skilled at blending his signature style of silly comedy with some heartfelt emotion, and that is on full display here! There are moments where the film had me laughing so hard, and then in the next scene feeling like I was on the verge of tears... and it didn't feel forced at all!

Author: EUyeshima
Review: Having not seen "Thor" since the first installment, I wasn't prepared for how director Taika Waititi had restylized the franchise to become more of a joke-infested comedy as well as a CGI-saturated epic adventure. It was funny at random moments with a few unexpected celebrity cameo appearances, but the constantly comic approach was maintained at the expense of the convoluted Asgardian adventure storyline. It also meant sacrificing the heart that would have us empathize with the fate of the principal characters. Chris Hemsworth still plays the title role in the manner born - though the rest of the cast felt somewhat less committed to their roles, even Christian Bale as the malevolent evildoer and Natalie Portman returning in superhero form as Thor's love interest. The souped-up climax was such a textbook MCU exercise in eye-rolling excess that the ending was robbed of its innate poignance.

Author: jamesvdm-43176
Review_Title: Thor: Love and Thunder and Selfishness
Review: In 2017, Taika Waititi wowed theatres with his revival of Thor in Thor: Ragnarok, and once again audiences have been wowed. Yet, this time in Thor: Love and Thunder, it is due to the disappointingly weak thematic use and character development. Firstly, the film starts off with an incredibly arrogant and selfish rendition of Thor, which after his development in the series is clearly out of place. Not only did Thor recognize his mistake and recover from his grief in Avengers: Endgame, his journey started with Thor (2011), which had the entire plot focused on recovering from his selfishness, pride, and arrogance. Furthermore, the other characters were practically nothing. The main antagonist, Gorr the God Butcher, performed by Christian Bale, was a delight while on screen, but sadly that was for such a minimal time that the threat and intrigue of the character practically didn't exist. Then, there's Dr. Jane Foster who takes the form of Thor wielding the previously destroyed Mjölnir. Again, she is underdeveloped on-screen and lacks the substance to even be an important part of the film. To even greater disappointment, the movie lacks any substantial or valuable themes, greatly due to Thor's poor character development. Throughout the film, Thor struggles with having someone to love and the loss he experienced with his ex-girlfriend Jane; however, he never grows throughout the film and continues to make selfish choices. Although in the end, he accepts a father-like role to Gorr's daughter, there is no grand revelation or growth in his character.

Author: deruytterwolfgang
Review: Don't know if i will continue watching MCU movies, we already have so much movies and tv shows in phase 4, and so far it has been pretty disappointing (No way home doesn't count, that was a special event outside the phase 4 and just a love letter to the spidey fans). I liked ragnarok, but this was just bad. And is Taika to blame? No, not always. I think it mainly the way marvel works that is to blame. Because the story is boring, the CGI is so bad i just immediately cringed at it, the humor is bad and there is a feeling of emptiness. Wait a minute, isn't that how all marvel movies nowadays are? Yes definitely. I remember i disliked the background in avengers endgame, it looked so fake, and i thought it was a one time thing, but ever since that movie, every background looks fake. The CGI has gotten even worse, and THOR LOVE AND THUNDER just hits an achievement: the worst looking MCU movie ever. And c'mon, can someone tell me which movie in phase 4 had an interesting story? And humor has always been a dislike of me in the MCU. So many unnecessary jokes in emotional moments. And yeah, feeling of emptiness? Mostly present within phase 4. So is thor a drastic change of quality? Nope, phase 4 has already proven its quality is gone. You know what I also hate? The middle part of the movie where the promising, new surprises are set up for future movies. We already saw it in Doctor Strange multiverse of madness. In the middle part we saw the illuminati, who halted the main story, purely for the purpose of giving fanboys something exciting, like a cameo, something that shows something for future projects. In thor we see it too. The Zeus part didn't need to be in this movie, it's just here because we need zeus to be attacked and talk to hercules so that they can set up thor 5. Ok this review is way too long but you know what i mean and how i feel bout the movie. I do think some things were really good. - the last 30 minutes were exciting -nathalie portman was great in this -every scene with Christian Bale was amazing, he was a great villain, and Bale is a master.

Author: Special-K88
Review: The franchise remains in Waititi's assured hands as he becomes the first director to helm more than one film in the series, unfortunately it seems like he's trying to use much of what worked in Ragnarok while at the same time trying not to totally repeat himself. Thor is still without a clear path or plan, but must take action to thwart the machinations of a madman (Bale, who deserves a lot more screentime) out to butcher all Gods. Thor also gets a blast from the past when he reunites with old flame Jane Foster--now bonded with his old companion Mjolnir. Even after three previous entries there's still a lot to work with here, but so many of the key characters are mishandled, the bulk of the comedic bits fall flat, and the ex-lovers chatter gets tired oh so quickly. After a promising opening the movie stumbles into tonal uncertainty as it veers between silliness and seriousness but never convincingly establishes what's at stake or manages to feel consequential. It's redeemed somewhat by the fantastic visuals and a third act that's pretty good, but the unevenness of the finished product and the limited use of so many great characters makes it curious as to what was left on the cutting room floor. **½

Author: dalyons-09311
Review: I liked it. The ending of Ragnarok and the bulk of Infinity War was peak Thor, so since Endgame didn't do the character any favors, I was looking forward to another movie where we saw Thor be epic and fun. And this movie didn't disappoint...for the first five minutes. Perhaps the biggest problem with this movie was the pacing. Despite being heavily focused on in the trailer, the Guardians of the Galaxy were gone pretty quickly. We go from one scene to the next, never spending much time anywhere. It's a short movie, too. Because of this pacing, a lot of the movie didn't get the time it deserved. In the opening scene, I loved that they were adding depth to Gorr's character and showing his backstory, but then we don't really get to see him do anything besides be a shadow until the end of the movie. I'd like to see the god butcher butcher some gods. The rumored deleted scenes would've helped a lot. The ending was also very quick. For the first hour and a half of the movie, everyone's making a big deal about how unreachable Eternity is, but then Thor and Jane make it there (separately) in about 5 seconds each. And clearly Thor didn't learn his lesson in Infinity War to go for the head, because after they defeat Gorr, they let him walk into Eternity and get his wish. And now he's raising a demon child, and she gets Stormbreaker while he gets a broken hammer. It's all so rushed and forced. Also in that ending scene, this movie suffers from the Last Jedi effect where it has moments that are super cool and surprising on a first watch, but then immediately become stupid once you think about them. It makes sense that Thor's able to give the kids the power of Thor since Odin was able to do that...but why didn't he do that against Thanos? Or Hela? Brings up so many questions. Aside from the pacing, the inclusion of Jane wasn't great. I don't like watching exes argue about who left who. I also think that the fact that Thor cursed the hammer to protect her means she wasn't actually worthy, which makes her transformation into the Mighty Thor completely meaningless. In addition, due to the comedic tone of the movie, her absence in the previous movies, and the notion of Valhalla and the multiverse, her death wasn't impactful at all. Speaking of which, the movie went way too hard on the humor. Humor in Ragnarok was necessary because the first two Thor movies were extremely stoic and often boring, so an overcorrection was necessary to make Thor fun. But once you've accomplished that, you balance it like the rest of the movies do. Instead, Taika made it even funnier, which is fine, but it makes it feel disconnected from the MCU. No Way Home knew when to be funny and when to be serious, but no other phase 4 entries seem to. Stormbreaker being jealous was really funny, but that kind of tone makes it hard for me to take any of this movie seriously, which is odd since it involves dead children and cancer. That's not to say I didn't like the movie though. Jane's hammer usage with the split parts was extremely cool. Giacchino's score was incredible. The desaturated shadow world fight was beautiful. It was a fun, action-packed movie, but the poor pacing and messy writing muddled the experience.

Author: mjpiro
Review_Title: Thunderous Thors Action Throughout The Universe!!
Review: Thor: Love and Thunder is the story of how Thor teams up with a few of his old friends to go after a group of modern day Viking children that have been taken to a different realm by character known as Gorr. Reprising his role as Thor is Chris Hemsworth (Rush) who meets up with his old girlfriend Jane Foster played nicely by Natalie Portman (Black Swan) who as we learn at the beginning of the movie - and unknown to Thor until much later in the film - is dying from cancer. Rounding off the lead cast are Tessa Thompson (Creed) who plays King Valkyrie and goes to war with the group against Gorr played by Christian Bale (The Dark Knight). Writer/director Taika Waititi rounds of the lead cast as computer graphic character Korg's voice a strong, charming character that seems to go way back with Thor. The action in Thor, the movie as I will be calling it for the rest of this review (and yes I will differentiate between the people), is absolutely outstanding!! They combine realistic fighting with computer graphic fighting and make it look very real which is very satisfying considering this is a sci-fi movie!! The humor in this movie is outstanding!! Of all of the independent Avenger movies, Thor probably is number one when it comes to one liners or just Thor's own line of thought when they let him muse. All of the different sets - green screen and otherwise - were outstanding!! This is the type of movie that takes us places, you feel like you really get your money's worth if you paid to see this film!! Director Taika Waititi did an outstanding job directing this film - characters are where they should be on-screen and the action is smooth!! Waititi, Jennifer Kaytin Robinson, Stan Lee, and Jason Aaron all contributed nicely in some way to tell a compelling and satisfying story!! Michael Giacchino and Naomi Melumad did a fine job with the orchestral soundtrack to the film!! Mayes C. Ruben did an exceptional job designing the costumes for all of the superheroes and non-superheroes in the movie!! Thor, the movie, received a PG-13 rating so it requires parental supervision for those under 13 otherwise it is a perfect escape for those 13 and up!! 7 out of 10 stars!!

Author: maxaminiholmes
Review: I'm a huge Taika Waititi fan. Everything from What We Do in the Shadows to Thor: Ragnarok. But let me warn you, this film is quite awful. I don't mean to be harsh. But it is quite quite bad. The story line is incredibly weak. The pacing of the film is horrendous. The one-liner jokes hardly ever land. There is little to no character development, the movie provides nothing to add to the MCU. I will say, however, Christian Bale's performance was amazing. He really went above and beyond to achieve such a gracious role for a horrible villain. But that being said, his role was wasted in a joke of a film. Natalie Portman didn't deliver. Chris Hemsworth was, well, just Thor. And everything else just didn't add up. It kind of reminded me of a Robert Rodriguez Kid Flick. Next.

Author: guggs-79978
Review: What is Disney thinking? Previous Thor movies have heart and humor. I'm all for humor when it fits, though it's hard to watch a film continuously making fun of itself and its characters. I simply couldn't take anymore. Too bad, because Christian Bale was a great villain wasted on a lame script of a movie.

Author: m-longstaff
Review: How can this film get so many good reviews?am I missing something? It was total cgi drivel.only good part of the film was seeing Thor naked, total rubbish.

Author: wendieta
Review: I loved Thor Ragnarok. Absolutely loved it. I also like Natalie Portman and Christian Bale, so I was really looking forward to this movie, even more so than Doctor Strange. I was disappointed. It's very, very boring. The guardians are somewhat wasted here, Jane's story is not good enough, and Christian Bale's character is boring and uninteresting as a villain. I really think this is one of the weakest MCU offerings. Probably on the same level as Thor The Dark World, which is unthinkable given how much bigger MCU has become since that movie came out, and that it has the same director as the excellent Thor Ragnarok. Eternals failed because it doesnt have interesting characters. This movie has familiar characters, but I think they are not utilised properly. Very disappointed.

Author: moskeman
Review: To be honest, I loved Thor: Ragnarok and I think it's one of the best Marvel movies, and by far the best Thor movie. Love and Thunder is just a poor copy of Ragnarok. At least it had a great villain, and Christian Bale's performance once again showed why he is one of the best actors at the moment. But even his great performance couldn't fill that emptiness when it comes to the shallow story. First 40 minutes looked like a parody. And the part with Zues and whole gods council or whatever it's called was like a Disney's kids show. With all the shabby costumes and shallow jokes. Also, they just wanted a way to give a farewell to Himdal and Jane, because they said they are bot gonna play these characters anymore. All in all, shallow 5 out of 10.

Author: ssinfo-51734

Review: CONS : POOR WRITING! JUST! VERY-VERY POOR! There is no ENOUGH back story and origin of the antagonist called gorr. The movie is so rushed "IT WONT GIVE YOU ANY TIME TO BELIEVE OR UNDERSTAND ANY SENSE AND LOGIC" There is no ENOUGH filming of any scene properly, ESPECIALLY when the Jane foster becomes the mighty Thor (THE ENTIRE SCENE IS ABSENT). For no reason, It's a comedy romance movie not a serious and superhero movie that we all ever wanted. The film needed more matter, it should have been like 3 and a half hour long or maybe 4 to complete all its important scenes and important factors. Director and writer has completely failed, to deliver us the quality of MCU standard, It looks like it's own perody. There is only one killing of a god by gorr which we can see on the screen, others were just aftermath, which is very very pathetic and mindless. The movie has wasted it's all essential time on silly jokes. There is nothing in this film to watch it, when it comes to story. They don't even a have "s" in this film of Seriousness.

Author: schung-60999
Review: This film was a disaster the minute it started. The director and writers should NEVER be allowed to do another Marvel movie again. It was a real shame too because Christian Bale was great as Gorr and if they had gone with a more dramatic theme, it may have worked better. Also, the way they introduced the Olympians was way off base and didn't give those characters any dignity either. Lastly, the costumes and theatrics were way over the top and completely tacky.

Author: bertorecuerza
Review_Title: Looks more like a spoof of a Thor movie
Review: This movie is about 2 hours long and had this been on TV and I happened to catch it in the first hour and fifteen minutes, it is highly likely that I would have though it was a big budget spoof. Just bad comedy and the only thing I'd say I liked was the classic rock music and the Guardians of the Galaxy being there. Christian Bale is looking like Hellraiser and Matt Damon is in it, but barely and I don't know why he is even there. I couldn't take this movie in one shot, but it gets better focus after the hour and fifteen minute mark. Until then, even Thor's lines are just absolutely ridiculous attempts at humor. I've seen other productions with Taika Waititi's name on it and they were not bad...just maybe don't let him touch another Marvel movie. And if you plan to watch this purely to keep up with Marvel in case something important in a future movie plays off of this one, do yourself a favor and just look up the "Honest Trailer" on YouTube.

Author: Pairic
Review: Thor: Love and Thunder: Another fun epic with some dark bits, but Thor (Chris Helmsworth) is so vain and conceited you'll always laugh. We even get an Assembly of the Gods (a bit like the SW Galactic Senate) in Omnipotence City where Zeus (Russell Crowe) rules the roost, The dark stuff come from Gor (Christian Bale) The God Butcher who is determined to off as many Gods as possible, he has some justification though. Also on the gloomy side is Jane Foster (Natalie Portman), she has terminal cancer but then is attracted by Mjolni which reconstructs itself and transforms her into a female Mighty Thor. We also get the Guardians of the Galaxy who help Thor (Helmswoth) deal with some fall out from Gor's activities. Great battles and skirmishes, Thor even gets a pair of giant goats to help him along with Korg (Taika Waititi) as his sidekick. A wonderfully imagined New Asgard on Earth (which has become a visitor attraction) comes under attack from Gor and his Shadow Realm monsters. This film is a fun epic adventure and doesn't over stay it's welcome with a 119 minute running time. Directed by Taika Waititi, who co-wrote the script with Jennifer Kaytin Robinson. 8/10.

Love and Thunder I think will do the same. Watching it a second time was a more pleasing because I could pay attention to the shots and the editing, not having to focus on where the story was going. The nuts and bolts of the film are on solid ground. It is well put together.

Author: birminghamfridy
Review_Title: The ones who make the little prince too big? Or those whose best book in literature is The Picture of Dorian Gray?
Review: Many of the Phase 4 productions of the Marvel Cinematic Universe have had rather bittersweet endings and different messages, but the ending of "Thor: Love and Thunder" offers a more positive overall message. Thor has spent years trying to ignore his trauma from his conflict with Thanos, and Gor sacrifices his life to avenge his daughter's death against the gods.

Review: Seriously dumbfounded that they let this go to production. The Thor franchise was one of my favorites. Starting with Ragnarok, and now this.... they've completely ruined it. It's like watching different films completely. It's stupidly goofy, they try to be so funny but it just isn't. The first Thor was so good, and yet they got good humor in it. The director change was the beginning of the end of this franchise. This will be our last one - husband and I agree that it's the worst marvel movie ever. We won't watch another one, ans if there's a Herculean spin off bases on this film - we won't be interested. So sad.... we loved the first two.

Author: CurbedEnthusiasm
Review: This is it, folks. This is the movie that killed Marvel. Not sure exactly what happened here, but the movie is an unmitigated disaster and highly embarrassing for all involved. Taika has seemingly gone into this movie without a lot of planning or preparation. The script is awful, boring, weak, with tone all over the place. This new chapter in the Thor series also throws all the past character development and lore out the window. I was so bored. While the movie was running, I was thinking of leaving, on my phone, and also wondering if I should ever return to the cinema ever again. Honestly one of the worst movies I've seen in recent times, and that's saying something because I've had to suffer through some real garbage. I suspect the crew think they made something wonderful. But I do hope at some point the word of mouth even gets back to them so they know they made absolute trash.

Author: Unrevolved_Revolver
Review_Title: It is a parody of itself.
Review: I now understand all the hate that movie has been getting from all the Marvel/Thor fanbois - they wanted a GTA4 but they got Saints Row 3 instead!!! I think the only way to watch it is to establish this is a parody (even if it isn't, just assume for your own sake it is) and just watch it, expecting nothing more than 2 hours of spoofs, silly jokes and other movie references. I am not going to rate it, because I would have to give it two rates: a proper Thor/Marvel movie - 2/10, a spoof/parody - 5.5/10 (had few laughs).

Author: mario-jurkovic117
Review: Too much jokes, which are mostly stupid. The worst part of the movie was the Zeus part. It was the parody of the greek pantheon. The first Thor movie had the best ratio of action and comedy.

Author: No-Life-101
Review: While watching the film I found that it didn't meet my expectations and I found that some moments were not very needed but they added them anyway for "comic relief". The jokes felt very odd and didn't suit what was happening, the story lacked so much and I felt like the characters have changed so much from when they were first introduced in previous movies. I understand that some characters need to grow and mature but at this point I'm starting to think that Thor is turning into a "comedy" franchise than actual storytelling. The script is bad and the characters lack depth. The visuals were good but it's 2022 and that should be expected of movies these days. Overall, I did not enjoy the film and couldn't wait for it to end, and I feel bad because my sister bought me tickets so we could watch it together.

Author: Dello_
Review: Thor: Love and Thunder is an empty movie, so much so that I almost forgot the movie shortly after leaving the theatre. This is because the movie feels like a collection of scenes glued in some way one with each other, without a proper structure behind and so the plot is non-existent. Indeed when the halftime break occurred I controlled the time because very few events happened and I couldn't believe it was already half of the movie. Also the jokes are bad and the entire audience had like 8-10 laugh over the whole duration. Indeed the peak of the entertainment of the night was one guy who fell asleep snorling. Also the character development, which was a big part of Ragnarok, is nowhere to be found here. Thor: Love and Thunder is not a putrid movie at all and someone will surely enjoy it, but to me it felt like throwing two hours of life in the vacuum because of how empty it feels.

Author: yaqoub_sarwat-1
Review: I can't believe how this movie went. Being the last one from the original trinity, this movie was supposed to take MCU in a new direction after introduction of new characters in last few films. However, what I saw was the weakest Thor movie to date with all God's turned into comedians. If not for Bale, would be a 1 star review.

Awful piece of trash

Author: gpapakyprianos
Review: After Thor Ragnarok Marvel seems to have way too much faith in Taika Waititi. So much indeed, that they managed to take a serious plot and make it a joke. Aside from the great music choices, the movie lacks good CGI, character development, not only for Thor, but for everyone in it, actual fight scenes between the hero and the villain, and most importantly, a runtime that would give it a chance to make everything better. Thor 4 is partially saved by the excellent performances from Chris Hemsworth and Christian Bale and a good first act. From the second act and then too much silliness in so little time, without it even trying to maintain any seriousness. Also, a huge problem existing withing most MCU movies, is a one timer villain, so much potential wasted, to a such great character and him dying after a very usual and cliché love talk rather than a huge fight.

Author: annabollinger
Review: This was an absolute epic JOKE of a movie. Bad scripts, bad acting, wasteful scenes that don't add to the story at all, bad CGI- just a dreadfully boring movie all around. It was as if they threw this together in a month and put it out knowing people will still go and spend money bc it's Marvel... This was insulting and probably the last Marvel movie we will see in theaters.

Author: replicasound

Author: ryderbenjamin
Review: Only made it halfway through this garbage dump fire of a movie. The premise here is that the characters are friendly morons and say ridiculously stupid things. That about sums it up. Oh and Jane had cancer. Couldn't be bothered to care where that storyline went. But at least Jane was taking her time to come up with a solid hero catchphrase. Solid shot of Thor's bare bum. That was a nice touch, but not worth the cost of the rental. The scenery is an animated mushroom fest. Which doesn't do the film any favours. The entire thing is plucked so far from reality that it feels like a 80's He-Man cartoon special.

Author: jsauri
Review: The whole awkward ex thing played itself out the first five minutes. But they doubled down on it by doing a whole other ex thing with his hammer. I ended up having to fast forward through most of the dialogue. But the action scenes were just as boring with no real threat as they joke their way through faceless armies of studges. None of the main actors have any chemistry. I feel bad for Christian Bale who wasted a performance on this garbage. Russell Crowe also entertained with some much needed actual laughs. Any hope of Thor developing any character even after the genocide of his people in earlier films is gone. He comes off as a clueless man child with nothing compelling to watch.

Review: Thor should be somewhat of a dark mood and follow the first 2 films. I thought the 3rd movie was bad with the lame comedic jokes but they took it to a whole new level of corniness! I had to stop watching when they reached the Zeus scene as everything before is simply silly. Whoever wrote this storyline and made it so so so idiotic should be fired. I'd rather be bored than watching this awful movie. And please keep other marvel characters in their respective movies.

Author: nathaliebazinga
Review: It is a, by far the most WTF movie I've seen so far. Not surprisingly though since it's Taika and his funny and twisted way of telling and mashing up stories together. Even though I love all the Thor adaptations, this part is the furthest thing from the original Thor movie, and it's still great. This movie made me laugh my buttocks off, get excited, cry out loud and question my whole life and knowledge of the Norse myths. Not liking Russell Crowe much before this movie I was also impressed with his acting since it was something I've never seen him do before. He is actually hilarious. I am not really keen on the cancer story and it was hard to watch that part since a lot of my loved ones were sick or died of cancer but I love the moral of the story. It was a meaningful and fun piece with a lot of soul and charisma... And a lot of love and thunder. I will definitely watch it again.

Author: cedricbloem-31558

Spoiler free

Author: dreduardo-53581
Review: This year Marvel has produced a couple of truly bad movies, but this is the worse so far. I was really and truly stunned by how bad it is. I really thought they couldn't make this lousy of a movie. The acting tends to be basically horrible overall (indicating the director was lousy). The characters almost seem to be act randomly without any purpose. The interactions are about as mature as middle school. The plot is inconsistent and the comedy is just not funny. There are a couple of serious themes that are jarring, when mixed with what seems to be attempts at silliness. I am really wondering how this turkey ever got any approval by anyone. This is work to be ashamed of. It seems as if Disney has given the command to destroy Marvel. There is an extra layer of awful here in that the Thor series has been fairly good up to this mess.

Author: sladem7

Author: jorgebustillos-25381
Review: Thor love and thunder could be a good movie, but it didn't reach its full potential.

Author: SocialNatwork
Review_Title: Tries WAY Too Hard to be funny
Review: Thor: Love and Thunder, is a very basic movie that is often very predictable. The first 30 minutes are quite sluggish and full of recaps from previous movies. Making the titular character a "funny guy" often distracts the audience from the truly emotional moment. This film biggest problem comes from it's need to make the audience laugh. This film tries way too hard to be funny, often feeling like they should've added a laugh track. The ending of the film feels very lazy and slightly ruins a character that needed a satisfying ending. Unfortunately, this is still one of the best Thor movies (because the first two movies were not good), but it does not live up to the comedic timing and charm of the film that came before it.

Author: thatsgottahurt-1
Review: After watching this, I felt a little let down by the excess of banter and comedic undertones. The other reviews tell me that I'm not alone. In short, too much nonsense and not enough meaningful plot or character development. The Guardians appear for a few scant minutes early in the going and Christian Bales Gorr is woefully underused, and spends precious little time onscreen. The movie is a 7/10. It's funny and enjoyable but should have been so much more.

Author: HabibieHakim123
Review_Title: Thor: Love And Thunder Is For Me MCU Worst Film To Date
Review: Thor: Love And Thunder is simply my biggest disappointment of the year, so far?, i think it will stay until the end of the year, but who knows, anyway despite the usual great MCU movie trailer, for the first time i'm leaving the theater so disappoint on an MCU movie, Thor: Love And Thunder is basically an awful romance movie where the main couples of the film have a superpower, Thor is mostly just a full unfunny comedian here, Jane Foster (Natalie Portman) and Thor chemistry is awful and their dialogue is just so cheesy, their chemistry is also not click for me in the first Thor but it's not terrible, and their chemistry is good in The Dark World but i guess that because Jane Foster did not appear much on that movie and only have a few scene with Thor and i don't mind it, and so i can safely give a conclusion that Natalie Portman as Jane Foster is just not good, Christian Bale as a villain surprisingly awful, Gorr is just a lame unbadass villain, he's not scary for me and he's not menacing, it is possibly MCU worst villain, from Ragnarok to Love And Thunder this movie is a super downer, if it's directed by different person it's still make sense but no it's still the same guy, Taika Waititi, in Ragnarok you got this version of Thor who are mostly still a badass just with a little bit of comedy and it works perfectly, a badass female villain Hela played incredibly well by Cate Blanchett, you got Loki which is one of the best thing in Ragnarok, you also got bruce banner, and the fight and the battle was fantastic, in this one only the first battle and the battle in Zeus place that i enjoyed, the rest is mostly a meh battle, i also wanna say that Lady Sif played greatly by Jaimie Alexander is probably MCU most underused and underappreciated great characters they've ever have, and she only have a very very small role in this one, much smaller role than she have in Thor: The Dark World, i love Lady Sif in the first Thor and Thor: The Dark World and not only i want her having a way longer screen time in here, and i also way much prefer her than Jane Foster, i think she deserve on the main team alongside Thor, Valkyrie, and Korg, and they did not do that, MCU really use her character so terribly, now let's talk the pros of Thor: Love And Thunder, the movie still have a few pretty good moments and the whole Guns N' Roses soundtrack that i like, i think the visual and special effects was great, Valkyrie and Korg was not awful in this one, they were ok, the last battle was also just ok, and that's about it, the rest i just can't stand it, so overall Thor: Love And Thunder is for me MCU worst film to date.

Author: liamfarren-09503
Review: Taika Waititi has ruined the Thor franchise in my eyes, the humour is over the top and the story is not a patch on Ragnarok. Ragnarok was at the time a fresh take on Thor with a sense of humour that was befitting to the storyline, Love and Thunder however reads likes a bad eighties action, love story comedy. This is just my opinion however and I would advise that you should only watch this if you liked JoJo Rabbit. I'm sorely disappointed with Marvel for letting this happen to one of their much loved characters. All I can say is that if Taika Waititi does get get his hands on Star Wars I for one will not be looking forward to it.

Author: danieljfarthing
Review_Title: Marvel done Waititi style (again) - pumped with unadulterated fun & silly feel-good factor. Hammer time!
Review: After the superb "Jojo Rabbit" terrific director / writer / co-star Taika Waititi smashes his second 'Thor' blockbuster: "Thor: Love & Thunder" which he pumps unadulterated fun into alongside Marvel's usual stellar cast (with too many A-List cameos to mention) & spectacular effects. Chris Hemsworth hams it up brilliantly as the loveably dumb titular warrior god who here must do battle with 'god butcher' Christian Bale, helped by the likes of Tessa Thompson, ex-gf Natalie Portman & a beast voiced by Waititi (but not by Russell Crowe (funny)). "Guardians Of The Galaxy Vol.2" is still the BEST Marvel flick, but this is up there, on silly feel-good factor alone. Hammer time!

Review_Title: Had potential, but was covered up by jokes
Review: Thor love and thunder, is the fourth installment of the Thor franchise (set in the marvel cinematic universe). It was a fun film to watch, but every time a depressing scene was shown there was a joke right after. It tried to one up Thor ragnorock, with its jokes. This movie should have been simple, with a few jokes here and there, not everywhere. I like this film but it's not as good as I wanted to to be.

Author: freshersmile
Review_Title: Genuinely thought this was a parody
Review: I'm really easy to please when it comes to films and love all the thor films and his featured parts in the MCU universe. But wow, shocked at the childish dialogue, forced acting by incredible actors and no break away from what felt like a pure parody of thor. I atcually had to press back to double check I was genuinely watching the new thor film. All the ingredients were here, great actor's including the addition of Bail and Crowe, great effects even guardians of the galaxy....but it was baked essentially into a parody of a film. I felt nothing, even in the scenes where I absolutely should have, yes thor films typically have a few moments of humour but through the entire thing? Most of which wasn't that funny, in fact some moments made me cringy uncomfortable. Crowe did make me laugh however as Zeus, although Crowes impeccable talent was wasted, making him a comedian god rather than the legend and myth we've all come to know...this film could have been amazing and I'm truly shocked at how much talent and opportunity they wasted on jokes and forced comedy value...so much so the film was turned off for over three hours whilst I cooked and ate dinner.. That shows how little invested I was.

Author: JoeYabuki
Review_Title: Comedy, drama, action, epicness and LOVE
Review: I liked it a lot. Despite the fact that the film was supposed to be a comedy because of how the character has been treated lately turning him into a clown, it has drama, action and epicness... And a lot of love. The villain is well-constructed, his origin-to-end story arc is very good, though I'm sure comic book lovers will say he sucks. The scene with the empowered children was a perfect touch. Using Zeus for the issue of inclusion and progressivism was funny, not forced at all; and the thing about Korg makes sense because he's just rocks. The Jane Fonda arc... I mean, Jodie Foster... I mean, Jane Foster and what she did at the end was fine, and the scene with Thor was very emotional and deep. Taika Waititi definitely convinced me this time, he gave us a good installment.

Author: OnjiMooteDaMarle
Review: Because everything from serious scenes to emotional ones were made to look funny or is it the actors making the script feel like a spoof or is it the script itself. Every character especially Zeus played by ABC is a joke. I haven't read the comics so I am the last person to judge the story so I won't. But the film in its entirety is a very badly made one while the VFX is as good as any other Marvel film except for the Thor as a baby scene that looked pathetic. The shots including the VFX are beautiful and fun. But characters aren't strong. A film that has a confrontation or a fight between two or more people/ teams must have strong characters/ sides. Here the villain looks menacing in terms of make-up and/or prosthetics but in terms of acting like a villain, the character is a joke.

Author: starrydancechick
Review_Title: Once again the Fanboys miss the point
Review: Was this the best Marvel movie? No. Was it as bad as these butthurt katekeeping fans want everyone to believe? Also, no. There is a lot of ridiculous in this movie and it's to compensate for the heartwrenching parts. Just because it isn't verbatim comic book cannon doesn't mean it's a bad story, and just because it's a different style of movie doesn't mean it's bad cinema. There are a lot of A list performers who knocked it out of the park. Bale, especially has the talent to make the viewer sympathize with the antagonist and Natalie Portman redeems herself by making Jane 100% less annoying than she was in the first 2 Thor films. The cameos are cute and funny and I appreciate that the movie doesn't take itself too seriously. A pretentious film can be good but it's very rarely fun. Obviously you don't have to like this movie, but if you never even give it a chance then you're going to hate it no matter what. Let go, laugh at the stupid parts, and appreciate the deeper moments.

Thor Looking at Chris patt's eyes like he's in love or something, I'm too much disappointed with this kind of presentation by Marvel, atleast Thor should not be made a joke some 5th phase Avenger could be.

Author: DaveModer
Review: I did not see this in the movies, but watched it on Disney plus, and oh boy, what a let down! I turned it off after 30 minutes. I completely agree with others that this movie is a parody, and a very bad at it. The constant forced jokes, and way too loud glam rock music. Although, I did not see one point in other reviews... Author: GeekyBee
Review: Having seen lots of the rating so far I have come to a conclusion, some people just LOVE to hate and it's pretty sad. I would give this movie a 10 just to compensate but will stick to my (rather generous) 8. Thor L&T is exactly what I was expecting and hoping, a lighthearted, sweet funny movie aimed to out inner child with a bit of rom com, a pretty decent baddy (Christian Bale will always do his job mightily) and a few hilarious cameos (the mid-credit scene made me explode), not to mention great Guns'n Roses themed soundtrack. Please stop complaining that Marvel lost his touch after Endgame, you know what? The new phase might be not aimed at you, hardcore fan that checks every detail by the book, perhaps to a new generation of 12 years old. Beside, Chris Hemsworth is comedy gold and I will never get tired of it. Thor L&T made me leave the cinema with a big smile on my face, and that's enough for me.

Author: JayDeeezy
Review: This was a very nice film. Taika and the Thor team are back with full comedy vibes but also with a big heart. Jane's story was very touching and the themes of love and taking advantage of the limited time we have alive were surprisingly deep for such a silly movie. The action was Marvel top notch and I enjoyed Christian Bale's performance although I do wish there was more of him. The cameos were very fun as well. Surprisingly there are still some twists in these stories that keep things fresh. Overall, very fun film with lots of heart - exactly was I was hoping for from this crew.

Author: prh-45797
Review: So disappointing. Its the first Marvel film I've felt like walking out on and that was about 30 mins in. Calling it a B movie is probably an insult to B movies. What were they thinking? It's almost as if Chris Hemsworth and Taika Waititi have intentionally sabotaged the film to ensure they never have to make another one. Played almost entirely for laughs that just aren't funny, no emotion or drama and a waste of everyone's time, money and talent. I can't understand how the decision makers at Disney signed off on this, maybe they've put too much faith in Taika after the success of Ragnarok but he needed reigning in this time. Maybe it's time for Marvel to take a break and regroup or maybe we've had too much of a good thing and the movies have finally run their course.

Author: danny-altered-natives
Review_Title: NOT EVERYTHING THAT'S MARVEL, IS MARVELLOUS
Review: Reviewers need to top applauding Christian Bale's performance. I'm a big fan of the source material and Gorr was absolutely destroyed by Bale, with Taika Waititi opting for him to look like a budget extra from a Star Trek movie to I feel please Christian Bale, because Bale feared he would be wearing a g-string? I believe either Taika was starstruck by Bale or Bale much like Cruise used his star power to yes, no what his characters role demands of him. His bipolar performance was only terrifying in how bad it was, jumping from sad dad to storytelling clown to bland villain back to sad dad. Gorr is am absolutely terrifying and driven character yet the film never portrayed that, or any God killing bar the intro and one shot from the comic page opting again for the cheap trick of conveying Gorr's campaign of terror to thousands of distress signals? Cheap. If anything this should have been two films, Gorr had zero menace built and Jane's storyline was poorly delivered, the Guardians should have featured more than just in an intro. Peter Quill, Thor's one friend, who lost his mum to cancer is written out when this storyline could have been used to build their relationship like Bruce and Thor in Ragnarok, as the supportive friend helping a friend prepare and deal with loss. Most of all, the humour just felt forced and Korg overused. Don't get me wrong there was a lot I loved but minor visual details do not make a great movie, that's like sitting through Revenge of the Sith just to spot the E. T aliens in the senate scene. I honestly think this is one of the worst Marvel films but you can't always have an unbeaten streak, I still love Marvel despite falling asleep twice, while drinking coffee to this. Natalie Portman looked fantastic as Mighty Thor, Russell Crowe as Zeus was hilarious, I just wish we got the film we really deserved. Alarm bells for me were triggered when months in advance before release after seeing Bale in an interview claiming to be unaware of the MCU's existence, so I feel being disappointed was expected and it delivered that, in spades.

Author: cliftonofun
Review: I thoroughly enjoyed Thor: Ragnarok. I enjoyed this one...much less thoroughly. This movie tried even harder to be funny than its predecessor, but trying is not the same as succeeding. It felt like a movie made mostly of tongue in cheek montages that occasionally remembered to add plot and stakes. Very occasionally. Why were the Guardians of the Galaxy necessary? Why did we need whole sub-plots about Asgard theatre troops? Why did Russell Crowe have to go THAT far with his whole schtick? Almost everyone other than Thor, Jane, and Gorr seemed like ironic cardboard cutout scenery. I appreciate the sense of humor, but it's not enough on its own. If the story (and really nobody other than Bale) doesn't take things seriously, why should we?

Author: Pjtaylor-96-138044
Review: 'Thor: Love And Thunder (2022)' feels like an absolute rush job. Seriously, it's like a half-hearted first draft. Lacking the charm, wit, wonder and chaotic energy of Taika Waititi's previous foray into the MCU, the film chugs along at its own meandering pace as it tells a simple story as straightforwardly as it can. Some of it has a lot of potential and some of it is even fairly good, but all of it is undercut by the almost oppressively unfunny screenplay that has no idea how to balance its tone. I could probably sue for neck injuries thanks to a couple of these instances of total tonal whiplash. The movie just isn't fun, either. It certainly isn't the sort of devil-may-care comedy you may expect from those involved. Despite a handful of jokes that I recall making me think "that's quite funny" (but, crucially, never making me laugh), the experience of watching this is a maddeningly straight-faced affair. I mean, it's like the easiest 'you laugh, you lose' challenge in the world, so much so that most of the humour doesn't even seem like it's trying to make you laugh even though it obviously is. The whole thing is actually kind of embarrassing, the equivalent of watching a screening of someone's University work that they clearly scraped together mere moments before they were due to present it. I'll highlight the few things that I feel work about the picture. Firstly, Jane's storyline has a lot of potential and comes close to being affecting on a couple of occasions. It unfortunately isn't capitalised on fully, but it's undeniably the heart of the story and brings the chemistry between Natalie Portman and Chris Hemsworth back into the fray. Secondly, Gorr's motivation is believable and his presentation is often fairly unsettling (thanks, in no small part, to the stellar work from an out-of-place Christian Bale). His introductory sequence is mostly stellar, until it eventually gets too silly for its own good, and the payoff to his arc is as mature as it is satisfying (despite the denouement's somewhat clumsy handling of its consequences). Finally, there are a couple of action sequences that are presented with distinct aesthetics that bring to mind the best work of Zack Snyder. The golden shower skirmish is probably the movie's most entertaining set-piece, whereas the gang's extended stint in the shadow realm builds on the flick's most disquieting scene to present a relatively eerie battle that's genuinely aesthetically interesting. Despite these limited successes, the picture is easily one of the worst in the entire MCU. Much like 'Doctor Strange In The Multiverse Of Madness (2022)' before it, it simply doesn't feel like an actual film. It has all the elements that ought to make for a strong superhero story, but it squanders each and every one to emerge as nothing more than an absolute mess.

Author: claudio_carvalho
Review: The last worshiper of God Rapu, Gorr (Christian Bale), crosses the desert with his daughter that dies of thirsty and starvation. He reaches an oasis and sees Rapu that mistreats Gorr. The powerful Necrosword choses Gorr that beheads Rapu and he promises to kill all the gods. Thor (Chris Hemsworth) and the Guardians of the Galaxy are fighting Sif and Dr. Jane Foster (Natalie Portman) is under treatment of a stage IV cancer on Earth. When Gorr kidnaps all the children of New Asgard, Thor, Jane Foster with Mjolnir, King Valkyrie (Tessa Thompson) and Korg go to the Omnipotence City to ask Zeus (Russel Crowe) to join an army of gods to fight Gorr, but Zeus don't care to his request. Now the quartet needs to fight Gorr to rescue the children and avoid the God Butcher from reaching the Etenity's gate.

Review_Title: It seems that during the past decade or so . . .
Review: . . . deputy J-a-v-e-r-t from LES MISERABLE'S has been pigging out on donuts, as cops are wont to do. As he attempts to waddle into the role of Zeus during THOR: LOVE AND THUNDER, Deputy J- resembles nothing so much as a gladiator that lions would fight over to consume. This cream puff may have a beautiful mind, but what does that matter compared to his jelly roll? With a gut like that, it's hard to picture this French pastry as master and commander of anything. If all the bozos on Mount Olympus resembled him, the bloke with the deity-killer sword would be more likely to perish from diabetes brought on by arterial spray than from anything else.

Author: arshdeep-61438
Review_Title: A hero entering battle after battle with a smile
Review: Like other MCU films that seem to find this domain currently interesting, this Disney movie too shows a hero discussing parts of himself through lessons on sacrifice and acceptance. What gives this one a spicier flavor is Chris' rendition of an ever upbeat broken hearted God seeking solace through saving others.

Author: vicinityghost
Review_Title: Bale is too good for this movie
Review: Thor Love and Thunder is a ride in entertainment that doesn't slow down. Not that this is a bad thing, but it leaves little time to breathe and develop its themes. The majority of the movie is seen as a comedic adventure while the deeper aspects of love and loss are put on the wayside. Christian Bale does a fantastic job as the villain and it would've been great if the rest of the film could match his efforts. It is legitimately a good time, full of fun, and when it comes to comedy it's great, while the rest is just okay. This causes it to feel rather shallow in the long run, but if you're looking for a fun two hours without much thought involved, Thor Love and Thunder does the trick.

Author: korisnik982
Review_Title: I really really loved it, even though I didn't expect it!
Review: Tbh, I really didn't expect much from this movie when I saw the trailers, even though I love Thor, Taika and Chris Hemsworth, but it deemed like it's going to be cheep mindless comedy. I was absolutely utterly wrong about that and I was never happier about that. I LOVED IT!

Author: imabariblaze
Review: Unfortunately this was not a great movie, I'm a huge Marvel fan but this was disappointing. Too many jokes, not funny, goofy Thor, too much Korg, Jane somehow worthy of Valhalla, overuse of the goats, overuse of GnR. Valkyrie is cool, but is Queen not cool enough? The tale of the two dads, ok we get it. I was also confused by the we can all be Thor's now. I though Thor is Thor. The God Butcher with Bale leading the part was cool but not enough time on screen. And were there any notable Gods that he butchered? And the Zeus part, just ridiculous! Imagine if it was Tessa's clothes being blasted? Outrage!
