Author: markawyman
Review: What the Hell were they thinking when they made this movie?

Author: jebyvyson
Review: I expected more from this movie. Taika Waititi is a good director at making serious theme matter with comedic acts to it. Even if act plays it off funny, the context is rather sad or depressed, which is why I like Thor: Ragnarok and Jojo Rabbit. However, this movie did not land on its subject matter and takes jokes as the main focus. There are some enjoyable moments of the movie, but it sometimes felt forced and not engaging. Ragnarok, Infinity War, and Endgame was a great switch around for Thor, but this movie dumb down this character and now just embrace him as a joke. I seriously believe this is the movie that's going to hurt the MCU. It's an enjoyable film but nothing to experience again.

Author: abalpn-99472
Review: Chris and Natalie did have chemistry in this film. I did see them in the first film and The Dark World. Not Ragnarök. Christian Bale nailed the character of Gorr the God Butcher. With all that makeup on him, his character resembles like Emperor Palpatine, Voldemort and the Nun. Overall, Bale was excellent and scary for the role. There were some parts that became campy but the lines and dialogues were funny. My dad, brother and I laughed along. Of course the action and fight scenes were awesome. There was good music throughout the film as well. Korg definitely stole some of the funny scenes and we laughed at it. The action sequences are great and we were amazed with the special effects. It's still an awesome film and I would watch it again. I wish I would hold Thor's hammer and harness the thunder.

Author: shahujjwalshah
Review_Title: Same nonsense repeated again and again.
Review: It's feel like I have watched a movie written buy bunch of kids. Why are they making a goofy Thor's parody movie? Christian Bale's character was awosome which is obvious but if you have read the comics, they did't build that character too well.

Author: tabuno
Review_Title: Typical Summer Superhero Action with a Nice Emotional Punch
Review: Reviewing this movie is made difficult with the subjective bias against the comedic formula that the screenplay uses incorporating The Guardians of the Galaxy characters for the first half of the movie. The plot unfolds with a slow opening of a tragic survival story and the introduction of a new menace threatening the universe. Then the story uses a juvenile-level narrative flashbacks and adds a romantic dimension along with the threatening menace which by the end of the movie becomes like Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness a strong redeeming climax that helps to greatly lift the overall assessment of the movie. For those unfamiliar with these characters, a number of well-known actors offer up some surprising, disguised performances, perhaps credit to their acting abilities and make-up, except for surprise appearance of Matt Damon (uncredited) whose presence is almost always impossible to disguise. In sum, Thor is an enjoyable, summer romp that does not break any new ground, but Chris Hemsworth makes great use of his light, comedic lines. Mostly tame, off-beat almost overly cute humor along with the typical fantasy action sequences describe this movie, but it is the relational moments that shine.

Author: benceman-94012
Review_Title: Tries too hard to be a comedy
Review: Not funny. The jokes are way too over the top, and who likes screaming goats anymore? So annoying! When the story gets serious, it's really good and I love all the Christian Bale storyline, but I hate hate the forced comedy. I think it's time for a new director if there are any future Thor projects. There are also dumb cameos that don't need to be in it. I laughed zero times when they showed up. Phase four of the MCU has been hit and miss and this one was mostly a miss compared to others in phase four, with Shang Chi and Spider-Man being the strongest in my opinion. Eternals was the worst, but this one was not too far off.

Of course Antony and sick woman could win against huge male monsters in alignment with the ne mainstream novel. We need to be host , there is something to save : the bad enemy Christian Bale offers a great interpretation. We cannot say the same for Russel Crowen poisoned in the ridiculous character of Zeus. We strongly hope to forget this movie as soon as possible.

I think I'll have to got back to the older ones for my Marvel fix. This review is not a reflection on the actors, again the script wasn't worthy of them.

Author: tinlittlenerd
Review: Love and Thunder doubles down on the success Ragnorak had and just tries to be a funny and light movie. Whereas Ragnorak had a little bit of something for everyone, this movie clearly targeted a much younger audience. The film doesn't take itself seriously at all and the pacing is probably the fastest we've ever gotten out of the MCU. Whether or not this works for you or not is completely subjective. I would've preferred a more mature approach to Gorr and Jane but that just isn't what this movie was going for. If you're expecting a complicated and nuanced story you won't be getting it, but if you're looking for a fun and heartfelt movie that is exactly what you'll get.

Author: everseescanners
Review: This movie could have been one of Marvel's best. Sadly it missed the mark for a myriad of reasons. The comedy being one of them. I'm not at all opposed to comedy i actually enjoy it a lot. The first Guardians movie was a riot. But if you have a story about Gorr, a God killing villain who lost his daughter, and within that same movie a story about love and losing someone to cancer, let up on the damn comedy. Gorr's character and development was rushed. He's a God killer yet he only killed one God on screen. One that didn't even seem like a threat. They could have easily stretched this out into a trilogy and made Gorr a Thanos level threat. And to not show what the villain is capable of on screen and instead of showing the dead God in the aftermath of what happened kind of ruins any tension building with said threat. They could have built the story up over multiple films showing Gorr killing powerful Gods and at the same time Thor building a team to take him on. Such a HUGE missed opportunity. If they would have approached this film with a darker more serious tone and took their time with it it could have easily rivaled Infinity War or even been better. But sadly they threw in too much Disney and not enough Marvel. I really wish Marvel would put on the brakes a little bit and assess what they are trying to do moving forward. There are so many amazing projects coming out in the next few years but if they keep on with these lazy writing choices those projects are doomed from the beginning. Daredevil will not be a continuance of the much beloved Netflix series and from what i read will not even have a mature rating. I have serious fears that one of the best Marvel heroes of all time is going to be neutered like all the rest of my once cherished superheroes. It's really a sad time to be a Marvel COMICS fan. I know these movie are not comic books. But alas they are based on comic books. Recently in title only which is the main issue I'm having as of late.

Author: CANpatbuck3664
Review_Title: A Passable but Underwhelming Adventure in Thor: Love and Thunder
Review: I was let down a little by this movie but I try to start with what I liked. Love and Thunder still looks good, it has the same kind of visual sensibility that helped Ragnarok stand out from the pack. The fight in the shadow realm has some nice cinematography and choreography with the action. Jane's return is also intriguing from moment one, I can't go far into spoiler territory but they do find a new angle on it to make Jane as Thor unstoppable yet vulnerable at the same time. The rest of the plot isn't as unique or fresh but the creative team handled her character's return with a lot of tact.

Author: myartifact-97983
Review: Well okay, I didn't walk out because I was sitting at home...but if it was the theatre, I would have. I just couldn't justify sitting through 45 more minutes of everything being a joke, thin plot, horrible CGI and mediocre action scenes by Marvel standards. So I turned it off. I think the biggest problem with MCU right now is there's no larger plot surfacing like we had with The Avengers/Thanos/Infinity Stones etc., at least not one that I'm seeing. The biggest problem with Love and Thunder, a joke every line. It's like what my English lit teacher used to say about swearing, 'If you swear all the time, then it loses it's impact. If you only swear once in a while, it really meant something.' This movie meant nothing to me.

Author: hmbrisbo
Review: Marvel is thinking too big picture and they've stopped focusing on the smaller picture. Ever since they started really getting into connecting the entire marvel cinematic universe, the quality of their individual movies has gone down. It's disappointing because I know they can produce a good movie. They are looking at a complete puzzle and they've stopped focusing on the details of the puzzle pieces. You should be able to watch any marvel movie/ tv show on its own, and it should be enjoyable. But that's not the case anymore. You almost have to watch every single thing they release, and that's less entertaining and more like a full time job.

Author: emonmohammad

Author: ryandawhite
Review_Title: A decently fun but out of character movie for the God of thunder.
Review: First off I enjoyed Ragnarok a lot. It gave the character Thor much more personality and made him more fun then the other marvel characters. Sadly though this movie over does every single good thing Ragnarok did. The plot jumps around and sometimes just doesn't make sense and Thor is a total idiot in this movie. The running gag was annoying and some of the characters that reappeared in this movie display why they should have only been in ONE movie. The main problem I have with this movie though is the villain. Gorr the God Butcher is a terrifying but a enjoyable villain to watch on screen. Yet we only get a few major scenes to enjoy Christian Bales performance! One of the first MCU villains I wanted more of! Overall the movie is just okay. If you want a few laughs and a few cool fight scenes definitely watch this movie. If you are looking for anything deeper than that steer away.

Review: With all the budget, great actors, great storyline. Even all these couldnt save this film all because of ita director, as a hardcore mcu fans, this is the worst MCU film to date. Its so empty, the plot is stupid, the jokes are unfunny that its humorous. Taika really think that he can get away with anything just because he can. Author: bbkg79
Review: This was really bad. Like dookie grits level bad. I don't mind jokes but, this was trying way too hard to be funny. The cgi was kind of poor, the fight scenes mediocre asf. Thor Love and Thunder kept my attention through the entire movie. It did not feel long because it was very entertaining.

Author: james-patrick-732-463468
Review_Title: Why kill Jane? Pointless. Such a shame.
Review: Terrible story and writing. So Marvel brings in The Mighty Thor just to kill her off? I thought the whole reason the hammer went to her was to protect her when each time she used it it made her more sick? They really phoned this one in. They didn't even use The Guardians of the Galaxy effectively. The trailer would have you think they were in the entire movie. This is proof that just because it has Marvel on it doesn't mean it's a automatic hit. Only fan boys will love this movie. I just can't get over how bad the story structure was. Who signed off on that script? I really wanted to love this movie. I'm not even sure I liked it. 5/10 is being very generous.

Author: skip-98756
Review_Title: Disney is Ruining the Marvel Universe
Review:
Whats going on here? Usually when I see a marvel superhero flick its a real treat, exciting, thrilling ,intense at times and even dark in some cases...Since Disney has gotten its gooey fingers on marvells movies, they have been Utterly destroyed and turned into Hallmark movies, comedic parodies and the heros completely emasculated...Look at Hawkeye, Hulk, and now Thor...whats next? Ruin Daredevil as well? This movie, I sat down to watch with my gf and 20 mins in we were both rolling our eyes and shocked at how shallow, stupid and childish it had become... we honestly couldnt even finish watching it,though i may try later myself...It was Painfully bad and thats really sad considering the high regard and respect marvel films had back in the days of infinity war and falcon and winter soldier...The decimation of an incredible franchise...the destruction of the marvel universe, more so than anything done by Thanos...so sad...
at least DC has kept it legit and Uncompromised.... Hard Pass on this mess of a film...Im shocked that christian Bale even wanted to be associated with it.

Author: MovieWarfare
Review_Title: Not as great as Thor Ragnarok
Review: Who would've thought that the only MCU character (so far) to get 4 solo films would be Thor? The first Thor movie was an okay introduction and the second one was quite bland. In came Taika Waititi with Thor Ragnarok (2017), who made Thor a charismatic and fun character. Thor Ragnarok was no doubt one of the funniest and most enjoyable movies in the Thor franchise so far. It was no wonder that I was looking forward to Thor Love and Thunder when it was revealed Taika was returning as director. So did Thor: Love and Thunder deliver more fun or was this a big thundering step backwards?

Author: jenkos74
Review: As the biggest Marvel fan I personally know, I have unfortunately began to think that it wasn't just Iron Man who died in Endgame.....but MCU movies. I sooooo want to be wrong but taking my fanboy, Cosplay/Comic con head off, i report as follows, and i will keep it brief leading up to Thor........Black Widow and Shang Chi were no better than OK......Eternals....just NO, Spidey brought it back a little if only for the reminiscing of old characters.... Multiverse, wrong Director!!! I love Sam Raimi but this was clearly him going to Disney and Pitching Evil Dead 4 wrapped up in Dr Strange's cape....and then alas we come to Thor.... I'm sorry, but again....wrong Director.... Waititi nailed it with Ragnarok as he blended the right amount of comedy with a tonne of action and great soundtrack. Love and Thunder was nothing more than a childish comedy with a couple of superhero moments....not sure if Waititi was wasted on drugs making it but annoying goats, a ridiculous Zeus (Russell Crowe....what were you thinking).... I honestly think it could be a "Carry On" movie (for people aware of the 60's/70's slapstick movies)...Disney please distance yourself from Marvel and stick to what you know best....or maybe just "Let it Go"

Author: dontdwellinthepast
Review_Title: The only worthwhile part is Bale
Review: The story is rushed, we're once again bombarded by Watiti's trademark garbage jokes, and Jane's sudden characterization is totally unestablished in previous movies. If you are at a low enough braincell count to have enjoyed Ragnarok then maybe you'll like this. Otherwise, save your money.

Author: sandeshhegde-80095

Author: rossn-86379
Review_Title: They made Joke out of Thor
Review: Marvel has made of joke out of itself. The last good marvel movie was Avengers Infinity war.

Author: rocksoap69
Review: There are a lot of complaints about this movie trying to be too funny. But this is the humour from Ragnarok, which sat very well and I actually found the humour a mild grace here (though far from a saving one.) Love and Thunder's biggest problem is terrible pacing and bad editing. Everything is cut together so quickly it seems to have no regard to building a narrative or giving any sense of challenge. It's hard to follow why any of the key plot points are happening and many of them have no consequence. Christian Bale's character is by far the most interesting and unfortunately unexplored while Portman's transformation comes unceremoniously and lands like a lead zeppelin. Such a shame for Waititi to not keep a plot on the rails while he's seemingly blinded by packing in big FX and keeping things light hearted.

Author: Avalala
Review: This movie, like all action/comic book and Marvel movies had it's flaws. That being said, I can't understand the bad or even mediocre reviews, that might be due to the simple fact that everyone experiences movies differently. Speaking for myself: I laughed I cried I was entertained the whole time and I found the plot and aesthetics to be a heartwarming (REFRESHING) change of pace for the MCU. As a marvel fan, my expectations are always high and I wasn't let down. As I said before, everyone's experience will be different. It's for THATTT reason that you should see it and decide for yourself!!! :) !!

Review: As big fan of the previous movie and of taika's previous movies I was very disappointed after seeing this. I feel like the comedy was very poor, nearly to suit American audiences, Thor was made out to be almost stupid as well as Jane who was seen as an intelligent person in previous movies. And what's with the screaming goats. Definitely went on a bit. Bale saved the movies with some proper acting. He gets all 4 stars.

Author: gcsman
Review_Title: Entertaining and vivid. But it can't quite decide what it wants to be.
Review: The first Thor (2011) is one of the best superhero films ever made. It had a clear storyline, great special effects, a great cast all around with a fine pick for the lead role (Chris Hemsworth), a stirring musical score, and a director (Kenneth Branagh) who knew how to lean right in to the mythical grandeur of the Norse gods. Yes, those were the days. Now in this fourth Thor film where are we? Norse god? No, a 'space Viking'. Serious warrior? More of a lovable doofus with muscles and a magical axe. It's all very entertaining and easy to watch -- things never drag, and visually, Love and Thunder is as striking as almost any thing Marvel has come up with. The Shadow Worls, the Hall of the Omnipotents, and the mysterious Eternity are terrifically well done things to look at. Also, for a cast that includes Natalie Portman and Christian Bale (and an over-the-top Russell Crowe cameo) how can you go wrong?

Author: davidgibson-19224
Review: Wow, this movie was bad. And weird. Could not decide whether it wanted to be a comedy ala Guardians or serious ala original Thor. This was nothing but a bunch of pretty people collecting paychecks. In fact, I gave it a five instead of a four only because it had so many pretty people in it.

Review: This is how you make a Marvel movie. All the nerds have their undies in a knot because they think it's jig serious enough lol. I loved it. Even more funny. Christian Bale was very good in a bit of a limited performance. Special mention of Russell Crowe ad Zeus. He was so funny and it was refreshing to see the actor in such a fun role. Best Marvel movie since Raganok! Portman was really good too. See it. Enjoy it. It's total popcorn.

Author: mollyedginton-78347
Review_Title: If you're a marvel lover, DONT WATCH
Review: Hands down the worst marvel film I've ever watched. I've never walked out of a cinema, but after 45 minutes, I couldn't watch anymore. Thor is one of my favourite marvel characters but you can tell this is not a proper marvel film. It was cheesy to the point of ridiculous.

Author: hmydnyahajy
Review: OKAY... THIS MOVIE IS UNBELIEVABLY AMAZING!!! I cannot decide between Thor: Ragnarok and Thor Love and Thunder! Props To the VFX team, Directors, and actors!!! The goats were hilarious! The moment they let out their first "AAAAAH!!!!!!!" I fell in love with them! But they do not even COMPARE to Jane foster as The Mighty Thor! Natalie Portman played that role PERFECTLY! And I can't forget to mention CHRIS HEMSWORTH, MY HEART THROB! HE IS MY PRECIOUS BOY!!!! I LOVED the Thor-Jane breakup scenes they were really sad, and funny at the same time! My favorite line was "They have a refrigerator without a door" Then Thor proceeds to smash a vending machine! Then we go to the character of GORR THE GOD BUTCHER! His screen time was PERFECT! You understood where he really came from in his journey. He wasnt just the villain that you wanted to die immediatly, You actually feel bad for him! His sword is SO COOL. Now we talk about Heimdall's son, Axl!!! He was so noble and brave, and I love how he was named after Axl Rose from Guns n' Roses! Which brings us to the music section! THE MUSIC WAS COMPOSED BEAUTIFULLY! I am also so glad that Thor has a "Daughter" HE IS THE PERFECT DAD! It added to the emotion of the film! And lastly Jane's death. It was played out perfectly, and made me tear up in the theaters (Which I never do) It looked like Loki's death in Thor: Dark world, which made it even sadder. I'm glad that they didn't decide to bring her back, because I think it was a perfect twist. I ABSOLUTELY LOVED THIS MOVIE, AND I WOULD SEE IT AGAIN AND AGAIN IF MY DAD WOULD LET ME! IT WAS SO WORTH IT! I RECCOMEND IT WITH EVERY FIBER OF MY BEING!

Author: thechair
Review: Not since The Predator have I been so disappointed with a franchise movie. I had my doubts early on but by the midway point it was full eye-rolls and willing it to end. The humour rarely works and just ends up feeling awkward, while conversely the serious themes are horribly misplaced. Christian Bale's villain was all over the place and by far the weakest in any Marvel film, with his motivations feeling glib from the worryingly poor prologue - honestly, what on earth was going on with that rubbish god-guy and the effects? Glib is a good word for the whole thing, really, with an end product that looks like zero rigour or care was applied to any aspect; a that'll do because it made Taika laugh approach.

Author: mmuggi
Review: Thor: Love & Thunder is the next installation in the Thor franchise, once again with Taika Whatiti behind the camera. This can be seen because his style is characterized by a lot of humor and many colors. There is a counterweight to this humor, namely Christian Bale's Gorr the God Butcher. A good enemy whose motivation one can understand.

Author: gackles
Review: Disney execs got together and whipped up a strategy to destroy yet another fan-favorite. Any rating over 2 is a bot or paid. In its defense, there were parts when there was hope that a real movie would begin only to fall so hard on its virtue-signaling, woke face that even Nancy Pelosi would roll her eyes. Disney has officially ruined Thor at such a low level that there really can be no recovering (kids can become Thor now?....wtf). On the bright side, I'll never have anxiety while waiting for any new Marvel installments because, at this point, the few that are left are in line for the chopping block. RIP Thor.

Author: hwephq
Review_Title: Fun - but Disney's Leftist Woke Agenda abounds
Review:
Its fun to watch, sure... I really wanted this to be a film worthy of the character and Mythos of Thor. Regrettably it falls short. Once again non-white, non-straight, non-male takes the front
seat. You'll see this very clearly when That Rocky fellow tells of his two gay Dads and how he himself is gay. Nothing wrong with being gay. Nothing wrong with being female or black. But having that as a surreptitious theme in a kids film makes that insidious & disingenuous. For that I have no respect for Disney. Let people decide. Stop ramming this woke "you must think like this" down the viewers throat.

Author: gavincoker
Review_Title: Only review you need to read
Review:
While it wasn't nearly as good as Ragnarok (and i know some people don't like Ragnarok), it is still better than Thor 1 & 2. I will say that i enjoyed the music they put in the movie (despite my hatred towards guns & roses). Christian Bale delivered a solid performance as you would expect and honestly the acting overall was good. I'm disappointed by Taika on this one because it seems like they maybe gave him too much control. It was basically a throw away movie to make money. And that's not always a bad thing but it really didn't do much in my opinion to move Thors character ahead any. The colors and shots were nice. Plot was maybe too rushed while also kinda throwing in scenes that were completely unnecessary. Seems like
most movies are shooting for 2 hours worth these days when it really isn't always necessary. Natalie portman is a bad actor i believe after watching this, but also could have to do with the fact that she doesnt really do cringey comedy much. As far as people complaining about how cringey the movie is, that's what it was made to be. It's supposed to be a mildly cringey 80s style Rom-com but it even kinda failed at the Rom-Com side. If the whole cast would've been killed by Gorr the God Butcher i don't think i would've felt anything. And that's the general feel of the movie, not a lot of feeling or heart put into it. Is it still worth the watch ? Well yeah of course but it's not gonna be a classic or anything and hopefully after the bad press for the movie, disney will get their act together. 6/10 if you consider Ragnarok 10/10.

Author: lynettecrandall
Review: If you want to see a Marvel comedy then this is the movie for you! Unfortunately I liked the Marvel Movies that had some substance to them with a balance of comic relief. Author: alexanderandyfilla
Review_Title: MARVELS final goodbye to its fans...
Review: After a ridiculous "Eternals" and a, lets say, messed up "Doctor Strange" (What the hell is the character of Charles X. Xavier doing in there?), the other Titles that came out were average at best now this. A Marvel Thor Movie needs a bit more than the right actor and costume. It needs most of all a decent storyline. Author: grantlindsay-67473
Review: Get over yourselves and stop taking yourselves too seriously! Honestly, It is a shame that everyone who gave this movie a bad review can't see how great this movie actually is. Yeah there is a lot of humor, but there is a lot of heart too. Thor just went through so many growing pains the last few times we've seen him since Ragnarok and now his storyline has come full circle. Also, you have to remember that Thor just uses humor to protect himself... it's his crutch to not feel sad... So it is important for the storyline. The humor was also witty and well placed and Taika was staying true to his directing style in helping the Thor franchise not take themselves too seriously. So please all of you who gave this movie a bad rating, do yourself a favor and go rewatch this film, and get out of your own way to enjoy this movie and see this film for what it truly is: Thor trying to protect his heart + acknowledging his heart is with Jane + Taika not allowing anyone to take themselves too seriously + so many throw backs to what made Ragnarok so great + a heart-felt full-circle in Thor's journey + Christian Bale being an amazing villain. This movie was well made and I love it almost as much as I loved Ragnarok, if not just as much. Oh and if you haven't seen it yet, go into watching it knowing it is it's own movie, with an amazing director who hasn't changed his directing style and that there is a rhyme and a reason for everything within the flow of this film.

Review: The "Scary Movie" version of the Marvel movies... Why did Taika Waititi have to direct the Thor movies? Nobody asked for it and he completely messed up this great superhero. Such a shame!

Author: ay6
Review: Was this a good Marvel movie or even a good Thor movie? Not really. It took too much tone from the Guardians of the Galaxy movies; don't get me wrong, they're great, and they work when written / directed by James Gunn, but their tone doesn't really work for a Thor movie.

Author: PartTimeCritic
Review_Title: Watch the Movie Itself Go Through a Mid-Life Crisis
Review: THOR: LOVE AND THUNDER (C-) gives us a Thor struggling with an identity crisis (expressed through non-stop jokes) despite the challenges and growth his previous 8 appearances have sold us on. The film itself seems to be struggling with the same thing as it has transitioned to an all-out comedy vehicle with just two dramatic notes - love is good and religion is dumb. Taika Waititi's work here is like religious satire of Voltaire coupled with the schmaltzy humanistic ethic of Oprah filtered through the cinematic comedy lens of Tarantino & Shrek. The film isn't helped by a plot that is as engrossing and ad hoc as the obvious and non-stop CGI locations they travel to. Nor is it helped by action sequences as the film seems completely uninterested in taking the action seriously by giving it stakes or a respite from the non-stop comedy or unique/creative beats. I laughed at some of the jokes, but I found myself growing less and less interested in Thor and the gang that surrounds him. At the rate this universe invents ad hoc items (God killing swords and wish granting altars) that should have been mentioned in the Infinity War, brings back dead people, or retcons the tone/plot of past films - why should anyone care about anything. I hope this is as low as the MCU gets, but I fear it won't be.

Author: garrysprice
Review: I felt the serious moments in the movie were over shadowed by the constant bombardment of jokes and gave it a parody/spoof movie feel.

Author: therapeuticsuicide
Review_Title: Disney continues to lower the standard for Marvel films...
Review: The first half hour or so has some funny jokes and pop culture references, starting off with a bang similar to the most recent Suicide Squad film, however, unlike the most recent Suicide Squad film, it completely loses momentum, and the rest of this film is utter, hammered garbage. Natalie Portman is fed an awful script, genuinely appearing uninterested in her role, and looks ridiculous as a female Thor - I literally pity her for having to appear in this filth, along with poor Christian Bale. If these producers had any actual brains, which clearly almost nobody working for streaming companies that make feature films does these days (Netflix is equally guilty of producing tripe features), when they read the proposed script and saw the name "Zeus" it would have been very clever for them to think to engage Liam Neeson in reprising his unforgettable performance as Zeus from Clash of the Titans, to the point that I might have given them one more crucial star towards a barely passing grade. Don't tell me Disney doesn't have the cash that this couldn't have been arranged, since Liam Neeson will seemingly work for loose change these days (not to detract from his work, he's excellent, but he appears quite easy to engage, similar to Nick Cage, who I also enjoy). Russell Crowe is utterly miscast as Zeus - his worn-leather face, stringy hair and obesity simply DO NOT CONJURE VISUALS WORTHY OF A GOD OF ZEUS' STATURE, PERIOD, to the GREAT detriment of that entire sequence. I'm surprised to see Christian Bale in such garbage, but none of the fault lies with him. The film has typically strong visuals (LITERALLY THE ONLY THING GOING FOR EITHER NETFLIX OR DISNEY THESE DAYS) but even the visuals are squandered, as mid-way through the film converts to black and white as they enter some sort of "shadow realm" thingy, and honestly, I feel they could have been more inventive making the visuals look good without using color. More routine, boring action sequences and bland storytelling ensue. Whatever, it's garbage, why am I making any effort going any further about it since Disney/Marvel didn't? Basically there isn't a Marvel film since Avengers: End Game, Deadpool 2 and Logan worth anybody's time. Looking forward to another actually GOOD Marvel superhero film ONE day, but at this rate I've accepted that IT'S VERY UNLIKELY...

Author: moviesknight
Review: Snooze fest. Very few moments which were kinda good. Silly one liners ruining the flow. Some visuals were wonderful in bits and pieces but most of it bland. And they dont even know what to show and what not to show in the trailers. Literally spoiled one of the main moments in the film. The marvel universe is getting bigger but I kinda feel they are losing the plot. No content. Nothing. I camt believe it is the same director who directed ragnarok. Huge disappointment. Would have loved to see more of meik. Lady Sif is a joke in thor universe. Gods are weaker and out of context. Everything is out at the mercy of Gor. He is better than all of you. Huge let down.

Author: forallthingsg

Author: neeltje_wijnen
Review: It already begins with the intro of the villain which is only a couple of minutes so you don't even know where he comes from or what kind of man he is. The god is immediately put down as a sarcastic spoiled child who doesn't give anything about anything... The whole movie is a cheap comedy with jokes that don't land of aren't even remotely funny. They try too hard to be funny but it takes away from the whole story that hardly isn't there anymore. Thor is just an annoying character with so many flaws.. like he learned nothing in the past 10 years. Jane has cancer and picks up the hammer out of nowhere? Also no backstory there. The whole this is just disappointing.

Author: Kingslaay
Review: Love and Thunder was not as strong as Ragnarok but I found it entertaining. The film had a somewhat good dose of humour. I loved the funny awkwardness created with Thor and Stormbreaker and the screaming goats were funny. Chris Hemsworth was born to play Thor and does well in carrying this film. It was great to see Jane Foster (Natalie Portman) play a hero figure who was equal to Thor but with a sad twist. It was the most serious film in the Thor film series with Jane having cancer and the death of the villain's daughter at the start of the film. I felt they could added a bit more humour, used the Guardians of the Galaxy more and perhaps Zeus and the gods could have teamed up to fight Gorr. I was not impressed with the black and white fight scene on the planet that looked like the Moon. This was far better than Doctor Strange which was disappointing and it had a great soundtrack. Overall not all bad.

Author: dlmiley
Review: I was very disappointed by this latest entry in the MCU. The movie starts out well with the opening scene starring Christian Bale as the "God Butcher". But then it goes downhill from there. Chris Hemsworth seems to be phoning in his performance, but he is also a victim of a bad script that tries too hard to be funny. I enjoyed the humor in "Thor: Ragnorak" but this one has too many jokes that fall flat and not enough action. The direction and cinematography are adequate but not inspired. Therefore, I can only recommend this one for MCU completists and/or "fanboys". 5/10.

Author: mishael53
Review: The movie was way too hammy in its humor versus the wittiness that was Ragnarok. In Ragnarok, the humor always supported the storyline to move forward. This movie just had collected bits instead of a cohesive story - like a long SNL episode. Also the scene with the Guardians was such a waste. Thor just reverted back to his arrogant pre-Infinity War self?? It makes no sense. What was the point of all of that?? And Christian Bale's talent was absolutely wasted with zero God Butcher violence and eeriness happening. The entire movie was so very disappointing. Ultimately, it's like Taika unsuccessfully tried to make Thor a Monty Python frat boy movie with cheesy humor.

Author: Sword_Rain
Review: They expanded the realm of God's in this, even introduced Eternity which fans have been drooling at for awhile. Zeus in this movie might as well be Goldmember from Austin Powers, which for a movie who's plot revolves around Gorr the God Butcher and his events, while also teaming with the events of Jane Foster's Mighty Thor. You would think that this movie would be extremely dramatic, and immensely emotional and not HAHAHA emotion and little quips all the time.. Those story lines were depressing, tension driven, and contemplative. This movie makes too light of all the situations and fails horribly at all of it. It all felt rushed trying to squeeze in too much in a movie, and also not even being able to scratch the surface of the surface of these characters. We are left with this hollow shell of what could have been an amazing movie. I feel bad for any actors entering the MCU in this movie, there was a lot of wasted talent. I was big fan of the MCU like most for over a decade now and it's wild that after Endgame we are getting these massive nose-dive movies and tv shows with minimum effort and mediocre writing.

Author: ghatbkk
Review: It gets better towards the end, but it is a really silly movie and the plotting is ridiculous. It seems like the Marvel Universe is focused on parodying itself at this point. Of course, Marvel fans still need to see the movies so that they won't be lost in the next one... or that is what Marvel hopes. Don't spend money to see this one. Borrow it or stream it.

Author: wcohan
Review_Title: I guess the target demo was 6-12 years old?
Review: I was a quarter way in and trying to figure out why this was surprisingly terrible; seemed like a satirical SNL take on the genre, but then I realized, oh, this movie is not meant to be seen by me, it is for kids. Problem with the super-hero movies is that sometimes they are pure good movies, with no target demo, like the original Hulk movie, the first Thor, first two Avengers, first wonder woman, first superman with henry cavill, Joker, Dark Knight, etc., entertaining for both younger and older people, but you don't know until after you start watching. This version of Thor was so disappointing, I can't begin to express it; like some kind of amateur comedy skit. The whole Jane becomes a female Thor bit was ludicrous, made zero sense. Another huge turn-off was the woke junk that was so obviously shoved in by the studio's diversity officer, echh.

Author: Oroncz
Review: Taika Waititi's Thor Love & Thunder has it all! A triumph in dramatic storytelling through the eyes of a humorous man.

Author: kakuraka
Review: "Please disperse. Nothing to see here." (c)

Author: MCUlifer
Review: I'm an MCU lifer. My wife and I have been attending opening nights since Iron Man 3 in 2012. 10 years. We left the theater tonight really disappointed. Too much cheesy humor, no serious dramatic feel at all really. Everything was a joke. Thor was a joke. The whole Zeus dynamic, joke. Bringing Jane back just long enough to kill her off, joke. It's like the movie couldn't decide if it was for 6 year olds or teenagers, with about 5 minutes dedicated to the adults in the room. I love Thor but they really did him wrong here, much like they did Hulk. The only bright spots were the brief appearance by the GotG and outstanding performance by Christian Bale. Jane was good but you couldn't really invest in her because they tell you up front she's dying. Hot mess of a movie and a disappointment.

Author: sameerpirzada
Review: Thor-Love and Thunder is one of the most entertaining MCU movies ever. I loved everything about the movie. It was funny, emotional, dark, and epic. Don't listen to bad reviews, some people always want MCU movies to be intense and serious which I feel is quite boring. You cannot expect every movie to be of the same level. Also, there has been always some comedy in Thor's movies so I don't get why some fans are disappointed. I understand Thor's behavior sometimes is silly and childish but this is what makes his personality more interesting and funny, and I always want him to be like this. Another thing which I loved about the movie was Gorr-the God Butcher. He was such a creepy villain and Christian Bale nailed this role. Hence, I thoroughly enjoyed watching this movie, the post-credit scenes were also interesting and I can't wait to see the next chapter!! ❤

Author: igor-persin
Review_Title: Do yourself a favor, read the comic
Review: Simply as title says, do yourself a favor, read the comic, it's really a great story about Gorr the God Butcher, Jane Foster as Thor, Unworthy thor etc. This on the other hand is really butchered and then butchered even more great story. One of the rare movies of this 'caliber' that I gave up half way through, kinda forced myself to watch other half later on on speed up, and glad that I didn't waste more time on this, it's B type of movie with big budget. So yeah, if you are interested in great story, good character development, emotional ending, maybe even some tears, someting worth your time, read the comic :D , and skip this pile of hot steaming ....

Author: Grey_rainbow
Review_Title: Not even 10% as good and creative as Ragnarok
Review: After mucking up Multiverse, MCU continues the trend and ruins Thor (once again). The first two Thor movies were terrible. Then came Taika and gave a whole new exciting, quirky, and colorful life to Thor via Ragnarok (who served well in Inifinity War and Endgame). But, like the last Strange's movie, Thor too devolves way far below the expectations. I now firmly believe that this is the beginning of the end of MCU's successful run.

Author: ostlerb-02853
Review_Title: This movie deserved a more serious tone
Review: I really liked the story, but the overall tone seemed a little too light-hearted when the events were anything but that. To it's credit, though, it did get serious for the most important part of the movie.

Author: optimajim
Review: I'm a fan of Hemsworth, Bale & Portman and a huge fan of the Marvel Comic Universe, but this movie was awful. Great actors did what they could with a putrid script, laced with unnecessary, irrelevant content. In the modern era, the first Fantastic 4 movie held the bottom spot, but I'd much rather watch that and the 1977 Spiderman TV movie over and over and over again, than to have to sit through this movie ever again. Please get rid of Taika Waititi and Jennifer Kaytin Robinson and never let them write any superhero movies ever again. I will never get that 1 hour and 58 minutes of my life back.

Author: adeeshasankalana
Review_Title: Least MARVEL-ous movie marvel ever made
Review: Very boring, slow and can't believe they made thor very very stupid and uninteresting. We used to love thor and they have made him stupid and now we cannot love his character any longer. "Mighty thor" is highlighted and she is terrible. This movie is more like a failed effort to replace real thor with a stupid female version. Nothing like the comics. In comics these two are two different heroes but this movie hints that they will replace OUR thor with his ridiculous female version.

Author: pcarey-49176
Review_Title: These movies are getting worse all the time
Review: As a life long Marvel fan, I've come to look forward to all these movies. Thor was always one of my favorite characters in the comics, but in these movies, he's becoming little more than a punchline. I can appreciate the occasional joke here and there, but the last two Thor movies have disappointed on almost every level. Mixing Thor in with the Guardians (and their *mostly* well done slapstick) has had a very negative effect on his character. Not even Christian Bale's excellent villain could save this movie. So much time was wasted with the extremely poor jokes that his (Bale's) character was more a side story than the main story. Even Russell Crowe's Zeus was made out to be a bumbling clod for the sake of a few 'jokes'. The actual super hero scenes that were in the movie were great, but they were too far and few to save this joke of a movie.

Author: jacobski-34770
Review: The MCU continues its fall from grace with the latest addition Thor Love and Thunder.

Author: misskrissy85
Review: Let me preface by stating that the acting, writing, and all the people involved weren't the issue with how this goes wrong. It was the format.

Author: slk-182-979066
Review: I'm still not completely sure what I just watched. The best description i can give is a bunch of cheesy jokes jumbled together, interrupted only by an occasional guns n roses interlude. If only it had been interrupted by something resembling a storyline. Even the action scenes seem tacked on, without any real motivation or goal. Actually, you know what it reminded me of? It reminded me of any of the times The Simpsons (or any other long running TV show) does a clip show. There's a bunch of random scenes and disparate locations crammed together, with the story just acting as an excuse rather than an actual vehicle.

Author: johngalan
Review: I love marvel. I have loved all of the past marvel movies and shows even if they had a few or decent amount of flaws I didn't like. However, this movie tried too hard to make us laugh. Nothing was taken seriously aside from Gorr (Bale did an amazing job). Ragnarok is a top 5 maybe even 3 marvel movie for me because it was funny when it had to be and serious when it had to be. That made it a perfect blend. This movie had my hopes very high just to be a big disappointment. Hopefully, Thor can make a huge comeback. Hemsworth did his job, but it was bad directing in my opinion. Too many jokes, short amount of time for stories to develop, not enough seriousness for scenes that should have been serioues, and not enough Gorr.

Author: Pepe_Le_Pew_2
Review: Following Ragnarok this was a disappointment. It was good overall but not as good as expected. I just hope this isn't the future of movies where we need to know every character's sexual preference. Seems unnecessary because it won't move the needle as much as they think it does. I still don't care about anyone's sexual preference. I guess that makes me a bad person.

Author: onnovinken
Review_Title: Not sure if it was a paradoy or an actual Marvel movie
Review: They butchered Thor and the Marvel franchise with this one, nearly walked out of the theater. The story had potential but it didn't deliver. The movie had so many cringe worthy scenes. It was like watching a parody of the Thor franchise. Yes, I do like subtle comedy in Marvel, but every other scene with obnoxious jokes is not the way to go. No character development what so ever. My advice watch the marvel movies till end game and leave it at that. I guess they turned Thor into a very bad comedy and the other reviews say enough.

Author: RSO_Media
Review: I really enjoyed 'Thor: Love an Thunder', and I'd say it's one of the highlights of 'Phase 4' of the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

Author: markosepjr
Review: Even when I saw trailer for this movie I was concerned about the film. It looked too "campy".

Author: WhyIhateNetflix
Review_Title: Just meh with an annoying taika narration
Review: This voice over of taika is super annoying. The rest of the movie is just meh. It is all over the place and a lot of obviously comedic moments shoehorned in. Not great... It is difficult to point out really great points in this movie besides Christian Bale. Chris Hemsworth is just an average actor but we knew that. Even Nathalie, who i generally tend to like in movies, is just meh in this movie. Most of it looks weird and off. I dont know what could have saved this movie but I like the quote of Chris Hemsworth as he described this movie as made by a child. I completely agree with it as there seems to be no structure, overly "comedic" stuff and just too much leaning on things that have nothing to do with the story.

Author: wescartee
Review: Producers just throw anything out there for the public to gobble up, believing we have no standards. Christian Bale did a fairly good job, but he couldn't make this enjoyable. I knew this movie was going to be awful, but I gave it a shot. Stop making terrible movies, find better directors and create stories worth watching. This movie cost $250,000,000, it's hard to believe with that kind of money you still can't create a halfway decent movie. People in the future will mock movies like this, because movies like this are an embarrassment to cinema. The majority of marvel movies are awful, they deserve no awards, and they will be forgotten. At least put in some effort to make a movie that will live on.

Review: This movie is a disaster. The 2 I've given it is justified. The pace is way too quick for the movie does not even feel close to 2 hours everything just hits you one after the other. I feel like I wasted money on it. It's very predictable right to the very end and the other does not have a consistent story line to it. I am completley and utterly disappointed. It needs at least 2 hours and 30 mins to make it a better movie. Feel like I've wasted money on it.

Author: mratto
Review_Title: From God of Thunder to court jester
Review: If this is how his new owners see Thor, then I humbly suggest to hire Jim Carrey to play Thor. It'd be a much better fit. I read hundreds of Thor comics and what I saw in this movie has nothing to do with it. Thor is myth and honor, drama and sadness. Losses and epic victories. In this movie instead you see Gods dancing and mocking, you see Zeus using his weapon like a juggler at a Circus show. Thor Love and Thunder is the worst Marvel movie ever. By far. Point is it won't be for long, I bet Disney destruction of the Marvel Universe is far to be completed. Stan Lee is turning in his grave.....

Author: lukerz-74681

Author: schlomo-jones
Review_Title: Light hearted MCU comedy was a fun ride
Review: So I went in with extremely low expectations as Ive pretty much written the Phase 4 MCU off as a lost cause. But this movie, unlike every other phase 4 film, was actually engaging and enjoyable the whole way through. Unlike Dr Strange 2 it doesn't rely on the audience coming with fresh knowledge of crossover content from Disney+ shows. Instead, we get cleverly narrated recaps of previous events through one of Thor's side kicks telling tales to children.

Author: fredrikstrom
Review: WTF did I just watch?.. At first I thought it was just a ironic, funny intro... But the whole movie is like a bad parody of the franchise, made for young kids. And let me tell you right away that they don't succeed in being "funny" by parody or irony, or whatever this is. Do yourselves a favor, and do not waste time on this movie. You also risk ruining the previous movies if you happened to enjoy them. It really beats me to figure out the point and idea with this movie. The characters are there, Christian Bale is doing an excellent job (as always) playing the villain, and the story aren't that bad to be honest. So why go and spoil it all with this style? :(

Author: slipskinny
Review: I'm a huge fan of the MCU movies but I have no idea what happened here. Although the previous movies had a hint of humor here and there in the right place, this movie was that guy who tells bad jokes at a party while he laughs at himself. I'm not sure who pressed the wrong button to nominate this film for any kind of award. I only watch this movie for first 15 minutes and I was done. I understand that there should be a break in between movies however that should be use to tell a compelling storyline which until now has not been 100% accurate from the comics. The two stars was because of Christian Bale's performance was amazing.

Author: arungeorge13
Review_Title: Visually striking; comically and emotionally inconsistent! [+60%]
Review: The movie is, by all means, a two and ½ stars but an extra ½ goes to Christian Bale who puts his heart, soul, and body into an underwritten character. With confusing character arcs, a good chunk of humor not quite hitting the highs you expect, and the lack of stakes, Taika Waititi's second Thor flick severely lacks the liveliness of Ragnarok. The GOTG cameos don't mean anything, and the entire scene with Russell Crowe's Zeus simply makes for a subpar comedy sketch. Heck, I'm sure Sam Neill, Matt Damon, and the Asgardian performers could've come up with something much better.

Author: Bright0001
Review: This had potential: Actually a lot of it. A plenty good cast, the right tone of being "retro fun" and not taking itself too seriously, yet it pretty much failed. If I were a kid, I'd probably like it, because it has quite some moments children would enjoy; Yet the fact some monsters are quite literally slashed in half makes me wonder if they would be allowed to watch it.

Author: brown-488
Review_Title: Another T Waititi must see movie
Review: As movie's go, this is a light-hearted action packed comedy classic, similar to the last Thor move but with more banter with a touch of genius in terms of keeping the audience gripped throughout the fim. The film tries to explain the meaning of Love but does this without a plot twist other than a cameo from MD. This movie has been slated by many as it's not your typical super hero film, but if you love fun movies and great acting, this is for you. The storyboard is serious but created in a way we can all laugh, not typically done in day to day life. Scored highly by me due to the fact Bale is class and the interaction of props is even better.

Author: glstrom-14260
Review: But could at least please MCU fans who have given time and $ to make this franchise what it has potential to become. Seems this was made as showcase for their smart alec kids (whom I never felt afraid for) and to emasculate/undress Thor and replace him with women. I wasn't thrilled when the push to see the more human side of a God from another planet lead him to have the pot belly of uncle Joe, but to have him blubbering words of love and sharing a beer with Stormbreaker is really quite enough. It belittles their power and importance making them a punch line.

Author: ryanwesthamfan

Review: Great cast, Hemsworth knocks it out of the park once again with his performance. Taika Watiti remains one of my favourite directors at this moment time. I'm just not quite sure where else this Thor character can go now. Feels like a conclusion for his character.

GOTG inclusion was a very brief one, but apt, since it's not their movie. Mid credits scene does set up an interesting future, but will the MCU work on it, that remains to be seen. MVP as expected was Christian Bale, what a performance! Overall, it's a theatrical experience I would recommend, but leave your brains out of this one.

Author: bassam-305-647015
Review_Title: Like many said way to many jokes
Review: I really kept hoping they would stop with the jokes but they just wouldn't knock it off. It almost felt like they were copying guardians of the galaxy. A few jokes were alright but most of them were terrible jokes, the story would have been much better without them. We all lived the prequels much more then this one. Sadly the comedy ruined the movie for our 2 families that went, so bad some wanted to leave. This has got to be one of the worst ratings I have given any of the marvel trilogy. I am truly hoping that the future of Thor is better then this. It truly was a disappointment for us. It was no wonder that Spider-Man no way home had the larger theater screen despite being an older movie.

Author: eddieburd3

What made Thor Ragnarok so good was the dynamic between Hela and Thor. This falls completely flat in my opinion as the underlying connection between Thor being a god and Gorr being the God Butcher never really clicks, like you hope it would.

Author: arnab_911
Review_Title: Advice for Marvel: LESS IS MORE
Review: Taika waititi made thor: Ragnarok and it was beautiful. It was spectacular with ample amount of emotion, sadness, rage and goofyness in all the right places! He just mixed up all the factors in this installment; maybe thought goofing around was the best possible way out when there's not much story to tell. Bringing back jane and mjolnir was supposed to be the omph factor in this installment but not much light in there as well. Chris Hemsworth looks tired, maybe haven't slept in days. Introduced zues in all of this just to further the storyline of MCU, and yes this is the last and most disappointing installment in the thor series. All in all its a watch and forget OTT grade movie at the max.

Author: Arod_18
Review: I thought the movie was great!

Author: alejandromundy67
Review: It seems written by 5-year-olds for 5-year-old viewers. Thor is a castrated clown. But I loved the Bennetton kids, hahaaa!

Author: Horst_In_Translation
Review: "Thor: Love and Thunder" (weak title explanation at the end) is a co-production between Australia and the United States and I guess the Australian impact here comes from director Taika Waititi and also lead actor Chris Hemsworth. Okay, Waititi is fom New Zealand, but close. You will find other English native speakers in here that are not American. The title gives it away of course that here we have the at this point newest cinematic addition to the Marvel universe. Avengers is through, but the franchise still keeps going of course with how much money it makes by luring people into theaters. Maybe this film was in advance considered a contender for number one in terms of money for 2022, but I doubt it's gonna reach that. It should have been a little bit better for that, but I am not sure. Have not checked these pages for a while that show us how much money a movie made. Anyway, I mentioned Waititi already and he is the director here as he was in the past with Thor and he (an Oscar-winning writer) got help with the script from Jennifer Kaytin Robinson and Stan Lee (rip) is listed again as well. I am not sure how accurate this is, but people love him still, so it makes sense. Chris Hemsworth is not just the lead actor here, but also a producer and if you take a closer look at the cast, you will find a few names that make this a bit of a family affair even, in terms of child actors, but also the Thor stage play we see once again here. Matt Damon was in it for that again too channeling his inner Loki. Interesting cameo again. In general, the cast is really top-notch. Natalie Portman plays the female lead, Christian Bale plays the main antagonist and Russell Crowe shows up as Zeus. I love the actor, but I am not sure how much I liked that. The Guardians are also there briefly and actors from the early Thor films like Elba, Dennings and Skarsgård (all three always appreciated), the latter only so briefly.

Review: Spoilers Below:

Review: If you are cool with a full on Taika experience this is wonderful. Hilarious and at times poignant in earned ways. If you hate fun then this isn't a movie for you.

Author: sornhayden

Review: The only thing good about the movie and story line is Gorr the God Butcher. I want the real Thor, before Ragnarok, he was cool in Infinity war and Endgame. But why cant they stick with the Thor we know? This movie is a Joke.

Author: lynnrush-906-18020
Review_Title: So disappointing. I almost quit watching.
Review: So sad to see how this movie turned out. It's a slap to the face and makes great actors and characters seem cheap and laughable. It's just so campy I could barely get through it.

Author: nicholsoncraydon
Review: My rating for Thor: Love and Thunder is a solid 9/10 best Thor film yet. Just been to see Marvel Studios Thor Love and Thunder at the ODEON Cinemas in Mansfield IMAX screening. Absolutely loved it one of the best Marvel Studio movies ever, well I say that every time but it is. A very eventful roller-coaster ride I loved every minute to ever second of it. Tons of laughter with Thor's goats "AHHH", Chris Hemsworth is so funny as Thor best guy to play the character and Taika Waititi as Korg brilliant an absolutely hilarious character so funny every thing he saids. The whole writing and production to the actors and actresses, and the director Taika Waititi so funny he knows how to get a lot of comedy in a action packed adventurous film buff especially a marvel film love him. Ever song fitted perfectly with ever fight scene best music ever they defo know how to pick the perfect songs the music department brilliant. Thor: love and Thunder is a serviceable entertainment that coasts off a game cast who could've done more. I don't agree what other critics and reviewers are saying that it's got a lot of resemblance to Thor: Ragnarok. The most humorous characters in the film were Thor Goats and where many jokes land and many do not amongst the triumphs it's a proper comedy detour to the home of the gods Omnipotent City. It's has the one of the best marvel villains and the most scariest Marvel Studios villains ever 'Gorr the God Butcher' (Christian Bale). All the CGI was spot on from the villains goons zombie like shadow creatures to the home of the gods to the really good part the shadow realm when it goes like (Monochrome) brilliant. Absolutely loved the ending tho not saying anymore but say to the end as always 2 credit scenes one post credits and after credit scene. My verdict Thor: Love and Thunder is more Waititi than Ragnarok. It's had a very good strong opening to the middle then to the end brilliant, and it's smooth and colourful to the very end and I loved how they kept true the the comics with one particular storyline for one of the characters of you don't know then go and watch the film now if from uk and in cinemas around the world July 8th.

Author: Benjamin-M-Weilert
Review_Title: A fun movie that lacked focus.
Review: As someone who has not read the comics these superhero movies are based on, it's interesting how I picked up plot points from some of the recent comic arcs prior to their cinematic debut. Case in point, I knew for a while that Jane Foster (Natalie Portman) became Thor for a while for medical reasons. In Thor: Love and Thunder (2022), this somewhat recent plot line from the comics combines with the modus operandi of Phase 4 of the MCU: wrapping up the loose ends from Phase 3 of the MCU.

Author: Sulan2
Review_Title: Boring childish theme ruins the entire movie
Review: The movie feels like an insult to the characters in the movie and I dont know how if the actors even know what they signed up on doing

Author: ptyrrell-41455
Review: Christian Bale was pretty good. The three scenes that dealt with the reality of Jane's cancer were well done.

Author: john_c-96391
Review: The reason I give this a 5 is because of Christian Bale, who did a really good job, but this is, arguably, the worst Thor of the series. The characters were wooden, it seems as though Thor has gone backwards in his views and demeanor (was he regressing because of the loss he felt🤔), almost to the point where he was, when he was first introduced.

Author: manningextra
Review_Title: Was this a film? Or an anthology?
Review: Natalie Portman felt flat as did most of the actors half the time, jokes landed sometimes (best was the goats, probably because it required little script writing tbh), and the whole plot felt disjointed. My favorite part was in the shadow realm, with the Wizard if Oz-esque color change - felt like a solid third act. Did enjoy the surprise fourth act with the kids getting Thor powers, I'm sure kids will be amped on that.

Author: servantofheaven
Review: I have been a huge Marvel fan for so many years and I wonder why this great movie has so many negative reviews. Though, I feel Thor: Ragnarok is better than this one, but still, it is a very good movie to watch. Chris Hemsworth was just amazing as usual. Natalie Portman and Tessa Thompson played nice supporting roles. I also liked Taika Waititi's voice (Voice of Korg). Christian Bale just nailed it with his action. Let me also mention that the movie's soundtrack was really cool. This movie is surely going to be a great success in the Box Office.

Author: ThurstonHunger
Review: Watched this with one of my sons who wanted to check it out in spite of the spate of negative reviews he had heard about in whatever multisocial mediaverses he treks through. Perhaps even here it seems.

Author: tmoser1434
Review: Thor: Love and Thunder is not the same breathe of fresh air that Ragnarok was. However, Chris Hemsworth continues to shine as Thor, delivering excellent comedic bits along with the big action scenes.

Author: aaitcomputers
Review:
Ill watch any Sci Fi
Ill watch the last season of Star Trek Beyond and enjoy it because its SCI FI

Author: kaanyildiziosdev
Review: Love and Thunder tries to be many different things, a fun movie, a drama, a story of love and loss... But fails miserably at every single of them. At the end, you only leave annoyed and with a headache. Probably the goats to blame here, which screamed about half of the whole movie.

Author: cvotonee
Review: How could anyone understand this word salad of a script, maybe Kamal Harris, maybe.

Author: teresbaregard-90502
Review:
The film was a disappointment. So bad. And why is Zeus a bad guy? Worst Thor movie ever ...
The film had no story. Of course the film offered laughter but that did not make the film better.

Author: sltryerson
Review: Yesterday I saw this movie at a theater. The first movie theater I went to in two years. The movie is an absolute disaster. It can't make up it's mind whether it is a kid's film, a comedy or a true super hero action film. In it's attempt to appeal to everyone it fails big time. It has destroyed the Thor franchise.

Author: AnnaPagrati
Review: Okay, an overall pleasant movie! Did not reach my high expectations in the least, but I love Thor & I love Marvel, so it's a 7/10! Christian Bale deserves an Oscar for this!

Author: cadadmail
Review_Title: So family friendly, Kids laughing when I saw this tonight...
Review: OK very family friendly story for under 10-12's really most of the heavy adult stuff at the speed of the story won't be remembered until after 20th time watching with their friends and family. I mean 40 kids get power and fight monsters - and the comedy had kids laughing when I saw film tonight.

Author: Rod_ccsqlp
Review_Title: The beginning of the end for Thor movies
Review: I wouldn't go as far as to say it isn't entertaining, but the story lacks emotion, the villain needed to be developed further(even though it was the best part of the movie) too much hype. It seemed like they tried too much too hard to make it funny and failed miserably, they tried to cram many things and failed to develop any of them, someone needed yo overview and focus on making one element work(almost made it with gorr.

Author: JohnyV30
Review: Everything felt weird!

Author: latsi-natalia
Review_Title: So bad that you have to see it to believe it!
Review: I am still in shock over how bad this movie was: a lot of time wasted on pointless scenes with stupid dialogue and at the same time major holes in the script and questions left unanswered. Christian Bales' wonderful acting as the "god butcher" was the only thing that kept me from walking out mid movie. At times the dialogue was so awkwardly bad that it made me cringe. I still don't get why they were trying so hard to make it funny...so much so that it ended up with the feel of a parody. Such a shame!

Author: gabeschneeberger
Review_Title: Small editing errors but still a goat of a ride
Review: In the opening credits I came in with limited expectations knowing phase 4 was dragging on a bit. But this narrative brings life to phase 4 and defines the path for the ongoing overarching story. I saw this in Dolby and the first 7 minutes is a prologue for the events ahead detailing on gors back story. If you look closely his eye tag moves from his right eye to left eye to right again. And this threw me out of the loop and probably why I wasn't heavily invested in this film like all of the other marvel films. The second act highlights thors antics while embracing in some cool combat scenes. When we meet Jane foster expect her to do every move while she's learning to fight for real against gor. Talking about Jane, the actor puts on a stellar performance next to Thor and even with her B plot she still sells the performance. Gor is a great villain and ones who's motives are clear from the very beginning but I still can not get over the skin tag (please change this for Disney plus. But all in all it is a mediocre story with subpar action making it a marvel film. Don't go in with too many expectations and you will be fine :) enjoy!

Author: BurlySquaw
Review: Let's start by saying that visually the film looks impressive, and the cast do their best. But this film is far, far too jokey, and not in a good way. There's nothing wrong with injecting humour into comic book films and indeed the first Thor film did so quite well, but L&T doesn't know when to stop. Even scenes that demand a sombre tone are undercut with more pointless jokes.

Author: FinJBrown
Review: Thor Ragnarocks success came from the needed makeover that Thor needed, a fun flashy film with interesting and funny characters and a sprinkle of good villains.

Author: bheadher
Review_Title: Where oh where has Marvel gone...long time passing...
Review: First off, I DID watch this all the way through...or suffered is more accurate. A lot of noise, meaningless noise...but very little real story. Has Marvel abandoned their fan base for newer territory perhaps? I dunno, but the quality lately is seriously lacking I must say...

Author: jasonlingo-30483
Review: I gave this movie a 9 when I first saw it. I ate a gummy before and was completely absorbed by what was happening on screen. But even then, something felt off about this movie. That feeling as it turns out was boredom. I actually found the contrast between the humor and the joker-esque performance of Christian Bale (he would make a pretty good joker I think) to be ingenious at first. The two worlds are diametrically opposed yet exist in the same space, which makes you afraid for Thor because you know Gorr isn't messing around and also sad for Gorr because you know life is so much better when you look like Thor.

Author: toranxzz
Review: Thor love and thunder is one of the funniest and simple MCU movie.

Author: basementbrotherscollectibles
Review_Title: Taika Waititi Broke His Career With This
Review: As I've said for years...Taika Waititi is not a genius, folks. He just subverts whatever he's given-for better or for worse. He's an immature child trapped in an adult body who likes to break great things that others made and/or love, then point, mock, and laugh. Some would call that a bully. Taika thinks his audience is a giant joke, and when given full control of a franchise that millions of folks love, he actually didn't know what to do, got frightened at the responsibility, so he turned it into a giant parody to hide his own insecurity.

Author: vikramgondane
Review_Title: Just 1 or 2 laugh worthy movie nothing else
Review: Movie is not upto the expectation. Was expected lot much from Gorr the god butcher but we get nothing. Taika thought its child's play literally. If same movie was to be shown with great details result could have been different.

Author: rabidur
Review: I didn't have high hopes for the movie to begin with but I was still disappointed. Christen bell was highly underused. For a villain named God butcher, They didn't even show any butchering. But the most annoying thing about marvel movie nowadays is the lame slapstick comedy in every few minute. All the superhero acts like they are stand up comedian. They made Thor even more stupid in this film. It feels like marvel is questioning audiences judgement by making these low quality garbage in recent times. They have all these great actors yet they dont even use half of their acting capabilities. This was probably the worst film so far in phase 4 and I cant wait to see what we get next.

Author: szlory
Review: It was not funny, and it was not exciting...Jokes were overdone, the villain was not convincing.

Author: carlajm84
Review: Reading these reviews... :-/ seriously people really need to lighten up!

Author: pzsbeni
Review: Taika Waititi is a really good director and actor imo. Jojo Rabbit is very great. This one was a joke overall. Couldnt take it seriously. The best character of the movie was Gorr and he had little screen time. They made one of my favourite actor into their goofy movie a villain. Bad idea. The plot was actually interesting but terribly boring. Ending scene with the children getting Thors powers were hard to take seriously. Thor4 is the worst of the franchise and nowhere after Ragnarok. Still actually enjoyed sometimes and the beginning scene were cool. Gorr was pretty great. And the Sweet Child O Mine is a really great choice.

Author: wariahharneet
Review: Natalie Portman's role was unacceptable, she's a petite little person. Her macho image was a disappointment.

Author: smavronas
Review: The movie had amazing cgi and all actors played their roles with success. The biggest problem of the movie is its pace and the fact that it needs time to tell people some jokes. In this way it reduces time from the basic plot and the movie feels a little rushed. Nevertheless i enjoyed the movie but i think that thor deserves something better.

Author: twh-00286
Review: Just doesn't seem to "land".

Review:
I enjoyed this just as much as Ragnarok. Similar witty
Humor, great cast. They brought Jane and Thor back together in a great way. Especially loved the scene
With the kids.

Author: aaravsuhassss
Review_Title: Thor 4 is more of a comedy
Review: Being a comedy is great and it was definitely a fun movie so I don't regret it in that sense but it lacks any strong storyline and it felt all over the place with little impact really.
