Review: Yea overall I thought it was a decent movie though it brought nothing new as it felt like reskinned ragnarok starting with the plot parallels and similar setup but tried too hard. The last Thor movie was my favorite marvel movie which may be why I think this isn't just terrible hoping rewatches helps the film make sense.

Author: rrkawase
Review: The movie is dumb AF. Disney"s strategy of turning sequels of successful movies into kids show is not sustainable.

Author: shreemoyeeroy
Review_Title: THE BEST THOR MOVIE EVER GOD
Review: This story line was extremely powerful, it was tight and secured story line, the interpretation of every aspect of the story is just amazing I can't even describe, there are lot of surprise bombs in the flim (it's not like unexpected characters, but unexpected story turn). Coming to the cgi which was really good and I really appreciate it so much, and the most favorite part is the AMAZING MUSIC OMG LITERALLY I LOVED IT SO MUCH. Overall this movies is filled with entertainment and is literally so pleasing, the most important thing is it is worth watching!!! It's so freaking hyping loved it.

Author: Ceredon1
Review: I really thought I'd like this one. The other Thor movies were all so effortlessly funny. But this one just isn't. Maybe it's because they were clearly trying so hard to make it funny and campy and to laugh at itself, but it just didn't measure up for me. One or two people in the theatre laughed out loud a couple times, so clearly the comedy style works for some.

Author: whedabrakyovaer
Review_Title: Two Stories At War With Each Other
Review: Thor: Love and Thunder is a bewildering film in which the final product is worth less than the sum of its parts. The two primary storylines don't mesh well, lots of big-moments happen off screen, and the jokes come at a cost to the characters rather than enhancing them. Truly, this is a puzzling follow-up to Thor: Ragnarok (one of my favorite movies in general) and Avengers: Endgame. I daresay it is a bad film.

Author: umairasalim
Review: They really did butchered Thor here. Its feels more like a Thor parody than a Thor movie. Too much cringey jocks and less acting. Had great potential but they destroyed it. Thor has became like he was in first thor movie... Dumb and arrogant.

Author: mukeshkumarkumar-46829
Review_Title: Gone the golden days of marvel. Totally childish
Review: TBH i used to be a biggest fan of marvel, I used to say bro i see only marvel because they are best. Seems like endgame was a real endgame for marvel (except Spiderman but that's of Sony).

Author: nshettys
Review: Might be one of the coolest MCU projects yet. Christian Bale shines as the antagonist. The visuals are phenomenal, and the background score is amazing.

Author: theprestonator-37584
Review: I refuse to watch this because Disney has gone Woke. It's a movie we need political agendas pushed in movies. I'm sure the movie is good and I love Chris Hemsworth but due to wokeness I won't be watching this.

Author: grahamvandyke
Review: Taika Waititi's idea of an MCU movie is machine gunning joke after joke to the point of cringe inducing nausea that makes for a confusingly painful movie experience. Ironically enough, as soon as the third act of the film rolls around and with the jokes easing up and dramatic tension is being sown, the movie shockingly (or maybe un-shockingly) becomes infinitely more relatable and interesting, ending on a very strong note. Unfortunately, I view movies as a whole, and having two thirds of the endeavour a trek of excruciating proportions probably chocks this up as a big loss.

Author: hawkeye-sid-ifti
Review_Title: Taika dropped the ball on this one
Review: The concept of this film must have looked great on paper. But in its execution Taika mis a few dozen steps or he just didnt care and I say this after watching the film and the making of this film (behind the scenes)

Author: pgrindol
Review: Poor script, clunky direction, actors portraying their characters with all of the depth of the cue cards they were reading. Just as the cheesy Asgardian history plays were cheaply produced by the denizens of New Asgard, this movie is a cheap knock-off of the previous Thor films.

Author: taurusflanker
Review: Disappointing to see such talented actors eith such a potentially awesome story only to be let down by poor writing and directing. Weak jokes and a feeble storyline.

Author: hbcwanders
Review: Seeing the negative reactions, I'm wondering if I saw a different movie.

Author: bestford
Review: People need to go buy a sense of humour. It's Thor! Since when has Thor ever been that serious. Yes its daft and a bit silly but that's nothing new and if you have watched previous Thor films this is very apparent. Me and my husband had a good giggle at this in parts whilst other parts were serious and meaningful. The end to me was slightly unexpected but on reflection it makes sense why they would do this. I take it the people who hated this film must also hate guardians of the galaxy as that's a bit silly too.....

Author: zwjonas
Review: I don't really see what there is to dislike about this movie. I have seen all the MCU films and this would be in my top 5. It was hilarious, interesting and exciting. I loved that Korg got his screen time. It did have 3 flaws: The main villian was missed potential and should have trusted the comic aesthetic with character and weapon, another very significant character who led the gods had bad dialogue and accent, and third was the agenda was annoying and obvious in the film. I hate being cryptic but avoiding all spoils.

Author: martim-roquette-durao
Review: Thor is a character with some humor, but what they did to Thor - Love an Thunder is childish enough to make the movie practically unwatchable. The foreshadowing was not good and it is confirmed, it is badly written, poorly directed and it is completely inconsequential and ridiculous. Pointless. What's the point of a luxury cast when the content is so poor that even the effects don't help to disguise it. And so begins the destruction of the Marvel Universe after the magnificent Avengers - Endgame. And this is sad. Disney was a symbol of quality that is now fading to a low quality standard, much forced by their political obsession and woke ideology, this destroys good storytelling, every time anyone forces a point of view, whatever it may be, destroys the creativeness and freedom art must have, this applies to all art forms. It's even sadder.

Author: ahdiscordia
Review: With Taika Waititi at the helm, I had high hopes, since I have seen greatness from his other work. Sadly, this pushed the self mockery too far, and became an embarrassment, instead of comedy, along with good storytelling.

Author: karinahatem
Review_Title: Was this supposed to be a joke ?
Review: I was very confused, as I thought a, watching a marvel movie full of drama and action, instead I was watching a comedy, I mean it was fun and entertaining, but the whole movie was a joke. Taiki did a fine job with the pervious Thor movie, but for this was, he must have been drunk, and Disney needed to release the movie to meet a deadline and make some extra $$$. All characters were funny except for Christian Bale' character of course. I think all those big actors they either were desperate for a role, or must have owed Taiki a favor, else they wouldn't have been in this film. The movie was funny and entertaining all the way, that you would expect a funny happy ending, instead, you get a rather sad and dark ending.

Author: danilkrasnykh
Review: Too much jokes, weak story that give up on everything was before Thor 4. Now Thor is a clown with a cape, what a mess :(

Author: rockdude-68045
Review: While I appreciated and looked forward to the 80s themed love and thunder it was good at its best and not so much rewatch-able at its worst. Majority of the elements I would consider alright 6/10 overall, but there was stuff lacking that pulled it down.

Author: jakel25
Review: The movie seemed slow at times. The jokes made it enjoyable and Christian Bale killed it as Gorr but the ending was unsatisfying. It didn't seem like a necessary movie and although it wasn't bad, it just didn't really connect. It felt like it needed more, but less.

Author: vinimych
Review_Title: Is this still the same Taika Waititi?
Review: Is this still the same guy who made brilliant Jojo Rabbit, What We Do in the Shadows, Thor Ragnarok?

Author: akashicorca
Review_Title: Even Better than the last Thor
Review: Thor: Love and Thunder finally breaks away from a too predictable Marval formula.

Author: tafziln
Review_Title: Probably the worst marvel movie I have ever seen
Review: Why would 1 make this movie. I don't ever remember the last time a movie gave me a headache. Watti should stop directing movies .................................

Author: sunnycielo
Review_Title: The 10 stars are for Mr. Bale
Review: Watch this movie only for Christian Bale. I am not a super fan of super hero movies and i didn't want to watch this one. My kids who are super fans put it on after dinner and so i was there in front of the t.v. So why not watch it right?. From the get go Mr. Bale does amazing and as the movie progressed it is obvious that he is the one carrying this chaotic mess. Some CGI was bad, most dialogue corny and predictable and some scenes were totally unnecessary. What the heck happened to Chriss Pratt being hilarious? Why bother having them as cameos? The goats...what the heck was that about it just annoyed the hell out of everyone who was watching it not them per se, but the noise....i shudder to think of it. The ending was cute but it took so many u turns to get there if it hadn't been for C. B. i would of left and gone to my room. It should of been a stand alone movie woth him and Thor as a cameo or something because one is left longing for more of Mr. Bales' storyline. These Thor movies used to be good and now it seems like they are going for cheap shots such as stooping so low and using a age old tactic of undressing Thor and exposing him...would they of done that with Jane or Valkyrie? No they didn't as it showed that they wouldn't do it so why did they do it to the man? It was unnecessary and cheap. Watch this only to keep the praise of Mr. Bale going.

Author: farzanmueez
Review: Nobody every wasted Christian bale like this movie did,, bale and his character both wasted. In attempt to copy previous film they screwed storyline characters everything.

Author: igumenova
Review: I'm getting more and more disappointed in the Marvel cinematic universe. Once I was completely delighted and even admired some films. Then the pictures became average, but they could be interesting. Now I see Frankenstein's monsters on the screens more often, screaming, trying to squeeze something out of themselves.

Author: pirekmatyas
Review: Plot is really boring and annoying, sometimes cringes moment for little kids (2-5 yo). Just Bale saved the movie from thrash of year 2022.

Author: smaniatopoulos
Review: With Ragnarok they flew too high. But just like the myth of Ikarus, they lost their humility, they flew too high, the sun melted their wings and they crashed and burned.

Author: iancosta333
Review: God awful movie, don't waste your time unless you're under 10 years old. It's a kids movie!!

Author: johnjryanjr
Review: Tugged on the feels, laughs, looked good and had good acting from Bale, Hems and the usual cast. If you don't expect a top 5 Marvel movie you should have fun watching it.

Author: vithiet
Review_Title: It really is not that bad.
Review: Wow critics are pretty harsh on this one. Yes, it is definitely a much weaker movie than Ragnarok and I understand how disappointed you can be if your expectations were pretty high; I happen to be in the same boat. But not taking its predecessor into account, this is still a fairly fun and entertaining MCU flick. Is the overall tone a little too lighthearted especially considering the supposedly seriousness of the villain? Probably. But I think it is still in line with what we can expect from a Taika Waititi Thor movie. All in all, I would still recommend it; just know what you're getting into and you will have a good time.

Author: clabuo
Review: We know Taika that you are a comedy guy but honestly this was supposed to be a super hero movie. Ragnarok had some comedy sketches, and we liked it, but they were balanced with action and drama, this movie is just comedy, and honestly it's not so funny: the story is weak, Olympus (or whatever you call it) is ridiculous and absolutely out of context in the MCU storyline, the "van damne" scene (tuo know what I mean) is really stupid... Hemsworth has been pumped like a beach ball, Thor character that has been painted so heroic, epic and at the same time weak in infinity war and endgame , now seams to be a clown. At the end I think that this is the worst MCU movie ever. I rate it 5 just because of the marvelous performance of Christian Bale.

Author: mikeyoung-06332
Review: I was very excited to watch another Mighty Thor movie! Love and Thunder intrigued me. All other Thor movies had greatness as Thor battled his foes along side other action heroes with plots changing throughout; but I thought this movie was supposed to be about super heroes against a super foe and their cohorts.

Author: jordan-hughes-098
Review: It's like Thor Ragnarok had a lovechild with Disaster movie, which then ate 30 metric tons of sugar in one go. Film was quite fun to watch but all over the place in terms of plot and tone. Also an oversaturation of Korg (who I thought was one of the best characters in Ragnarok) barging into the scene with a silly quip made him irritating after 1hr 30minutes of viewing.

Author: inconspicuous_penguin
Review: This film is incredible. It's a perfect balence of light, dark, comedy and seriousness. Gorr the God Butcherer is such a great villain. The music choice was also excellent. There are so many great things I can't go into without some spoilers but this film is incredible. I'm going back to watch it three more times.

Author: lordoflightrhollor
Review: I thoroughly enjoyed this addition to the Thor franchise. It was campy but not cheesy. It was fast paced (not in a bad way). It was hilarious. The soundtrack was stellar. I loved the visual effects. Christian Bale gave a tour de force performance as Gorr. Russel Crowe completely owned his scenes. Natalie and Chris had wonderful chemistry. Tessa was still badass. Loki was definitely missed. Of the Phase 4 films, this one is at the top for sure. Does it top Ragnarok? I think not. But it's pretty darned close.

Author: koa_neuva
Review_Title: I pray this isn't canon to Earth 616
Review: For reference, Ragnarok was the right amount of seriousness mixed with comedy, like staring doomsday in the face and trying to think of some witty banter to lessen the stress. Love & Thunder however, was joke after joke, and each joke was beaten into the ground until you couldn't even tell it was once a dead horse anymore. Even the actors didn't seem to take any of their roles seriously (either because it was part of the script and they weren't thrilled, or they just wanted to goof around), aside from the two serious moments in the movie that lasted all but two seconds before they rolled in another gag. I don't know what the director of this movie was doing, but directing this movie was not one of them. It would've been a decent stand alone movie with different characters/franchise, some weird multiverse bit, an exaggeration by Krog considering he narrates bits of the movie, but this movie is a step in the wrong direction if this is canon to Earth 616 of the MCU. I haven't been this disappointed in a movie since the live action Avatar the Last Airbender.

Author: dhanushkpnada
Review_Title: Waiting for next part of Thor ....
Review:
Chris hemsworth and gorr and mighty Thor performance is out standing ...
Background music was amazing ..
Thor killing the zeus scene was extraordinary..
It is totally full pack of sentiment, comedy ,action,adventure film..

Author: ramonsponcetx-25483
Review: I only gave it 5 stars for Natalie Portman and Christian Bale being in the film. The rest of the film was a long joke. Maybe if Kenneth Branagh had directed it, it would have been a better, more serious film. Too bad.

Author: herriwood
Review: God! All the whinging and harping on the negatives. Just watch it and enjoy the story. It's got everything and for a change is light hearted. Cameos everywhere and the references are great! More goats please!

Author: syedwaheedpasha
Review_Title: Easily the worst movie of Marvel.
Review: Watching Thor : Love and Thunder movie is just waste of time. The Christian bale is the only one character who hold us to watch the movie. Inspite of the Christian bale's performance the movie is the No .1 from the below.

Author: khan90
Review: Disappointed! I am so glad i did not go to watch this in cinema, it is on Disney+

Author: LeeG808
Review: I was a huge MCU fan, but this was painful to watch.

Author: sakakermorah
Review_Title: EndGame was the end of marvel great movies!
Review: Every time marvel release a new movie after End Game its become more and more disappointed.. the movie wasn't great, it is weak, empty, no strong story! I think they tried so hard to make it funny.. and that's it!

Author: dd-96232
Review_Title: The end of Thor love and Thunder
Review: In the dramatic scene of the film, Thor fights the gods in the city of the Almighty and takes the power of Zeus' thunderbolt from him. However, the first post-credits scene reveals that Zeus has survived the ordeal and is now seeking revenge on Thor. Zeus sends his son Hercules (played by Burt Goldstein) to kill Thor and restore the people's faith in gods (rather than superheroes). This storyline is not directly taken from the comics, but Hercules is tricked into fighting with the Avengers in a part of the comics and eventually joins the team as a hero, and Zeus banishes him from Olympus to another place.

Author: lucaslw-93145
Review_Title: Not a bad movie, but definitely not Waititi's best
Review: Good things first, costume design in this movie is through the roof amazing. Some of the best costumes and props in the MCU so far. Soundtrack is up to expectations following Thor: Ragnarok (Thor 3). There's a sequence shot in black and white with color editing reminiscent of Schindler's List. That was very nice visually and sandwiched by solid action sequences on both sides of the film.

Author: mike_mat
Review: The movie is honestly not that great. Not enough Gorr most of what he does is off-camera. The whole movie is extremely corny, it only has about 4 jokes that made me chuckle. The costumes where great and I liked the colors in them. The action is good and not to say spoilers but the ending fight is very very dumb. I honestly felt like the movie did nothing and it was a waste of gorr, Jane foster ,and time.

Author: aghunter83-884-588733

Author: JonNorris1256
Review_Title: Fun movie ignore the bad reviews

Author: dkmookie
Review: Enjoyable for all the right reasons.

Author: Tetrahejon
Review_Title: Still afraid to kill main characters
Review: This fun, thrilling, and action packed adventure follows Thor, Valkyrie, Korg, and Jane Foster tracking down the God Butcher. Excellent performances by Natalie Portman and Christian Bale whom both stole the show! The story pushes Thor and Jane back together but fails at the romance between them. Also, the movie seems to be afraid to kill off characters. I counted 5 times where I thought a character died but simply recovered by the next scene. On a good note, the mythos and action were ramped up as you would expect in a Thor movie! Post credit scenes paved way for future stories to be told. Overall, fantastic superhero movie with a couple of bumps in the road.

Author: KrazydeBug
Review: You saw some bad reviews here. I will tell you it's mostly because of their expectations were not met. As soon as I saw Taika Waititi as director, along with the trailers we've seen, I just knew it's gonna be a comedy-comics-nonsense mashup. In that perspective, it's a fine movie. For simple laughters.

Author: Dimakovtun
Review: I think that Thor story is one of the better ones in Marvel Cinematic Universe. It has potential to expand (and it did) independently of the other movies. Thus, I decided to give a try for the 4th installment.

Author: oscy79
Review: I don't understand the hate at all. These must be the same people who love "The Batman". I thought the whole thing was fun. Bale was spectacular as Gorr, he walked the line as weird and creepy and evil and scary. All cameos were enjoyable, I even enjoyed Melissa McCarthy as Hela. The idea that Zeus is this Greek weirdo was fun for me too. You all must have been watching something else. I can't believe the complaint about the CGI, this movie had the best CGI of all the Marvel movies. The Eternals to me wasn't very good, I understand the complaints about Multiverse of Madness (although that was pretty good too me too), but this just feels like people are just looking for something to complain about.

Author: rickyspanish14

I love Waititi and almost all of his projects... But maybe there is such a thing as too long a leash even for the extremely talented directors? The core plot actually has the potential to make a great movie... The cast could have shone (Christian Bale as a god killer? Shivers) but everything failed to come together and I have blame the writing for that one.

Author: spikeypoet
Review: This movie should have been entitled Jane Thor: a feminist movie about ultra-strong masculine women, and weak, bumbling, buffoonish men, whose only purpose in this satirical comedy... ahem movie... is to serve as props to showcase how "strong" and "awesome" the females are.

Author: darucla-1
Review_Title: Please keep Taika Waititi away from the MCU
Review: Rule 1: "Don't take the p%^&".

Author: aidanratesmovies
Review_Title: Sadly the worst of the Thor series
Review: Having been a fan of all the Thor films prior- it really hurt to see how muddled, messy, and just completely useless this film ended up to be. What was the point of fridging Jane Foster? You took the effort and brought her back, just for her to be killed? Seriously? This film also just had so much going on it was hard to keep track, between Thor, Valkyrie, Korg, Zeus, Gorr, we are expected to be excited about so many little things showing up on screen and yet almost every single one of them feel incredibly underwhelming. The visuals prove to be nice at times, but that can also come and go- with the scenery being a visual marvel and some other CGI looking like it came out of 2007 or earlier. As someone who gave Marvel a pass for their lacking CGI in so many projects lately, it's frustrating to see them keep making the same mistakes over and over and now attributing far lazier stories as well. The script for this film is just a mess, none of the jokes really land, and it really only serves as filler for yet another continuation of Marvels next great lineup. There is no heart, despite how much it tries, and even the actors at hand seem to be putting far less into their iconic characters. The only one I can really shine light on is Bale, who always brings his most to every role he portrays. His character can be undermined by the lacking script , but the first few minutes of the movie with Bale is far better than anything else the film sadly has to offer. In the end, Thor Love and Thunder misses the mark. It's just a tired and sorry excuse for a film, especially when there is so much content produced just like it. It's not all hopeless, but for the most part-it's a forgettable blunder that only offers some visual and light remarks- and is far better left for dead.

Author: rpaleschi
Review: Successful Marvel movies have a fantastic blend of action, humour and effects. Unfortunately this goes so far overboard on the humour that it feels forced and is a complete parody.

Review: I must say that I love the MCU and especially the Thor movies. But this one was just short of awful. I struggled to define what it reminds me of - a hybrid of Austin Powers? Guardians 2? Review: Needed more Gorr, less Korg. Needed more Valkyrie, less jokes. Christian Bales character could/should have been explored more. Feels like a great actor was underused. Russel Crowe as Zeus was disappointing. Natalie Portman is great but she doesn't have the charisma of Tom Hiddleston.

Author: mcjdoherty-75522
Review: This is the best Thor film to date, we had a villain with a meaningful back story, perfectly acted by Bale, he was scary and intense at times, and managed to switch quickly to Erratic and energetic. The visuals of this film are some of the best, you have these beautiful bursts of colour throughout, contrasted by this somehow bright black and white tone In the alternate realm. Thor continues to experience a roller coaster of emotion, and has surprising, yet satisfying arc. Natalie Portman was a surprise, she delivered a decent performance, showing two sides of the same coin. The overall storyline was satisfying, there are moments I wish had happened, but it's not a deal breaker. The highlight for me was Russell Crow as Zeus, it feels closer to what Zeus was probably like compared to other depictions. Highly recommend seeing this film, it's not about fan service, it delivers an enjoyable and comedic experience, whilst adding a sense of horror, not as extreme as Multiverse of Madness.

Author: Sykes64
Review_Title: Wasted talent. Abysmal writing. Just awful!
Review: What on Earth is going on with this movie?! It is awful! I'm halfway through & I'm already struggling to stick with it. Too many jokes that are badly timed, irrelevant & pointless. So far it just seems to be one silly mess. Bale is wasted in this bile. The writers must've been on a strike. I can't believe they all looked at this script & thought this was a good idea. For once, possibly the first time, I find myself agreeing with the critics. And thank God I didn't pay to see this at a cinema. Hemsworth is flat & unimpressive despite the muscled build, decorated with bar room tramp tattoos. Crowe as Zeus is a fat man. A gimmicky circus sketch who speaks with a nasally Russian accent. Zeus, is a Greek God! Not a Russian tyrant! Portman's character is just boring. I think if I'd been in the cinema, I'd have walked out & tried to ask for my money back. It is up there among the worst films I've seen. The only thing I liked was seeing Mjolnir with a different power & even that hammer acted better than most of the people in the film.

Author: mitchell5954
Review_Title: Another Entry on the List of Mediocre Phase 4 Movies
Review: Thor Love and Thunder is the latest Thor movie, as well as the latest Phase 4 MCU film. As far as the Thor movies are concerned there hasn't been one I flat out dislike. I enjoy the first movie. Dark World is okay. Everyone hates that one, but it had some hype moments for me, and I was never truly bored in it. Ragnarök is one of my favorite MCU movies. So, I was somewhat excited for this as it has the same director attached. Although, my excitement dwindled after seeing Dr. Strange 2 and seeing the reviews for this film. I personally have found Phase 4 quite disappointing. The only entries I think have actually been good are Spiderman No Way Home and Falcon and the Winter Soldier. Everything else has ranged from okay to incredibly subpar. Dr. Strange 2 especially has been one of the most disappointing MCU films for me. This movie, unfortunately kind of follows suit on that trend.

Author: wwwswagatochatterjee

Author: Darwinskid
Review_Title: Brings the thunder, but not so much the love.
Review: I liked Taika Waititi's last installment of the Thor series, Ragnarok felt like a fresh and exciting direction for the character in the Marvel Cinematic Universe with a good balance of humor, heart, and presenting the best replication of Jack Kirby's visual style in live action. However, even as I walked out of the theater after seeing that film, I didn't think it should be established as the standard for any and all Thor stories going forward, but it looks like many in Hollywood and its own writer/director Taika Waititi thought very differently, and as a result lightning doesn't strike twice.

Author: gaurav219
Review_Title: Week narration, weak humour ruined a potentially good sequal!
Review: Weak narration from the very beginning of the film (villain choosing evil over Gods for planet's suffering induced by God's). Humour throughout the film felt forced upon when none needed & story could keep afloat easily. Humour in Thor Ragnarok was quite natural & meled with the plot. This time not really. Thus only ruining the story telling. Also, Jane Foster role felt not properly developed & weak. Had hoped for a slight longer screen time with GOTG characters to spice up the movie which w'd have been better. Thor character (Chris Hemsworth) slightly weakened to make way for lady Thor but hope he's resurrected to his full potential for next sequal if it's to be made. Hope Director Taika Waititi doesn't repeat same mistakes.

Author: adamrmcgee
Review: It was a strong 7. It was a fun movie and a breath of fresh air to finally move away from the dark and brooding MCU for a bit. No multiverse, and the stakes weren't as universally high as they usually are (although still a really good villain), but it felt great to have an MCU movie like that again. Admittedly, it felt a bit rushed, and there were a few moments here and there that teetered on the brink of parody instead of comedy, but still a solid standalone movie. Lots of laugh-out-loud moments, though, and definitely one worth rewatching multiple times.

Author: abisio
Review_Title: An action comedy with tragic ending
Review: Every complain about the movie does not make sense. There are lots of comedy moments some of them really good. There some (not all) very good action scenes and by end the story ends tragically with the death of one of the main characters.

Author: stephenw-83296
Review_Title: Balanced the silly with the serious
Review: Was a throw back to silly Thor but again all part of the Thor arc. 2 hours flew by, Crowe and Bale are tops. Portman surprising good. Its the next step from Ragnorak and endgame. Much better than the scores being given.

Another thing is the hammer does not create or use lightning so if the hammer actually would go to Jane foster she could not use lighting because she is not a god but in this movie she uses lightning and does everything thor does but can almost match him by just being with the hammer for like only a day.

Author: rtf-facebook
Review_Title: Terrible waste of a marvel movie
Review: I'm a huge marvel fan, but this was a terrible letdown! I was actually bored in this movie! I was ready to turn it off within the first 30 minutes. This is not the magic of marvel past! So disappointing! Sad! The story line was weak! The humor was slapstick and not at all good! The idea of Jane becoming a Thor because the hammer called to her. It could have been so much better. This is nothing like the marvel movies of the past. The second half of the movie was much better. Christian Bale played a good role. Creepy. But he did a good job. If more of the movie had been like the latter half it might have been worth watching. I like humor but at least make it funny.

Author: azcdk
Review: Most younger audiences and those who are not aware of other cultures will probably not notice all of the offensive symbolism in this film. Suffice to say, it was perhaps the worst Marvel production so far. I felt nothing but sadness as I watched this travesty of art. Beyond that, the special effects were as always quite good, that is about all these movies have now a days. Sign of the times, I guess. If you're looking for a film that gives a good accounting of some of Marvels oldest characters, you probably won't find it here. Simply my opinion, I've had some time on this Earth and it is disturbing, these trends I'm seeing...

Author: OMTR

Author: vickyr0304
Review: I saw the commercials and thought "eh" but I liked it. I would've liked to see more of his menacing character. The message was nice and it's a very happy movies- with serious elements. I would've liked it to be longer- so the serious moments could've really made it's impact- the serious moments felt almost rushed. If you liked Ragnarok you will like this movie. The colors and black and white scene was awesome. I feel it's becoming a trend to hate on marvel movies now- it's not the perfect film but I enjoyed it.

Review:
Thor (since Endgame) has been teamed

Author: temorkhanzalmai

These movies are all extremely predictable, mainly made of cgi, and contain the simplest of dialogues. Yet, they are always so hyped up in media and have mass grown-up followings. How? Author: ksaefos
Review: This film fails in all aspects to retain the status that Marvel had constructed for it's universe. This time the funny side of Thor went way too far. Unnecessarily though. And to think this is the super hero who eventually killed Thanos. It's almost disrespectful for the character had envisioned at first. And I get why they wanted to make a more light hearted film on this hero it just falls short compared to Ragnarok. Jokes are so petty and the whole plot inexcusably stupid.

Author: ozzmosiz
Review_Title: The Batman & Robin of Thor films, but not as good
Review: Utterly appalling. Rubbish jokes and writing overall.

Author: vanleeuwenthomas
Review_Title: More cringe than a Hallmark film
Review: This film was borderline unbearable. Marvel shows a complete inability to have a serious scene without trying to get a cheap laugh from the audience. I spent the majority of the film praying the movie would end, and the rest of the film plotting the death of the obnoxious goats that served as the recycled joke that stopped being funny 30 seconds after their first appearance. Christian Bale delivered a great performance as Gorr the God Butcher that was wasted on this dumpster fire of a film. I would have enjoyed more screen time with Bale and less time of Thor uncomfortably conversing with his weapons. If this and Eternals is a glimpse of what Disney has planned for the future, then RIP Marvel Studios.

Author: rchevalier-37303
Review_Title: Sorry bad writing and making Thor campy doesn't work
Review: I was worried that this would build on Ragnarok in all the wrong ways. Where Ragnarok had writing to provide a framework for the comedy, this film doesn't have that. The story is weak and fragmented. Bale is excellent but he cannot carry the film on his own. Hemsworth has gone from a believable hero to a chemically enhanced gymrat. It's like all the steroids removed his personality. More Kiev is too much. He should be comic relief not a vehicle for Waititi to "act". Portman seems tired of the whole thing. Just waiting fo r it to end. And while it is not ridiculously long it is long to watch. Some of the effects especially at the beginning are really lousy and look like high school CGI. It needs an editor badly to keep things moving. It's like they kept way too much filler. A setup for a fight with Hercules sounds both boring and a reach. Jane arriving in Valhalla is a nice touch but it took a long time to get there. They say Thor will return. Hopefully in a better movie.

Author: spam-778-616598
Review: I really liked the trailers, so I went in, however it was not worth the money. Yes, there were some fun parts in it and I really liked the (underdeveloped) Jane Foster arc - but the plot overall was too messy, confusing, relying too much on cgi, completely forgetting a truly cinematic story. The last series I watched was Stranger Things - and the quality differences in writing, directing, cutting etc. Are astounding. Can't Marvel do better? I'm a bit bummed to write this, because Thor would've had so much potential. It's mostly ridiculous now - and unfortunately not in a good way.

Author: dougzinboston
Review: This has the sparks of one of the best Thor movies, but for some reason they not only kept it in the comedy realm, they went too far in that direction. God killer, Jane Foster as Lady Thor, monsters, gods, relationship tension, etc...the makings of a great action movie but they ruined it. If this wasn't Thor, and a movie with different characters billed as a comedy, I'd rate it much higher. I don't watch Thor for a bunch of bad jokes, thrown away roles that could have been amazing and a small spit of action. Probably one of the worst Marvel movies and if you watch a Marvel marathon, skip this one.

Author: The1aboveall-1969
Review: From screaming goats to Kiwi quips it's a hodgepodge of humorous lines from Taika Waititi. Bale's performance as Gorr the good killer is quite exceptional as he puts the perfect twist of evil and madness together for a decent performance. The rehash of Valkyrie and Asgard was unnecessary and given too much time, not sure why Korg and Valkyrie had to return other than giving Taika's twist on some Kiwi egg another go for the sake of personal promotion. It's a comic book so it's comical, but lacks any good story telling in the writing. I'm surprised Russell Crowe took the part, and the accent oh brother. The entire rating is given on Bale's expressions performance and the witty quips dropped here and there.

Author: Joshumms
Review: A fun as hell ride that consistently puts a smile on your face and makes you laugh and while it isn't as good as Ragnarok it's definitely another great movie by Taika Waititi. This movie clearly isn't meant to be taken too seriously as many of Waititi and Marvel's movies but some of the serious moments work. Gorr is a good villain to an extent, he is definitely just a construct of the plot but Christian Bale's performance is enjoyable and at least he has an arc and isn't just bad marvel dude 32. The movie did jump around a lot and wasn't as focused and I think that's why Ragnarok was a better movie than Love and Thunder (and part of me really missed Loki being in these movies).

Author: Elvis-Del-Valle
Review_Title: A very funny and enjoyable parody
Review: Really enjoy this movie, it is quite enjoyable in colorful visual aspect and there is never a lack of good action scenes and amazing special effects. The catch here is that the movie is very comedy oriented, giving it a cartoonish tone and it feels like a parody of Thor. Russell Crowe's Zeus character is too cartoonish and ends up contributing very little. Chris Hemsworth is still the best as Thor and Natalie Portman now has more participation. The relationship between Thor and Jane Foster brings this movie to life more than the first 2 installments and there is more chemistry between them. Christian Bale in the role of Gorr is an extraordinary villain, quite dark and with a good story that justifies his actions. Another exciting thing about the movie is the soundtrack, which includes Guns N' Roses songs that offer a really exciting moment. As much as this movie ends up being a parody, it manages to fulfill its objective of entertaining like any Marvel movie. My final rating for this movie is a 9/10.

Author: Farzad-Doosti
Review: Every time we say that this is the worst Marvel movie, we are surprised again that it can be even worse.

Author: alisolimanzaki-25509
Review: The movie is better than part one and two, but Ragnarok still have the best screenplay among the four parts, the CGI and cinematography are supermassive, and the negative about comedy in the movie looks coming from Saturday night live, which wasn't good, I think what saves this movie is Gorr by Christian bale he gives the best acting in MCU, I have seen this performance in comics movie from two Heath Ledger and Joaquin Pheonix.

Author: luoji-64737
Review_Title: 80s throwbacks doesn't make a good movie
Review: Well this was an unnecessary exercise. This actually made me tired of all the 80s throwbacks that are force fed into your faces. Felt like a kids movie, and if that was the case, then it is fine, but I think even kids will think this is too corny of a rendition. This wasn't even funny as a parody. Christian Bale as Gorr was a too generic of a villain, seen it before in dozens of movies and was a dime in a dozen. Marvel has become a money hogging scam and trying to milk this franchise as much as possible with nonsensical storylines. We should rate this honestly lower as to give a signal the audience is not dumb, we know what quality is and script writers needs to be more creative. To people who do love it, more power to you, have a nice life.

Author: vvendetta-46505
Review: This movie didn't know what it was - at times a comedy, sometimes a kids movie and even an Asterix movie with over the top silliness (including special effects), especially with scenes with Zeus, for example. It even seemed to try and tap a daytime soap with melodramatic stagings. Maybe this is all due to Waititi and Hemsworth being unrestrained this time and unfettered from the Marvel restraints which helped to make Ragnarok a more perfect balance of comedy and drama and greater success. This was less than the sum of its parts and tried to do too much with too little, never allowing its audience to go with the flow. There are great performances and some brilliant cameos, for those who have loved Hemsworth's Thor history, but it lacks the cleverness of Ragnarok and ends up being clunky and a pale immitator of the Marvel movies leading up to Endgame. In trying to please everyone at all cost, this leaves a confused mess and bring the Thor greatness of Ragnarok back down to earth with a thud - where The Immigration Song was inspired in Ragnarok, too much Guns and Roses just led to a land of confusion, and a Universe that may have been blown by all the colour and lights. Even a nude rendering of Hemsworth can't distract from its obvious flaws, though it was a nice try. Time to go back to the drawing board to hammer out a better Thor, for those who love the God of Thunder. This movie does him a disservice.

Review:

the story is shallow.

Review_Title: A comedy that tries too hard
Review: I really wanted to like this movie. I really did.

Review: Easily the worst Marvel movie I have ever seen, poor CGI, awful dialogues, lame comedy & a joke of a plot.

Review: Lighthearted and funny. I liked it, it's entertaining and funny in the subtle way that Taika works his magic. It's a MCU movie and a really good movie to follow Ragnarok. Thor will be back!

Review: It was pretty good when it was serious but the emotion was lost because you just didn't know when something stupid was going to be said.
