Author: alex-799-908199
Review: The entire film was hugely aimed to suck as much money from kids. Joke after joke after joke after joke after joke. Only real serious acting was Jane's death from cancer. The rest was so confusing you really didn't know the build up to the end.

Author: mattf-91730
Review: Just back from watching Thor Love and Thunder and what a quirky little movie it is!

Author: theredsky
Review: Massive disappointment from both the MCU and Taika Waititi. Feels more like a parody of Thor: Ragnarok more than a continuation to that movie. Waititi's style works incredibly well for his other films but here it's just too much. The comedy undercuts almost every emotional moment and deflates almost any tension in every scene. The character development here for anyone who isn't Thor is underwhelming. Natalie Portman returns as Jane Foster and she feels more like a mandate from Disney to include her rather than Taika wanted to. I also don't think Portman is doing a great job here but the script she is given doesn't help her at all. Chris Hemsworth is good as Thor. It's clear Hemsworth is having a blast and his charisma kept me somewhat invested. Christian Bale's Gorr is a very mixed bag. On one hand you have a really fun, engaging, and great performance from Bale but that character of Gorr just isn't great. His origin is rushed and confusing before the film bizarrely chooses not to show him kill any gods besides one. A character called The God Killer only gets to kill one god on screen. Great job Marvel! The other actors like Tessa Thompson and Russell Crowe are doing a good job but their characters feel like an afterthought. The filmmaking here in general honestly feels a little bland. Taika's style is there but it feels awkward this time. The visual effects don't look great most of the time either however with the recent news about how Marvel treats it's VFX workers and how little time they have then it's understandable why they look incomplete. The film wasn't completely devoid of anything fun though. There were some fun sequences and fun jokes though. The black and white fight is very creative and fun to watch and The Rock at the end was pretty great. The rest of the jokes in this film really aren't that funny though. The screaming goats weren't funny the first time and they weren't funny the 15th time they made the joke. With the lackluster output that Phase 4 has given us, Marvel is in trouble right now if they don't course correct soon. If you enjoy Ragnarok then maybe you'll enjoy this but at the end of the day you can skip it.

Author: vc81
Review_Title: One of the worst Marvel movies...
Review: Ever since James Gunn came crashing through with Guardians, Marvel has doubled down on the sarcastic slapstick style of Marvel movies with bad timed sarcastic jokes and tone deaf jokes at the expense of some great heartfelt scenes that were derailed by idiotic sarcasm and mockery of tragedy.

Author: emryse
Review: Let's begin with what seems to be the biggest criticism of this film, the comedy. Having seen Taika Waititi's other films I felt fairly prepared for there to be a joke every 5 seconds, not every joke landed and there were moments when jokes didn't fit the tone but overall, I wasn't too distracted by it. I think this film failed in a lot of other ways but for me at least the overabundance of humour was passable.

Author: ashleykeylor
Review_Title: Disappointing...I should've listened to my inner voice...
Review: Our daughters really wanted to go and see this movie. I have read some negative reviews about it but we have seen almost all the Marvel movies and usually love them so I caved and said yes. First of all, this movie is not any good. The parts that should be serious are not taken seriously at all, which makes the movie feel very odd. There are so many random parts in the movie that just don't seem to make sense or go together. The negative reviews that you read below pretty much spell it out for you. On top of all of that there are multiple mentions of things that are probably not best for kids, some of which are sexual (orientation, orgies, references to making babies, describing love as a "sh-tty feeling" multiple times, etc...). The whole film is bad and laughable except for the dark parts which were really disturbing for my daughter. I also felt like the movie is pretty anti-god in several of the scenes- yes, it is supposed to be in the context of Greek mythology, but it felt like more than that. There are also mentions of serious sickness, that I don't feel like the took seriously enough, making light of it in some key moments. I understand that they wanted to infuse some humor, which I'm normally totally on board for, but this just wasn't done well and I wish we hadn't gone to see it. Even if my kids (who are older) wouldn't have been with me, I wouldn't have enjoyed it. Sad, because it could have been much better with the actors they had.

Author: vivienzubai
Review: I'm honestly a hardcore Marvel fan yet this movie was simply bad. I liked the jokes but sadly there were too many and that made the whole movie look silly to me. I liked the friendships between the characters but you can't really enjoy it because of the unnecessary jokes. I was disappointed:(

Author: Smellman426
Review: This was another solid entry into the MCU. A solid story with great action, acting, and humor. Really enjoyed the performances of Thor (Chris Hemsworth), The Mighty Thor (Natalie Portman), and Gorr the God Butcher (Christian Bale) all around. Korg (Taiki Waititi) is one of my favorite Marvel characters, and it was good to see him receive another time to shine in the spotlight. The performances of Valkyrie (Tessa Thompson) and Zeus (Russel Crowe) are entertaining too. Some scenes in this movie were really interesting, and I am looking forward to watching them again later. This movie has been receiving lots of bad reviews, but for people on the fence, I encourage you to check it out as it is lot a better than you may expect.

Author: ThomasColquith
Review: I actually enjoyed "Thor: Love and Thunder." While there were a few odd scenes and the opening caught me off guard, it was overall a well made movie that entertained me for two hours, thus I am rating it a 6/10 like the previous Thor sequels. I liked the music and the sense of humor, I know not everyone does, but I did. In fact, Hemsworth is a great comedic actor whose manner has really defined this modern Thor character. I enjoy the slight silliness; I don't need overly dark and serious superhero films as some people do. I also liked him in "Men in Black: International." And even playing a real bad guy in "Bad times at the el royale" he still can't help showing off that odd sense of humor and his fit body of course. Obviously not everyone likes these Thor movies and that is ok, but I do, and I'm not a big superhero genre fan. Though I don't like some of the flashing lights and stuff, but that was really only an issue in the first film of the series, which is why I rated "Thor" only a 5/10.

Author: cross525
Review_Title: Better than Dark World. Not as good as Ragnarock.
Review: Caught the 1:00 pm showing. Like I said better than Dark World but, not as good as Ragnarock. Even though many of the cast, characters and the director. Me and my wife, my son, and his friend all saw this movie at the same showing and we've got different opinions on this movie. But, we thought it would at least be as good as Ragnarock and we were all disappointed about it. It was good to see some of the familiar faces that we've not seen in a while. One that hasn't been seen since WandaVision on Disney+. It may be worthwhile to catch on a matinee or early bird price if available at your theater. As always just my thoughts and opinions. Well in this case my family also, lol.

Author: jamesgoomba
Review: A perfect balance of humor, dread, action, and love. Definitely one of the better marvel movies out there. Such a diverse universe of characters and tropes that range from different species, religions, and backgrounds with finding no two alike. The ending was fulfilling and graceful. Can't wait to see how they continue the story!

Author: gabethedinosaur
Review_Title: The night Jane and thor have finally strike the box office
Review: I can't believe it's been 9 years since Natalie Portman was in marvel studios since 2011 2013 to 2022 . Christian bale did a great job in the movie too . And his daughter did a fantastic job as well . The laughter and humor in thor made it more exciting. The filming was brilliant and hilarious. I hope to see Natalie do more marvel movies again . Cause marvel and Star Wars have made portman a bigger actress. Chris as thor made a remarkable comeback playing thor again .

Author: megumicristina
Review_Title: it used to be one of my favorite
Review: I don´t know why the producers decided to make Thor a comical character, after the story joined the Guardians of the Galaxy (GOTG) I got really disappointed. The only thing that makes GOTG interesting is that it gives a background story about Thanos, but I think it's too much Disney like, the talking animals, songs and poor jokes. I used to like Thor so much because the story is darker and mysterious. Now this attempt to make Thor a funny character is the opposite of what makes him a interesting character, I usually like the Marvel movies, they often have a great plot and the best thing is the special effects but they definitely can improve on Thor.

Author: pareekshivam-77937
Review_Title: It's not marvel it's disney movie
Review: After Disney's involvement marvel becoming more of a kid show.

Author: alejandrokilei
Review: The title says it all. Don't expect much from this movie which focuses on propaganda rather than story (the former being used as the primary driver at each point of the story). This doesn't come off as much of a surprise with Disney ramming their "not-so-secret agenda".

Author: deloudelouvain
Review_Title: Another score for Marvel, very colourful.
Review: I enjoyed the last Thor: Ragnarok a lot so I was expecting something similar with Thor: Love and Thunder and I can't say I was disappointed. This new Marvel movie was of the same quality as the previous one. Very colourful, bombastic, spiked with again some good humorous scenes mostly because of funny one liners. The CGI's were again very spectacular. The cast consists of very good actors so you know you won't be disappointed by them. Christian Bale's character was creepy so credits to the make-up artists for that. The story is easy to follow, with a lot of action, no dead moments at all. If you're a fan of this genre of Marvel movies, action with a bit of humour, you won't regret watching this new Thor adventure. Up to the next one!

Author: philfun2
Review_Title: Most disappointing film of the year
Review: I thought Ragnarok was incredible: not only a great comedy, but a fantastic super hero film. So I was really looking forward to Love and Thunder.

Author: deepfrieddodo
Review_Title: Missed Potential Due To Odd Tone
Review: Despite great potential and some brilliant performances, Waititi's second direction of Thor is wide of the mark. It seems unable to find the genre it wants to fit in, keeping the same humour from Ragnarok, but mixing it with horror in Bale's Gorr. Neither genre is able to build momentum, meaning typically funny scenes, which would have landed in the previous film, have far less impact, yet the comedy is too constant to allow any other tone for the film.

Author: alindsayal
Review_Title: An Above Average Mess Of A Film
Review: One of the most hyped films, Thor: Love and Thunder is out and I have now finally had a chance to watch it and here is my review for the film. The premise of the film sees Thor attempting to work himself out when he must team up with his ex Jane Foster in order to stop a new enemy.

Author: k0nsumer
Review: That was the dumbest movie I have seen in a while. What a waste. Comedy? Well yes the movie was a joke. 2 stars for the production, effects, Bail and the music score. Everything else was terrible. Such a waste of a great cast. The first three were great this final instalment was just pure cheese. But not in a good way. I watched it with a few others and the sighs and ughs were commonplace. It is definitely a one watch movie. It felt like the whole movie was a kitsch imaginary cut scene or a bizarre dream that made no sense and is difficult to remember what happened after waking up. I think this may be a sign of the end of marvel movies. Time to move on maybe.

Author: vlancuba-593-261723
Review: The movie was ok I'm glad I waited for it to land on Disney plus. There were Far too many jokes. It feels like it were made for kids to enjoy yet it's also too graphic for kids so my criticism is the movie doesn't know who the audience is. The kids fighting scene was ok. The jokes were ok. Christian bale was great. Torg scene at the end was subtle like it was made for kids. Same with the King kissing the maidens hand. James character was silly at times. Thor was being too dumb at times. Heimdels sons name change was interesting, I understand why it's in there but there was no context, almost like it was made for kids.

Author: cdavis-50399
Review: Funny, but it felt like every line was trying to be a punch line. I love Taika, but it seemed like he got ahead of himself and needed something to reel him back in so the story could go a little deeper. Granted, it is a superhero movie but when you cast Christian Bale as the Vilain the movie can't be all fun. It was good but not as good as it's predecessor. Keep the silly but add a serious undertone and it would have been great. Add some more depth to Thor and it would have been great. A little more of the God Butcher's build up/journey would have been great. It just needed more and felt a little rushed.

Author: tavismelvin
Review_Title: By far the best Thor movie
Review: Watched it twice and it gets better each time. The movie had heart, laughter and of course bad a$$ action scenes. Loved , loved , loved it all. Better then Doctor strange by far and that says a lot cuz I love Elizabeth Olsen.

Author: Skeauxsha
Review: No, just no. Nothing else but no.

Author: rentan_3
Review_Title: Is The Marvel Universe becoming a joke?
Review: Holy!!! I feel sad that the Marvel Universe is becoming a joke. This movie has a weak story and lack seriousness. Seems like Marvel relies on "poor" jokes, nudity and lame catch phrases.. what happened with the quality from eg. Captain America?

Author: snoozejonc
Review_Title: Unfunny to me, but doesn't deserve the panning
Review: Thor reunites with Jane Foster.

Author: battlecrusadersgames
Review_Title: Not bad, but not great either
Review: I have given this a 7 because i have always loved Thor and there are some good elements; Gorr is menacingly scary, Korg is funny as ever and there are some beautiful visual effects. Sadly there are lots of things that if changed could have made this the best Thor movie yet.

Author: sdrose-41994
Review_Title: A Lot better than that god Awful Doctor Strange 2
Review: I wish i had seen this movie in Cinema than DS2.

Author: witqueen
Review: I had high hopes for this movie, but the expectation did not meet the reality. Heavy handed, tries too hard, not funny when they try, and a bit of a "religious" undertone about the afterlife. The story just wasn't as compelling as previous Marvel movies. I actually was a bit bored and we saw it on a Sunday afternoon, which may account for only 6 people in the whole theater, though we chose the 3 D version. Save your money and maybe stream it online, if you really need to see it.

Author: a7mdG
Review: This is the result of preferring a stupid agenda at the expense of beautiful cinematic art, why this insistence on presenting everything that is boring and incorrect, Marvel and Disney from bad to worse 👎👎👎

Author: alangilmore-52359
Review: Tried to be funny but wasnt. Tried to he an action movie but wasn't. This has really made me question watching any new marvel movies in future. If this is where the MCU is headed... I'm out!

Author: andyruth792004
Review_Title: All these haters must've watched a diff't movie...
Review: ...because Love & Thunder was so much damn fun. It was whacky & weird, funny but serious when it needed to be, and just had a good vibe with heart. Christian Bale gave Thanos a run for his money as one of the best MCU villains. He was a guy who was wronged, seeked revenge but ended with redemption. Not some one-note one dimensional villain. His performance was "all in" and he didn't phone it in like a lot of actors do in the big pay day comic book films. Hemsworth was the best he's ever been as Thor, and his storyline with Jane was filled with complications, romance and was the core of the film. Taika's writing and directing was great. The music, cinematography, production design, were all great. The cast of supporting characters were all awesome as usual, including a hilarious Russell Crowe. This was the best MCU movie since Endgame. For real. Great solo story that has it all.

Author: ryanmo-35178
Review: The fourth episode of Thor, but the plot is just normal except the introduction of Natalie Portman as woman Thor. Christian Bale played good but the character is not convinced. Many funny scenes but the main plot is not good and even bored in the middle of the movie. Though the scenes Thor gave the power to the kids to fight is attractive. Maybe it's the final episode?

Author: chaseuba
Review_Title: All I enjoyed seeing was Christian Bail and Natalie Portman
Review: +3 stars for Christian Bale.

Author: richard-llewellyn-jones
Review: I really liked Natalie Portman's character in the first two Thor film series. That was probably because I was a scientist, who worked in general relativity theory as well. She is a really good actress when given good material and the attraction of opposites works well in the first two films as a believable story.

Author: doomsdayrocks
Review_Title: Yet another disappointment set up film
Review: This movie was a disappointment. The idea that Thor is a giant goofball is a bad one. Waititi needs to stay away from the MCU. The movie is tonally deaf, pretty but shallow, and the finale is rushed garbage. A million jokes a minute but only half of one hits. Lots of setup for future perhaps better projects. Maybe it's time to retire the MCU and focus on letting some movies stand on their own.

Author: mail-19035
Review_Title: Writers: How much silliness do you want? Producer: Yes!
Review: I love almost all Marvel Universe movies, but this one feel like it's just all over the place, it's a very goofy movie! I laughed out loud several times, but it's like they threw every bit of seriousness out the window and just went balls to the wall crazy with everything.

Author: michaelaeperkins
Review_Title: How is this lower than the dark world?!
Review: I really don't understand the harsh ratings for this film. After reading them myself I was preparing to see an awful film and boy was I surprised. I loved it and even my very stubborn husband enjoyed it.

Author: paul_haakonsen
Review: Initially when I saw the trailer for director Taika Waititi's 2022 "Thor: Love and Thunder" movie, then I wasn't overly impressed. And I have to admit that this wasn't a movie that I was going to be rushing out to the cinema to watch.

Author: afortenbacker
Review_Title: Enjoyable but a bit too silly at times.
Review: I honestly enjoyed this movie in theaters as a non-comic reader. Was a bit disappointed that they immediately abandoned the Asguardians plot thread, a few of the jokes were annoying like, the bit with Stormbreaker being jealous, but I did like Jane's arc and thought Mjolnir's ability to break apart and reform was pretty cool. The Eternity scene actually made me cry in theatres. Hope they tone down the jokes in the future and act more serious. Christian Bale and Chris Hemsworth's performances were great as expected. Taika Waititi was a bit annoying. Probably one of my top 5 movies of Phase Four.

Author: malcolmjohnston
Review_Title: Such a waste of talent for cheap laughs
Review:
Why oh why did the makers of this film miss such a glorious chance to use the talents of The Guardians of the Galaxy cast but more terrible they've blown probably the best Big Bad in Marvel films to fill the movie with cheap laughs rather than be a big hitting extravaganza
Love & Thunder bumbles along on the same path as the previous film but it could have been much much more.

Author: alan-1106
Review_Title: Marvel factory has a quality problem
Review: It was just watchable however I was glad when it was over. Quite a few walkouts during the film so not just me. The marvel franchise needs to focus on quality not quantity.

Author: rawllk4
Review: It was a weird movie in a whole , a lot of forced comedy bits , the narrator was unnecessary to say the least .

Author: david-visser11
Review_Title: Dark World is not the worst Thor movie any more
Review: I wanted to watch this movie in cinema but glad I didn't pay money for it. I stopped watching it the first time after 20 minutes because I just had better things to do and it was so so bad. Second time i did finish it but it i did not enjoy it.

Author: grahamrjohnson
Review_Title: Cant believe I wanted to see this disaster at the cinema
Review: Thank god I didn't waste my money. Is this the beginning of the end for the NZ director? I CANT understand why this train wreck was made.

Author: Harbsa
Review:
Seriously...
The number one question is why?

Author: goldrb6
Review_Title: The ONCE mighty Thor has fallen
Review: This was once a great franchise. It would have been nice to take my 10 year old grandchild to but she would have fallen asleep. DONT WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY.

Author: warren-87235
Review: Given that I'm someone who, in addition to dramatic and serious movies, greatly enjoys silly B-movies, I find it strange that I'm increasingly reaching a point where most big-budget action adventure movies are leaving me totally cold.

Author: pokhrelsaugat-07802
Review: I felt the movie is too short for the story. The beginning is quite paced,seems they edited it in hurry. Otherwise, the movie's got great cast and the ending is quite nice too. The music and sound can be made alot better as Thor: Ragnarok.

Author: lojitsu
Review_Title: Lower your expectations and it will come out alright.
Review:
Here's The 4K Lowedown on "Thor: Love and Thunder" (PG-13 - 2022 - Theater)
Genre: Fantasy/Comic

Author: Tactrix
Review: Ok the first thing I have to address is the goats, every single time they screamed all I could hear is "WHAA I FEEL GOOD". And that by itself cracked me up to no end. Now as for the movie, it was ok, it was the same 30% corny 70% hero thing most Thor movies are. I think the dialog could have used a good once over, and the story wasn't really as engaging as the other ones. It just didn't seem on par with the other ones in terms of hero value, but I mean this is a long going franchise, it was inevitable that it would fall off eventually. The acting was good as usual. I give it a modest 7/10, it did what it was suppose to do. I really like that they made kids be part of it, it's a new twist and good to introduce kids into the marvel universe and let them feel godly.

Author: mark-48939
Review_Title: Really a Blow to the Thor Brand
Review: Actually I wish I had not gone to see it ... it was cheesy and very disappointing. It was like a spoof on itself. Compared to the previous films on Thor it was literally insulting like we were being punked for both watching it and spending money to see it.... I wish we could have gotten a refund. It really hurt the Thor brand.

Author: rjgrund-123-603438
Review: Please Marvel no more Taika Waititi! This is a mess and his Thor is a mockery of the character. Was no one watching what he was doing? This story is all over the place. A literal farce. The characters are cartoonish. The acting is over the top. If I had paid to see this I would have been angry. Even seeing it for free in my own home feels wrong. The actors do their best with the nonsense they are asked say and do. These are good talented people who cannot overcome this silliness. And the woke MCU message gets old. Make some changes Marvel or go the way of DC. Sooner or later your audience will tire of this.

Author: clcarter-25120
Review: I am beyond disappointed with this film in every way. If you love serious characters acting like buffoons the whole time with random lame content, then this is your movie. How embarrassing and disappointing for Taika Waititi and the actors. This was so ridiculous!

Author: ykzqr
Review: I just watch this film and almost walked out. I loved the other Thor films and even though the Thor character has been increasingly comedic. This films story line seemed rushed and also made the guardians look foolish. Times when you would aspect some seriousness there was levity, actually I would call the oil a comedy. You can definitely see the Disney wokeness spilling over in the film. I wish I waited to it came out on cable.

Author: docbennett-472-557329
Review_Title: Sad to See Where MCU Has Fallen
Review: Poor writing, worse directing and bad acting. If "Jane" could have any more wooden she would be a tree. The money paid could in no way make up for the script they had to read.

Author: ruhlandethan
Review_Title: Possibly the greatest movie I've ever seen
Review: I walked out of the theater stunned. My mind trying so hard to process what I just watched. Everyone else coming out of the theater was also speechless. I wish this movie was 5 hours long because I never wanted it to end! Comedy, action, visually stunning, sensory overload in the best way. I will rewatch this movie 5 more times just so I can try to grasp this incredible plot and put the pieces together of what I just witnessed. Love love love it, another big win in the books for Taika Waititi.

Author: alisdair-42129
Review: Except I didn't, watch, I mean. I gave up after 45 minutes, which had I realised earlier that this was such a dog's dinner, was 44 minutes too long. On every level, this is jaw-droppingly awful. This was a thriller which couldn't thrill a two year old, a comedy which was toe-curlingly unfunny, a drama about as dramatic as the weather forecast. And the cgi effects weren't as believable as the 1960's Batman tv series.

Author: robertheduardoperezmachado
Review: I couldn't choose a better headline, the movie was a 6 to me, but Bale killed it and I have to give it an 8 for such a terrific villain. Nevertheless, I didn't like the ending, didn't like that lazy writing. Anyway, the movie is not bad, enjoyable from start to finish, but too many stupid scenes. The movie was kinda emotional, I cried with Jane's death, which helped with my rating as well. Frankly, feels like a filler, shippable movie, it doesn't really develop the phase 4 of the MCU, but it was fun to watch IMO.

Author: nhawk2
Review: The movie keeps trying to make you laugh, but the jokes are made for 5 year olds. Acting is similarly lacking. This should have been done as animation for kids.

Author: cardodavid
Review: Has some funny moments, but lacks epicity and doesnt add anything new. You can delete this one and nothing happens to the MCU universe. Christian Bale acting was interesting, but Waititi didnt get his best.

Author: ervinkp
Review: Terrible acting, terrible story line, save your money and watch Ragnarok again. This movie is so very disappointing.it's the worst of the MCU movies by far.

Author: christianbushell
Review: First off. Christian Bale, as usual, great! Everything else was just utter nonsense. How and why are these movies being made? The first Thor movie was good and each one has gotten worse but this one was just utter nonsense! I have no clue what audience this movie was aimed at. I don't know what direction it was trying to head in and neither did the people that made it. Terrible jokes and puns that where just both unfunny , stupid and super annoying with touches of wokeness mixed in. You know Disney has to be sure to keep it's mentally ill woke people happy. After the recent Dr. Strange garbage and now this. Safe to say I am done with these types of movies and probably done with Disney.

Author: dannyk90
Review: It felt like they can not be bothered to write a good film anymore, no thought at all has gone in to making story. So they just resort to mocking themselves. What is even worse, they think it is funny when it really isn't, they are trying too hard to be something that it's not.

Author: christineballone
Review_Title: Not so bad after watching a few times!
Review: Just edited my harsh previous review to a kinder and more forgiving one. I just watched this for the third time because honestly sometimes there is nothing else even having Disney, Prime and Netflix! I have to say that it's growing on me! Yes it's silly and hilarious but also deep and loving ! Natalie Portman is good as usual and the rest of the cast also does a good job! I guess we'll just have to look back at this version as being the silly one. The CGI are as usual amazing. I'm hoping for another instalment of the Thor saga and believe there are plenty of possibilities for a really good one ! Meanwhile I'll keep watching the existing ones!

Author: thisisgere
Review: Its passable. I had a fun time, saw it twice and laughed. C. Bale was very interesting as the villain. Natalie's Jane was inconsistent switching from nerdy behavior to serious at lightning speed. Zeus was hilarious! I ?LOVED HIM! Tessa Thompson is always gorgeous. That weird bit with the portable speaker was.... weird. Korg should have died.

Author: tfstbrice
Review_Title: All the years of good work...gone.
Review: Marvel, please stop ruining what up until end game was a dream come true as someone who grew up wishing and hoping to see these characters and stories on the big screen done right.

Author: AlexanderKyriakou
Review: Thought that it would be at the level of the Ragnarok one, which was at the border of funny and properly entertaining.

Author: leiferik-senneset
Review: This movie had such a huge potential. I really tought this was going to be a great movie with Bale portraying Gorr butchering the gods and Thor trying his best to stop him.

Author: politicidal
Review_Title: Cartoonishly silly but colorful addition to the 'THOR' movies
Review: Chris Hemsworth carries this fast paced sequel that has big ideas and an intimidating villain (played by Christian Bale no less). He reminds audiences that he can be very charming and cool as a leading man in a big-budget blockbuster like the THOR movies.

Author: martinrobertson300482
Review: Marvel continues its downward spiral with another Thor movie that could off worked. But tries too hard to be up there with the last one.

Author: sammytalb-10939
Review: This movie was a silly spoof on itself. Weak story, weak characters, bad acting by mouth breather Christian Bale as usual. I gave it two stars because twice it made me chuckle. The rest the time I thought I was watching a children's movie. It's like Marvel ran out of stuff to make movies about so they just decided to make this one on the fly, figuring out the plot as it went along. It was ridiculously dumb and I would not recommend it unless you're under the age of 12 years old. This movie will go on the list of movies not to be seen ever again. The last sentence in this review is only because they require 600 words or more to finish the review.

Author: rooosterrory
Review_Title: Pretty good movie despite horror elements
Review: I loved this movie, they did a good job on the special effects but something I criticise is that the film had too much horror elements, do we seriously need the MCU turning into a horror movie franchise, still, the film was epic despite the ending.

Author: cherylkyrandia
Review: The entire Thor series is far from homogenous. The original and Ragnarok were pretty outstanding, though being rather different in the ways they presented themselves - one more serious, the other more comedic. Never the less, both delivered an outstanding cinematic experience with depth of storyline and characters. This particular film fails on all fronts. It seems like an excuse to get together an all star cast and milk the franchise with millions of dollars without delivering anything new. The jokes in this film are simply not funny and rather childish to be perfectly honest. I think the Thor series ends here.

Author: attobuoy
Review: Christian Bale condemned to a part where he had to overact. Chris Hemsworth condemned to a part where he had to over-saccharin. Other cast condemned to be un-indicted co-conspirators.

Author: The-Sarkologist
Review_Title: Well, We Have Some More Thor
Review: I guess what surprised me was that most of the original Avengers have basically retired from the franchise, yet it seems that Thor is still there. Then again, that might have something to do with Chris Hemsworth not quite wanting to retire from the franchise just yet, and if the end of the film is anything to go by, this isn't the last we have heard of him. Then again, it also provides a pathway to bring in some of the other gods, such as Zeus and Hercules (though what we do know, or at least those of us who have only seen the trailer, is that Zeus does make an appearance).

Author: jomy-augustine
Review:
Poor comedy ruined the whole legacy.... For now...
Thor's struggle through his emotions made him look like a teenager. Maybe it was made for younger generation to connect with but the makers can't just show anything to grab attention of certain age group because after all he's a God who knows that he's a God.... Mighty Zeus was portrayed as if he was gay... How else could you fail? Could have been much better if they knew the depth of emotions shown in the film. After all they had Christian Bale with them... They could make a masterpiece but there it is, a poor comedy film in the end.. Casting, Editing, acting, all good but few points less for screenplay... made me sad.

Author: faltukaamkelie
Review: Horrible from start to finish. Post credits also worthless. Just marketing and hype. Marvel has fallen beyond imagination. Dissatisfied and disappointed.

Author: harry_tk_yung
Review: I said "full circle" meaning that "Thor: Love and Thunder" takes the audiences right back to the source. Watching this movie is like reading comic books.

Author: jodawa80
Review: This film plays as a Mediocre improv show With an optic feast

Author: jessybessy-at
Review: Loved it! Will watch again! Very entertaining, light movie, with beautiful effects, fun dialogs and enchanting characters. Yet touching and even though not that deep and profound, it is a sincerely crafted story about the power of love. There were a couple of moments where I did think, oh, well, this reaction of that character was totally unrealistic, even for a fantasy story, but, then again, it was really not that bad and didn't ruin my experience. It is kids friendly and you can make a great family movie night out of it. So, may be some professionals would not give it a ten, but I, as a happy customer give it full points, for making me for an hour and a half forget my daily troubles. Oh, loved the soundtrack - how great to have Guns'n'Roses and Slashes supreme solos support the storyline!

Author: grandempire1738
Review: First of all: ADJUST YOUR EXPECTATIONS. If you really want deep, thought provoking tales I suggest you look away from the MCU in general (check out The Boys lol).

Author: lislas-60965
Review: No, just NO! I'm so sad that many, many of us were excited to see this film and it was such a let down. I feel bad because as actors, I love all the people in it. I mean, RUSSELL CROW even!! 💙💙💙💗💗💗 just so many awesome actors forced to do such a silly movie. TOOO MUCH COMEDY! It basically unanimous!! A little comedy was perfect, but it's being taken too far and it takes the dynamic out of the MCU movies that makes them great! Honestly Dr Strange was almost as bad but Wanda saved it! Sorry guys, the actors are awesome. The writers and directors fell short!!

Author: johnpatouchas
Review: I had a feeling this movie was gonna blow my mind just like ragnarok but all it did was making me question if it was a parody or not. They turned thor from this badass god from ragnarok-iw-endgame arc to a guy who doesnt even take himself seriously. Also i loved how they build up jane only for her to die by uknown reasons even though mjolnir was supposed to be saving her...

Author: rollerskatetori
Review_Title: It's like having Thor watered down
Review: I was super excited for this movie, actually we all waited years to see a really great Thor movie again and all it was at the end was a let down. I think the best part was seeing Matt Damon and Melissa McCarthy's re-enactment. The movie tried too hard to be funny and was just plain cheese balls. I'll put it this way. Have you ever accidentally made your ramen noodles taste badly cause you put too much water in it? Well Thor love and thunder was exactly that, a watered down version of what could have been.

Author: matsolito
Review: I set the expectations too high on this one. Turns out it's a silly movie with a lot of unfunny jokes for 12 year olds kids .

Author: michaelhooper2009
Review: I really enjoyed this. I do not believe it is better than Ragnorak, however, it certainly has some high points, whether that be comedic or emotional ones which perhaps exceed anything in Ragnorak. Overall it is a strong stand alone film, especially if you love the franchise and taika. I think it is a good thing it isn't stale and just trying to be Ragnorak 2.0. It takes risks and this should be admired.

Author: shanemessman
Review: The Thor series gets another story ahead. No high expectations just for the summers. Personally enjoyed the action and comedy elements. But movie feels like it doesn't contain a big event like marvel movies do. Some jokes may get too goofy. A good point is Christian bale as the villain absolutely thrilling performance the kids in my theatre ran away. Chris hemsworth is good as Thor like expected. Some good emotions were blended with the story about the female Thor's illness. The director has not full filled expectations like the 3rd part of Thor being the best. The climax is ok doesn't feel huge. Action pieces also ok noting new to get excited. Overall a fun summer entertainer for me. One time watch from marvel.

Author: djburnham
Review: Possibly the worst Marvel film. Poor writing. The acting poorly done. The storyline just horable. The dialogue is laughable, but not in a good way. All in all, a very juvenile, and poor excuse for a movie. I can only guess that much of the short comings of the film falls on the director. Everything in this movie feels rushed, and seems half hearted, and unprofessional. The sad thing for me is that I really like everyone in this film, but I am not going to just give a positive review due to the personalities, instead of the performances. To me it seems like they were more interested in an agenda than entertainment, or doing the job the public expects them to do. This is my second submission I have made for this movie. Several of my reviews have been ignored entirely by IMDB. I cant help but think that any mention of wokeness, PC, and how the entertainment industry pushes an agenda automatically gets censored. After all we cannot have anything said that the PC crowd disagrees with. It will be interesting to see if this gets by the censorship.

Author: mr_bickle_the_pickle
Review_Title: A lot of heart, a lot of fun - sometimes too silly
Review: Overall I really liked the message of choosing love. And there was a lot of heart and soul in this movie. But it also was a little undercut by the jokes sometimes. And I liked most of the humour but there was some jokes that were really corny and unnecessary. I actually really loved Natalie Portman as Mighty Thor. She was a great addition. I didn't particularly care for Christian Bale as Gorr though. He was borderline camp for me. I was a little disappointed with the after credits scene. First one reminded me of the GOTG 2 scene with Adam Warlock. And the second one was unnecessary. Overall though I had fun with the film and enjoyed myself.

I also feel like the storyline was all over the place. Good to see Thor back in action but sadly not like this. Who decided Thor was a comedian ? Just wow I'm grateful for the movie but disappointed in how everything played out.

Author: miraclel-17376
Review_Title: NOT BAD! Flawed, not as good as Guardians 3....

Author: zeljko-kolevski
Review_Title: Well, Marvel officially lost its way
Review: So, i went so happy to see this movie, i really liked previous Thor movies, and now with Guardians in it i was thinking it has to be SO much better.. i was wrong..

Author: maryskywalker11
Review: I was one of the few fans who seemed to prefer the first 2 Thor films to Ragnarok & the more comedic direction they decided to take this franchise. Knowing this had the same director & having watched all the trailers, my expectations were low...though as a huge Christian Bale fan & a Marvel fan I felt the need to at least watch it once. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised by how the tone of this film seemed to be a happy medium between original 2 & Ragnarok. It worked! It's not an excellent superhero film, and certain elements were underutilized, but it was enjoyable! Seeing Jane weld the hammer was so great - I'm glad Natalie made a return! And for the record, the MCU doesn't deserve the brilliant actor that is Christian Bale. He absolutely nailed this role soooo well, but his performance almost seemed too good for this film. All in all worth watching & after some solid Marvel duds we've been given lately...this was a welcome relief.

Author: hughlane
Review: The movie was trying to be funny at the beginning, but had no direction from the start. Many Disney moments, but doesn't work well with Thor. May have to rethink if I want to see the next Thor comedy hour. It had a bit Wizard of Oz moment with Zeus.

Author: shreelekhamandal
Review: Only saving grace is Christian Bale. Terrible writing, humour falling flat on its face, such awkward dialogue. The plot had god potential but it's been ruined by the dialogues between the characters - found the humour really forced.

Author: bgwinup-53-634155
Review_Title: It's official, you can't please Marvel fans
Review: I really don't understand the hate this movie is getting. My wife and I were laughing almost the entire time. We've seen every Marvel movie and show to date and thoroughly enjoyed this movie. It wasn't the best ever, but it was fun and the CGI and filmography was fantastic. People need to stop going into these movies like it's Endgame.

I really hope we get another Thor movie but Thor Trilogy isn't really good. Probably Introduce beta ray bill.

Author: michele-isik
Review_Title: A lot of fun and lots of surprises!!
Review: It's a super entertaining movie! I was surprised to see Christian Bale. I feel silly saying he did a great job because ..duh.. he's Christian Bale LOL. The cameos were hilarious! A few corny scenes here and there from Thor himself but I think that was intentional. I enjoyed seeing it in the theater with my family. I appreciate the laughter and smiles :)

Author: matealright
Review: A kids movie at this point. Utterly upset at how this has come out. We could all agree that Ragnarok was a great hit and the new 'version' of Thor was funny yet also serious. For Love and Thunder, it's as if Thor doesn't know what serious means. He seems to be joking around at all times even whilst the lives of people around him seem to be in imminent danger. So upsetting at how marvel movies have become now. I miss the Thor in the earlier movies. The Thor that argued with his father about wanting to go fight in Jotunheim. This Thor is a child in a man's body. Wasted 2 hours of my time. Should've honestly just watched Minions.

Author: vprohl
Review_Title: Major disappointment from such a good director
Review: Watching trailers for this had me excited. Considering that Taika Waititi is one of my favorite directors currently with movies like Jojo Rabbit and The Hunt for the Wilderpeople being genuinely funny while managing to be emotional at the same time, striking a strong balance between the two. Love and Thunder's predecessor, Ragnarok, fell neatly into this category, while not being as fulfilling or, in my opinion, quite as good as the other examples. Unfortunately, as soon as I saw the first god on screen, I knew this would be much different. I was, unfortunately, correct. This movie leans so hard into the comedy aspect that ragnarok brought to the table that there isn't any emotional payout to be had whatsoever. On top of this, most of the jokes didn't even land for me. Instead, they brought on an eye-roll or a facepalm, especially the 2012 screaming goats joke that manages to overstay it's welcome throughout the entire film. As a cherry on top of all of this, much of the action (one of the main selling points of a marvel movie) fell flat or seemed overly jokey, though I don't know what I expected. The only real saving grace I've found with this movie is Christian Bale's performance. While I don't think he fits the role very well or even wanted to be in this, I feel like he put up a good performance for the script he was given. Overall, this was an extreme disappointment for me and I am not looking forward to the next one.

Author: letdogsdrive
Review: Now I can talk about all the things that are wrong with this movie but the one that I'm most displeased with is the fact that none of the characters did a butterfly twist followed by a triple backflip like I expected.

Author: jpjosmer
Review: This movie was so good. It is really what you expected from the posters and trailers, although i must say it felt really short. The visuals where amazing, chris and tessa where on point, and natalie portman....wow, i love that they brought her back (even though they kill her at the end :/) but overall it was good seeing her again in the mcu. This film was filled with joy, a lot of comedy, some scary moments i do need to say and action.

Author: stilloopless1
Review_Title: Not Quite Enough Love or Thunder
Review: Another week is under our belts and with it came the next big summer movie release. Marvel's Thor: Love and Thunder. My excitement following the success of 2017 Thor: Ragnarök and the return of Taika Waititi as not only director but also co-writer has been palatable as well as guarded. With only an hour fifty-nine-minute runtime, the return of so many established characters, along with the introduction of new storylines, combined with the "late in the game" onslaught trailers, clips, and other hype I was more than a bit fearful we would've pretty much seen the entire film before it actually hit the screen.

Author: yfmgfhr
Review: Was expecting so much more, but it left like an expensive snl skit on Thor. I don't understand how they let this happen. Thor is a bumbling idiot, the jokes never stop, and the goats remind me of Jar Jar Binks. I honestly would pick him over that incessant scream. The only characters who came out of this unscathed were Tessa Thompson and Christian Bale.

Author: timeblank
Review: Nitpicking MCU Fans, I despise them! Thor was finding his place. Gorr was upset with false Gods that killed his daughter. Personally I love how they created Love and Thunder.

Author: mdeec
Review: I have been a fan of all MCU films, but after End Game, something is missing and all films are going in a different direction, the wrong direction in my opinion.

Author: shefali-59244
Review_Title: Thor: Love and Thunder: Lots of Flash and Fun, But the Film Doesn't Soar
Review: Director Taika Waititi is an artist with many talents, but one of his great accomplishments has been inserting mischief into the MCU. His 2017 film Thor: Ragnarok was subversive, surprising and exhilarating with a touch of absurdist humour, which humanised the characters. As Waititi told it, superheroes and gods were, like the rest of us, just fumbling and struggling. Who can forget Thor and the Hulk raging at each other and then sitting side by side, talking about their emotions and making up? This mix of sweet, sincere, melancholic and ultimately hopeful is what defines the Waititi oeuvre. His films - even the one about Nazis, Jojo Rabbit - hold a kernel of joy in their heart. And Waititi functions like a conductor, blending these disparate tonalities into one satisfying symphony.

Author: siderite
Review: Many people were afraid of what this film would do: replace Chris Hemsworth with a female Thor, destroy the legacy of Marvel's greatest hits, foul the spring of superhero purity and so on and so on. It's good that Waititi didn't give a rat's behind about anything and just made an entertaining film instead! If you liked Ragnarök, you will probably like this one, too.

Author: stevengilchrist
Review_Title: Visually decent, otherwise whats the point?

Review: The movie was bad but i so love marvel cuz this i rated the movie 10 at 10, we was so excited for the movie spicialy with goor charechtar ,but he was so normal in the movie , marvel please do something great after NWH.

Review_Title: Should have been a two part movie
Review: There is too much content in this movie to fill in a two hour movie, it should have been a two part movie one as Mighty Thor introducing Jane as Thor without Hemsworth till the end and Jane learning her abilities, limitations and getting training from the valkyrie and introducing Greek gods and then we get the Thor 4 where all of them unite to defeat gorr and would have enough space to add new characters like Beta Rey Bill etc... would have been a much better movie.

Author: dmansel
Review_Title: Botched first act and underdeveloped villain
Review: Marvel Studios' Thor: Love and Thunder finds the God of Thunder (Chris Hemsworth) on a journey unlike anything he's ever faced - a search for self-discovery. But Thor's retirement is interrupted by a galactic killer known as Gorr the God Butcher (Christian Bale), who seeks the extinction of the gods. To combat the threat, Thor enlists the help of King Valkyrie (Tessa Thompson), Korg (Taika Waititi) and ex-girlfriend Jane Foster (Natalie Portman), who - to Thor's surprise - inexplicably wields his magical hammer, Mjolnir, as the Mighty Thor. Together, they embark upon a harrowing cosmic adventure to uncover the mystery of the God Butcher's vengeance and stop him before it's too late.

Review: Well, I liked it, I liked it maybe too much. I understand the flaws, the mistakes, the stupid jokes, but it wasn't definitely a boring movie. Maybe there were too many jokes but this didn't make the sad parts ridiculous.

Author: brendasmpt
Review_Title: Don't spend any money on this
Review: Seeing the Guardians of the Galaxy at the beginning and Chris Hemsworth with his biological daughter at the end were probably the best parts. Russell Crowe looked ridiculous playing Zeus. This movie made very little sense as other reviewers have commented. The jokes fell flat most of the time. The little girl with the empowered bunny was hysterical. This movie was so silly I watched just to see how far they would go. Interesting after credits scene with Jane being welcomed to Valhalla. If I were Thor, I'd be too embarrassed to return... It would be nice to see Chris Hemsworth and his daughter in some other type of movie.

Author: bbv-69237
Review_Title: CGI and demeaning superheros does not a movie make
Review: If they wanted to make a movie that would kill of the superhero franchises, I guess this is what they tried to do. But then again, this comic books based CGI action theme was always destined to go the way of all the other 'popular' themes like musicals, westerns, 3D, etc etc. What we started to see during Covid and are seeing more now, especially with Spider Man, Thor and Jurassic World is the declining end-game of the CGI based action hero movies. I guess Iron Man saw it coming and got out in time with his dignity intact - end game indeed. I wonder what will become popular next. I hope it involves mainly adults and intelligent dialogue (mostly) and rational plots that are well directed and produced, with quality actors giving their all for their art - you know, like it used to be. I am sick of western teenage girl targeted movies - hopefully they will grow up soon.

Author: jacobpolak
Review: After Thor: The Dark World was rated the worst marvel movie of all time for obvious reasons such as idiotic plot, badly coordinated action sequences and barely any action, Thor: Ragnarok changed the game entirely and soon became one of my favourite marvel movies. I had pretty high expectations for Thor: Love and Thunder and they were unsurprisingly almost 100 percent met! Taika Waititi's funny sense of humour is prominent- playing Korg and he stars in it whilst also directing the movie! The movie was action-packed from start to finish and it was really cool to see Jane return again. Chris Hemsworth was great as usual. It is probably in my top ten movies of 2022 and I'd highly recommend it to any Marvel fans out there!

Author: sinirjhor
Review: It seems everything goes wrong with this movie! Very bad script, screenplay, cinematography, editing, acting, dialogue. I mean everything. There are a lot of questions at every plot point. Like why Valkyrie didn't die with that powerful sword? Why gorr took those kids to eternal gate? There are thousands of weakness in the script. Very poor & disappointing script. It was so boring & unbearable that I wanted to leave it several times.

Author: akuma_tenshi

It wasn't eternals level bad and the goats steal the show, otherwise, eesh, I'm still shocked at it.

Author: iliasth-64342
Review_Title: It could have been way better

Author: ONeill4797
Review_Title: Taika Waititi's Second Thor Outing Can't Recapture the Spark of Ragnarok
Review: Thor: Love and Thunder grapples with maintaining a consistent tone, struggling to blend Taika Waititi's humorous style with the weighty theme of terminal cancer., These tones clash rather than complementing each other, resulting in a disappointing comedy that lacks the freshness and hilarity of its predecessor.

Author: makatron
Review: They turned Thor into a dumb hero, when in the infinity saga he was a mighty warrior that felt defeat after the snap and then wanted redemption in End Game. This movie was trash and I guess Taika go-to comedic style it's going stale. Jane Foster was mostly in this movie just so she could be used to hype up the trailer, Lady Sif was barely mentioned that makes you wonder why bring her into the plot at all, Valkyrie had so much to do in Ragnarok but here we're presented with her being forced to deal with bureaucracy after being named king. Author: jeff-98697
Review_Title: A SUBVERSIVE MOVIE. AND I LOVED IT.
Review: I have long loved Taika Waititi's satire. Anyone who can make us laugh and also think seriously in a comedy about a young boy in Nazi Germany (Jo Jo Rabbit) can do so even more subversively in a movie that is, at its core, anti-religion, anti-blind faith.

Author: stevesky-15087
Review: Where to start with this absolute mess. The frustrating thing is that it contains glimpses of what we loved about Ragnorok, but, unfortunately, the writing partnership shows its inexperience and this movie is one hot mess. It has no idea what it wants to be. But it is sure of one thing. It wants to reinforce all the wokey stereotypes of the day. Well, well done. You succeeded in that, but along the way it makes for some really bad story telling and third rate scripting. Remove your brain and watch it like a 6 year old and you'll be fine. And BTW who signed up GnR for the sound track. Can't these directors get any original music to use rather than 30 year old dad rock. The closing track by DIO is 40 years old for Gods sake. Don't get me wrong. I love classic rock but it really comes to show a lack of creativity and imagination when you are a director in 2022 and you have to rely on 40 year old music for 90% of your sound track.

Review: Too goofy for my taste... Bale carries the movie, and makes in worth watching, however the kid army was too corny for my taste. Maybe if I was 11 i would find rate this higher.

Even kids are now brought in to fight which makes it all even more cringeworthy.

The only part I didn't like was the women in those white outfits, which isn't sexy to me. The story plot was interesting and kept my attention throughout the movie. I loved the story where Jane and Thor, get together with a loving kiss. Awww However, I do miss his brother Loki. I'm glad Thor grew his hair back, he looks great! I don't think that any type of nudity is appropriate for children under 17 years old.

Author: Slarkshark
Review: Taika went overboard with goofy Thor. It was an absolute perfect balance with 'Ragnarok'. It could be argued even that one was a bit much, but for the most part it was thoroughly enjoyed by everyone and is regarded as one of Marvel's best outings. The same cannot be said for 'Love and Thunder'.

Author: skylermoore
Review_Title: A Comedy Action That Gets Action Right
Review: Thor Love and Thunder is Ragnarok's much worst sequel. This movie is a 2 hour film with mainly the same 3 or 4 jokes over and over. Thor Ragnarok was one of my favorite MCU movies too date so I was so excited for this. However it misses on 90 percent of the comedy, and while that sounds like an extreme, this film is basically a joke after a joke from the first time we see Thor to the end. It never stops. While the comedy was horrible though you have to give credit to the action and visuals in this movie. They are tremendous and truly fun to watch. The standout here was Christian Bale, his portrayal of Gorr was incredible and he stood out as an actor in this movie. Jane Foster as the Mighty Thor works really well which I wasn't expecting and the universe it starts to make cannon in the MCU is also a huge plus.

Author: Hey_Harry
Review_Title: Thor 4 (2022) is still worthy despite some flaws
Review: Like the original Thor film, "Thor: Love and Thunder" is superhero action combined with a love story between Thor and Dr. Jane Foster who makes a final return in this sequel. Love and Thunder is probably the most emotionally-driven Thor film with equal amounts of romance and action followed by a super jazzy soundtrack.

Author: Otis-K
Review_Title: Sorry but it was a waste of time.
Review: It is no secret that MCU movies are getting worse and this is the worst one yet. It was a combination of Xena: The warrior princess from the 90s, but in a form of a low-budget telenovela (even though I doubt this one's budget was low), all packed in an anime-themed wrap.

Author: tim_d3
Review_Title: Christian Bale is great in this

Author: danny-76289
Review_Title: I can't believe this is a movie
Review: Can anyone explain? Genuinely, why would they make this?

Author: maxwelbern
Review_Title: Wasted 2 hours of my life I will never get back
Review: A sequence of random, tasteless and disconnected cliches. The children saving part reminds "save the orphans" song from the "2 and a half men", when everybody is supposed to feel empathy just because the screenwriters say so. Was waiting for this to finally build up to some sort of an adult logic or a twist, but it didn't. Good quality visual effects and actors don't make up for the whole and total 2 hour cringe. I'm not really sure if it was a sabotage or a mockery of the Marvel brand. Or they sold the franchise, the building blocks and templates to a kindergarten. Can't believe the overall score is still so high.

Author: alaisdair-99083
Review: Chris Hemsworth is back for the first fourquel in the Marvel Cinematic Universe with Taika Waititi returning to direct and the original cast returning for a comedic space romp that sees the Thor series finally embracing the Norse mythology and embracing the other gods sprinkled throughout the universe. This time around Natalie Portman returns to the series as the central character taking on a version of Mighty Thor which allows for some great romantic comedy tropes to come into play. The action is bigger, the laughs are louder, the premise is outrageously camp showing there is still life left in the Thor series, Thor : Love and Thunder is the best MCU movie in the current phase, and perhaps the best Thor movie of the series.

Author: mahendraakhilesh
Review: It was good with cameos of zeus, hercules, eternity.

Review: Loved the first couple of Thor installments but this latest production was utterly horrible. Very dark and felt like I needed to take a shower when I got home. I left halfway through and realized Disney will never be the same. I think this is the last Marvel movie I'll ever watch! They just keep getting worse and worse! Don't waste your time or money. Junk!

Author: gaccm
Review: Pretty much drivel. A well-executed fun fest where everything was sacrificed for fun, including logic, the plot, other characters, and the larger world. A movie for children. It was Thor's recovery story and a (potential) ending for Natalie Portman.

Author: ematt-cal
Review: This movie can't make up its mind what it wants to be. It obviously doesn't want to be taken seriously and then expects to be a passable tearjerker.

Author: skeecats

Review: This movie has all the silliness of a cartoon, it sacrifices Thor's very rich experiences and backstory to tell jokes that arent even that funny.

Author: CountJonnie
Review_Title: Few strong moments, buried under a funny mess
Review: After Guardians of the Galaxy, Marvel went into a comedic direction with GOTG2 and Thor 3. Now Thor 4 takes it a step further and pushes it over the edge with non-stop misplaced jokes.

Author: EODGhost
Review: Wow, someone tried way too hard to be funny. In doing so, you pretty much ruined the Thor franchise. This movie was just a sad attempt to make this into a kids show.

Author: ahall122
Review: The fourth Thor movie was such a waste. Every bad bad decision in editing and plotting that could be made in this movie was made. Taika Waititi can't let any moment of drama go by without undercutting it with a bad joke or screaming goat. This is a pitty, because Natalie Portman, Chris Hemsworth and Christian Bale are all giving great performances and deserve better. This movie is filed with purposeless diversion just to shoehorn in pointless cameos. Thor: Love and Thunder seems like it was made by a committee of blind, deaf mutes.

Author: akatexmex
Review: The pacing is solid, the jokes land well, and this movie shifts right to the drama without missing a beat.

Author: jamespreston-58362
Review: Not much else to say, this movie was awful. A real shame, I'm a massive fan of MCU but this was just absolute dross, worst MCU movie by far, not sure what they were thinking?!?!? A real shocker, hopefully they learn from this!

Author: ben-1252
Review: A new low for Marvel. A slapstick comedy with the worst written jokes and a lot of lights and screaming goats (yes, that 10 year old meme). Scorsese was right. This content (not a movie) can be compared to a 5 year old child's crayon drawing.

Author: justicejvm
Review: Why waste Christain bales performance? Way to much woke crap! Just stick to marvel no need for the gay and "sexual identities" it's pathetic they just feel they need to incorporate it and all they did was ruin what should have been a good movie. Hemsworth does not disappoint story is good action is good but feels more like a garbage reach with unnecessary dialogue and identities. It's comical but the latest marvel movies to come out keep adding and incorporating useless needless sexual crap!!!!!! And anymore I go into the movie expecting disappointment and we'll it's getting worse and worse ....

Author: mikicave-69873
Review: Thor is a Marvel character not a parody. This was clearly a parody. Waitit gave us the worst Marvel movie.i hope the next Thor will be a proper superhero movie not a comedy or movie for kids.

Author: skpatriot-32390
