This was a huge zero in the world of Marvel movies and absolutely no fault of the people acting in it! SAD. Did I mention, Love these actors and actresses. Sad to see them misdirected and trying to act out such a flawed story!!!

Author: chris_coombs1975
Review_Title: It's bad, I mean REALLY bad!
Review: Decided to take my daughter to watch it as we both enjoy Marvel movies. Was watching the trailers and didn't even realise the movie had actually started. Disney wokeness shines blinding bright throughout this movie but it's not just that that ruins this movie, acting terrible, story terrible EVERYTHING about this movie is terrible. Yet again we are subjected to a movie that offers nothing and definitely falls into the 'would have been better off never being made' category. Save your money and time and give this trash a miss. Disney are ruining a once magical franchise.

Author: purbanjali
Review: Well definitely not like a typical marvel movie, as we see thor fighting in his cool Jacket and Gym pants... but beautiful narration and sharp humour made it a wholesome movie! I still cant hate the Gorr here, idk if directors really wanted to make his character like that.. Natalie did stole the show everytime she lifted the hammer...! Love it..

Author: jeff53590
Review: Thor: Love and Thunder. All the scenes with Christian Bale were good to great. Well acted and consistent. Everything else was just bad writing and direction. I am not certain why the MCU keeps trying to be a comedy instead of being about super heros I feel bad for the actors that were required to play along with the script. Chris Hemsworth was still able to bring the original Thor out a few times, but for the most part had to stay in his new "comedic" character. Other reviewers ahve likened it to an SNL skit and I agree. They had some funny moments that were pulled far beyond the moment and they just kept on going until it was painful to watch.

Author: stijn-7
Review: At first i thought the beginning was like a exaggerated dream of something or someone. But soon i came to realize that the filmmaker was being "serious". This movie is BAD; it's made for kids and to to be taken serious at all. Perhaps that was the plan; but this does not fit in the Marvel universe at all.

Author: gillespiesan
Review: Just like Ragnarok, there are laughs aplenty and some great cameos in Love and Thunder. Unlike Ragnarok, there isn't really that much of a story and the genuine excitement comes in dribs and drabs. In short, the good is great, the not so good is pretty average. And here's why...

Author: Mr-Fusion
Review_Title: Light-hearted mixed bag, just add muscles
Review: Short and sweet: the movie rides on Hemsworth's charisma, it looks good, and Bale offers up one of Marvel's best villains. Given the doomerism in the world today, my thirst for succinct escapism was quenched, and I had a few good laughs. Job adequately done as far as I'm concerned. This would be rated higher if not for the soundtrack, which completely baffled me.

Author: marveltstodd
Review: From the beginning to the end, everything is a JOKE, and this is not me complaining about the film calling it a joke. Literally, every character and plot device in the film is a joke. You have Chris Hemsworth who CRUSHED it as Thor in all the previous films and the story does not seem to remember any of the story lines or arches in the previous films with Thor. He does not go on a journey or evolve, instead it feels like a parody of the character. You have Oscar winner Natalie Portman coming back to play Jane Foster as The Mighty Thor with the comic story arch which should be a SOLID HOME RUN and the character is written as a joke, why? Last, the film has Oscar winner Christain Bale as the villain Gorr The God Butcher as he is barely in the film and like the other characters is written as a joke. It is one joke after another after another. I don't understand what the director was thinking. He has the budget, the characters, the talent in front and behind the camera and this is what was given? Taika (director) you are better than this!!!! Kevin Feige (President of MCU) where were you? How did you let this happen?? The film has its moments, but my God all the unfunny childish jokes take away from those moments. Also, MCU, Hollywood.. please stop saying you have LGBTQ+ characters if they are represented in 1 second moments that can easily be removed in other countries. This is not representation, it is baiting. I hope Thor stays around and goes under another director.

Author: busaman
Review: Character choices worked for the most part but come on, everything was segmented like a TV program. The Guardians could have been way better used and Jane's Thor, man was the ball dropped there. Like most others have said Bale was excellent as always but putting a "bloated" Russell Crow as Zeus with that weird accent was unbearable. Disney should not be allowed to continue with Marvel movies. They are going to ruin every franchise.

Author: kenzibit
Review: The movie sucks to be honest, bad plot.... infact the only thing I loved about this movie is Christian Bale as Gorr. His performance and look were so rich and incredible. That's all! The rest of the movie is Soo that I tried my possible best to sit through. I mean why would Marvel do something like this? Also what happened to the special effects team? The VFX was so poor in this movie; looked cartoonish and cheap, with un-laughable humor... Only humor I did enjoy aside Bale was the bleating and screaming from the Goats. This is a very forgettable movie and will definitely not add this to my library cuz I feel so ashamed of it. Production and directing were too poor and won't recommend this to anyone.

Author: hoggscarl
Review: People got too much of attention to phase before Endgame. Thats the problem. Come out of the endgame era first. I loved the movie as usual. Nothing to complain. Its a new beginning. So it takes time to build up. New era. We have more surprises in store. Its going to be totally different. Good start to the next phase of Marvel. Emotions and some good comic relief. Will become a classic as days pass. People will realise the worth of this movie lately for sure.

Author: sonamparora
Review: First scene was the highlight of the movie, after that headache inducing toilet humour. Thankfully I nodded off before I was left with a full blown migraine.

Author: dcostaadrian
Review: Don't know what the fuss was all about. People saying it wasn't a good movie? It's better than Doctor Strange: Multiverse of madness. People have been slamming marvel ever since iron man died. Just get over it. The movie had all aspects. Good story, good humour, good action, good music. Go watch this movie with an open mind and you'll love it. It's always a treat to watch Chris Hemsworth and Christian bale in action. A boring movie will divert your attention for a bit, but this movie grips your attention throughout. Lovely writing and great acting. Needless to say, the graphics in marvel movies has always been top notch. Excited to see where the story of love and thunder goes from here. Looking forward to the future movies of the ongoing phase.

Author: semihiparcz
Review: Christian Bale was amazing, and terrifying. But even he cannot save this bad collobration of couple of videos. This thing is a total mess, it made me sleep for the first time in my life while I'm watching a movie. Just remove everything except Christian Bale parts and I'll give it a 6.

Author: mejaflora
Review_Title: Good and bad for this movie
Review: I wouldn't smash this movie to bits as there are some enjoyable parts and then some parts that could have been better, and some parts that were downright cringey. I would start with the best parts:-

Author: njegospb
Review: As the Rock once said, it's the biggest piece of dogs**t. When I look at the old Thor movies where he was jumping around fighting demons from hell, kicking Hulk and all kinds of other stuff and watch this, my stomach twists. How did someone from Marvel look at the scenario and said, people will love this I don't know... Nothing surprises me from them anymore... We didn't have good film from Marvel in like 3-4 years or so, everything is around CGI and special effects bit story wise my 5 year old nephew wouldn't want to watch this... Maybe they will sometimes look at the ratings their movies get.

Author: earthincommonnutrition
Review: This was a very lazy movie. It was literally a joke. No substance. Felt like they think we are stupid and will pay for anything so why not. And maybe they are right. We are pretty stupid in a lot of ways. Just silly very weak story line. I was surprised that the main actors would agree to do something like that but who knows. A B movie.

Author: pagettsgadgets
Review: Marvel yet again managed to destroy another superhero movie, complete lack of substance very contrived humour, which sadly fails over and over.

Author: autumnbrodland
Review: Could've been better. Woke Disney ruined what could've been a fantastic movie. Was my least favorite Thor movie and not kid friendly like the other ones.

Author: tylerlrhoads
Review: I'm a pretty big marvel fan but I must say I have been pretty disappointed since endgame. This movie was a little all over the place. The gods were under utilized and uninteresting, thor was funny but overly so and had no other character traits, Jane was cringey and because of that her sad story line didn't resonate (which sucked because I love Natalie Portman), Tessa Thompson was great as a support character and Bale was a phenomenal villain. I wanted a lot more scenes of Gor the god butcher killing gods as he was by far the best part of the movie. The ending with all of the kids using Thor's powers was corny.

Author: hxiqkcnra
Review: Don't get me wrong it is enjoyable and entertaining, but in the grand scheme feels like a step backwards with Thor's character arc. To many jokes that take away from the potential this movie had.

Author: eb-77766
Review: A very uneven film.. Some parts are quite good, some parts are ok but some parts are also terrible.

Author: starblade-94597
Review_Title: No one has a sense of humor or wonder anymore
Review: Great movie! Funny from start to finish. Writing was great, characters were great. It was just a good time all the way around. Everyone complains about it for being silly or not comic accurate or whatever. I don't care what they say. It felt like when I was a kid reading comics and there was a sense of wonder and whimsy. The movie felt like the writers said what if we could do this or that crazy thing and just did it because they can. It's their universe and they were playing in it. In today's world, no one appreciates this kind of thing anymore. It all has to be diverse or inclusive or politically this or that. People today demand their particular flavor of activism be the main point of a movie. If they don't get their way, well then they need to destroy that movie and it's cast and crew. I feel sad for those who have lost their childlike wonder. Their world is darker for it.

Author: deanwrio
Review: The beginning of the movie was alright but there are so many things I liked about the second half that I ended up loving the movie. The kids fight scene, Jane Fosters fate and the decision made by Gore and what Thor agreed to.o.

Author: guldo
Review: As soon as I heard about this movie I got curious, and then I heard some more about it, and I got less curious. Even so, once it popped up I finally got around to watch it and man, it was even worse than what that nagging feeling about it told me.

Author: Popcorn_Media
Review: Staying in the same vein as its predecessor, LOVE & THUNDER is full of silliness, quirky characters and daft action. Frustratingly the stakes feel rather low this time around and anytime anything meaty comes along, the jokes take priority, for better or for worse. Narratively, just like Thor himself, this forth instalment feels just a little bit lost.

Author: sartazwafi
Review: (Spoiler)I have very little idea about movie review. But after watching thor love and thunder,the problems of the movies were very clear to me. First of all,a menacing villain has kidnapped children.the protagonist is planning to rescue the children.from the start of the planning to go to fight with gore,there is unnecessary comedy,which doesn't go with the plot of the movie at all. Even there is comedic dialogue between an afraid kid and thor. Reunion of thor and jane was supposed to be emotional and romantic. Jane was going through stage 4 cancer. Excessive comedy doesn't go with these situations at all. Before revealation of cancer to thor,there was no way to understand that thor and jane has been reunited after 8 years. I think this kind of tonal inconsistency of the movie was extreme foolishness and stupidity of the director. I have never seen such tonal inconsistency in any movie .In many movies,presence of a good villain elevates the quality of the movie. But i think the character of gorr was not well developed.janes cancer, reunion of jane and thor,gorr the god butcher .... overall the movie seemed to me a huge mess.

Author: xanndy-79589
Review_Title: Don't waste 2 hours of your life
Review: This movie epitomizes what's wrong with this new phase of the MCU.

Author: khbcwzm
Review_Title: Guess a lot of people aren't catching the subtext
Review: A lot of reviews saying the humor is too much. Of course there is a major play towards humor: the remaining parts are basically laying out the real joke on mankind, religion. How gods are basically not listening or will raise a finger to help the people who give them their praise and life. Really drives it home in one line Gorr utters in the end. On first watch, I too felt the humor was a bit much, but upon discussing with a friend of moments I liked, I realized how intense the subject matter was, and how cleverly Taika Waititi hid it. Go and check the Christian reviews, all hung up on the homosexual notes and "false pagan gods" (their actual words) yet not even noticing the defiant cry at the absolute useless nature of their own religion. I am definitely looking forward to a second watch, being more aware.

Author: ariqakbar
Review: I think I get it, it's feel like stand alone movie. Taika really expand his own universe, try a lot of stuff. Which for some pov, it's great. Become something totally fresh.

Author: Oneiric
Review: After a stinky sequence of mostly forgettable and at least one outright bad movie, the post-pandemic MCU gets charged up again with Vikings in Space. It's not the genius romp that Ragnarok is, but Thor, his goats, and his allies (including a PC UN of "Asgardian" children) hit their comic marks, the CGI monsters writhe and wriggle, and two controversial but also accomplished actors bring both a major and a minor villain to wicked life. There's a whole slew of love triangles and odd couplings playing atop a rock-and-roll score and aesthetic, too.

Author: dorukoztugran
Review_Title: MCU lost its seriousness in plot writing
Review: SPOILER ALERT

Author: grantgoodrich-68267
Review_Title: Not sure how this fits into the new MCU but I enjoyed it
Review: Overall a very entertaining and funny film. Good action sequences, good story, great soundtrack and effects, and genuinely a fun movie. While I loved the Mighty Thor as Jane Foster I was sad to see it done in such a quick fashion but I understand there's only so much you can do. Valkyrie could have been more involved but she was given great dialogue and still remained a great onscreen force. Only negative was the poor choice of accent by Russell Crowe as Zeus and me not quite understanding how this movie furthers the new stage of MCU, but the end credit scene was very well done and a great send off/in remembrance of a beloved character.

Author: Wordwhisperer
Review_Title: The worst Thor movie so far
Review: Thor has been transformed from movie to movie into a mockery of a character. I am not sure Disney is trying to make these kind of movie for dumb and dumber. The humor in the movie was kind of forced into the script; very few moments when the humos was needed.

Author: stuartruddick-44927
Review: I felt compelled to create an account to warn people how bad this movie is. Huge fan of Marvel movies but this was actually hard to watch, very nearly walked out. Tried way too hard to make it funny, did not find a balance at all compared with other MCU movies. Storyline was all over the place and was pretty silly in parts too, if I could give 0 stars I would. Complete garbage. Expected so much more from Marvel.

Author: jiminniekyutie
Review_Title: nothing groundbreaking just a fun little thor movie
Review: A fun camp action comedy with romance. While it wasn't as great as ragnarok, it's still better than the majority of the other marvel movies that have come out recently. Tailed delivered once again and though it might not be a perfect masterpiece it was still super enjoyable and entertaining.

Author: meshman-07200
Review: I'm surprised. I'm an MCU fan and liked the other Thor movies but this one was just weird. The best way I can put it, there's a scene like in Ragnarok, of actors doing a play of when Odin died. Their acting was lame and cringey, intentionally so. That's what most of this movie felt like. Dialog was delivered like they were just reading it off of teleprompters and nobody seemed serious about their parts. It's like the actors got together on a weekend, threw something together and could care less whether it was finished or any good.

Author: skywalker-46567
Review: Couldn't pick up any form of theme. I loved Thor Ragnarok theme, but no memorable theme for Love and Thunder. There was some bad languages that were unnecessary and out of place.

Author: joeynos
Review_Title: What they say about Too much of a good thing??
Review: Or, how about the more the sugar, the bigger the sugar crash. Besides another killer soundtrack with this Marvel flick paying an awesome tribute to Guns n Roses, L&T also displays uber-fantastic FX. So what went wrong? L&T intersperses too much silly unnecessary comedy , some of which flat , tired and not funny and too little action. However, when the action arrives , L&T delivers just fine. Unlike its predecessor Ragnarok which perfectly blended great action, FX and comedy , L&D ODs on attempted humor and gets lost while leaving the viewer begging for the stuff that made this particular franchise food of the gods. Disappointed and left empty. To footnote, Christian Bale's performance, per usual, is definitely a major plus!

Author: ackerman-dalton
Review: This movie can be understood to me as a misinterpretation of how to continue a direction that was working for Thor Ragnarock and GotG. The comedic elements of those films are an understanding that a universe that includes the unbelievable possibilities of space and the multiverse can't be taken so seriously as to ignore the ridiculousness of a talking raccoon and tree or a realm of space Gods on a floating disc with a rainbow bridge. It does the magnificent. Retaining the much loved elements of the comics and original idea of their writers and figured out a way for them to make sense together with out forcing us to pretend it works. Instead it coaxes us to attachment with the tree that can say one phrase using comedy and heart felt connection.

Author: sheshercat-55641
Review_Title: I walked out it was so bad
Review: This is a sad excuse for a movie. Just stupidity. Ridiculous plot. I have sat through several of the Thor and other DC movies and been entertained pretty much even though I go because it's what my husband wants to see. However, I couldn't take it any more after an hour and I walked out to wait for him in the car. He came out of the theater and said it didn't get any better. What a waste of time and money! All those A-listers should be embarrassed for being a part of this money-grabbing Hollywood production.

Author: paisley-dan
Review_Title: Why? What would make Disney ruin the MCU so brutally?
Review: I have been a marvel comic nerd since I was 6 years old. Thor has always been a staple for me. Nothing about this movie speaks to any Thor comics I've ever read. Maybe something newly created resembles this.

Author: Hesashi
Review: The script has a great premise, and I was absolutely loving hearing about not only of the inclusion of the Mighty Thor arc but also bringing Natalia Portman back with new shoes to fill. But her arc didn't feel important enough and comedy and jokes came in the way for the drama that in my opinion is equally as important as action and funny stuff.

Author: jw7
Review: After the Avengers Infinity War and End Game, the MCU movies keep getting worse and worse... It was not because that End Game set up a great standard, it's just that all other MCU movies after it suck!! It will not take long before MCU losing its loyal audiences.... The Thor series peeked at 3 and then took a deep nosedive to get this low....

Author: davydaws
Review: 2 hours of a forgettable story. Chasing laughs with weak jokes and poor writing. Shame really, felt as if they have tried to out do Ragnarok and as a result the plot and characters have fallen to the wayside.

Author: sansupercool
Review: Don't waste your time on this movie, let it on in the side but don't look up.

Author: jigarbhadra-40861
Review: Christian Bale has done an excellent job but justice was not done to gorr, movie lacks seriousness even in the intense scenes. Movie is full of jokes some are good but some are not timed right and feels unwanted.

Author: bobbyem-1
Review_Title: Marvel should sue Taika for this movie
Review: This is far the worst Marvel movie in my opinion.

Author: SenethavilayCasey
Review: Love and Thunder is a reminder that Marvel can still get it done. It's funny, action packed, and even emotional at times. Much like Ragnarok this one feels like it's own little adventure, which is perfect for the MCU today. The score/soundtrack is amazing, and the visuals are really good. Christian Bale played a great and honestly terrifying villain. He had limited screen time, but he stole the show for me. Everything in Love and Thunder just worked so well. The cast played well off each other, and you can tell they have a real chemistry. Overall, this film is a relief that MCU fans deserve after a slew of mediocre films recently. A reminder that the MCU is still king.

Author: dmoorejr
Review: I already prepared myself for the humor in this movie. It is Taika Waititi afterall. It's a bit heavy handed. Some of the jokes were just super cringe. Had some great visuals through. I thought all the cinematography regarding Gorr was super inventive, and top notch. Wish they leaned more into the heavy metal stuff but what we got was pretty mint. Gorr as a villain was intriguing. Menacing. Jane's story was tasteful. Disappointed with how they handled certain characters without going into spoilers. While this flick was entertaining, I can't help but think this is more "Meet The Spartans" than "300". And Marvel Studios keeps doubling down on this type of humor in all their properties. So that's just their standard as of now.

Author: haydenkatz-09098
Review: I had a great time watching this. It was fun and memorable. I liked the action, visually it was great with the color grading and cinematography, character arcs were pretty good with Thor learning to love again only to lose it again then find it in a child, Jane was really interesting and I liked watching her deal with cancer and I thought it was a good ending where she essentially killed herself to save the universe but she went to Valhalla so that was a good ending. Christian Bale did great with his performance being the selling point for his character. The story was really good, making complete sense and having lots of logic backing it. My problems are that I think the movie is too fast paced, at least in the first act. The humor didn't work at all, which it doesn't have to, marvel movies aren't necessarily comedies, but I think I expected it to be funny b/c of Ragnarok. But that's it. I had a really good time watching this movie.

Author: basvdwallen
Review: What's up with all the negative reviews?

Author: juniorgarry-55456
Review_Title: The title was accurate to the movie
Review: If you loved ragnarok you'll love this one for sure, it was truly a Taika Watiti movie to the fullest . I loved the jokes but at moments it was getting repetitive and I wish there was more god slaying from gorr but Christian did an amazing performance. All that aside this movie was fun and had amazing action sequences and it was a love and comedy story more then a Marvel movie which is unique .

Author: i_dont_even
Review: It was a fun ride. CGI is pretty good, story straightforward, action rather ok. Nothing especially ambitious which means it's a shame that Christian Bale was wasted on this. Won't satisfy Marvel edgelords, but if you're not one, it's not a time fully wasted. Movie doesn't treat itself seriously so the humor exists but doesn't necessarily land. It has a good pace.

Author: russelllade
Review_Title: Uber woke with weak acting and storyline
Review: What a waste of time. I've always been a huge marvel and Thor fan, but this was a sad waste of time. Wish they would bring back good old fun movies instead of focusing on their weaving their agenda into as many aspects of the movie as possible and losing the plot along the way!!!

Author: cordellm1
Review: I'm not sure exactly what made this movie subpar, it's a lot of little complicated things. And generally, either too much Taika Waititi or too little - I can't tell if the studio was the problem or not. So I'll just highlight the most glaring issues. One, Gorr definitely does not show up enough. It's embarrassing and a definite waste of talent. The 'God Butcher' only slays ONE god on screen. Second, the film goes by too fast, especially in the beginning, and the dialogue feels lazy as a result. Like trying to get a lot of information delivered without much thought on the delivery.

Author: hayjiggy
Review: Really fun to watch. Waititi's writing and direction is funny, we'll-timed, and creative. It has exactly what I want in a Thor movie: humor, classic music, LGBTQ+ representation, the right amount of tenderness, and plenty of himbo energy. If you like Ragnarok I think you'll really enjoy this one.

Author: shakthi-82794
Review_Title: This was disappointing. Worst entry in the MCU universe.
Review: The movie for the most part of it felt very unfocused. There were some possibilities of a serious and engaging storytelling in it's plot, but was ruined by the addition of humor.

Author: benwiskin
Review_Title: Who is this film even for?
Review: I really don't know where to begin except, this is probably the worst film in the MCU.

Author: crazyburn87
Review: Christian Bale does a wonderful job as Gorr the God Butcher and Natalie Portman bring back some great emotional scenes between her and Hemsworth.

Author: nickkvanheester
Review_Title: This isn't an action/adventure movie it's a comedy movie with silly overused jokes
Review: The fact this movie is part of the mcu is absurd!

Author: erscrimgeour
Review: I absolutely LOVED ragnarok. It's a masterfully paced movie with excellent chemistry, from which comedy erupts effortlessly. By contrast, love and thunder feels forced. It continues its predecessor's saturday-morning-cartoon silliness, constant stream of jokes, and bright aesthetic, while retaining little to none of its chemistry. Its characters are thrown in similarly wacky scenarios, but they feel forced, rather than natural and seamless.

Author: monemthedon
Review: Over time, Marvel movies have undergone changes that have caused some viewers to feel that the films have deviated from their previous status as enjoyable family-friendly entertainment. These viewers argue that the inclusion of subtle agendas within the narratives has been poorly executed, raising questions about the need to prioritize storytelling over messaging. While there may have been moments that resonated with audiences, they were not sufficient to make the films suitable for children. This dissatisfaction is expressed through a strong negative sentiment towards the current state of Marvel films.

Author: deloresjack
Review: Gore wants to bring his daughter back to life and it looks like his wish will come true. However, Love's reflection seems more like an eternity than a normal child, and he has powers that he doesn't seem to have had before his death. His strange appearance and origins suggest that Love may actually be a singular version of the Marvel Cinematic Universe. In Marvel Comics, the Singularity appears in the sky after the collapse of the multiverse and reaches Arcadia in the 16191 timeline.

Author: radr-20417
Review: I originally wanted to give one star for this horrible horrible movie...but I was generous with two only because Christian Bale was amazing. Natalie Portman should have her Oscar taken away for her horrible performance. The whole thing was nothing hit a money grab.

Author: AustinTheFilmCritic
Review: Thor : Love and Thunder is an astonishing piece of diversity and inclusion. Being the first Marvel film to include a character of Greek decent. Crowe's portrayal of a fat, greedy and perverted Zeus is just the kind of role model young Greek boys have always needed. 8.94/10.

Author: vamanatds
Review:
Boring, Bad jokes, Long, Uninteresting,
No serious story or logic.. just whatever..,
Portman had no real reason to be in it..they just wanted a female thor..because why not..
Also the Guardians of the Galaxy had no real reason to be in it..they just wanted them in for a while..because why not..

Author: kobemackenzie
Review: Thor: love and thunder follows Thor as he tries to stop a god killer while also dealing with his ex being Thor now. The movie had a engaging storyline with some great humour and action scenes with some great CGI. I think this Thor had the best character development for everyone and we got introduced to some new characters and saw some old. Thor is still badass as ever.

Author: fvhimawan
Review_Title: Entertaining and easy to watch.... as usual
Review: The Thor series has become more and more comedy and this sequel shows it all.

Author: Equestria_Guy
Review_Title: Felt Like a Disney Live Action Remake
Review: This movie had so much potential. It could've been darker and more mature. Christian Bale nailed his role. His character, though, doesn't belong here. This movie feels like it was made for a bunch of elementary school kids. Everything that could've been great was butchered by an endless comedy.

Author: niallh-66092
Review_Title: A forgettable experience that somehow does unforgettable damage
Review: Every time I see a new Marvel project I am forced to think of a few things. I hope the writers know how to treat this character properly. I hope they dont try completely change them from what people loved for arbitrary reasons. I hope the story being told is a good one, and one that respects the characters and what they've been through to get here. These kinds of questions didnt need to be asked before this phase, because the MCU did all these things without fail. That's what made it good. But unfortunately they do need to be asked now, as almost everything they do goes against what made them great.

Author: yzrahava
Review: What a letdown honestly. To think that I had been waiting for this for years, like any Marvel fan, and walking out feeling like I wasted two hours on a half arsed kiddie movie that wasn't even funny. Ugh.

Author: mcmeyes
Review_Title: Fun Thor Movie With Decent Story
Review: Don't know what's wrong with some of the reviewers, this is pretty fun Thor movie. The action, magic, emotion, good soundtrack and a decent storyline, its all there.

Author: xzxfrqwj
Review: The only thing they could've done better with this movie is not deleting the scene where Valkyrie licks her sword and generally having more Valkyrie😩😭😭

Author: annnafs
Review: I'll start by saying this movie is not for everyone. If you like action and plot this movie is not for you. But if you like funny characters and memorable lines then you will love this movie. I think some people expected too much from this movie and it's how come there have been a few bad reviews but overall this is a really good addition to the MCU. The MCU has changed since it's first movie and whether that is a good or bad thing is yet to be seen but Thor love and thunder is a great addition.

Author: wtcook-97856
Review_Title: Not deliverying up to it's hype.
Review: After pretty cool and refreshing Thor:Rangarok it's sequel does not live to expectations. Script is really lame and Taika Waititi did sloppy job with direction (apparently Rita Ora got too much of his attention while filming). Camera often is pretty horrendoes, we got a lot of unneccessary close-ups and rest looks like a very cheap editing. Story jumps erraticaly between comedy and horror movie and blend is far from seamless. Overall it's a pretty weak movie even by Marvel standards.

Author: joper-1995
Review_Title: This movie is literally a marvel creation
Review: Every so often in "Thor: Love and Thunder," the 92nd Marvel movie to hit theaters this year the studio machinery hits pause, and the picture opens a portal to another dimension: Its star, Chris Hemsworth, embraces wholesale self-parody, a pair of giant screaming goats gallop along a rainbow highway and Russell Crowe flounces around in a flirty skirt and Shirley Temple curls. As the movie briefly slips into a parallel realm of play and pleasure, you can feel the director Taika Waititi having a good time. It starts with a pasty, near-unrecognizable Christian Bale, who, having been relieved of his DC Dark Knight duties, has signed up with Marvel as a villain with the spoiler name of Gorr the God Butcher. Waititi quickly sketches in Gorr's background, giving it a tragic cast. Believing himself betrayed by the god he once worshiped, Gorr is committed to destroying other deities. It's potentially rich storytelling terrain, particularly given Thor's stature and Marvel's role as a contemporary mythmaker. But while Bale takes the role by the throat, as is his habit, investing the character with frictional intensity, Gorr proves disappointingly dull.

Author: acuipylo
Review: Sorry to say this but I've always had a hard time watching Marvel movies. Movies and characters need heart behind them and it feels like a lot of them lack this heart in favor of fan service and ways to make the most money possible. Most of them are overly dramatic and the jokes that do make it in don't usually land for me. But I remember watching Ragnarok with my family and... laughing? Didn't even know who Taika Waititi was until earlier this year and was surprised to see he wrote the one Marvel movie I enjoyed. As expected, his 2nd Marvel movie didn't disappoint either! Honestly, Gorr wasn't the most compelling villain but he served his purpose. Christian Bale needed more screentime!

Author: donritz
Review: This movie has some really great elements.

Author: manurnair5-330-715446
Review: Taika did good with comedy last time. He tried to pull it off again but it was an overkill. Trying to add too much comedy and the movie lost the plot.

Author: imaginelovinglife
Review: Christian Bale really needed more screen time. I would have traded off some of the jokes for more character development and acting from Christian Bale. The way he performed or acted was amazing. It was like night and day compared to the others. He had some good scenes.

Author: Bruh263_Movies
Review_Title: I'm sorry but the humor is too much man
Review: The humor Is just so overblown that whenever the film has actual serious moments it just doesn't fit with the tone of the film. Taika Waititi made this movie for actual children where there has be so MUCH UNFUNNY COMEDY! The visuals and action are the only really great things about due to it being messy,Having a weird direction and humor that doesn't make you laugh. Jane also holding the name of Thor was ridiculous. Thats Thor's Name not a title! Seriously Disney I loved Thor Ragnarok and it's humor but this is just clownish.

Author: domper-43844
Review: The fact this movie was written by Taika Watiti and Ragnarok wasn't says everything. The whole movie is a huge disappointment, spending way too much time on the jokes and not enough on the story. It was like they fired out every idea they had hoping something would land. This movie had so much potential but instead made every character look like an idiot and Thor was stripped of any depth from his previous films. All serious points of the movie were laughed off and rushed past. As many have said it was genuinely like watching a piss take of the movie itself. I love marvel but I've never wanted to leave the cinema more. Christian Bale was great with what he was given but it was a huge blunder for Marvel - he could have been a main villain for phase 4 giving it a purpose which seems to be lacking in a lot of movies in this phase. I can't believe this came out the way it did!

Author: southdavid
Review: "Thor: Ragnarok" is, for me, one of the highlights of the MCU so far. The broadest comedy of the series and almost a reinterpretation of the character of Thor that sticks to this day. So, anticipation was high for "Love and Thunder", perhaps too high, as having seen the film it's a 'like' rather than a 'love' for me.

Author: toseale
Review: Taika Waititi took another stab at the Thor movies after his huge success with Thor:Ragnarok, and while it was a fun ride, it wasn't able to top its predecessor. Thor: Love and Thunder was everything but boring. The jokes are shot off at every chance given, and the majority land well. In my opinion, it did the one thing Marvel fans are scared of: became a comedy. It was a fresh take on superhero movies in the sense that it didn't just have comedy, but can be classified under the comedy genre. Waititi has a brilliant, zany mind, and this movie really showed that. Christian Bale's Gorr the God Butcher was excellent, and truly a scary villain. Every character had good development as the movie progressed, and Chris Hemsworth was clearly putting a lot of effort into Thor's personality, which payed off. Plus, Natalie Portman's Jane Foster made an epic return, something anyone can get excited for. The movie also gave us a lot of new, exciting characters and things to look forward to in the future - something every Marvel fan loves. While the plot itself was a bit fast paced, and it kind of felt hard to keep up with the different scenes and settings at times, it still carried itself well. So while it may not be the best of the Thor franchise, it was still a blast, and definitely something I can't wait to see again.

Author: Helloistme
Review:
This film was horrible in every way the plot promised a lot, but everything is left aside to give importance to boring and mediocre characters (tessa topsson's character) thor movies were never even at least 70% faithful to the comics so you can never expect anything, especially from current hollyweird the only redeeming and sadly wasted quality is christian bale's villain otherwise l, this is so mediocre, cheap and tacky
I will not watch the next movie, since Thor will become a woman, enough of this nonsense

Author: lisafordeay
Review_Title: Not as good as the 1st movie.
Review:
Thor Love And Thunder is a 2022 action prequel starting Chris Hemsworth,Christian Bale,Tessa Thompson and Nataile Portman
Directed by Taika Waititi,the movie is the 4th installment of the Thor franchise and follows a god killer names Gorr( played by an unrecognisable Bale) who seeks revenge on the gods as they killed his daughter. So it's up to Thor,Valkyrie and Jane Foster(who's now a super hero due to a broken hammer which makes her stronger since she is actually dying) to stop Gorr before it's too late in Asgard.

Author: neiker
Review: I thought I was bored of Marvel movies but this movie changed that a bit. Definitely an improvement over the last 2 or 3 movies of the MCU. Hope they keep improving the writing instead of rely on cameos.

Author: kianjames-02823
Review_Title: More thunder in the action than love of the story.
Review: I liked this film. Filled with gags, sometimes too many. Christian Bale as Gorr provided for one of the greatest MCU villain portrayals, just under Josh Brolin's Thanos. Just under-utilised with the lack of screen time. Hemsworth, great as always. Nothing more to be said there.

Author: joshuaclieske
Review: I am a fan of all the previous Thor films, I am a big fan of the character... and that's why I didn't like how they made Thor kinda pathetic in Avengers Endgame... and a pathetic comic relief at that. It feels like because Ragnarok was such a success, they assume that making a Thor film with more jokes is all it takes to make a good Thor movie. Story, character, and everything else get NO effort here! It's all sacrificed in attempt to get laugh! I'll admit that Ragnarok has some good comedy, but here it doesn't land nearly as much, AND Ragnarok's story so much better than the nonsense that is Love and Thunder. So the end result is a story even WORSE than Thor: the dark world that's down right failing to be as good of a comedy as ragnarok. I don't know if it's the worst MCU movie of all but it's easily my least favorite.

Author: AvionPrince16
Review: I found the movie pretty off topic mostly because the director of Taika Waititi is a director who more into comedy genre. And we can see that the movie have some bad jokes, nudity (that is pretty unusual in the marvel movies and really feel not like a Marvel movie). Its pretty classic and the more interesting parts was the part where Thor doubt about the love and stuff and we see also that he will be aware of the health problem of his love. I was glad to see the guardians of the galaxy. But what i really enjoyed is the part where Christian Bale was there and for me that man and his performance as an evil guy was really convincing and make me go into it each time with him. I enjoyed the white and black part and the special effects in general. I found the make up of Christian Bale really good and make him a really interesting evil. For me he saved the entire movie from his performance to be honest. But overall i didnt enjoyed it and find the jokes too much present and the sexual side was not necessary. Pretty disappointing marvel. Even if it have some interesting moments with Thor and Nathalie Portman.

Author: saumyashikhar-35317
Review: Kinda disappointed with this one.......too much comedy ruined the movie for me.....some jokes were over the top.....sometimes I was thinking whether am watching a parody of Thor movies.....Christian Bale was the best part of the movie.....he acted so well and I think better than all other actors.... I think this movie is well suited for OTT viewing experience only.... I didn't like the pre climax involving the kids....

Author: IonicBreezeMachine
Review_Title: A solid story that touches on themes of grief and loss that finds itself suffocated by directorial excess and an overly jokey tone
Review: While working alongside the Guardians of the Galaxy, Thor (Chris Hemsworth) and his companion Korg (Taika Waititi) part ways with the Guardians after learning of a distress signal from his Asgardian comrade Sif (Jamie Alexander). As Thor comes to Sif's aid he learns someone known as Gorr The God Butcher (Christian Bale) has been murdering the various Gods throughout the universe using the Necrosword and now has his sights set on New Asgard on Earth. Once there Thor fends off Gorr's shadow monsters alongside New Asgard leader Valkyrie (Tessa Thompson) and is met by surprise when he learns Jane Foster (Natalie Portman) now wields Mjolnir which unbeknownst to Thor was a last resort by Jane to stave off her aggressive cancer. When Gorr manages to abduct the Asgardian children, Thor, Jane, Valkyrie, and Korg team up and set out to find help from the other Gods and stop Gorr's rampage.

Author: ncarolina-43197
Review_Title: Disney is great at making trash
Review: Title pretty much says it all. Marvel movies officially suck and are trash like most everything else Disney puts out nowadays.

Author: masonfisk
Review_Title: YOU GOT YOUR ZANY COMEDY IN MY MCU FILM...!
Review: The latest MCU film starring Chris Hemsworth as the God of Thunder. Hemsworth has dropped the weight he had put on in Endgame but gained more in the form of the Guardians of the Galaxy who he's hitched a ride with to pass the time having adventures with but things are at a lull for him as he contemplates retirement but then Gorr: the God Butcher, Christian Bale, is wrecking havoc across the galaxy murdering deities in an effort to extract revenge on higher beings who let him down when his daughter perished from thirst even though his prayers were loud & often. Meanwhile back on Earth, Thor's ex, returning champ Natalie Portman (not seen since The Dark World), is suffering from stage 4 cancer & she's at the end of her rope until she decides to make a trip to New Asgard for a cure which comes in the form of a reconstituted Mjolnir & her becoming the Mighty Thor which sends main Thor into a tizzy since he wants his woman back (& his hammer as well). What's a god to do when his plate is full? Taika Waititi is back (after directing Ragnarok) bringing oodles of his absurdist humor & kitchy visuals (a lot of it reminded me of 1980's Flash Gordon which I think Waititi is making a new animated version of) to bear w/the jokes & gags coming a mile a minute (just by the sheer volume not all of them hit the bullseye) & w/a game cast even the stingiest of Marvel fans will give up a smile.

Author: matthewssilverhammer
Review_Title: And is it too much to ask that Thor have just ONE unqualified happy ending???
Review: "Love & Thunder" is like a fun but forgettable filler comic - silly, short, bright, diverting, feigning import, & largely lacking substance. The biggest problem is the incessant humor fighting against the uber-serious themes. I miss Branagh's Shakespearean self-seriousness that used to ground this character. Don't get me wrong; it's often quite funny, but when there are ten overly self-aware jokes every minute, some are bound to work.

Author: rich-man82
Review:
I cannot believe I'm giving this film a 2 out of 10. Ragnarok is in my top 5 favourite marvel films. Because of that I was very much looking forward to this film...
Ragnarok had the perfect blend of comedy, seriousness and action. This simply did not. As you have probably read in other reviews the comedy is just constant throughout... and it starts to get annoying quite early on. The joking becomes extremely irritating because you are waiting for the film to really begin and for me it doesn't. Thor has become a parody of himself. Its like he's become a fool. 30 minutes into this film it was obvious that it was going to be a let down so I just slumped in my chair and waited for the end...
The acting from Hemsworth was OK, I actually think he can be funny but it did start to bore me. Bale was superb, but not used enough. He did seem quite unsettling at times as Gorr which is to his credit. He slays many gods, he cuts off Sifs arm in battle... but you do not see any of this... you are just told. His fight scenes with the Thors are probably the best thing about this film. Visually they were stunning but there were not enough of them.

Author: batman-823-915598
Review: Wow I was blown away with how good this movie is. I laughed I cried I was shocked. I enjoyed every minute of this movie. I would highly recommend anyone see this movie.

Author: davetooke
Review: This franchise has gone the exact way the Batman franchise went 25 years ago...until it went back to its dark and more serious roots..I found this movie ridiculous for anyone under the age of seven..and don't get me wrong these movies are based on comic books meant for children which is all this movie has to offer..immature nonsense perfectly harmless but lost on any adult audience...Disney are destroying the industry with this utter liberal appeasing garbage watch at your own peril people or be prepare yourself for severe disappointment.....let us please watch the Batman series made by Nolan and build on that for there lies the promised land of all encompassing entertainment for all ages..

Author: Reviews_of_the_Dead
Review_Title: Another Fun Popcorn Movie from the MCU
Review: The Thor series of movies were ones that I wasn't fully interested originally but have become my favorite of the original group of Avengers. This one also pulled my interest with the villain being Gorr and played by Christian Bale. This one I watched with Jaime as there are certain superhero films she will still watch.

Author: alinpopad
Review: Bad story, comics, scene, mixed feelings that spoiled my night. I don,t recommend at all, worst sentiment I had in my all life about this movie.

Author: amazon-39476
Review: They should have warned us. We were looking forward to this THOR-Movie for quite some time now ... expecting a "real" THOR-Movie. Now ... without warning ... it's only a parody ... a bad one ... dragging the Brand Value of THOR down the drain. The whole flick, including the unbarably lame humor seems to target a whole other target group. It's a slap in the face for real MARVEL-Fans. In some scenes I even thought ... was this a vain attempt to bring Monty Python humor to the MCU? Even the CGI was below MCU--standards. THOR will be back? How will he recover from that?

Author: RageQuitLeigh
Review: Further evidence of the quantity over quality policy currently adopted by Disney for most of the franchise brands they now own. Since 'End Game' with the exception of Spider-Man we mostly have been subjected to quite poor MCU outings whether on the big screen or TV and Thor 4 is no exception.

Author: irongix
Review: Very silly and over the top in story and visuals. Movie moves at a brisk pace but slows down at the romantic moments.

Author: AvidWatcher101
Review_Title: Not great but not as bad as user reviews make it out to be.
Review: Some of the things that bugged other folks didn't bother me at all. I liked the jokes, the kids, the romance, and the basic premise which is that love triumphs over revenge. The only bit I didn't like was Russell Crowe as Zeus the egotistical. Was the accent meant to be Greek? Look, as we get older the metabolism slows and the pounds go on. I am a prime example. But wouldn't the powerful Zeus , God of Gods, have more of a "God bod", as it's called when Thor gets back in shape? With the bulging golden armor and little white skirt it was all a bit cringey. Zeus aside, there are some honestly good scenes, some character growth, and some really decent action. And.. I liked the soundtrack.

Author: michaelterry79
Review_Title: Big disappointment after so much anticipation
Review: Before the release, I thought this had a chance of surpassing Top Gun Maverick, presumably behind the December Avatar release for top grossing movie of 2022. After eagerly awaiting this movie, it didn't take long at all to realize that it would not be able to reach those expectations.

Author: ash_dunn
Review: As movies go, it's ok. There are a few stand out moments in the film and to me it felt like some of the best bits have already been shown in adverts and press junkets. It felt like there were too many stories running simultaneously.

Author: nimrod-14908
Review: If you're 10 or under you'll probably love this, but for anyone who enjoys more than kiddies cartoons? Prepare to be very VERY dissapointed. It's purile rubbish, no plot worth speaking about and the acting is terrible, even for a franchise film.

Author: kieron-44166
Review: L&T is another Waititi masterpiece. 10/10. Guess the "critics" don't like Taika anymore. Movie has it's ups and downs, but overall, I love it. Taika rarely dissapooints me. Ragnarok, Jojo Rabbit and now L&T r all masterpieces IMHO.

Author: hjakephillips
Review: I hate the word cringe. It's over used and not used correctly, mostly. But I couldn't stop cringing at the "humor" In the movie. Bale was good but under used. Plot points in this movie creates huge plot holes and creates questions for movies like Infinity war and end game.

Author: strabgerthings
Review_Title: Thor: Love and Thunder - A Badly Written, Colorful Disaster
Review: I went into Thor: love and thunder with high hopes because of how good ragnarok was but i was very dissapointed. This movie is filled with so many jokes that really weigh the film down for me. The plot of the movie warrants a more serious tone but what we got was much different. The performances are mostly good with Chris Hemsworth, Natalie Portman, and Christian Bale as standouts. Christian Bale really carried this movie for me, and if it were not for Gorr and his scenes being as good as they were, this would have a lower score. Other than the Gorr scenes, this movie feels like some sort of parody of the MCU. The jokes aren't funny, there is an overload of colors filling the screen, and the writing is, at some points, laughably bad. This movie is, in my opinion, a huge dissapointment coming from he same guy who did Ragnarok.

Author: aminmnr
Review: Okay the real question is why is MCU moving further and further away from what it built leading to Endgame?

Author: moviemonki
Review: The first act is told as a legend, an "Epic Thor Adventure," we're told. The dialogue and action are often heightened like a play. The choice is over-the-top and fun. Or, depending on expectations, too odd and silly.

Author: questl-18592
Review: Why is Thor so hard to get right? Thor 1, so average. Thor 2... We try to not talk about. Thor 3 was great and now... Yikes. I have to believe Waititi was being pressured by studio execs. I refuse to believe that he would've created something like this on his own. He's too good. This thing was a mess, it was awful. It really felt like big MCU trying to recreate Ragnarok but stripping it of its soul. Hemsworth is trying, Portman is amazing and even she can't save this from being a mess. Oh, and Bale... Bale is doing the best he can with what he's being given. That's just it though, I don't feel like it's on the actors, they each feel like they're trying but you can only do so much with so little. It's really hard to watch these Post-Endgame movies and not think Marvel is starting to circle the drain. Had a good run, but wow does it feel like we're grasping at straws now.

Author: steelershane
Review: This movie has some humor that works at times, but that is the best thing that you could say about Thor: Love and Thunder. Everything looks mailed in with this effort. The gags often go on too long and overused, even scenes that are supposed to be emotional are not. I never thought the tone was right, it never feels like a MCU film. Yeah, they have some of the actors and the costumes, but something isn't right. Some of the CGI doesn't look right either. Several actors look miscast or just putting on a terrible performance.

Author: alexandreperes-96669
Review: I never could've think that this film was going to be worse than the trailer. Good things about this movie? The soundtrack is amazing, for sure. The colours are stunning and the CGI on this thing is pretty good. And that's it. The story is super standart-ish and the comedy is very mediocre. Everything that happens in this movie is super predictable, and that could not be a bad thing, but it is on this film. The characters appear to have their personality destroyed. There were many ways to insert in there many cameos to make the movie better, but that didn't happen.

Author: cococola4444
Review: The music was awesome and fitting, the acting was fantastic, the inclusion representation, the visuals, the storyline... all well done. It was cool seeing Christian Bale's kids and Chris Hemsworth's family in it, too. I loved the fact they gave Korg more lines and spotlight. It was such an action packed and emotional journey. Enjoy it!

Author: dindaalifahhany
Review: I can understand why many hate MoM, Eternals, Ms. Marvel, or Hawkeye. But i really don't understand why many hate "Love and Thunder", cause i truly love it. Y'all love "ragnarok" but dislike "love and thunder" while both of the movie being very similar. For me Love and Thunder is even richer and more creative. I think it's not MCU quality that is reducing, but the fans expectation that's getting higher. Y'all get stuck on endgame and want every new movie to be on endgame level. Instead of setting the standard, we should focus into the new/fresh idea that MCU bring to us. We are on the new build right now, it's like intermission after the peak. Don't get too rushed.

Author: moviesgamesandvideos
Review: I just stopped watching after about 30 minutes or so. The film was so tragically corny and unfunny I had no interest to continue watching.

Author: mrsdanielleedwards
Review_Title: Fun film with a deeper meaning
Review: This film started off with tears, ended with tears, but I laughed through the middle. It was a fun Thor movie with little clues to the end sprinkled throughout. The directors choice to go black and white for a certain part of the movie, was so well done. I really loved this films ability to make you connect with the entire cast - heroes and villain.

Author: major13
Review: I don't know man. This movie is probably funny if you're under 16 - for everyone else it's just painful to watch this forced and stupid humour in every second goddamned scene. There are a few jokes that are sympathetic like the - god of dumplings - but other than that it's not very creative. Visuals are great (of course) but that's not enough to save the movie from an extremely bad script. Even Christian Bale can't save this trainwreck of a movie. If you thought - Thor Ragnarok - was funny you might even like this movie. Waititi went extra 1000 miles to put even more of those juvenile, empty jokes inside this movie.

Author: Brother_Maynards_Brother
Review: Sadly, this production is quite frivolous. Irritating rather than captivating. Could not wait for it to reach its conclusion. I very much enjoy "Ragnarök" (and LOVE Taika's "What We Do In The Shadows") and the bulk of the earlier Marvel flicks but this comes off as a weak children's movie. Thunder a-plenty in terms of decibels cannot smother the fact that this is celluloid gossamer.

Author: segevohayon
Review: This movie actually is the opposite from the last movie of Thor.

Author: PedroPires90
Review: The story doesn't make sense, but there are some scenes (Zeus, black and white, final battle) that are pretty good and the comedic bits work for the most part.

Author: niko-oinonen
Review: Thor: Love and Thunder like the previous one Ragnarok is really a comedy film. It has got very much the signature feel of Taika Waititi. I didn't care for Ragnarok, and the same issues are present here, but at least some of the jokes land a bit better.

Author: jeppers81-642-272224
Review: Bringing in Melissa Mcarthy even just for a moment destroys everything!! Then on to childish acting/script and dialogues, bad fighting scenes, lame humor, giant goats screaming like little girls. This is a total disappointment and ruined what Thor was in the past marvel movies!!!!

Author: morrisfotograf
Review_Title: When I was young I thought it was called soolicide...
Review: But now I know how to spell that word correctly and my thoughts almost every minute I watched this horrible waste of human effort... Was about how to slowly shove a dull spoon from my ribs upwards to my now stupified brain.

Author: lynn-heckles
Review: Loved seeing what the characters are doing but it could have been an hour special on disney plus rather than a film. Had some funny parts in it but it was mostly a stepping stone in the marvel universe.

Author: Johnny-the-Film-Sentinel-2187
Review_Title: Bit too much of a... good thing? I don't know.
Review: Thor: Love and Thunder does its best being a true sequel to Ragnarok but the key elements are missing this time around: and that's Thor's buddy-relationship with his brother Loki. Christian Bale's character is like a stand-in for God of War's Kratos in terms of archetype, make-up and also fees like a 'campy-go-grumpy' stand-in for Tom Hiddleston's iconic trickster.

Author: hosseinalien
Review: I really don't know what happened to Thor, this movie was much weaker than its previous part, Thor Ragnarok, maybe it is the worst and weakest movie of Thor. In this movie, we saw Alki's joke. It was nice at first, but then it was not good. Thor's thunder and special effects were not good, but Gore was a good villain, but we had not seen the slaughter of gods. Zeus was not well, then he was quickly killed by his own thunderbolt. This movie didn't have a good ending at all. In fact, this movie is a good movie for children and those who haven't seen the news, trailers, and teasers of the movie. I really expected more from this movie, even though it was a weak movie, but Thor was the lovely Thor.

Author: navillusds-73601
Review_Title: Glad I didn't buy a ticket to watch this
Review: I have enjoyed the Thor movies that came before "Love & Thunder," but this one was just bad. I had heard/read reviews about the poor attempts at humor, but overlooked them because I always make up my own mind, and rarely agree with bad reviews from critics, especially about humor. However, I found this movie completely un-funny and I kept waiting for the barely-there plot to develop. I was interested to see how the Jane-as-Thor happened, and I'm not mad at that because although I am not a comic book fan, I do know that it was taken from the comic books as were the goats. I will say that the one thing I enjoyed was when the children got the power of Thor "for a limited time only." After watching the movie I read some positive critic reviews and cam concerned that they were posted under the incorrect movie title because there's no way a person with any intelligence could say those things about "Love & Thunder." If I had paid money to see this in the theater I would be seriously upset that I wasted my money on this woke garbage. Don't waste your time.

Author: Horror_Flick_Fanatic
Review: This film is all tongue and cheek. It never takes itself seriously. That was an attribute that I appreciated most of all in the film. There is a central theme to the film too, it is about the toxic nature of hatred & holding on to grudges. It offers embracing love and forgiveness before it is too late.

Author: MrDavidCJohnson
Review_Title: Funny, very funny, Thor and Thor ... Good combination!
Review: As usual and expected of a Thor movie this one continues the tradition of having excellent dialogue and a very fun story!! Getting right to the point this movie was good, but what it also visibly did was lure in the younger viewers. Some would say that it aimed at the Stranger Things viewing audience to make the relationship between Thor and Jane more plausible to them while extending the true story of Gorr (Christian Bale) and his feelings about losing his daughter over the entire story arc. The weapons anthropomorphic theme is hilarious 😂 and better than well played, while Russell Crowe as Zeus is brilliantly portrayed. There are important Marvel Easter Eggs that MUST be explored now that they've been brought up, i.e., Hercules, battle of the gods....things of that sort. We'll see, I'm sure!! Good movie!!!

Author: jaytiwari-59246
Review: Finally marvel had produced something worth watching in phase 4. The movie is absolute joy to watch, the story will keep you hooked, the performances are awesome as well. Author: amadour-87687
Review_Title: The best of Thor the worst of Thor
Review: The silliness in the beginning of this movie almost makes you miss a truly heartfelt movie. A romance blossoms somewhere near the middle of this movie that actually gives it a believable center. If you don't let all it's initial lameness bother you and stay invested until then you will be rewarded with a classic finish that is unexpected in every way. In this left brain right brain struggle to make a movie the sane half finally takes over and wins your heart. I love this director when he's letting his serious side show. He is a great man struggling against himself. Sometimes he wins, sometimes he loses, but always he is worth watching.

Author: pinemaples
Review: I'll start off by saying that Thor: Ragnarok is one of my favorite movies of the whole MCU. I expected this one to be basically more of that, and in some ways it is, but it hits different. For a while, it's just goofy, and not always in a good way. The jokes largely don't land as well, and it takes a while before it really starts to get going. But when it does, boy it REALLY goes. It's a lot more serious than I expected it to be, and the vast majority of the comedy ends after the first 1/3 or so, after which it's just one fantastic scene after another. There's one part about halfway through where we are treated to probably the most visually unique scene in the entire series, and it blew me away. From that scene on, the movie just didn't stop for me and I loved everything from then on out. Christian Bale absolutely dominates and really shows Chris Hemsworth up in his own movie, which is saying a lot because Hemsworth is as good as always. But we've seen him before about a dozen times, while Bale brings a whole new energy to it. Speaking of energy, there's Natalie Portman's Mighty Thor. I'm so glad she decided to come back, because she was fantastic and in no way did she phone anything in, in the least. She absolutely sold every line and action, and same goes for Tessa Thompson. I loved her in Ragnarok, and I love her here too.

Author: statuskuo
Review: He isn't, but it's kinda funny that they rhyme. This movie has a lot of adult ideas percolating in the ether and hangs like a off-putting not-made-for-fun atmosphere. They want to address deeper things like spirituality and Gods but also cancer. Had co-writer/director Taika Waititi not burden himself with being Marvel glib, he could've ran a very poignant connection between the two. Well, Gorr sort of points this out. As if praying to Gods helped his own life suffering. Also, to paint Gods out as hedonistic blowhards who sit on high and demand un-yielding faith and devotion is oversimplifying religion. It's really religion as anchored into the faithful. The ones who called on Gods for help will always be disappointed. Funny thing...I'm not entirely sure this is how the process works. Had the writing been honest, they would've had ONE God with the maturity of a God and not buffoons who create safe spaces. In the case of Zeus, Gods come to bask in his glory. Enter eye roll here.

Author: chera_khalid
Review: "Thor: Love and Thunder" hammers its way into theaters with a 6/10 rating, and I must say, it was just okay. Chris Hemsworth and Tessa Thompson deliver charismatic performances, injecting humor and heart into their characters. The film editing keeps the pace lively, balancing action with quirky moments. Its strength lies in its exploration of themes like identity and legacy, and the film certainly doesn't shy away from the over-the-top comic book fun. However, it falters with a somewhat convoluted plot and a sense of déjà vu from previous Thor installments. The music adds a bombastic flair, and the cinematography captures the fantastical landscapes with vividness. "Thor: Love and Thunder" may not be the most thunderous entry in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, but it delivers a decent dose of cosmic superhero antics for those seeking a fun, if somewhat familiar, adventure.

Author: Mysterygeneration
Review: In Taika Waititi's most recent adaptation of "Thor: Love and Thunder," there are both serious stakes and humor. The humor, especially the mocking man-mountain, really makes it. The way the tone alternates between profound seriousness and deathly seriousness won't be to everyone's taste. Taika Waititi, the filmmaker of "Thor: Ragnarok," deserves praise for treating everything as lighthearted entertainment. The "great bits" are Turn-the-Tide brawls set to Guns'n'Roses' Greatest Hits, and they only occur once in each of the film's three acts.

Author: harcool
Review_Title: Thor: Love and Thunder Review: Fun, Vibrant and Emotional
Review: Thor: Love and Thunder is a heck ton of fun, and very vibrant in colour! It is so awesome with a lot of what it does. BUT- I do think Ragnarok is still better, though this movie is amazing too! Taika Watiti is a Legend, as he directs this movie perfectly and what is does with Jane Foster and Gorr The God Butcher is a huge feat. Christian Bale is perfection in the role of Gorr, and Taika Watiti finds a way to turn Jane from bland and boring to a very awesome, likeable character. And I don't think this is a Spoiler, as it's been revealed before: Jane has cancer in this movie, and what the film does with it is very great and full of emotion. Chris Hemsworth as THOR IS JUST AMAZING!! Most of the jokes land, though there are some moments that didn't hit with the audience. Overall.. a very fun time at the movies, and I can't wait for what's next for Thor!

Review_Title: It was a high-budget comedy from MCU.
Review: I think they lost the equilibrium on this one. Thor (1) was ok but every intro of MCU character is ok film, 6/10. Thor (2): the Dark World was not bad and kept strictly Thor world with Thor story characters, it had its own style, so for me it was 7/10. Thor (3) Ragnarok was great, they hit the sweet spot with action and comedy and adventure, from me 8/10. Thor (4): Love and Thunder, in my opinion 6/10. That's because it got a bit too silly by having too many silly moments, a bit too long of silliness, a bit too far with silliness, but jokes were not bad. It was a fan movie ti watch, no doubt, but didn't give a feeling of the blockbuster spirited marvel movie. It was a good high-budget comedy from MCU.

Author: AscendeSuperius
Review: Just like how Ragnarok was sort of a transition movie for infinity war(albeit a good one), this one feels similar, a prequel perhaps, for the next Thor movie. It touches ever so slightly into the emotional themes of love and romance, but ultimately falling short of what the title asks suggests. Furthermore for an action film, it just doesn't seem enough. It's trying to be both an action and a romance, but failing on both aspects. Still, while I'm not really a fan of the ending, it's a decent and enjoyable film with a few witty moments here and there.

Author: ayoreinf
Review_Title: There's a good movie hidden in here
Review: I liked what Taika Waititi did with Thor Ragnarok. The lighthearted attitude worked fine with the serious attitude Thor has to the world and to himself. I said it a few times before - humor is probably the best cure for pompousness. But humor works best with set boundaries, most of these seem to be forgotten in this movie. And as far as I'm concerned it's plain shame since the serious part of the movie is one of the best I've seen in a long while. With Natalie Portman and Christian Bale both giving two of the best performances I've seen in superhero movies ever. And the rest of the leading roles didn't fall too far behind.

Author: brojames-16152
Review_Title: Thor has become an unintelligent simp
Review: It's about 10% Thor and 90% Jokes and can't be taken seriously. This is far from Ragnarok good. I regret not waiting to watch it later on Disney+ since I pay for that subscription begrudgingly. I felt no sense of urgency from the "god killer". MCU films would make you anxious for what would happen in the next battle or adversity but you couldn't care less in this because it's trying to be a comedy but with stale jokes. Thor is portrayed as a meat head which has always been a part of him but that was always balanced out by being the strongest avenger and a force to be reckoned with on the battle field. He was always highly respected among his peers but in this he's mocked, made to be dumb, incompetent, having poor leadership and 2nd to "Mighty Thor" Jane Foster. This is worse than the supposedly bad Dark World. Was really keen for this movie and seeing the comic Jane Foster come to the screen but instead very disappointed. Would rather of seen Top Gun a 2nd time.
