Author: nymh
Review_Title: Really underated. details good, the best joke I've seen.
Review: It was unique. I am really surprised to see the comments. Look at the action scenes, it was wonderful, where did we have such action scenes in the fantasy genre. Those who have watched long and boring series of this genre know what I am talking about. The film is miles ahead of all the films and the best adventure animations. See, it is not artificial at all. Even very big movies and series do not reach my feet. The movement of the camera was calculated. We have the peak of entertainment in a movie and we are also experiencing a work of art. All the characters in the movie are great. We don't have such a movie at all. It was better than beauty and the breast either. I enjoyed it a lot and got a feeling. It was a very well-made and strong movie. I never thought that a fictional film could be so strong and at the same time heavy. Or they can make it. I saw a movie once and the wonderful acting of the actors stayed in my mind. I usually do not like very serious and imaginative movies, so I enjoyed this movie. The acting of the actors is very serious and real, all the acts are correct. At the same time, jokes are included. The actress who plays the role of Thor, Natalie Portman, our actresses should learn acting from her. Christian Bale very serious and extremely good game. Enchanting script. Even mat damon plays well. The same sequence played by Natalie Portman is worthy of all the Marvel superhero movies. This movie has a special feature, which is that it has nothing to do with taste. It means that it was not made by measuring people's tastes and purposefully. So we see that even the most famous filmmakers of the last few decades use this feature. It couldn't be better than this. It makes me laugh to compare it with Ragnarok. It is the same as shown in the film itself.

Author: manikandannccarmy
Review: I felt movie was so good. With lots of fun and i didn't get distracted at any point. Went to watch without any expectations. Came out with more satisfaction than spiderman no way home and doctor strange Multiverse of madness.

Author: dhruvrajraulji
Review: Well, Well, Well 29th MCU cinematic outing and a great one at that. It's a 10 out 10 for me topic 5 for all marvel comic based movies. The movie is a complex storyline yet easily explained with a lot of comicy element with some of the best heroes and villain. I have never been a fan of Thor before Ragnarok and Love and Thunder takes it up a notch. I love Thor now. Guardians were a fun part of the plot which leaves rather early on. Jane and her story of becoming the Mighty Thor was properly based on the comics and she was really well portrayed by Natalie Portman. Now moving on with Christian Bale, woah he gave me the chills at moment, element of horror in the movie, especially the dark scenes like the black background one. He had a tragic story with a happy ending, spoiler " getting her daughter back" Gorr was well built. As for King Valkyrie and Korg they are the same fun people we saw in Ragnarok. Now finally the Hero of the show Thor Odinson " Chris Hemsworth" From being a self indulged hero, to a lover and then Uncle Thor, he grew a lot as an individual in this movie. As for Zeus and other gods they were a fun addition like actual fun. We finally see a celestial being other than celestial in Thor love and thunder. Eternity, who later on becomes sort of Thor's daughter. Jane's death brought me to tears. And she entering Valhalla gave me hope. Maybe the 5th one Thor Valhalla. Even saw Heimdall for a second their. And well Hercules is going to hunt Thor now. It is silly but a whole lot of fun. Love you Taika, only you can make such a mad movie.

Author: Ryan331
Review_Title: Taika brings back parody films from the 2000s!
Review: Not sure what I watched - a parody of Thor (Meet the Spartans, Superhero Movie) or a secret sequel of 2005's Sky High. Christian Bale did a good job as a Mad Max Fury Road character. Russell Crowe does a mediocre Greek Borat impersonation at some point. No worries though, he'll get two years to perfect his accent as the next Thor villain.

Author: MJB784
Review: Could you explain the time traveling from Asgard to the children? Also, Jane doesn't make sense. How does being a viking stop cancer? We also don't know how they broke up or why she gets the hammer. I also don't understand the villain Gorr or her daughter being Thor's niece.

Author: brunovanael
Review_Title: This MCU thing is getting really old
Review: Thor will be back. I can't say that I'm excited. I also can't say that this will be in another Thor movie, because in the MCU universe it doesn't matter who's name carries the movie, as long as they appeared in any marvel comic everyone's welcome whether it makes sense or not. This leads to a messy storyline and many stars standing in front of a green key. I have to admit, the Omnipotence City looked absolutely stunning, but I would have been much happier watching a good scenario. Every recent MCU movie seems alike. Lots of stars, heroes, CGI, yet another apocalyptic threat, a more interesting mid part before the final fight, credits, a teaser for a future marvel spoof, more credits and a final scene. This has become a total drag. On the plus side : 3 funny scenes and a good villain.

Author: Gwendlyn007
Review: This creative film totally entertains its audience! From well choreographed fight scenes, beautiful scenery, hilarious scenes and some tender moments. I loved this film! It made made laugh out loud! And Chris Hemsworth is witty and charming and fabulous eye candy. I'm looking forward to the next Thor Film. I know it will be spectacular!!

Author: mofobuss
Review_Title: Did you guys not get the concept of this movie??? You are saying this was as bad as the dark world
Review: You guys are s*** fans. Was the movie too funny for you or something? I don't recall where it had to be a serious film. Maybe rewatch it. It's a beautifully done movie and gorr wasn't meant to be a big bad in phase 4...so they nerfed him big deal enjoy movies for what they are.

Author: gzqahghie
Review_Title: Exactly what Taika fans want and expect
Review: Going into a Taika Waititi movie then writing a review about how it's all a joke is like going to cadburys world and being disappoint at all the chocolate, this movie is everything I wanted it to be but with the added bonus of tremendous heart. Bale is wonderful as the villain, creepy, fun, dark, broken, seeing Portman back is fun and she obviously enjoyed the lose script, she seemed to be having the time of her life but it is Hemsworth and Waititi just plain messing around which is the most delightful. The jokes flow second to second each more surreal and unmarvel like from the last but much like ragnorok it's the stunning visuals that really standout in the movie, it's just beautiful. Waititi's eye for this world is unlike anything else happening within the Marvel cinematic universe. These movies standout in a very formulaic world and I for one feel they are a total breath of fresh air. Absolutely adored it.

Author: geokk
Review_Title: Probably the best film of phase 4!
Review: It's really nice to see Thor back on screen and especially in such a funny and action-thrilling movie! Taika Waititi worked his magic once again, this man is a genius with such an amazing sense of humour, there were moments in the film that I couldn't stop laughing! He truly did such a great job with the script, the direction of the film and with Korg! Also loved all the gay representation he put in the movie! The actions sequences are pretty good and they are as aggressive as the movie requires. Gorr is in my opinion is the best character in the film and probably the best villain in mcu history! Christian Bale is a legend and portrays the character excellently! I love his creepy moments and his powers, they did a perfect job with his character, although I would like to have seen more of him. Valkyrie is a badass as always but we get to see a more vulnerable side of her too, which I loved. There's two things that kept the movie from being a 10 out of 10 for me. One is that I think they should have shown the exact moment that Jane became the Mighty Thor and not just give as the how and second that the movie should have been a bit longer because the first 20 minutes or so felt kinda rushed! All in all, the movie is great, hilarious and it also brought back the feeling of how the mcu was, you know? Like the years from Endgame and back! Because phase 4 had some disappointments in my opinion!

Author: jordyntsmith
Review_Title: It's Fun, and that's about it
Review: The ongoing adventure of Thor after Endgame.

Author: tindfoting
Review_Title: Well...Thor has objectophilia. Who would know?
Review: For those unaware of this perfectly "normal" mental condition, Thor is in love with his axe, and are afraid his axe is jealous of Mjølner, his ex. To complicate matters, Mjølner is no swinging by our old BRILLIANT scientist Jane Foster (Nat Portman with big abs), who NOW is The Might Thor. Why, you say? Well, sadly she has 4th stage termal cancer, but visiting Tønsberg, were Åsgård now is run by King (WHY not Queen??) Valkyrie, she spots the pieces of ol' Mjølner, and gets to be Thor. We will never know why. And Thor still loves the NEW Mighty Thor. So this is a love...triangle? Or something.

Author: damianglen-32286
Review: When i first saw the trailer i thought this was going to be one of the MCU best movies instead we got Love and Thunder. Instead of a journey of self-discovery for Thor we get a movie that ends right where IT started just with another annyoing character added to the MCU. Unlike Ragnarok that combined humor and drama, we got a movie full of unnecessary humor on scenes that really didn't need IT. Even if you ignore that the story is practically non-existent, and really doesn't make any sense. And even though I absolutely loved Gorr as a villian, I wanted to see him BUTCHER some Gods instead we see him tell some scary story and try to get to some genie to grant his wish. The chemistry beetween Jane and Thor is gone. And worst of all Thor saves the day by giving some cliche and cheese not to mention out of time superhero speech. I thought we got over this old time cliche after Collossus speech on Deadpool. Seriously MCU what happened to your glory days.

Author: waltermwilliams
Review: What I liked about "Thor: Love and Thunder"...it's killer big hair soundtrack.

Author: ImpertinentGremlin
Review: Sat through this movie. Two stars because it made me chuckle a few times, but the constant set up from one joke to another got tiresome. The whole thing was like a run-on sentence with sloppy scene shifts and jarring changes in pace and tone. I imagine I missed half the jokes just because I am not into the MCU. The climax made me wonder why that wasn't the go to answer in the first place and a lot of the lead up to it was premised on constantly shifting rules that made no sense outside the scene they were in and were changed for a joke or on a whim in the next scene. It could be argued that it was meant to be more of an "emotional" journey, but even then smacks you in the face with inconsistency and unbelievable character reactions.

Author: matthewscott-45333
Review: What have they done to Thor? Thor has been turned into nothing more than a character that only provides comic relief. He did this throughout the entire film. The character is nothing like Thor in the first two Thor movies or in the first three Avengers movies. They decided to take the fat Thor from Endgame who is silly and juvenile to make this movie. I am a huge Marvel fan. Watch the movies every time I see one on TV. They finally made a movie I never want to see again. Having jokes every 2 minutes was more important than making a movie true to the character of Thor. Thor is supposed to be egotistical and arrogant. This is not Thor. I am extremely disappointed in this movie.

The story was decent but the execution felt little rush, The old characters return jane and her friend and sif with it thor's journey with guradians was nice, The CGI was too brilliant specially the golden temple and some gorr's scenes they were eye-pleasing,The gorr was awesome but it felt underused just like other marvel movies villians, The zeus and other gods portrayal was little amature-ish and with gorr's arc it could be awesome but the whole terror was missed with the fun vibe of movie and with the jane's arc although it was good on paper it needed more runtime to proper cover all the plotlines without that it felt kept going just like that although The Love and thunder reveal at last and the final act was amazing, the mid credit was awesome and end credit was decent. Author: shoguna2m
Review: Yeah, let's turn death, cancer, a love story, and Gorr the God butcher into a joke and remove all chances of having a great villain display and a profound character development, despite the fantastic acting of Christian Bale and others.

Author: kashanimoji
Review_Title: This start a new era of movies
Review: This film might not did it perfectly, but genuinely there were so many things that was done differently about this movie. I saw a completely different perspective making this film. So more realistic characters with emotional aspects illustrated with great sense of humour. It shows how people really get impacted with events around them, and interestingly how they can take themselves out it and gain a greater more powerful personality. I love how deeply Chris Hemsworth played a hurt character and how well he found purpose on life. But in most movies everything is exaggerated, even hopelessness. This movie showed me an experience in life and how amazing you can still be even though you might have been hurt. Thanks loved it needs more films like this.

Author: TharsheyN
Review_Title: You are not the Thor we're looking for!
Review: Thor Love and Thunder feels more like a comedy then a superhero film under Taika Waititi's direction. While Ragnarok made it work this just didn't feel like a Thor film. I miss the feeling one got from watching Thor or Thor The Dark World.

Author: ThereelscoopwithKK
Review: The opening scene raises quite a heartfelt moment and very quickly establishes the villains motive which I particularly like here. It also raises serious theological questions to ponder , but the goofiness and lightheartedness of the majority of the movie allows you to avoid a dreaded car ride home debating the merits of religious beliefs.

Author: keith_wills
Review: Everything you loved about Ragnarok is so overdone here - I wanted to get up and walk out of the theater 15 minutes in. Wait! I was watching this at home - even worse 'cause now I can't just go home! It was that bad. Terrible script and plot, and it was not well executed. As everyone said, Christian Bale is the highlight of the movie, everything else falls short. Even Hemsworth was made to look like a foolish hero. The Guardians cameo was absolutely horrible! I thought maybe this was some dream sequence and they were just doing a parody of themselves and then it would get serious. No, this was the movie, as it was written! Ruined Sith, and really ruined Zeus! How did something like this ever get made? Who thought it was a good idea? I'm starting to think I'm still rating it too high...

Have we learned nothing from George Clooney's Batman ?

Review: I absolutely love the "infinity saga" of the MCU, which is to say the films from "Iron Man" to "Spiderman: Far From Home". And I was initially excited about Phase 4, which we've seen since 2021. And that didn't impress me.

Author: kalenaot
Review_Title: Another moving Thor film that has me a lil intrigued to see more Marvel
Review: I've really enjoyed the last few Thor's, I've felt they have been a great mix of thriller, comedy and imagery that helps makes a non-fantasy/superhero movie fan like myself keep entertained and also wanting to talk about the film after.

Author: wheywood-24674
Review_Title: It was a fun way to spend a couple of hours
Review: Ah look, it was a fun movie that could have been more. Like other reviewers I found the comedy off putting and used way too much. It broke the pacing, cheapened the heart moments and made Thor the butt way too often.

Author: Aries_Primal
Review: I really loved the reunion, the Rock Thor, the jokes. But bringing Voldemort to the show, seriously? Anyway Christian Bale played the role amazing, so realistic.

Author: The_Orenda
Review_Title: A heavy burden to bear, this thing called continuity.
Review: In Ragnarok, Waititi, Hemsworth et al had a certain looseness that made for an entertaining hero movie that did not feel like one. Tessa Thompson drinking herself off an entrance? Gold. Thor hijacking Gamesmaster's ship (Don't touch anything")? Another gem. Love and Thunder certainly began with hope when Thor throws his cloak at the beginning of the movie, but by the third song recycled from the Appetite for Destruction album alone (there was no other hard rock band they could use in a hard rock themed movie?), the film was showing its wear and tear. That's not to say Love and Thunder is a bad film, since the cast is all staying true to character, the pace of the movie is on point, the colour, the design, the shade... Love and Thunder is in fact a sharp movie, but the film itself is handcuffed to way too much continuity that has to be answered to.

Author: stephanierie
Review: This film had great potential, unfortunately wasted to make way infinite jokes and pseudo-comic moments that interrupt, in my opinion, the continuity and immersion of the viewer into the story: Gorr, the killer of the gods. A beautiful script could have been done with this premise. But some changes were needed, in my opinion. Thor could have stopped being a fool from the beginning to the end of the movie, more subplots could have developed. Instead the result is a noisy, sometimes cringe movie. The part with Zeus/Russell Crowe was also very embarrassing. Positive note for Christian Bale, but his talent has been wasted in such a superficial plot. Natalie Portman excellent in the role of the Mighty Thor; otherwise, the movie is enjoyable in small sections, but disappointing overall. MCU/Disney believe that using the same card (Waititi) just because a movie (Ragnarok) came out great, can guarantee success. Not really, you know? In this movie, everything is exaggerated, the comic tempos, the music, the jokes (endless, endless jokes ...) in the end aren't even funny anymore. On the other hand, the great inclusiveness for Korg's fathers and Valkirya's dead girlfriend is very positive. This aspect could have been even better if the plot had been supported by decent dialogues and story development.

Author: ravenhair702
Review: Ever wait for a movie to come out and it's a bitter disappointment? THAT'S what this movie is to me! It came out today on Disney+ and I was so amped to see this one! IT'S MOSTLY STUPID! Sure, it's got a few serious moments, but again mostly stupid and goofy! So far, this is my LEAST favorite Thor movie. The other ones had a few laughs and funny moments, but this one was obviously written by a gag writer! The beginning starts out with Thor on another world with the guardians of the galaxy, minus one member, (I'll let you figure out which one...) and it just gets stupid from there. I'm REALLY glad I didn't go to the theaters to see this. RAGANOK was better than this! And by the way, the ONLY reason I gave this a higher than 4 rating was then ending made me misty. NOT cry...just, misty. Peace.

Author: pedrojoseeverett
Review: When did Thor became a bad comedy with 3D as a background?

Author: magnaman44
Review_Title: Go see this, it's a blast !!
Review: I too, felt compelled to leave a review after reading all these negative reviews. This is my first review in years if not ever. The negative reviews here are silly and way off mark. We go to movies to escape, be entertained, to laugh, to cry, to cheer. This movie delivered ALL of these things. The love story was sweet and emotional. The ending was both heart wrenching and heart warming. And it's Thor. Just sit back and enjoy it !! I will see it again. Please just go see for yourself. And just expect another great Thor movie.

Author: michaeljdemars
Review_Title: The fact that MCU fans hate it, makes me love it even more
Review: Unlike most other MCU movies, this actually has a story, depth, and thoughtfulness. If you don't like Taika, but you like the mundane writing and plain vanilla feel of most other superhero movies, this isn't for you. The absurdity, cleverness and ability of Taika to get the best acting from this cast is storytelling at its best. I feel like it was made for me.

Author: bchminer
Review_Title: They were so preoccupied with whether they could
Review: "They were so preoccupied with whether they could, they didn't stop to think if they should."

Author: skylarpmacomber
Review_Title: Out of place for a Thor movie
Review: The movie itself is not a bad movie it has its pros and good moments. The problem is that the whole movie seems out of place, nothing ever seems to fit together in this movie and I personally feel like it wastes a lot of time with small meaningless scenes but rushing through things like explaining Doctor Jane Fosters appearance and the fact that she has the same powers as Thor.

Author: seanhmoss6
Review: AMENDMENT: Out of sheer boredom and curiosity, I finally finished watching this. The last 20 minutes or so resonated with what made, again I say MADE, Marvel movies special. However, Marvel is dead. Make no mistake. I still stand by my initial review.

Author: gepetto33
Review: Coming from a place of voracity and enthusiasm for the MCU, to say Thor L&T was a disappointment would be an understatement. Honestly, giving it a 6 even feels generous. This movie fails on so many accounts; pacing, story building, character development, and so on. Even with so many great tools at their disposal (high caliber actors, effects, director) they still managed to destroy whatever this movie could have been by speeding the plot along to try and meet a 2 hour run time. Christian as Gorr was completely wasted.. his presence in this story felt completely arbitrary, and disposable. The only exciting thing from a fan's perspective was the introduction to the cosmic abstracts, which i'm hoping will be further expanded in future movies.

Author: mattstone137
Review_Title: "If You're Ever Lost, Just Look Into the Eyes of the One You Love."
Review: Thor: Love and Thunder is the twenty-ninth film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, a franchise which has been barreling ahead since The Avengers first game out in 2012. To reiterate, this franchise has released nearly thirty films in about fourteen years, starting with 2008's Iron Man. After all of this time, with films so frequently released, one would think audiences know these characters intimately and those in charge wouldn't have to spoon feed expositions into our gullets like mother birds. One would be wrong.

Author: contactrahall
Review_Title: Thor no More or Hate & Blunder
Review: Poor written script, slapstick humor, childish action scenes, and every line is made to be a one-liner joke.

Author: deni_sway
Review_Title: Don't know what I just watched
Review: I feel really bad for this incredibly cast! I mean.. Hemsworth, Bale, Portman, Thompson.. How can you have such amazing actors and deliver such a poor movie? Bale was incredible and the rest just worked with what was given to them. The only scene that was ok to watch, for me, was when they are captured in the Shadow place..

Author: flipi_boy
Review_Title: Christian Bale shines in whatever that was.
Review: The second Marvel chose to make Thor comedic relief and then elevate him to clown supreme was a huge mistake. Chris Hemsworth is really talented and can be very funny, but there should be a line somewhere for when all your superhero movies are infested with jokes. Marvel made this mistake years ago and they wanted to make each main character into a comedian.

Author: markricks-68-975207
Review: This was was a great, comedic, love story, that happened to have superheroes in it. Anyone who doesn't like this movie forgot how to have fun. Brilliant!

Author: ambusched94
Review_Title: Typical badly made and directed MCU film
Review: Another forgettable, laughably bad MCU film Marvel Studios and Disney keep churning out to reap a sad profit. The only salvageable element of this film would be Chris Hemsworth and Natalie Portman's chemistry as Thor and Jane. The action scenes, jokes, and plot are so poorly written and designed, it gets boring FAST. I definitely preferred the first two Thor films over Love and Thunder. The direction was much more cohesive and the runtime didn't drag on versus this film which is a tedious slog to finish watching even on a first viewing. Not recommended even for MCU fans, which I can happily say I'm not one.

Author: TennSound
Review: To be fair, I'm not much of a Marvel movie fan aside from Iron Man, some of the X-men movies, and the surprisingly good Dr. Strange, but this is the lowest of lows. I took my wife because she wanted to see it, and I couldn't wait for it to be over after about 20 minutes or so. Bad character development, poorly-written storyline, over-the-top cheesy dialog and action sequences, and some woke nonsense sprinkled in the mix. It was so bad that I won't watch another Marvel movie unless someone whose opinion I trust happens to highly recommend one. I can't be monetarily supporting this kind of cinematic garbage out of principle, not to mention wasted time. 2/10 would be too generous. Really.

Review: All I have to say is very clear. Thor: Love and Thunder seemed to me a parody / ripoff comey version of Thor franchise. I mean SERIOUSLY?! There was no necessity to present Thor like this form, more like a comedian. I still remember the 'infinity war' version of him, those presence give me goosebumps! But Taika Waititi just successfully ruined the character. Only positive thing is Christian Bale. He nailed as Gorr! Outstanding performance as always. But his screentime was so little that audience must feel craving for more of him.

Author: Oceanfrontian
Review_Title: Disney, I think you need to end the MCU, because it has run its course

It's kind of frustrating to see Thor going through the same arc again, just undoing his development in order to redo it. Overall, this movie is fine, if you want to see it, go ahead, but I wouldn't say it's a must watch movie.

Author: feyipuk
Review_Title: Top marks for Bale, less for the other
Review: Taika Waititi has a problem. In the wake of the amazing Thor Ragnarok, where does he take the franchise? Most of the original MCU Avengers have retired, yet the sparkles, the Lord of Thunder, is still putting in the work to change odd bod into god bod. Following all he has lost - parents, brother, friends, planet - he has a lot of issues that he needs to work out. And into this mix comes Gorr, played by an amazing Christian Bale, who challenges Thors strength and other emotions, with his own quest. And in the middle of this epic grudge match of god and god killer, steps Natalie Portmans Jane Foster, reintegrated into the Marvel fold following the falling out over Patty Jenkins, and given a much more beefed up role than just the scientific side kick and love interest. Her transformation is straight out the comics, and not to be questioned, though given all the space magic we've seen in previous films, it's good to see Kat Dennings asking some good questions.

Review: One word to describe the film is Meh. Far from being even close to the best Marvel film. Its watchable and Bale redeems it somewhat, but far to much posturing and unfunny attempts at jokes. Feels like one too many Thor movies have been made and should have perhaps been left alone.

Review_Title: What lifted this movie, in my opinion, was the humour and the music.

Ragnarok is still the best Thor movie though. I laughed a lot when I watched this movie, and everyone seem to hate the goats, but I loved it! I think it was a big letdown that Christian Bale did not get more screen time. He is one of my favourite actors and his talent and the villain Gorr the God Butcher was wasted in this movie. The action was not that good either. The part with Zeus was a bit disapponting as well. Zeus did not feel very Zeus-like, and it was a bit cringe. Author: damon503

The directors comedy, while fresh, new, and had adult humor in Ragnorak, just fall face flat here. I felt I was watching a softer Thor movie aimed for kids and not adults. Although rated PG-13 for a few juvenile scenes, the rest was kid friendly which I thought ruined the whole Thor franchise.

Author: shannonmamer
Review_Title: Couldn't stop laughing, until I cried...
Review: This is one of the funniest Marvel movies I've seen yet. I felt as though they went above & beyond to inject laughter into what was ultimately a sad & relatable story for many an atheist like myself. I don't believe in gods for exactly the reason Gorr wanted to kill them. They permit unending pain if they do exist, as though it were nothing to them. The levity makes this so worth watching. The constant screaming of the goats should be hilarious to anyone who loves goats. The jealousy of an animate axe. When the children are told to pick weapons & the little girl keeps her stuffed bunny thus, making it her weapon. Many other hearty laughs, all leading to a bittersweet ending. I loved it & I wish the comic book gatekeepers could handle the release of ONE movie without acting like simpering children. Looking forward to the next movie, but hoping scenes Peter Dinklage works on don't get cut from future movies as they did in this one.

Author: Polotovar
Review: Let me put it this way. I expected worse. Lately, Marvel movies haven't been reaching the quality they once did, so I wasn't expecting anything special, and that's probably why I'm not disappointed in the finale. It went by pleasantly quickly because there was a lot of action, which I thought was pretty epic in places, but there's just one catch. Story-wise, it's not such a joy anymore. There is a lot of humour. A lot. That's a classic with Marvel movies, but here there's perhaps I would say a little more of it. I generally don't like a lot of jokes in superhero movies. I prefer more serious superhero ventures, like Christopher Nolan's Dark Knight trilogy, but that's beside the point. There were several times in the story where one character was speaking to tell the story and that bothered me. I don't like it much and rarely like it, but sometimes it's cool, but here I didn't like it. Then as I mentioned the humor is really over the top here, which wasn't my cup of tea either. I don't want to spoil, but story-wise it wasn't a total win either. Well it was saved for me by the aforementioned action, which I enjoyed and which Marvel can and probably always will, except for Eternals. That was pretty damn weak in my opinion and Thor: Love Like Thunder is still fine in comparison. So, for me, a good movie that although I would recommend to Thor fans, I might not after all because it gets quite the hate. It's hard to say. My friends were really disappointed with this movie. I'm satisfied though and for me it was fine.

Review: I like Waititi, but, like with T3, he has too much humor for a story that should be serious.

Author: hafbloodprince5
Review: After Thor Ragnarok I had massive expectations from this movie as it was directed by the same director. Boy I was wrong. They dumbed down Thor so much and dude was cracking jokes every two minutes even during serious moments when a bunch of children were kidnapped. I think Ragnarok had a proper mixture of comedy and seriousness that's why it worked but this is mostly comedy and about 10% serious moments. Also they wasted Christian Bale as Gorr the God Butcher. For someone named Gorr the God Butcher he only butchers one God and the rest were shown in some screens aboard the Benetar. There was no sense of threat from him as we never get to see him in full glory. The movie felt rushed and the editing was poorly done. Only the story of Jane and Thor splitting post Ultron was shown properly. I heard the movie's original length was 4 hours and a lot of scenes were cut as Disney execs were adamant to keep the running time of this movie under 2 hours. That's why we got this movie clocking at exactly 1hr and 59 mins so that they can sell more shows per day. Just imagine if we had got 20-30 mins of Gorr the God Butcher actually butchering Gods and more story of how Jane becomes the Mighty Thor and her learning to fight using Mjiolnir and Lady Sif fighting alongside Falligar and failing to save him and where she has been post Ragnarok, introducing Heimdall's son early in the movie and not as a floating head, Hercules defending his father in the omnipotence city and not introduced as an after thought and some more Guardian's scene as they went to answer the distress call. All or some of these scenes would make the movie so much watchable instead of this jokefest that we got. They think that the audiences are fool and anything nowadays with a Marvel logo on it will sell but if this is the trajectory Disney and Marvel are aiming for then they are certainly gonna crash sooner or later.

Author: gregoryparmer-49843
Review_Title: 9.9/10 Due to lack of variation on the soundtrack.
Review: Thor: Love & Thunder (2022) Was a pretty remarkable flick with all mainstream things considered. Acting, 10/10, script, 10/10, graphics and surprise theatrics 10/10, sympathy for the villain, 10/10, big-name guest actors, 10/10, conclusion, 10/10. The only complaint I really have (which is not much of a complaint) was that I typically enjoy a bit more variation on my flick's soundtracks. Don't get me wrong, it was a great soundtrack, it just lacked the variation I was looking for. I cannot see myself taking away too many points for lack of variation in a soundtrack when the film was entirely almost picture-perfect otherwise; for a purposely manufactured, summer blockbuster. So, without further delay, I will give Thor: Love & Thunder (2022) it's just reward of 9.9/10. You definitely want to see this one at your local movie house on the big screen, so that you can soak up all the thrills and action the way it was intended to be seen; as a mainstream summer adventure film with a bucket of popcorn. Try to keep that in mind and don't be so judgmental. We know it's not Citizen Kane (1941), ok, film school hipsters?

Author: Mabkid

Author: hybrid-james-penny
Review: Need I say more? This story had so had so much potential and they ruined so much. The only good thing I can say about it is they did Gorr the most justice, but even then there were problems.

Author: atkinsonlouise-73873
Review_Title: A Fun, but Flawed MCU Experience
Review: The 4th Thor film is here and overall I had a lot of fun here. The vibrancy and love put into the film by its director and the great cinematography really adds to the vibe. Chris Hemsworth is still great here and you can tell he enjoys this role, with Korg still a fun character and Kieron L. Dyer was really good as Axl. Christian Bale as the main villain was great and showed why he's such a great actor, although I would have liked to see more god butchering. Jane Foster's return was ok, the humour around her character wasn't great and the humour was very hit and miss for the most part, but didn't distract me enough to not enjoy the film. The main plot lines needed more room to breathe personally, with the God Butcher and Thor and Jane's relationship and the general theme of love explored decently, but needed more detail. The gods again were fine, Russel Crowe fit the bill, but didn't blow me away with his performance. The fight scenes were fun and aided well by the soundtrack. I loved the scene in particular where it was all black and white, great cinematography there. It was a bit too predictable and followed the MCU formula pretty casually, but the fun here and Taika Waititi magic made me enjoy this film. Score: 7/10.

Author: aitkenrender
Review_Title: Felt forced, and a bit empty
Review: Ok it's not a bad movie in my opinion, I went twice to the cinema, and it's fine. Average Marvel movie that doesn't deserve spotlight now it's time has come and gone but also shouldn't be slated for being bad. Although, I feel as though they tried to find too many gags after the success of the last Thor film and missed a few. I mean. Some of it was funny. But some was just cheese man and I kinda wanted to see a bit more real Thor. We got his whole arc with Jane yes so it's not like there wasn't anything real but I dunno. Story was fine though, the whole God Butcher was good, and Christian Bale was phenomenal. Forgettable marvel movie however.

Author: syma-57051
Review_Title: Why the movie is absolutely masterpiece
Review: One of the best comedy and adventure movies. I think it was even better than Billy Wilder's comedy movies. Who's watching some of these movies, doesn't want to think about any other movie. To perfection You see, everything is found in this movie. The depth of the story, character, dialogue, rhythm, what else can a science fiction movie do. Dad, let go of the previous bulls, Martin was right when he said that it is a game city, it is different. This is a movie, now someone wants to think that it belongs to children, and someone will tell me why it was not like previous episodes. Marvel came out of its replica mode. Marvel is changing, but the change is not bad at all. It has not been successful so far, but in a film like this, I see that we are on the side of an artistic director who knows the language of cinema. The movie definitely has a direct impact not only on Marvel but also on the entire science fiction cinema from now on. But the important thing is that the movie itself has become a masterpiece. If we want to look at it objectively, we will hardly realize that it is a good movie and we have to watch it several times, but if we look neither objectively nor subjectively, we will realize that it is a masterpiece. From an objective point of view, this movie is not as memorable as a show, but with our second view, we deeply accept that the movie is either a masterpiece or it doesn't suit me at all. Enough of the weaving philosophy. Regardless of any asides related to previous Marvel movies, there are scripts here, not humble remakes of outdated sci-fi. Sorry. ...

Author: masterdm31
Review_Title: Taika Waititi is back at it again
Review: Taika Waititi is back at it again, from the success of Thor:Ragnarok, comes Thor: Love and Thunder, which has just as much comedy and action packed as the previous film. Waititi executed most of his comedy very well, many jokes and situations had me and the audience laughing. Some were a little too much but not to take anything away. A problem some Marvel movies have, is placing comedic moments in the serious moments, I can assure you, this movie did not do that. Which highlights and makes Christian Bale as Gorr the god butcher feel so menacing. His performances, in anything he is part of are amazing and once again he is great in this film. Everyone was great, but for me, he was the scene stealer. Chris Hemsworth is amazing as Thor, but we done known that. It's safe to say, if you're not into rom-coms you won't enjoy this one. Marvel's deepest cut into romance so far and probably one of the most comedic movies of the MCU. If you weren't a fan of Thor:Ragnarok, you probably won't find this one that amusing either but if you enjoyed it, you'll enjoy this one as well.

Author: ToastyBeyond
Review_Title: Funny and enjoyable but sorta bland
Review: Thor Love and Thunder directed by Taiki Watiti is a film about Thor played by Chris Hemsworth trying to find who he is and what is his purpose, on the way he has to stop Gorr the god butcher played by Christian Bale, so Thor gets help from Korg played by Taiki Watiti, King Valkyrie played by Tessa Thompson, and The Mighty Thor played by Natalie Portman. I didn't think too highly of this movie and I thought this movie was just gonna be a cash grab from Marvel. It was a cash grab from Marvel but I think it was pretty good and was better than I expected. I thought the movie was pretty funny, the 1 hour and 59 minutes seems like it is short but the pacing fits for this film, the acting was good, but nothing outstanding other than Christian Bale's great take on Gorr the God Butcher, the story was ok but it is too predictable. Something that I think would spice up the story a little bit was if Thor tried to get help from not just the Gods but everyone that he saved, but that just what I think. My favorite scene of the movie was when Thor is trying to call Mjolnir back to him while Mighty Thor is holding it but instead of calling Mjolnir back he gets Stormbreaker, throughout the Movie Stormbreaker seems like it is jealous of all of Thor's ex like Mjolnir and Mighty Thor and that was pretty funny because Stormbreaker is an Axe and I thought that was pretty unique that they gave Stormbreaker personality because in past Marvel films Thor's weapons usually don't have personalities so I thought that was pretty unique. Parts of the film I disliked was the CGI, it wasn't so bad to the point that you would leave the theater, but Marvel has impressed us in the past with better CGI, and how this movie had lots of CGI problems like Thor's gold and blue helmet, it looked so fake and I wonder why they didn't use a practical helmet, most of these bad CGI scenes were minor. Another part of the film I disliked was how there is no real stake, there is not a time in the film where it felt like they would lose, they try to make it seem like there is no hope and Gorr will kill Thor or whatever but it never really comes to that. This film was lacking in some things like a real sense of danger but other than that it was funny and I enjoyed the film compared to other Marvel projects. I will give Thor Love and Thunder a rating of 7/10 and I suggest you watch the movie you are looking for action packed short film.

Author: wackoreviews
Review: Goats! Thor embarks on a journey unlike anything he's ever faced -- a quest for inner peace. However, his retirement gets interrupted by Gorr the God Butcher, a galactic killer who seeks the extinction of the gods. To combat the threat, Thor enlists the help of King Valkyrie, Korg and ex-girlfriend Jane Foster, who -- to his surprise -- inexplicably wields his magical hammer. Author: dakotadickenson-83457
Review: So, I've struggled to write a review on this movie for a couple reasons. One reason being how I feel about the movie with my own pros and cons. Number two being other peoples pros and cons. It's been hard to put it in words how I feel about this movie so I'm just gonna do the best I can. This review will contain spoilers as using them will be the only way I can really explain my thoughts on the movie itself. First off, Christian Bale as Gorr the God Butcher, absolutely steals the show in every scene he is in. His character honestly had the potential of being one of the best villains ever to come to the MCU, if not for one thing. We don't get enough of his character like we were expecting. In total, he probably has only 30 minutes of screen time in this movie and his name the God Butcher doesn't stand for much, because he literally kills no gods on screen in this movie, other than the one he stabbed in the beginning. After the opening scene started and the Marvel Studio credits started rolling, I was hyped and ready for what was to come, only to be let down drastically. Chris Hemsworth as Thor the title character was good, but kinda goofy and not always making the smartest decisions in this movie. I honestly thought we would of gotten more of his character like we did in Thor: Ragnarok and Avengers: Infinity War, but instead we just got this goofy light hearted side of Thor that I honestly don't care if we ever see again. If I see Thor again in the MCU, he needs to be darker and have those elements that he did in Thor: Ragnorok and Avengers: Infinity War. If there was one character we got way, way too much in this, it's Taika Waititi's Korg. There were scenes in this movie that he had no place of being in. He was used way more than he should of been used, but if any good came out of it, we got to know a little more about him. Tessa Thompson's Valkyrie I felt we finally got to see a side of her character we haven't seen yet before, as she is now the new leader of New Asgard who is struggling to get by as the new leader and is still learning the ropes. In the end, it made me want more of her character. The standout character was definitely Natalie Portman as Jane Foster/Mighty Thor. Honestly if this would of been a stand alone film on her version of Mighty Thor and character Arc, I would of been totally in for it and it would of been better than the film we ended up getting here. Russell Crowe as Zeus was a okay character. I kinda wished we've gotten to seen a little more of his character and hoped the source material would of been a bit better than what was given to him. It was nice to see the Guardians of the Galaxy make a appearance, but honestly, they had no point in being in this movie unless they were gonna play a bigger role in this film like fans thought they were going to, but we just got let down again instead. Overall, it's a okay addition to the MCU, but definitely not it's finest hour as it's brought down by bad source material, Taika Waititi's comedic tone and has a waste of what could of been a great villain. Rating 7/10.

Author: tendobear
Review: Very, very disappointed. Story was messy and didn't make much sense. Characters were one-dimensional. Too many jokes so you can't take any of it seriously, there's a joke every minute, and often the jokes really weren't that funny. Visuals lacked any subtlety, nuance, or sophistication - the colours were just too damned bright, my eyes hurt after about 10 minutes; it's like the film-makers only understand how to use primary colours. Also everything just looked cheap, bad, and plasticky. For example the 'armour' they wore just looked like the plastic toy viking/roman costume armour that you get from the Dollar Store. While these devices may have worked for Ragnarok, I just feel that they went too far this time, like they thought "oh, this worked on Ragnarok, let's crank it up to 11!" I guess the only saving grace is Christian Bale as Gorr, who is sadly and criminally under-used, which might actually be a good thing because the tone of his character really didn't fit in with the whole hokey-jokey tone of the movie. Overall, this was just a parody of a Thor movie.

Author: stephenjames-20141
Review: This film was fantastic. It fixed Ragnarok's two biggest issues by introducing a far more compelling villain in Gorr, played with a truly frightening performance by Bale, and it didn't undercut the dramatic moments with humour like Ragnarok did. Love and Thunder isn't as funny as Ragnarok, because it focuses more on the romantic/dramatic elements, which were electric. But, the action is a lot better and the score is one of my favourites in the MCU. I also love that there's a lot of moments when we see the characters just being themselves, and it having nothing to do with the script. The action was surprisingly creative, the visuals were either very vibrant or very washed to juxtapose between Thor and Jane's lives (I liked that), and my favourite aspect was the score. Best score in the MCU. I just wish it was longer so we could flesh out the Thor and Jane's relationship a little bit more!

Author: vallancedetta
Review_Title: More SPACEBALLS and less STAR WARS
Review: The more is more about trying to land a joke than the story or having any logical sens Even injecting Bale portraying Gorr into the fray seems a complete juxtaposition to the main intent which is to get a laugh at all cost including the dignity of the characters or the plot. Its like throwing everything at the wall and seeing what will stick. And the end result is one hot mess. Where the jokes landed well in Ragnarok which had a nice balance, this time the occasional silliness is relentless for the sake of cheap laughs rather than in the furtherance of the plot or story. And it feels more like the Director having a party and inviting all his friends than a serious attempt to respect the character of Thor and what's gone before parody similar to the "play within the play" which also lands flat this time as it is recycled for cheap laughs And in the end, the viewer is left lost at sea as a spectator to all the party guests in an orgy of lame jokes wondering how the whole is so much less than the sum of its parts. Even Korg's narrative can't put all the pieces together in any coherent way. And what's with all those kids (and I don't mean those screaming goats)??? There's little to love and any thunder is lost in all the gags and silliness.

It was intended as a comedy parody of the original Robin Hood, nothing more, and I thought it was enjoyable. Seems this was intended as a comedy parody of the series, but was neither funny nor well thought out. This is harsh, but in my opinion it was the worst movie I've ever seen, and I've entertained some pretty bad movies.

Author: tmyoung-58789
Review: Alright. Here is one of the instances where I'd just like to say something I saw on YouTube that I really agree with. Never mind the critics. This is a fun, enjoyable Phase 4 film that perfectly balances (a lot) of humour with some really dark undertones and upsetting scenes. I'm trying hard to keep this spoiler free, but some scenes are just so powerful (especially nearer the end) and Christian Bale was just.... incredible. Who cares about the character design? It's not even that bad! He was menacing, ruthless, but not evil enough to be irredeemable. Chris Hemsworth was amazing as usual, and Natalie Portman played her role SO WELL. So on this one I say don't scroll to any more reviews and watch the film without being a hardcore film critic and criticising everything, And enjoy the film for what it is. If I could I would rate this 8.5/10 but I will round down because 9 is VERY high, and reserved for films like Endgame. Stay for both post credit scenes! There are 2!

Author: MoviesWithX
Review_Title: It's alright, but if it were the last Thor movie, I'd be fine.
Review: I don't mind there being humor in these movies, but this just felt kind of looney, and not in a good way. I laughed at a couple of things but I didn't laugh that much at all throughout the movie really. And that makes the approach taken with it that much worse. And let me just say that the running gag with the goats was not that funny at all. I don't think there was one time where I was actually laughing at it, but I was amused by it once and then every time after that I was just like "okay it's old now". I liked the performances, and I think the movie mostly looks good for the most part (although I do think these movies are starting to look the same now). You got Christian Bale, one of the greatest actors in the world to be the villain. I don't like how he was used here. Bale was great, but Gorr the Butcher was a disappointment. Taiki Watiti said he was going to be the best MCU villain ever. I know that's the kind of thing that directors say about their own movies, but I at least thought he was going to be one of them. I understood his motivations, but as a villain, he didn't really do anything. He was hardly in it. The "god-butchering" took place off screen. And Russell Crowe was a cartoon as Zeus. Honestly, as much as I love the Guardians of the Galaxy, they didn't need to be in this either. They were used to be part of the set up concerning what Thor was going through but I'm not sure if they really had to be. I feel like they just did it so that fans can get a whole hype train going before the movie comes out and say "oh the Guardians of the Galaxy are going to be in too!" and then they're in it for like 5 minutes or so. Speaking of them, let the Guardians of the Galaxy be the Guardians of the Galaxy. What I mean by that is I feel like the direction that the Thor movies are taking are because they want to emulate the success of the GotG franchise. That franchise deals with humor better though because it feels baked into the personalities, whereas with this movie it brought things to a halt at times. This movie needed more balance and nuance. If this is what we can come to expect out of Thor movies going forward then I'm not really looking forward to any solo outings with the character, even with what the mid credit scene suggests. I did like some of the action in the third act though.

Author: jack_pearson
Review: When you compare it to ragnorak or jojo rabbit then this is literal garbage but if you take it for what it is then it's enjoyable. Felt completely like a kids movie, i can't believe they wasted bale on this script. Some of the dialogue was funny from thor and korg but they made jane so corny and cringe. Tessa thompson was phenomenal, she was by far the best part of the film. It jus felt too rushed and like kids were the target audience. Such a drastic drop off from ragnorak, hard to believe the same guy made both movies. Lastly, terrible CGI suit on hercules during the mid credits.

Author: speeding_motorcycle
Review_Title: They went too far to the joke side
Review: Ragnarok is my favourite Marvel movie and Thor has been my favourite character up until now. This movie unfortunately just got so much wrong that the previous Thor film got right. Everything in this film is a joke and an over the top joke at that. They have made a total fool of the character and wasted his arc. There is no character development here which has always been the greatest strength of Marvel movies the way they make us care. Bale is absolutely fantastic yet absolutely wasted along with the Guardians and Valkyrie. Due to the overly comedic side of things the serious moments don't hit at all. People talk of The Dark World as the low point of Thor but this is the film where they have lost the character. I just hope that they realise this and get someone else behind the wheel before the next instalment and we actually get a hero we can care about and get behind again. I'm giving it five because it isn't a bad film and I did enjoy it but it was such a wasted opportunity. Phase four is hitting serious problems...maybe the wheels are starting to fall off. The absolute smugness of Love and Thunder is the sort of thing that can almost signpost the beginning of the end, arrogant and incredibly self indulgent and the quietest applause of a full opening night Marvel movie yet. Eternals doesn't count because due to Covid the place was still pretty empty. Please Marvel don't make the same mistake twice!!!

Author: charlesem
Review: Critics were kind of meh about Thor: Love and Thunder, but I found it one of the less wearying of the entries in the superhero comic book sweepstakes. Aside from the unnecessary episode with the Guardians of the Galaxy, it zips along through the narrative challenges and nicely balances the love with the thunder. Chris Hemsworth is one of the most engaging actors stuck in the action genre, especially when Taika Waititi is giving him opportunities to play the goof. Christian Bale turns Gorr into one of the more complex Marvel villains, and it's good to see Russell Crowe loosen up and have a ball playing Zeus. I have mixed feelings about Natalie Portman's performance as Jane: She does a good job playing the diminutive foil to Thor, but I never felt the necessary chemistry in their love affair. Thor seems more enamored of Mjolnir than he does of Jane. I don't know why Waititi needed to reprise the gag of the actors - Luke Hemsworth, Matt Damon, and Sam Neill - playing Thor, Loki, and Odin, this time adding Melissa McCarthy as Hela; it only overloads an already bloated excursion into Thor World.

Author: fionasharp-37853
Review_Title: I think it tries to hard to be funny
Review: I love all the Marvel films. I think they have all been superb (except maybe Antman... little yawnsville but I think Paul Rudd as an actor is awesome!). I think it tries to be too funny. The last Thor -Ragnarok was brilliantly funny, not too much but just enough. I almost felt that this move tried to hard to be funny, and although it was funny at times, it felt like it was joke, after joke, after joke, after joke and I found that quite exhausting and felt that it lost some of the more serious aspects of the storyline.. janes cancer, the little girl, message of a broken father... I will always love Marvel and the movies but perhaps the next could be light but not so you feel like you're being slapped across the face with a joke every 30 seconds...

Author: shameensalim
Review: " Thor Love and Thunder " has a slightly rocky path through the Marvel Cinematic Universe. The first movie reimagined Thor as a fish-out-of-water buffoon. Later, he reinvented himself as a romantic figure, and he became a full-fledged comedic figure in "Thor: Ragnarok." But after putting Thor through the wringer in the "Avengers: Infinity War" and the subsequent "Avengers: Endgame" film, he finally found his footing. That said, Thor has been in the Marvel Cinematic Universe for more than half a decade, and each of his iterations has been unmoored.

Putting aside the tedious narrative that tries to be meaningful, the film simply lacks the level of humour of its predecessor. There's a lot of poor attempts at humour, almost bordering on juvenile. Author: moatandbailey
Review_Title: Taika's meditation on religion drives Thor's latest
Review: Two particular juxtapositions come to mind in Thor 4: vulnerable and innocent children magically imbued with Thor's destructive might, and, secondly, the corrupt gaudy garish decadence of Omnipotent City and Gorr's final quiet contemplation with Thor on the nature of Godhood and true salvation at the tranquil altar of Enigma. I think the gist of what Taika was going for gets through for the most part. Omnipotent City is a commentary on failed leadership, failed religion, fallen angels, corrupt deities who have brought existence to stagnation and misery. The ending finds Gorr and Thor trying to make sense of this revelation, this disappointment (Thor with Zeus, Gorr with his god who he slew earlier). Together they rediscover what is meaningful again, without the guidance or inspiration of their respective idols or gods. They realize that what is most meaningful was inside them all along- the capacity for love and, thus, sacrifice and heroism. There's a nice message here in Taika's second foray into the Thor series if you, as Mighty Thor says with her parting words, "keep your heart open."

Author: davebaxter-234-220871
Review: This movie is a train wreck that somehow follows up some of the best movies of the past decade. How can you take Thor, one of the best characters in the MCU and make a movie that only gets good just as it ends? I get that there have always been jokes in the MCU, but this was full of horrible jokes that must have come from a beginner "comedians" that sold the jokes for $5 just to be able to buy dinner. By the time I actually got as into this movie as I could, it had like 10 minutes left. It's a shame that Dr. Strange can't make us all forget this ever happened. Who is Peter Parker is now the least of MCU fans worries, we still have to see Thor in the next Guardians movie too. I'm sorry but outside of No Way Home, and MAYBE Multiverse of Madness, the MCU should have realized that Endgame was just that. The endgame for an amazing run. Please stop now. The universe is crumbling beneath our feet!

I absolutely loved Cristian Bale's performance, he genuinely is one of the scariest MCU villains in my personal opinion. I loved the Chemistry between Chris H and Natalie Portman, and the fact that Natalie became the mighty Thor was also pretty cool. However, apart from good performances, and some good cgi the film was missing a bit of magic. I can't quite put my finger on it, but something more was needed to make this film absolutely amazing. I would say people should definitely watch it in the Cinemas but also that they should wait.

Author: migel-shehu
Review: Don't get me wrong on this review. The movie was fine, but i saw so many lost opportunities. The history line was great and there were some amazing actors that could have made the movie so much greater. It was really a lost opportunity in so many directions. Christian Bale is a great actor and one thing that I liked, was that only his character brought ''realness" to the movie. It was only where he was part of the scenes where u really could not take the eyes of the movie. His character really was made out of a good reason and it lives space to think. On the other hand Nataly Portman as Jean Foster was a great fit and she portrayed so well the character. But the downfall of the movie and what needs to be fixed in the next ones was the parody. There is nothing wrong when fun moments are added during the movie, in my opinion is better because it gets your attention but should not be overdone. From the beginning to the end it seemed more like a parody and not in a good way. Was totally disappointed in this direction. There were of course really funny moments but mostly is was over exaggerated. So many important and powerful scenes where wasted and were turned into jokes. It made the move feel very very commercial. Like a strategy only to attract the audience and taking it further away from being a good movie. It seemed in many moments like I was seeing Deadpool (but not in a good way). Deadpool was a successful movie of course but this doesn't mean that you have to turn every marvel movie into a parody. It looses its meaning. Thor is not a parody movie and please keep this in mind in the other ones. Was really excited to see it, but when I left the cinema I was totally disappointed. It really looks like the only intention was to win money and the content was not important turning it 100% into a commercial movie. Incredible cast but so purely guided.

Author: scottdmaccallum
Review: This was definitely a huge step backwards for Marvel. Some comedy is good, but this forced humor everywhere! Gorr was the only good part and he wasn't even in the movie much for one of the best villains in Marvel.

This movie is very light, in your face, and ridiculous, so I can see many people not enjoying it. It is essentially a Saturday morning cartoon turned live action, which I myself enjoyed quite a bit.

Author: rechtienejalec
Review_Title: Yes it's funny and entertaining, but it is overall meaningless film
Review: I had high hopes for this movie, but it ended up being one of the worst Marvel movies to date. Thor has long been one of my favorite MCU characters, but this film finally made me realize how washed his character arc is. My biggest complaint is there is almost no plot or overlying theme. "Love" seems to be such a vague theme that it doesn't seem like a theme at all. Another complaint was the meaningless cameos, especially with the Guardians of the Galaxy. I love the guardians, they're probably my favorite franchise in the MCU, but they did NOT need to be in this movie. They contributed very little to the "plot" and were completely out of character in the little amount of time they had in the beginning, and then they just left! If they really wanted the guardians in this film, they should've given them a bigger role. Rocket and Thor were like bread and butter in Infinity War and Endgame, why not continue that if the guardians are in the film at all. It leads me to think it was just a marketing device the entire time.

Author: ryanconduit
Review_Title: Pros and Cons, but good entertainment.
Review: So it took me some time to get around to watching this one due to alot criticism and dislike for the film from the audience and I'm going to put it down like this... Thor love and thunder may not have been the best marvel movie to come out but it is by far not the worst one. Yes the CGI was a bit much at times and a lot of the plot was made up of some pretty cheesey dialogue with more then the usual amount of jokes being made, but I found the majorty of it to be alot of fun to watch. There are pros and cons to this film 100%... Christian Bale 10/10 performance definitely was the highlight of the actors on this film maybe almost under utilised with Chris Hemesworth of course playing a fantastic Thor, Tessa Thompson and Natalie Portman also respectively playing there roles well. All up this movie is good fun and entertaining, the story line needed a touch up but that certainly didn't get in the way of enjoying this one. Big suggestion dont let what people are saying about this flick spoil it.

Author: robadams-52163
Review: Appallingly bad film. Why the relentless Dad jokes that fall flat and ruin the underlying thread of the most basic of stories. Dialogue is abject and the performances struggle because of it. Stan Lee must be turning in his grave with fury, at what has been done here. Bale's character had so much potential, so why put it in this madness. Waste of time. It could have been so very much better than this nonsense. It had started from the black and white scenes and developed from there , then perhaps a decent film may have emerged, but I wish I hadn't spent the money and wasted the time on this colossal mess of a film. 2/10.

Taika´s style is still here but the story telling was truly a one trump card and on the 2º movie it all comes crashing down. Like thunder, not love.

Review: I had issues with Ragnorok after seeing it and the attempt at humor it had. But then this movie makes Ragnorok look good.

Author: jacobbriscombe
Review_Title: Not the kind of Thor film I like
Review:
This film
I enjoyed it much more than Multiverse of Madness which isn't a very hard accomplishment to achieve in all honesty. The film was very funny and Christian Bale's performance is the main strong point of the film. He definitely carries the film on his shoulders, his presence is so dominating and steals the spotlight from the protagonists Hemsworth and Portman. That is where my praise ends. Although comedic that's all it has going for it as the action scenes and plot are sub par, predictable and frankly don't have much depth to them. This film continues the trend of tearing down Thor from being an incredibly strong hero both physically and writing wise, completely turning him into a clown who's only purpose is to entertain the spectator through his comic relief. This change in attitude to characters is a trend I've noticed with the Marvel Cinematic Universe at the moment. They take a once serious and 3 dimensional character and create this weird amalgamation of complete goofy and ridiculous nature with just enough of a serious edge to care about them slightly. Some audiences may actually prefer this style of Thor but I certainly do not share that view. To conclude I only recommend watching this film if you enjoy the current MCU releases.

Author: info-354-549559
Review: I didnt hate it, I didnt love it. I couldent figure out what this movie was trying to be, it went from insanely serious christian bale moments were amazing. To zeus talking about orgies, to kids getting super powers and fighting. At points I thought I was watching a night at the roxbury comedy, at points I thought I was watching a finding nemo kids movie and then they started talking about orgies.

Author: gaborpeto

Author: gouravkhare-81271
Review:
The movie is just awesome......the editing, the story, the vfx, the action just EVERYTHING is epic. You can have every emotion in the movie.....it has everything....
Perfect rating from my side.

Author: hugopape
Review: After Ragnarok I was expecting something great as that is my favourite mcu movie, but I came out of this one wanting more. The jokes were not funny and I think I only laughed twice. The guardians of the galaxy while one of the highlights of the movie, felt very soulless with only Quail being really a character with the others only making some noises. Gorr was wasted and felt like a very superficial villain. Most of the stuff I liked about Ragnarok was just not in this movie. While I feel Ragnarok fixed the character, this movie ruined him. I was initially intrigued at the inclusion of Jane Foster as mighty Thor but I found myself very unsatisfied with her scenes and her death felt very rushed. I liked multiverse of Madness a lot but I had many problems with the movie with many of those same problems being very large in this movie. Zeus was a positive I had with this movie, I liked the scenes he had but I wished there were more. I don't think this is Taika's fault, I think this is a movie I could compare to justice league, there is very clear studio interference and I think the apparent 4 hours of cut footage was necessary to make this movie good. Very disappointed.

Author: JDR_Reviews-2
Review: I loved the MCU phases 1-3 will always be peak cinema phase 4 has been lacking and movies like this one shows Marvel is running out of steam. They are causing burnout among fans and this movie shows. But the biggest problem I have with this movie is Thor's arc. He is one of Marvel's best and he had a perfect arc in Ragnarok but this movie single handled destroyed him as a character. He went from learning to move on from his hammer and becoming the God of Thunder to wanting his hammer again and just going back to not as powerful as he once was, he also is the butt of the joke now. I love goofy Thor but they made him too goofy now and to the point he can't be taken seriously anymore. This could signify the end of the MCU.

Author: jakerl-43504
Review_Title: Fun movie (even if a bit too silly at times)
Review: TLT has received mixed reviews upon release, with praise directed at the visuals and performances and criticism towards the screenplay and overuse of humor. I fully understand people's complaints about the humor but I still had a great time with this movie. At times, it does feel like a spoof of Thor, which does undercut the movie's serious moments(which it does have a few of). However, it's just hard to hate a movie that I saw with my loved ones and put a great smile on my face. And let's talk about those aforementioned performances. I wasn't sure what I'd think of Lady Thor, Natalie Portman did very well in the role. And while it was nice seeing Thor and Jane reunite, the real standout here was Christian Bale as Gorr the God Butcher. He was extremely creepy and intimidating, which is a slight departure from his performance as the caped crusader but a welcome one nonetheless. If you're looking for a fun time, go see this movie, but if you thought the humor was cranked up too much in Ragnarok, then you definitely won't like this one. Overall, I rank TLT above the first two but not quite as good as Ragnarok. Rating: 7.5/10.

Author: cboul-46170

Review: Should have had more Jane foster and more time diving into her character and the villain. Felt like the movie actually played a part in the Grand sceme of things, which Ragnarok was just a side story. I'm glad they showed that the villian was doubled sided that got corrupted by a certain sword. The parade or joke on God's throughout the movie was great, since god's have been criticized throughout human history. The mockery and critic on God's helped show other aspects of the human slash God relationship.

Author: geostamatakis-63432
Review: No real scenario (just save the kids from the bad guy), Guardians of the Galaxy fade away really quickly with just a few lines, too many jokes and Jane just gets superpowers with a ridiculous way. Really? The only good thing in the movie was the Guns 'n' Roses cover in battles which were short and most of them placed in deep dark background for obvious reasons (less CGI work, less money spent). The simplicity of the movie made me think that it was a "let's get over with it fast, we have the franchise, the financial outcome (box office earnings) is certain, so get it done and go for the next one" movie. At the end, I think this was exclusively a kids' movie, just as most MCU movies and series were after "Avengers: Endgame". And to close up with, mainly Guns 'n' Roses songs have played, Sweet child o' mine has played twice and after the post credit scene Dio came up? What a discontinuity...

Review: Why all the hate? Yes, it was sillier than Ragnorak but it was still a fun romp in the Thor universe. Chris Hemsworth looks like he's having fun and it was Natalie Portman's strongest performance in the franchise. I didn't really read many reviews so was surprised to see Russell Crowe make an appearance. We didn't have a lot of expectations, just wanted some escapist entertainment and on that level, the film worked for us. I do feel the ending felt tacked on for a feel good effect but we were thoroughly entertained until the last 10 minutes. It got a little predictable but I'd still recommend Love and Thunder. Get your popcorn ready!

Review: Hats off to Christian Bale! Bale was great in this movie which kept my attention more than anything else happening in it. It was a watchable movie but a bit silly at times.

Review: I use IMDB quite a lot, but this is the first time I have felt the need to write a review for a film, and it's not for a good reason.

Author: vicewsssixteen
