Author: Ray3100
Review: Christian Bale's Gorr.is a villain of gravitas. Thor has zero gravitas. The resulting movie is very disjointed in tone. Is it funny and irreverent? Is it dark and brooding? The movie tries to be both and instead doesn't really become neither. And instead of resolving that conflict in tone, they try to have a bit of sentimentality and emotion add in as well, but that just makes it look like a melodramatic soap opera.

Author: toclem
Review_Title: Enjoyable, funny but with real stakes for the characters
Review: I don't know why there is so much hate for this movie. Yes it has funny moments (the montage was hilarious) but the funny moments are mostly used to explain the character motivations. It also deals with tragedy, Jane Foster is dying from incurable cancer and Gorr loses everyone he knows to famine. Those are serious and depressing subjects, the humor is necessary to offset them. What more do you actually want from a movie?

Author: capshuu
Review: Laughed my ass off, enjoyed the soundtrack and how the film didn't take itself seriously for the most part. It also had some deeper bits, which I thought could've been better, but Taika Waititi gets a 10 from me for his humour. THE GOATS WERE THE FUNNIEST THING EVER!!!!

Author: oliverlines
Review: It's not controversial to say that the Thor franchise got pretty stale after the first two films. A new direction was sorely needed and Waititi provided that with Ragnarok, which was excellent.

Author: pvn-tibrewala
Review: The movie has completely destroyed the image of Thor that was built over the last decade.. He is portrayed as stupid and unable to act or think like a super hero.. Story line is poor and has lot of loose-ends. Only thing that kind of saves the movie is lot of "pretty faces doing funny things"

Author: jsteelezz
Review_Title: Might Be The Worst Marvel Film
Review: For someone who loves Taika's work I was very disappointed with this movie. It almost felt like I was drunk and missed 2 hours of the movie where it was actually good. Where was the content? Where was the classic Thor storyline thas had made the first 3 movies in the series beloved by all marvel fans?! End Game truly ended it all. It is true what the other reviews say...Christian Bale would have been an excellent villian in a different marvel movie that had the backbone to carry a story.

Author: kindersurprise1000
Review: It's too bad marvel studios completely gave up on the Thor franchise. I loved all the previous movies, including the last one Thor: ragnarok. It was clever, visually stunning and funny. This movie was very weak. Bad acting, really not funny, it felt like a parody and not a real movie. CGI was very poor as well. There were parts of it that made me cringe. Natalie Portman was completely miscast. She's a great actress but she wasn't suitable for this role. First 30 minutes are unwatchable but then it picks up a big. Christian Bale was the only good thing in it. I'm surprise someone greenlit it and produced it. I hope it was an off movie for them. Looking forward to the next better Thor.

Author: alshemali35
Review: I actually thought this one will be trash like the others especially after multiverse of madness... but it was actually good the second part tho the first one was bad..

Author: leonelt
Review: Well, I don't know what Thor this Thor is, but it's not the one you can take serious. Instead of "Love & Thunder" I would call it "Clown with Muscles"

Author: Cochise3333
Review: There is so much to love about this movie. Definitely one of the better marvels, much better than anything DC puts out. Open your heart and watch it and feel like a kid again. Love and Thunder will pluck at those heartstrings, but only if you got 'em.

Author: hotturkey
Review_Title: Taiki Waititi has turned Thor into a caricature
Review: Director Taiki Waititi spends more time trying to make jokes then furthering a decent plot. As a fellow New Zealander I really wanted to like the movie but I just couldn't.

Author: crizz-47674
Review: Wow how the mighty have fallen. Rehashed jokes like matt Damon and Chris brother playing loki n thor. Rest just lack luster and lame. Seemed to be struggling to have any reason to exist.

Author: pronuke
Review: The bottom of the barrel in the Thor franchise. A few quips are good. This movie has way to many attempts at humor. The movie is watchable but just barely. As many movies before it the movie can't decide if it is a comedy or a drama and ends up being neither. Marvel needs to do better.

Author: lovefoolosophy
Review_Title: Worst Thor movie so far for me
Review: As a big fan of Thor and Taika Waititi, I had high hopes as with everyone else, following Ragnorak which was brilliant. Love and Thunder, however, felt like a children's movie with some decent Marvel crowbarred in. The decent is Christian Bale as Gorr, who, as ever, puts in an outstanding and convincing performance. But his dark brilliance screen time is limited, with unfunny screaming mammals and cringeworthy improvised comedy from the other cast favoured instead it seems. Also needless silly references to internet memes that won't stand the test of time. The movie also features many child actors and sadly I didn't find any put in a convincing performance, they rather 'broke' the magic of the movie - it all felt very amateur. Overall, half the movie is trash, half is great. I'd love to see a Director cut of this - remove all the silliness, keep the good humour and add more Bale (give him some more backstory!). Marvel movies have generally been losing their way since End Game and sadly this Thor is another example.

Author: bree_lfcfan
Review: Ragnarok, for me, was the best Thor film, potentially stand-alone MCU film there has been. This falls short of the mark. The humour isn't the same, although the goat's did bring a few chuckles. Valkyrie was more an under-used sidekick whose humour didn't land, but Christian Bale as Gorr was the standout performance, but with little screen time.

Author: peterseymour-31475
Review: Couldnt finish, its not bad acting just the tones all over the place, normally like marvel humour but this is too far. Its completely imbalanced which is a massive shame.

Author: purpledragonone
Review: Is this really all the better Marvel can do? For me this was the worst of the Marvel Movies to date. Not sure what they are thinking between this movie and the last couple of series it would seem they have lost how to make a good and entertaining movie or series. Things continue to get worse with each new release. Another couple and I will not even bother to look for or watch Marvel products.

Author: aaroz88
Review: This sequel has lost its identity as a comic boss superhero adaptation. All bark, no bite. Too much unfunny jokes that they leave no gap for seriousness, epic and intense fight. The villain is meh, The superhero itself getting nerfed and dumbed down. Taika Waititi and Kevin Feige needs to fire themselves and step down from any comic book superhero adaption. What a trash! Even worse than Ragnarok. There should be no point for another standalone Thor movie if they could not even getting the details right. This is what happened when someone getting too much ahead with the woke culture and lose respect to the source material.

Author: usagimiwa
Review: First of all, I love what Taika Waititi done in this film. Contrast between colorful and grayscale. CG looks great, amazing costume(very satisfied) and fun story(maybe pace too fast but acceptable)

Author: keithsealy
Review: I think the some of the reviews are being very harsh. This is a very fun movie... high art? Of course not. The best in the Marvel cannon, no. But, it is extremely watchable and fun. It is a comic book movie, don't expect too much.

Author: email-393-982430
Review_Title: Messy, and could have been a lot better
Review: Although not a terrible film, it wasn't great.

Author: i_numb
Review_Title: Too many empty holes to fill
Review: Sadly Bale's great skills wasted in such a way. His part is done fairly enough. Though i believe some must have scenes from Portman's are not included in this movie.

Author: nreems-203-645478
Review: I don't need social justice or diversity and inclusion in my super hero films. Disney continues to thrust this upon us with every chance they get. Tried again after multiverse of madness, but fool me twice... shame on me.

Author: MrM7md30
Review_Title: Almost perfect in my opinion big love to this movie
Review: First of all everything in the movie was perfect the comedy, Drama and the action everything was in place and the villain "Gorr" and his daughter they were amazing "Jane" part was unexpected and we've seen "Axl" and his father was good to see them in Valhalla in my opinion everything was amazing for a Marvel Movie and better then "Dr. Strange: multiverse of madness" I hope I mentioned everything that needs to be mentioned that's it

Author: amirfalcon
Review: She-hulk now this ?! Where are you going with this nonsense . You turned the mighty thor to a blah comedian. Zeus is a joke ?

Author: echo33
Review: This movie never takes itself serious at all. Any time I think the movie is going to move forward they increase the humor. It really comes across as a parody of hero films. The story was there, it just didn't make it to screen. The actors were fine with the material they had to deal with. It was just again, no one took the roles serious. Let's go for laughs at every turn. A little humor goes a long way. This makes The Three Stooges look like a drama. Gorr could have been a worthy scary villain but instead is just a sad revenge filled man. Thor is trying to be a Thor clown at all times. I cannot even figure which character I liked it this movie.

Author: rmrpxd
Review: Christian Bale is amazing. The ending is great. The rest is all fart jokes. I would highly recommend waiting for the Disney+ release on this one boys and girls.

Author: leeyoungin-51641
Review: The plot followed to the main theme nicely, love and thunder. The movie succeeded to show the battle between two sides but dealing with love emotions. Although I thought of Thor kinda weak compared to the other films showing his power, it is almost covered by the screentume of other characters such as Valk, Jane, the rock dude, and other characters like Stormbreaker and the goats. People Enjoyable if you have liw expectation.

Author: ja-lens
Review: I have mixed feelings about this one. There were things I liked and enjoyed about it but also things I didn't. For me the biggest issue was the first act. It felt rushed and could have used way more. For instance, I would have liked to have seen more backstory with Gorr but also more with Jane as well and what she was up to with her cancer diagnosis and all. Another thing is they should've actually showed her initial transformation into Mighty Thor, they had to have filmed it, I know they filmed it. Also her first meeting with Valkyrie and their relationship. Another thing I wasn't a fan of was the stuff with the Guardians. I just didn't care for that section and thought the jokes were a bit overkill at times.

Author: marcell-karafa
Review: Chris Hemsworth is nailing the character, that became mostly comedic at this point. As being a great actor, would not mind if the story was more dramatic.

Author: sara-691
Review_Title: Good movie, flat jokes but great ending.
Review: The beginning was OK, but felt rather weak, and the movie tried SO hard to be funny that it all felt kinda flat, Thor and Janes lines felt a bit awkward.

Author: TheSeasafarianMuse
Review: The verdict is final. Taika Waititi let us down by not replicating his previous successes with Thor. It's the story of the missing creative spark that my Polynesian brother lacks. General rule: Don't lose your charm when you're in a hurry to meet the deadline. It's true! A lot of great storylines go unnoticed, which is a shame because they're some of the most interesting parts of the MCU. Thor is a likable character, but the sequels didn't do him justice. He has a good arc of growing arrogance to humility and humor. I think Loki is better in Thor because his motivations are stronger, his relationship with Odin is better developed, and we get to see his point of view, unlike Hela in Ragnarok. Simply put, he has more to do, and in my opinion, it's the best sentence.

Author: schatel
Review: Perhaps the worst MCU movie yet. An incoherent plot, endless jokes that never land, a weird tonal mix where cancer is trivial and amusing, a big bad who is neither big nor bad and an ending that makes absolutely no sense upon a modecum of reflection. Thor has gradually gone from an epic character to the butt of a long tedious joke.

Author: kerttu-74561
Review: I dont understand how people didn't like that the movie but of coure it's their opinion!

Author: alan-50673
Review: This movie is about an alien who thinks gods in Thor's world have let him down but it's also about the main character. Gorr is the main villain who wants to kill all gods and Thor wants to stop that from happening. Gorr doesn't need a lot of movie time to be creepy and threatening to gods. We hear about his destruction and see the aftermath. Thor looks for other gods to help fight Gorr because he is has a sword that makes him as strong or more than the gods he's killed. Jane is back and has the same comic story but she isn't taking over for Thor believe that or not. Valkyrie is back and ruling Asgard but it's not a big part of the movie. Thor gets Jane and Valkyrie to help fight this powerful enemy. The Guardians of the Galaxy have a small part at the beginning and Peter gives Thor some advice Thor really tries to use. Korg the rock alien is part of this. If you like him you should like the movie. If not then it will probably make you think it's worse than Hitler. I don't know why some people really hate this. There is a good mix of serious and funny. The funny stuff doesn't overwhelm anything dramatic. This is a great and entertaining movie without "too many jokes" although if you are a very serious person you will probably not think so.

Author: nevilhrithik
Review: Seeing negetive reviews all over i kept my expections little down and watched the movie.

Author: spongeycamelblaze
Review: This is so camp. I love it! This movie was so much fun! Good acting, amazing visuals, and a great time all around. Has its moments, but it does not take itself too seriously. Please dont go in expecting Thor: The Dark World.

Author: ludwig-f-369
Review: Well, i was interested by the trailer but the movie itself lost my love. Very teens oriented , baby jokes ..thx the actors are good and we love em. More special effects that give a wow for the work done. Strangely they play Guns'n roses 88! The only good thing in this movie, I'm just amazed they are using the music i listened to in my youth to the new kids who listen to crap tunes those s days...

Author: lynettecsmith
Review: Really Enjoyed the movie. Very Likeable characters, lots of laughs and touching on serious things too. Great soundtrack. Christian bale played a Brilliant villain. Perfect ending.

Author: kaytlingrace
Review_Title: Arguably the worst movie I've ever seen.
Review: I might be one of the biggest Marvel fans you'll ever meet. I even enjoyed highly criticized Marvel productions such as Thor: The Dark World and Eternals. However, as much as I hate to say it, Thor: Love and Thunder may have been the worst movie I've ever seen.

Author: sasukesphone
Review_Title: Am I crazy because I actually liked it
Review: I don't see where all of the negativity is coming from. This movie was great although not quite as good as Ragnarok, it still had it's own good moments.

Author: nzsinternational
Review_Title: Disney please just sell all the Marvel and Starwars franchise
Review: I'm going to keep the review simple. Disney please stop making anymore Marvel or Star wars contents. Stop being so overly inclusive and stop trying to turn all contents into kids show. You are destroying everything the franchises created over the years. Just stop torturing us.

Author: rainfollower-95-646324
Review: Basically, here is the same story as in Venom Let There Be Carnage: 30 minutes of actual story, the rest is just fillers. Lame humour, meaningless dialogues, characters presenting themselves (again), awful 'romance'.

Author: k-m-rayyan
Review: There is a feeling that Marvel is systematically destroying Thor's image since Ragnarok (which i love) but since then Thor is a comedian, and it is not funny, this worked nicely on ant-man but keep destroying Thor is becoming irritating. Iron-man, and captain America got their legendary closure. But for some reason the most powerful Thor and Hulk are going nowhere , put them in sitcom if you think they are too funny.

Author: flynndevelter
Review_Title: Brought down by the first third, much stronger second half
Review: Thor: Love and Thunder suffers for the first 30 minutes from a very meta-like, over-joked, and outright silly dialogue and storyline. Strong performances from the whole cast try to bring the viewer into the movie, but fail mostly due to too many jokes, and to much screentime for Korg, who's only purpose is to add a joke to every scene.

Author: coolbeancelebs
Review: I find it hard to rate Love and Thunder. As a movie, it was mostly entertaining. Thor felt like a kids' movie that used the the s-word more times than acceptable to make it PG and the goats...the goats really made it feel like a kids movie. I'd rate it a 7/10 as a family movie.

Author: Mainhoonfilmpremi
Review: This movie is a passable one time watch. The thing that annoyed me the most was the number of fakeout deaths.

Author: Tulip88
Review: I don't understand all the bad reviews and low ratings, I really liked it. It was funny, I liked Natalie coming back as Jane. I actually don't like Tess Thompson as an actress (that's just me ) so I was happy her role wasn't big. Rusell Crowe was hilarious as Zeus. Maybe people shouldn't take everything so serious and chill, enjoy the movie and don't overthing everything...

Author: ezviewer
Review: If Taika Waititi is directing, then you can safely assume it is going to be very tongue in cheek ..... get over it!!

Author: rajikn-73222
Review_Title: Thor is literally a parody now, still a one time watch..
Review: Taika Watiti's earlier film was treat to watch with good blend of humour, action, emotions...the posters looked promising but this has gotten outright goofy, like a forced effort to make everything funny or comical...Even for scenes that could have had emotional depth and dramatic potential they just goof it up literally...was eagerly waiting for Christian Bale's villainism to roar the screens, not only it was generic but the master actor had little screen time...wish they shot scenes of him ruthlessly killing the other powerful gods but nothing...the visuals are amazing with extraordinary highly innovative colouring but rest everything seems so empty... strictly one time watch.

Author: looman2
Review: A confetti cannon of stupidity.

Author: mateoskoric
Review: The storyline is mediocre, humor is just right for me, same old Marvel I'd say. Couple of visually beautiful scenes. Christian Bale has once again proven his amazing acting skills, eventhough his villian character is introduced to us poorly.

Author: paoloratcliffe
Review: I personally absolutely love the original Thor & Marvel movies & even rather enjoyed Thor Ragnarok where they started to turn Thor into a joke character ... but , this is absolutely dreadful beyond belief!!

Author: lucydalmolin
Review_Title: Another great addition to Waititi's work
Review: I really loved this movie. I have been finding the MCU pretty stale recently but this film really did it for me. Super funny with classic Waititi kiwi humour. I get that his comedy isn't for everyone so if you do find his jokes unfunny, you'll probably not have such a great time with this since its very reliant on its comedy. Review: Taika watiti def went too comedic on the movie however it isn't bad as everybody says it is , Christian bale did a majestic performance as gorr with the body language , the cgi was good except for the floating head part .

Review_Title: Pretty mich similar level of fun to third one.

Review: I'm finding it hard to rate as there's parts of the movie I really enjoyed & I was never bored during it, the storyline itself is fantastic, cannot fault it at all and there's some scenes in there especially at the end that are great, but execution of the storyline is not always great, there's so much unnecessary silliness that at what first I smiled at soon wore thin, it's never ending, in moments that needed to be a bit somber or serious it's just there and rips you out of the moment.

Review: Loved the movie great cgi and the cinematography in the shadow dimension was amazing but Gorr's backstory seemed rushed in the beginning if it was up to me i would've spread it out through out the movie.

Author: chrus1987-325-790108
Review: This movie doesn't classify as a comedy, it is a parody. Like disaster movie or Epic movie it was a non spoof. I left the cinema feeling physically ill. Marvel is dead.

Author: abhijitshil-12568
Review: I'm a huge fan of Marvel & i hardly ever have anything bad to say about the MCU, but this was a letdown, i reckon. "Ragnarok" Was easily one of my top Fav marvel films, so was very excited to see this one, but this wasn't gone into that Potential, in my Opinion.

Review: Seems the more Marvel films get made the quality dips every time, if it wasn't for the performance by Bale, which is outstanding, this would have got turned off half way through, the comedy of Hemsworth just gets on your nerves and is so forced I couldn't remotely find it funny, it ruins the film in my opinion, the odd joke or bit of humour if good, but trying to make every scene funny doesn't work, which is a shame as I'm a fan of Taika's work, Korg even over does the joking.

Author: nexusdesolator
Review: Bale as Gorr was amazing and i loved the scenes with him, but he was absolutely wasted in this joke of a movie. A serious setting would have been a much better fit for him.

Author: ariansedighi
Review: I enjoyed this thor adventure, it had some great emotional and fun moments. It does have issues as well. Thor ragnarok is the superior film but this is still a solid adventure. The screaming goats were funny too. Bale, Portman, Hemsworth and Thompson all brought their A-game. This is still better than the first two thor films. I like this film more than multiverse of madness.

Author: abofahad006
Review: The movie should have stick with thor hanging with guardians of the galaxy a lots better than actually movie

Author: blueskyy_ng
Review: Nobody likes a goofy Thor. But what many people don't realize is that this story was told through the eyes Korg -- an alien rock species who has a world view that is vastly different than that of humans and gods.

Author: xxpurshotterzxx
Review_Title: Too much comedy not enough substance
Review: They've tried to continue the trend of ramming as many jokes in as possible often reusing the same one throughout the film and they rarely land. Cgi was poor and the story a bit weak. Also how did mighty thor go from nothing to fully powered up off screen, what a waste.

Author: kroviofthedead
Review_Title: Amazing villian but not much else
Review: When i got out of the cinema for love and thunder I just thought it was a guns and roses heavy mcu film but were it shines is with Gorr the god butcher played amazing by Christian bale who if this film was like thor ragnarok could have been more terrifying.

Author: dishjones
Review_Title: A few cool things, mostly lazy retread
Review: This movie could have been so much better. It was a great potential concept for a theme to play with. But it just never made much effort in developing the details of the story so they would be meaningful in any way. Instead it just comes off as a rushed and cheap story with plot devices so convenient you can't help but roll your eyes. It wasn't terrible but definitely a misfire and a wasted opportunity. It feels like this could be the last Thor although the ending and character leave plenty of room for adventures to continue. But I feel like the second half of phase 4 has just been really weak. I don't see there being another Thor movie anytime soon considering the plans marvel has unveiled. Unless it's one of the unnamed titles they have planned.

Author: levipennington
Review: It was a pretty decent movie, and one that I definitely enjoyed watching. However not much actually happened. The themes were great and done pretty well, but the scale and stakes of the battles seem off. For having the name Gorr the God Butcherer, we don't really see him kill a god. The opening scene sure, but other than that there is only talk. And him only wanting to wish them all away. Which I guess is fine, but then they stopped him, so there's no real change. Rather than him going and killing gods, he just kidnapped some kids. Don't get me wrong Christian Bale was amazing, but his character's thought process just wasn't the most entertaining to watch. Overall very enjoyable, but completely optional. There is nothing that happens in the story, you could just skip this movie.

Author: ghostboyofficialnft
Review: This movie seems like a stand up comedy but it ends up being real life facts. I dont get the point. They should pick a genre they want to be in. Each shot of the movie is different fromn another. Please its a good production because its named Thro otherwise its is terrible. Story line as up and down.

Author: joette-67783
Review: After reading negative reviews and not expecting much, I actually enjoyed it. The only scene that was strange and cringe worthy was the Zeus scene otherwise I really enjoyed this movie. If it wouldn't have been for the Zeus scene I would definitely give it a 10. I personally enjoyed the comedy parts because that's what makes Thor so loveable to watch. He also had some very touching scenes with Natalie Portman that was very sweet. Without giving away any scenes I definitely loved the ending with a little girl and wish there would have been more scenes with her and Thor because it shows a different side of him. I would love to see a movie with him raising her .

Author: cboyercolon
Review_Title: Great Movie, but not to great in action!!!!
Review: I loved the movie but I was expecting to seen more actions and more participation from the Guardians of the Galaxy in this film!!! I think they tried to create a storyline similar from the Guardians and actually they forgot the actual first two Thors storyline formats. They implemented to many funny scenes and moments. I wanted to see more action from Gorr!!! I read his story and I think he got a great story to tell to the audience but they focus more about Thor path!!!

Author: akhtarzein
Review: Masterpiece, classic Thor Adventure, great action, jumps straight in to the movie, legendary acting performances from Chris Hemsworth and Christian Bale.

Author: xokapokaa
Review: For real, if the actors were not the same, i would bet that it is a very bad parody... They really have the potential to create something good, but they try so hard to add "funny elements" that it ruins everything... You can not enjoy anything even if you try!

Author: CinematicLight
Review: This is so far the worst of Thors movies! Very immature scenes, cringe moments, bad and childish dialogue. Not even a great acting from Cristian Bale could not save this movie. Thor is presented very immature with bad jokes, not even close to his character in avengers. Plot of the movie was sacrificed for the sake of the jokes, and it turned really bad. Children that shares Thors powers, army of kids vs monsters, really felt like a kids movie. So much missed opportunity with Gorr, there was no room to build his character. There was no scene where he fights other gods besides the one at the start of the movie. In the end his daughter with Thors axe jumping and fighting, really childish. I was really disappointed in the cinema watching one of my favoruite heroes getting butcherd and not by Gorr in the batlle. Only thing that i liked is presentation of Eternity!

Author: stephrory
Review: 10/10 absolutely amazing. Feeling blue? Come watch Thor. Did not feel rushed. It was a comedy, an action movie, mixed with a l feel good love romcon. You need to get away from everyday life? Come watch it.

Author: mohamed_tarek
Review_Title: The Villian We Deserved But Never Got
Review: I am really disappointed. Taiki made Thor, Jane most importantly Gorr silly even with Christian Bale great performance. What a waste of talents and time. He even wasted a great talent Russell Crowe. He should never direct a movie ever again in Marvel and I hope never in DC. He had the perfect characters yet he ruined every single one of them. Gorr is strong, powerful and feared. He even enslaved Thor in the comics. I was really hope and expecting to see a great movie but I didn't. I would only recommend seeing it for Christian Bale's performance. Let's hope someone else continue Thor's journey specially with the what happened in the first post-credit scene.

Author: kr004
Review_Title: Enjoyable but I wish it took itself seriously
Review: I really was looking forward to this movie since ragnarok was my favorite marvel film, and I like Taika Waititi and his work. Like several others have stated, the movie felt more like a comedy than having a lot of depth. Everytime the film began showing emotion, it would quickly break it up with jokes and such. It was funny in parts but I feel liked it sacrificed character building just for the sake of laughs. I love Valkyrie, but I am really dissapointed how they use her character mainly for comedy and they don't take her seriously. It seemed the only character that wasn't repeatedly cracking jokes was Gorr. Don't get me wrong, I enjoy when movies don't take themselves too seriously, but it ended up being too much. I wish I could have gotten to see and learn a little more about Gorr, and watch his journey as a villain. It seemed like we didn't get to see a lot from him, and it almost felt like there wasn't any serious danger throughout the film. Obviously there was, but it was covered up so much with comedy it never really left room to feel the conflict the characters were going through during the film if that makes sense. I liked the Jane storyline in this movie, and i'm not even gonna lie I even got a bit emotional during it. But I wished they could have done a little more with it because it felt a bit rushed. The entire movie kinda did, and I think there were some pacing issues. I appreciate what Waititi had done with the thor movies, and i think he considerably helped them. Although I wish the movie could've had a bit more of a serious tone, especially with the content it could've focused more on. I would definitely watch it again, it's kind of a fun watch. But it's kinda upsetting to think what they could've done with the film if it took itself a bit more seriously.

Author: rmara1750
Review: Full of laughs and heart warming sequences. I had a good time in the theatre and was struggling to understand the backlash it keeps getting. It's not a perfect movie by any means and certain characters deserved more screentime/development. However if you go into the cinema just expecting a good time rather than a multiverse altering Marvel storyline, I think the experience will be enjoyable.

Author: uuuweee
Review: There are obviously no high expections from this movie because of the rating and also because there wasn't any good movie coming from Marvel since Infinity War. However this one is good. Why? Because the movie went so fast you dont even notice it. No, the jokes are not too much, the plot is not boring and the performances are good. Just go see the movie. 10 because of the so many bad reviews.

Author: miketobin-56828
Review_Title: Critics be damned, this show was fun
Review: Love and Thunder had a ton of humour and a dash of heart. The jokes were silly throughout, it felt like a past phase marvel movie in a great way. The ending was not perfect but I felt that they it could have been a challenging film to wrap up, simply because we want to have more time to have fun with these characters. I could understand the disappointment in this movie as we don't quite get to see Dr. Fonda to carry on the mantle of Thor. In the comic book world though anything can happen or reinvent itself. It was obvious the director had a ton of fun making this movie and I feel it will be appreciated more in years to come.

Author: alainlizarraga-03085
Review_Title: Not as amazing as Ragnarok... but it surely delivers!!!
Review: Taika Waititi has done it again!! It gave us an amazing villain arch for the character of Gorr and an amazing send off to Jane Foster's almost forgotten in the first two films of Thor, by adding an amazing storyline to her character. As for the weak points I believe Valkyrie deserve more screen and character development. The film uses a lot of the elements and enhances to the max what made Thor: Ragnarok an amazing film. Although I believe the last film to be my personal favorite, Love and Thunder is full of heart, twists and turns and the amazing comedic seal of Taika Waititi.

Author: blackdoor-22727
Review: Don't listen to the haters of this movie. This is a fun romp filled with great humor. Taika Waititi is one of the best filmmakers out there. He knows how to balance the emotions of the film and his tonal mastery is on full display here. Every actor is giving their all in here. Gorr is one of the best MCU villains to date. Speaking of the MCU, this film stands alone which is fantastic. It's insular, tells it's own story without relying on the larger MCU which really works for the story. It's a modern mythological drama, filled with the same emotional beats and moral lessons/quandaries as the Norse and Greek tales of old, but, again, modernized. I loved it and I can't praise it enough. Forget the haters. See this in theaters while you can.

Author: teaguemcgill
Review: Continues the tradition of MCU movies being the most bland, cookie-cutter snoozefests they have all been recently. Oftentimes terrible cgi, characters acting like absolute buffoons in the face of extreme stakes, and the most boring cinematography in recent memory. The plot falls apart with even the smallest amount of thought (why was Mjolnir killing Jane, why did Gorr change his wish at the last second, why was his wish not always going to be to save his daughter). Thor has been turned into a walking punchline, zero character his own other than to be a vessel for jokes, I thought after endgame kept his depressive episode we'd see some insight into him as a character but that was dropped offscreen in order to give him a "character arc" in this movie. Gorr was absolutely wasted, accomplished nothing, changed nothing, if Jane was going to die because of Mjolnir, what did Gorr actually contribute to the story. If removing your primary antagonist would in no way change the outcome of the story they were not an impactful antagonist. Brief moments of some really stellar acting from Bale are wasted on a completely wasted, one and done character who really should have had time to develop. For a brief moment I was excited as actual stakes seemed present with Korg's "death", but that was quickly lost with his "revival" and the lobotomy of Zeus. All-in-all, what could have been a great story about growing past your pain has been turned into an extremely generic action flick, which seems to be indicative of this phase of the MCU.

Review_Title: Bale is carrying this movie really hard
Review: The movie was good but not amazing. You can see the fun touch of Taika in this movie but I feel it was done in moments when they were building up the moment. Author: joshreynolds-15663
Review_Title: Don't Let The Haters Fool You.
Review: Is it your typical marvel movie, not by a long shot so don't go in expecting it to be, its first and foremost a comedy but it includes some amazing dramatic moments as well as the intense action you would expect from a Thor movie. You may even question it at first, mostly due to the shock value of it not being what you would expect. Give it a chance. It's hilarious, it's experimental, it has in depth meaning and explores various facets of love and pain. I personally found it to be an amazing watch and highly recommended for anyone that can appreciate comedy and depth. IT IS NOT YOUR TYPICAL BLOCKBUSTER. But more so a work of art that stays true to the mythos. So please watch this movie and watch it for what it is and not what you expect it to be. So don't pay any mind to the haters, they probably went in expecting your typical non cerebral action flick and were given something to think about.

Author: Marvo2369
Review_Title: A Messy Script With No Love
Review: Let me begin by saying this film is fun. It is funny as usual like every MCU project has to be to appeal to a certain taste. As long as it doesn't ruin the good emotional moments, right? No, it doesn't. This film achieves a good balance of humour in the right places and emotion in the others. There are genuinely laugh out loud moments that make the film really special, but still holding its heart in place. Christian Bale as Gorr is the best possible decision ever made by Marvel. He delivers an astounding performance and portrays Gorr as Gorr in his own right, and you forget he plays the character as he loses all sense of Christian Bale as a human. Excellent casting. However, that doesn't mean it was all rainbows and sunshine.

Author: vpkdgwp
Review: This is the first review I have ever done, I don't do reviews but this one was so bad I felt I had to speak up. For such a star filled movie it failed on every level. I feel that I have less respect for some of the stars in this film after watching what they did here. I think that if I were Chris Hemsworth I would've turned this role down. This is by far the worst Thor movie out there and quite possibly the worst marvel movie yet. I am a huge marvel fan And I was extremely disappointed! I literally had to force myself to make it to the end of this film. I kept telling myself it has to get better... it just has too, Yet it never did. The only actor that did an even a halfway decent job was Christian Bale and I'm not even a huge Christian Bale fan. If this is where Marvel is heading I'm just at a loss and don't know what to do except find a new hobby I guess. All I can say is that it looks like Disney is just trying to destroy the franchise. I haven't seen a decent Disney film come out this year. As a fan, I don't know what's going on but I hope whatever it is gets fixed. I wouldn't even give this one a decent rating as a B rated flick. Please Disney get your act together.

Author: zvp74753
Review_Title: Another enjoyable outing for Thor, but ...
Review: This is a welcome return for the God of Thunder, playing up the comedic tone established in other recent outings but also giving us a reasonably scary and compelling big bad in the form of Christian Bale's Gorr the God Butcher and a moving depiction of Natalie Portman's Jane Foster struggling with cancer and finding her inner hero. It's fun to see Thor's interactions with the Guardians of the Galaxy and great to see him fighting back from the rock bottom he hit between Infinity War and Endgame. Chris Hemsworth does a lovely job of depicting Thor as a superficially oblivious heroic meathead, while giving us glimpses of the character's underlying vulnerability and brittleness after his world and family has been systematically destroyed. He, and the rest of the cast, give us plenty of laughs along the way. And, perhaps unsurprisingly, the chemistry between Hemsworth and real-life daughter India Rose as Love at the end of the film is just adorable.

Author: john-lima-1
Review: Waititi caught lightning in a bottle with Thor Ragnarok but did not succeed in recreating the magic with Love and Thunder. I kept trying to determine if I was disappointed with Love and Thunder because of how much I loved Ragnarok or because this movie just wasn't that great. A little of both is the best answer. The best Ragnarok bits seemed like ad-libbed gold. The funny bits in Love and Thunder seemed forced or too carefully fabricated to be cutesy. Christian Bale's performance was great. His screen time highlighted, in a negative way, how light the rest of the film was. The mix of actual story vs generic hi jinks was off.

Author: risbycatrina
Review_Title: Glad I didn't listen to the negative reviews.
Review: I almost never write reviews but decided to give a short review for this movie as I really believe others got it wrong, in my opinion. It wasn't my favorite Marvel movie, but it was over all a good movie. It lags a little from time to time but definitely not as bad as some of the negative reviews I read. Overall if I could rate it, I would say 6.5 out of 10. I had a few chuckles throughout and felt for the most part that movie held its pace. I even cried at the end. Gorr the god butcher was a great villain. The CGI was ok, actually even good at times. The action and fight scenes were exciting and done with style. I love how they elaborated on the back story to Thor and Jane's relationship. Good movie overall. Not great but good, and definitely not the worst.

Author: davidlouthian
Review: The story behind Love and Thunder was great. The execution left a lot to be desired. Taika Waititi took the fun parts of Ragnarok and made the whole movie that way. This would be great if Thor was nothing but a joke. Ragnarok had the perfect balance of comedy and serious action story telling. Love and Thunder felt more like a B rated summer camp low budget movie. I expect more from a big Blockbuster hyped movie. The cgi, special effects, soundtrack, costumes, etc were on point. I would chose other Marvel movies over this one when looking for something to watch. That being said if it came on TV I would not turn it off.

Author: vinniec-53536
Review: Last we saw Thor Odinson (Chris Hemsworth) in 2019's 'Avengers: Endgame', he had relinquished the throne of Asgard to Valkyrie (Tessa Thompson) and set out with the Guardians of the Galaxy to chart his own path. Now, in 'Thor: Love and Thunder' (his fourth solo film), when a vengeful man (Christian Bale) with a serious grudge against the gods of the universe begins killing them off one-by-one, Thor must part ways with the Guardians and put an end to the slaughter. This time, however, besides King Valkyrie and rocky sidekick Korg, he has an unexpected new ally fighting by his side in the form of ex-girlfriend Dr. Jane Foster (Natalie Portman) who, by wielding his former hammer Mjolnir, has become the Mighty Thor! Thor and Jane's relationship takes center stage here, as this film is essentially Marvel Studios' first romantic comedy, and director/writer Taika Waititi (returning from 2017's 'Thor: Ragnarok') and co-writer Jennifer Kaytin Robinson breathe new life into said relationship and truly make you want to see them get their "happily ever after". Chris Hemsworth's and Natalie Portman's chemistry is great, and I cared about these two more than I ever have before. The comedy was pretty hit-or-miss for me, but thankfully most of it landed. It's just as silly as its predecessor 'Ragnarok' (perhaps even more so), but there are also some really emotional moments that balance out the silliness. Unfortunately, the story does often feel rushed, and definitely could've benefited from being a bit more fleshed out. However, I absolutely LOVED the ending! I've also seen some criticism about the film's CGI, but everything looked real and convincing enough for me, so I have no complaints about it. The cast is a delight, and Hemsworth's Thor continues to be a highlight of the MCU, but Portman's Foster and Bale's Gorr the God Butcher really steal the show. Jane/Mighty Thor is such a likeable character and is impossible not to root for, and Gorr is honestly one of the creepiest, most unsettling movie villains I've ever seen, yet he's also sympathetic because of his motivations. We sadly don't see as much of the latter as I would've liked though, and I wish he had a bit more screen time. The film is also amplified by a rockin' soundtrack full of some of Guns N' Roses' greatest hits. Overall, 'Thor: Love and Thunder' is a heartfelt, fun, and enjoyable rom-com adventure, and a worthy inclusion to the MCU.

Author: chellshock78
Review_Title: A movie that should be diagnosed with ADHD
Review: The storyline was great. However, the direction the producers and writers went to implement the telling of the story was absolutely terrible. It didn't even feel or appear as if it were a Marvel movie. So many dumb (supposed to be) "jokes". The creativity for "how" to direct "Love and Thunder" was as if it was dictated and directed by elementary kids. I am SO genuinely disappointed by this. I think it's the worst Marvel movie to date... I am NOT a fan of "dumb" or "stupid" entertainment, because someone seems to have ran out of ways to make people laugh. "Hey, I know, let's just throw in screaming goats every couple of scenes." And stretch out the actual story by throwing random situations in it. Then....back to the storyline.

Author: liampm-99998
Review_Title: Oh Marvel, what have you done?
Review: To start off, the only things that I appreciated about this trainwreck of a film is Christian Bale's performance as Gorr and Chris Hemsworth's performance. The first five to ten minutes of the film are a good setup to the villain and why he wants what he wants. But, it all goes downhill. The first God Gorr meets leaves a weapon that can kill him lying around, which is a bad idea. Gorr isn't allowed to be a genuine threat, only killing one God on-screen. The film also squeezes in too many jokes, about which 90% of them fall flat. There are times to be funny, and very few of these were appropriate. The dialogue is extremely cringeworthy and some of the characters (like Korg and Valkyrie) serve no purpose. The film also deals with complex themes like losing family, kidnapped children, and cancer, all of which are serious topics, but are thrown away for laughs. The Guardians could also have appeared for more, but Taika said no and did the dumb. He's a great director, and films like Ragnarok, Jojo Rabbit, What we do in the Shadows, and Hunt for the Wilder People really show his talents. Russell Crowe's accent is also bad. This film really shows that Marvel is falling and needs to slow down, or stop.

Author: dustingonzalez41
Review: It was entertaining at times but the first have was definitely over-bearing on empty 12 year old comedy just to tone down the serious moments and/or cover up lacking character arcs. What a way to waste some potentially great characters and actors. Natalie Portman really could have delivered well with the jane story-line but they gave her entire role a comedy aspect to it?? I know it ties to old thor films but those films didn't work so this was the chance to really change her character around and they failed majorly. What happens to Jane is still interesting and probably the second most interesting arc in the film but they tone it down horribly. As for Bale? Not only barely in the movie but they also severely watered his storyline down. Although, he actually delivered on the performance. Two of some of the best Thor storylines really just tossed in the trash shoot. Every other character was also horribly utilized and I would have been okay with Thor's repeating character arc and goofiness if everything else in the film was turned up a notch. Or actually given creative and serious thought. I will say the moment they entered the world where Zeus and all the Gods were till the moment where the black and white scene ends, my eyes were glued to the screen. They were good getaway scenes and had the action comedy, romance, and entertainment I was expecting. Thor questioning the Gods himself and Jane's one serious moment, it looked creative specifically the black and white scene and Gorr actually seemed like a Villain I wouldn't want to go against for a minute. The comedy was paced in much better in these moments and in general It was the only effective scenes of the film. I would call it the middle act, whereas it is squished inbetween two other acts that were pointless, lazy, rushed, and all-around ineffective. The new character at the end seems like they could be interesting in the future but made the character that brought that character into the film feel even mire lazy. At least Multiverse of Maddness actually put in effort in the all around story, the comedy was in the back seat, and most sequencers were entertaining; it was just the writing that was weak. I can't even say what it is about Thor that they failed at because it kind of seems like they through anything at the wall to see what lands.

It held my interest; the deep soul searching for Thor and him meeting Jan after so many years after the Thor II film. The film is fast past- and Zeus could have worked out a little for this movie but oh well!! It's all in contemplating for Thor but tragic for Bale as the God killer. So may plots to this film. They could have trimmed it a bit and tightened the storylines.

Author: Xfilesfan22
Review_Title: Serious story weighed down by forced humor
Review: The overall story of this movie was very good. The issue I felt was really the tone. Very goofy humor in this didn't feel right for the story. In ways it reminds me of a Darin Morgan episode of the x files, self parody. But the difference with a Darin Morgan x files and this is that this movie the humor/parody angle feels forced and not appropriate to the Jane foster storyline and even gorrs. It's an enjoyable film but would have been better if the director took a serious approach to the story over comedy.

Author: Yumyumyup
Review: I don't watch Marvel because I'm not interested, so when I knew that Thor had lost all of his lovers, friends and younger brother, I really felt sorry for him. When I saw him tattooed "Rip Loki" on his body, I understood how much he suffered.

Author: PatchesOHoolihan
Review_Title: No stakes, not remotely serious, not enough Christian Bale and unfortunately too much Taika this time
Review: Having thoroughly enjoyed Thor Ragnarok, enough to rewatch it multiple times, I was excited and had high expectations for Taika Waititi's next entry in the Thor series of movies and as such went along to an advance screening last night to check it out. Unfortunately I left the cinema feeling thoroughly disappointed with what I saw and that I had once again been tricked into watching another extremely formulaic and tonally misguided piece of modern Disney film/television.

Author: adruggan
Review_Title: Not half as bad as I expected.
Review: I held off watching this simply because of the terrible reviews. However,after watching it,I regret doing so. I liked it. Yes,the general premise of the film is shaky but its a rare superhero flick that doesnt suffer from that problem. Is it dumb in places? Yup. It's certainly very colourful,bordering on psychedelic,and while this has upset many fans I enjoyed this. Mighty Thor? Beyond annoying a few teenage fans I dont see the problem with this character and thought she fitted in well. I also didnt think the "jokiness" was at all intrusive. Sure enough they dont always work but for me worked more often that not.

Author: dhruvpathak-07950
Review: One of the most overhyped movies of the year, by one of the most overhyped director and company, with one of the most overhyped cast, and yet it turns out to be an empty film. The entire storyline is irrelevant to Thor's character development, Jane is literally just shoehorned in, Gorr's character is wasted, and the side characters are....just irrelevant again. This movie is the answer to the question - What happens when you combine the worst selling series (The Mighty Thor) and the best selling series (Gorr The God Butcher) of a fan favorite character? The answer is that it turns sour. Gorr, who was supposed to be scary, is reduced to a mere kidnapper, and somehow feels way worse than the comic counterpart. The jokes rarely land, and they just keep on disrupting the movie, which itself wasn't enjoyable in the first place. Let's just hope that Marvel learns from their mistake.

Review: I was extremely disappointed in n this movie. After Ragnarok , I had big expectations and left the theatre bewildered. I even waited a few days to give a fair opinion. If anything , I like it even less now. Maybe Marvel is putting out too much now, but it definitely took a wrong turn here.

I applaud Marvels attempt to not rinse and repeat, although, some haven't lived up to their hype. I was expecting a lot more of this film. At times felt rushed and forced.

Author: bbartolome
Review: The movie is odd for me because I was unimpressed with the first and second act but found the third and final act quite rousing. Yes, the use of the children at the end was very "Disney-fied" but somehow it worked. People focused on the comedic misfires throughout the movie, but Hemsworth, Thompson, and even Portman were obviously inspired by Bale's turn as Gorr. The serious scenes involving the four were quite moving. Viewers also complained about the action but it was actually short and well choreographed. Unfortunately, L&T felt rushed at times especially when it came to developing Thor and Val. Overall, I found L&T better than Doctor Strange 2 and less tiring than SM:NWH and The Batman. I didn't like Ragnarok and I'm not a fan of Waititi's style, especially how he dismissed the Warriors Three, Asgard, Odin, and poor Sif. Hopefully, we get a more serious director that focuses on the rich folklore of Marvel's Thor and Norse mythology in general.

Author: A7medSalah
Review_Title: "the stakes never acquire much urgency in a movie too busy being jokey and juvenile to tell a gripping story."
Review: Allow me to start of by saying that it's a worthwhile watch at the movies, as the visual spectacle and jokes will keep anyone well entertained during its runtime.

Author: b-79640-87169
Review_Title: Not even the visuals can save this movie
Review: This movie sucks. The plots and lines are totally illogical and/or infantile and I suspect even kids would find this movie childish. Every character is shallow and empty and dumb. I wanted every character to shut up and had the dialogues track in the audio been taken out and left us with only music and natural sounds this movie could've been a 6. Horrible waste of time. I didn't bother to finish it after 60% because I just don't care about anything in the movie. The script and writing is lazy as hell and contains nothing but "memes". Any ratings over 6 stars only make sense if the reviewer is younger than 12. If you're older than 14, skip this movie for sure. I hope Disney go bankrupt as this is a serious waste of money.

Author: BrandoFoundDead
Review: This wasn't as good as Ragnarok but still good. It was disappointing though. I thought the pacing a too fast and they could've dialed back on the humor a bit. Some of the jokes didn't land either. Christian Bale's Gorr the God Butcher was underutilized, but whenever he was on screen, his performance was spine chilling. He was definitely a better villain than Hela. What would've really added to his character is if they had shown him slaying the gods to show how much of a threat he is, rather than having it done off screen. The strongest part of the film was the dynamic between Jane and Thor. Their dynamic in the first two installments was lackluster, but in here we get more emotional weight that works so well. Natalie Portman was fantastic as The Mighty Thor. Overall, this wasn't as bad as some were saying it was but it's nothing groundbreaking either.

Author: OPPATRIA_
Review: The "Thor" films were never really good, they were rather enervatingly colorful. This does not change with "Thor: Love and Thunder". Taika Waititi, who already tormented us with "Jojo Rabbit", has now taken over the direction of the new part of the Marvel film, which ensures a lot of silliness, which, however, should by no means cover the serious tones that are struck. The principle of remixing and sampling is an expression of postmodern pop culture, but we should not make the mistake of equating postmodernism with the so-called fun society. What if silliness and seriousness alternate in a dangerous way? Because it's clear, this comic adaptation also pleads for victimhood and preaches the ideology of just war. At the same time, this film is religiously influenced in a special way, the afterlife is just as present as the hope of a heroic death that lets you enter eternity. Chris Hemsworth as Thor also meets his ex-girlfriend Jane Foster (Natalie Portman) again - together they have to compete against Gorr (Christian Bale), the slayer of the gods, to secure the rule of the gods and thus their own existence.

Review: Idk why people don't like this movie, it's not the worst marvel movie out there and i enjoyed the comedy in the first half before jumping into something more emotional, it was just a fun film altho dealing with themes of terminal illness so a tw could have been somewhere idk. Christian is such a great actor and they could have used it to the fullest, if they just stretched more of his story with his daughter it defo would have been a hardcore punch also kore just being ill at the end was kind of nowhere so they could have given more and more hints throughout to show him getting weaker like what they did with jane. Also zeus being that weak??? And the end cred with hercules like is the next villain idk, but overall it leaves thor movies and character very open for anything to happen, this movie was more of a wrapup of jane and thor's relationship and story which opens a new story for literally anything, MOM and this one are more wrapups of certain characters and plots from previous films and leaves everything else in the open.

Author: filmpurgatory
Review_Title: How Tonal Inconsistency can Ruin a Film
Review: Expectations were high when the movie was announced, with many fans looking forward to Jane Foster's Mighty Thor being brought to the big screen. And I have to say, Natalie Portman brought a much-needed breath of fresh air to the character. Like most characters in the previous two Thor films, Jane Foster felt very bland and her chemistry with Thor wasn't believable. However, in Thor: Love and Thunder, we see the two spend time together doing normal things a couple would do. This makes it all the more heartbreaking when we see how they broke up and cathartic when the two are reunited.

Author: 64ctgst
Review_Title: Just, "good" BUT could have been, "Great!" 7.5 out of 10 rating
Review:
Just, "good" could have been, "GREAT!"
...as many other reviews have said there were just too many jokes. There were too many moments that weren't written seriously - when it would have worked much better if they were. ...unlike many of the user reviews tho - the movie was still quite good despite all that! ...it really makes you wonder why (Writer/Director) Taika Waititi always goes a bit further than what actually works?! ...like for instance - the MCU Thor doesn't get Earth references and such and he can be a hot-head but Waititi makes him a flat-out idiot (which he isn't in the comics) and isn't like that in the first Thor movie and the first Avengers movie. I guess - maybe - they figure the comic Thor would be too bland/boring (and maybe that's true) but does he have to be a complete idiot?!

Review: Based off initial reviews I was expecting to walk out of the theater demanding my money back from Marvel and Disney, but that was far from the case! "Love and Thunder" isn't on the same level as "Ragnarok" but it is far from the MCUs worst. While the plot could have used more work, and the rise of Jane could have been developed more, this was still a fun and humorous viewing experience with great visuals, especially in the costume department. All of the actors do a good job, and it's especially fun to see Natalie Portman in a superhero roll.

Author: stop_thebeat
Review: I saw TL&T last night & it seems clear to me that Marvel Studios are unable to recreate the excitement of the Infinity series. The films will continue making money because fans will go see them out of loyalty to the brand & to discover more of the puzzle pieces rather than them being good films. There seems to be a lot of focus on the multiverse & magic but I'm not getting the sense of an ominous theme like the Infinity Saga. L&T is also let down by its 'humour' while Ragnarok was IMO the best Thor film with regards to tone, humour & characters, this one fell pretty flat. The same issues arose, namely the side characters proving to be far more interesting than the main. Thor, like Spider-Man is great as part of an ensemble film, but in solo films the character and stories prove to be dull. Hela stole the show in Ragnarok even though she wasn't in it nearly enough. Like wise Gorr was a really interesting character, not evil by any means but complex due to his origins. There needed to be more explanation as to what & how he became like he did. All the intesting parts of the story were left to throwaway lines with mystic origins, those stories were far more interesting than the frankly dire representation of someone going through mental health problems.

Author: wahdmsyhy
Review: Taka Waititi, I will never forget your name. You are a real artist. The classic Thor adventure takes place in a humorous and balanced context. Everything indicates that there is some kind of perfection in this film. Imagination is experienced in a completely enjoyable way. But the key of the film is Gore and his characterization which makes the film even more high. We have less here than ever, certainly less entertainment and more art. Less than ever because advanced entertainment tools are not used according to the audience's wishes, and when we say that we have a work of art here, it means that we are actually facing a balance in their feelings and romantic characterization. It is really the best joke that we can give an example in the history of cinema. Taka Waititi is a stylish director. And having a style is an important thing that makes the image form and uniform. The story does not suffer from false emotions that destroy the entire structure of the story. I mean, it doesn't deviate from the beginning of the movie to the end of the movie. And that focus is what Taka Waititi has perfected. Even in the great stories that we read from classical literature, for example, this focus is not present in the entire structure of the story, and this point is very important. There is drama from the beginning of the film to the end of the film and that is what makes this film a masterpiece. And again, we have to consider that we are watching a Marvel movie. And the ground for doing such work is hardly prepared. Another thing is face painting. The facial expressions of the characters in the film stimulate our senses in a wonderful way and serve the script. Taka Waititi has won an Academy Award and several Emmy Awards for hit series. But clearly his best work is this movie. No matter how many times we see the movie, we are caught by more things. And this means depth. Artwork must have depth. I always keep this point in mind that the work of art must have depth. Not by flipping the script and creating artificial complexity in it. The depth of a work of art comes from a complexity that is not artificial. For example, in this movie, the three main characters deepen the story. The rhythm of the film also gives depth to the film. Chris Hemsworth adds emotion to the film. Natalie Portman gives it a deep sense of humor and Gore balances it. Everything in the film becomes form and there is no trace of defects in it. Let's face it, Marvel needed a change. Now the She-Hulk series had an excuse. But why should such a movie get so much hate for no reason. It's not just about Marvel fans, hitters have a problem with work form.

Author: paytonmichael
Review_Title: Can't Wait for the Next One!!
Review: If you wanted more of the magic from Thor: Ragnarok, it's here in spades. By virtue of his design, Christian Bale's deliciously hammy performance, and the delicious shadows swirling around him, I couldn't keep my eyes off Gorr the God Butcher. I could listen to this villain talk for ages. He and his plot take our heroes to some of the most visually creative locations and set pieces we've seen in the MCU thus far. When set to the great Michael Giacchino's score and a perfectly-fitting hair metal soundtrack (lots of Guns 'n Roses with a dash of Dio), you're fully whisked into a world that could only happen in comic books. It's just a notch below Ragnarok due to the occasional leap in logic (one in particular towards the end comes out of the blue). However, this is for sure on par with Thor Odinson's best adventures. Taika Waititi was born to direct this lovable himbo space-Viking. I can't wait for the next classic-rock science-fantasy trip. If those end-credits teasers are any indication, there's plenty more to explore with the God of Thunder.

Author: cam-88268
Review_Title: Was this a Mel Brooks spoof?
Review: I'm disappointed to say this was a poorly presented movie.. the humour was bordering on the 'ridiculousness" of a Mel Brooks film. There were a few laughs, and the actual storyline was ok, but there wasn't the witty subtlety of the previous movies. Thor himself has somehow become extremely dumb, the guardians seemed to have forgotten how to play their own characters, Valkyrie is all over the place, and, realistically, only Natalie Portman's performance as Jane saved the movie. Before the opening titles ran I began wondering if it was actually a "Pure Blond" beer commercial and not the start of the movie, considering the poor acting and amateurish feel to it.

Author: willdenomme-87605
Review: After a fantastic Thor in Thor Ragnarok, we now have a Thor that is, unfortunately, quite lazily made. While Christian Bale is very much in this movie for a solid 20 minutes, his performance is undercut by very poor dialogue, poor acting from his co-stars, subpar CGI, and a story that is very low on innovation, surprise, inspiration, and stakes as a whole. Gorr the God Butcher is a much weaker knock off of Kratos in God of War, and Thor should have maybe stepped aside and let Jane Foster permanently take the mantle he so unmotivatingly holds. If you enjoy watching the God of Thunder have relationship-problems with his hammer, axe, and a plastic lightning bolt, then this movie is for you. If, instead, you wanted an intimidating villain and a film with any stakes, this film misses the mark and seems aware it does so.

Author: adrianmesfin
Review: I've always loved Norse mythology. Their gods and cultural beliefs have always intrigued me. Thor is one of my favorite Norse gods so these movies about Thor have always resonated with me. Everything about the trilogy and now this one. I was always at the edge of my seat in this movie. I like Taika Waititi's vision of Thor. He's interpretation of the character is a breath of fresh air in the MCU. This makes the god of thunder very relatable. Truly an enjoyable film, in some ways it felt different from most MCU films, and while it didn't turn out to be as groundbreaking to critics as it's predecessor, it proves to be the perfect superhero movie for the summer. Many others before me say that it didn't have enough story, but let me tell you what it lacks in a "stellar" story it more than makes up for in action, humor, outstanding visuals, pop culture references, cameos, and overall creativity. While I was a little surprised not seeing Gorr do as much god butchering on screen, Christian Bale makes up for the character's limited screen time through a powerful and albeit creepy performance, one scene in particular reminiscent of Pennywise from It, and his powers are unbelievably awesome. My only real complaints is are there is too much focus on the love story between Thor and Jane Foster, the first part of the film feels somewhat rushed (though I did enjoy the action packed '80s style fight), and of course without Loki, it just didn't feel the same. Best of all, the mid and post credits scenes make me optimistic for the future of both Thor's story and the MCU overall. My complaints are few and my thumbs are all the way up to the heavens to join the gods themselves 😇. Highly recommend this film, and please, don't worry about what others think, go see it and make you're own opinion ;). Also, Russell Crowe as Zeus was both powerful and hysterical, respect for holding the Greek accent 👍I loved every second of the movie and I hope the MCU will rivit us with more amazing works.

Author: Bigbadbru1-157-42852
Review: I couldn't fully appreciate this movie the first time I saw it. I don't know what it was that kept me from seeing it for what it really was. Maybe I was expecting an epic Infinity War type experience. Maybe I just read some idiots review and jumped on the hate bandwagon, but the first time I saw it I was near disappointed. I couldn't even tell you why. I expected a more comedic approach like Ragnorak, which it definitely took, but I think I let other people's opinions skew my own. After the 2nd 3rd 7th 10th viewing I can't even fathom how I was disappointed. Each time I've watched it the laughter has grown, the messages are more apparent, I don't even know what I felt was wrong that first viewing. These are marvel movies, not the Shawshank Redemption, but I feel the overall messages were just as important as any Oscar movie. There was never any doubt it was funny, but I see the love from the heroes, the misguided, but understandable hate from the villain, I see the sacrifice of a human character and I think it was all put together excellently. It's a Marvel movie. It's not the Godfather, but I left this review because I think it should get more love than what it does. Well done Marvel.

Author: ty-money
Review: The humor here is a little silly, but on brand for Waititi. If you enjoy laughing, and don't have a stick up your butt, then prepare to laugh. The visuals and music, despite losing some of their novelty, are still intriguing. The best part of this though is Bale, his villain is complex and frightening. More importantly, he juxtaposes Thor, a worthy god, perfectly. I was worried this was going to be a disjointed story, but it isn't. It is unique and doesn't feel rushed, and that is saying something for how much is here. The overall movie does leave you wanting more, but I for one am thankful for the barely under 2 hour runtime.

Author: visitken
Review: I am a Taika fan but cognizant that sometimes his humor falls flat or feels cringy. There are more than a few flat and cringy moments in this movie. Thor: Love and Thunder would have worked better if there had been fewer forced jokes and more serious moments. The opening battle scene was chuckle-worthy but the phoned-in delivery by the crew of GOTG was a hint at what was to come. Don't get me wrong, I thought the acting by the main actors were fine. But they didn't seem completely sold on the script or the dialogue and didn't have the heart or nerve to tell Waititi. So it's off to work they go, delivering their lines the best they could, hoping that the audience would go along for the ride after 2+ years of Netflix at home. The 3 or 4 times that I actually laughed were honest laughs but the majority of the time, I was wishing that Taika would dispense with the attempt at humor and just get on with the story.

Review_Title: It is not as bad as people say
Review: Thor love and thunder is way better than the second thor and also the script isn't bad but there are many jokes in the movie and people don't understand it .If there was more screen time of gorr and less jokes it would be great .This movie also has some great battle scenes and music . Thor was great and Christian bale as gorr was fantastic and he was the best thor villain in my opinion but he needed more screen time ,to people who say is a bad movie because of the jokes .They shouldn't see the movie because they have seen from the trailers that the movie won't take herself serious . Imo it is a 7.2/10. Finally zeus was great and funny and it sets up a great villain for the next thor movie and the ending imo is perfect and people who say the cgi are bad ,they are way better than the other marvel films in phase 4. Don' t listen the others about what they say i don't say is perfect but way better than the first 2 thor . You shouldn't take the film serious and you will have fun watching it ,in the first 2 thor you get bored so you prefer a film which is funny and entertaining.

Could've chosen any name to make her her own unique character but no. Thor is the name of the hero its not a thing like the hulk is a thing. I just can't with this bs anymore.

Author: pratim-79123
