Review: Another trash like from MCU, literally disappointing and below average movie. They really kill the main story line of God butcher.........

Author: katievelociraptorz
Review: This feels is obnoxious as all hell.

Author: chrishomer-69515
Review_Title: Fun film, not a great one
Review: This is definitely more popcorn for the brain. Not one that you're going to think about after viewing. It was definitely fun, but seemed like they were cramming in energy to make it all seem more hilarious, but I would say this makes it more zany than funny. For example when Thor is saying Starlord can keep his own ship. Seems more like comedy by the numbers. Ragnorok on the other hand was more thought out, and less pounding the one liners.

Author: vallikkannuganz
Review: Just go for it ! I am not 'that matured' to give a 'matured' review of this film but as far as I had seen (I watched in 4dx) it was a roller coaster ride with strong effect. A fun loaded entertainer !

Author: guinevereobroin
Review_Title: Stage 4 cancer does not mean death
Review: We watched this to relax and instead get faced with stage 4 cancer on the screen. Again portrayed as a death sentence when it is not now. It simply means it has metastasised and spread to at least one other area. It does not mean death.

Author: rdavisq
Review_Title: Good but Waititi a little overexposed right now.
Review: Good 'ol Taila Waititi up to old tricks again. His humor is so hard to put a finger on. It is subtle and understated, at times silly but always unique. His new wacky Thor is ultimately better but maybe a bit too much in this one. Big Natalie Portman fan here and it is fun too see her jacked as Mighty Thor. Ragnorok was so good it was an uphill battle to reach that zenith and fell a bit short. Solid effort.

Author: zanelladave
Review_Title: The only nice things are the screaming goats
Review:
This movie Is bland and boring
Hope that the goats Will be in a stand alone movie, 3 hours of Just the screaming goats, some farts and rainbow .

Author: darrellpirkey
Review_Title: Too much Lethal Weapon 4, not enough Lethal Weapon
Review: So, this might age me a bit, but anyone who knows the Lethal Weapon films knows the original was a gritty, violent cop drama with some comedic moments that by the 4th film had turned into a comedy with a few action scenes thrown in. That's how Thor: Love and Thunder felt. An amazing cast is wasted on a story that tries too hard to pull on your heartstrings, has too many comedic moments that fall flat and even the action scenes pale in comparison to scenes in past movies in the series. I turned it off more than once and forced myself to finish as a fan of Hemsworth, Bale and the Thor movies. It was fun, but forgettable and I don't see myself going back for a rewatch. Skip this and if you're needing that god of thunder fix, throw on Thor Ragnarok again.

Author: pedrodenyr
Review_Title: I felt like Marvel is making fun of the fans
Review:
As a fan of the MCU, I can assure you that this is definitely the worst movie that Marvel has ever released and the worst piece of audiovisual material that I've ever saw in my whole life. The majority of the film is like a massive joke, which is one of it's main flaws because, certain parts of it that require a serious approach lose all of their
emotional weight and end up being just irrelevant. There's no story development to make, theoretically, important scenes feel important. Another point is: Gorr's development is equally very poor, which is sad due to the fact that Christian Bale is an amazing actor. They literally threw away one of the best villains of Thor in the comics and an overtalented actor. In the end, everthing is just totally forgettable and not worth watching.

Author: skeware
Review: The visuals are really good for the most part, except for the character Gorr who didn't look at all like the noseless alien with fleshy appendages protruding from his head that fans of comics were familiar with. It comes as no surprise that so many fans of the source material and art buffs feel very disappointed and won't ever agree with the decision made by the producers. Gorr was good, but could have been so much better, and even though Christian Bale does a great job, it is also very cringey to watch him make the exagerated expressions.

Author: bexhillz
Review: Slow to start but then kicks into high gear, soundtrack is SUBLIME. Brilliant continuation of the previous movies, I still loved it.. I will definitely add it to my collection when it's released and might even go and see it again.

Author: keanonk
Review: Like I said,I don't write reviews but this one is special. This has to be one of the worst superhero movies in the mcu,period. It felt like a bunch of school kids wrote the story. Even Black Widow is better. The mcu has fallen and it is really sad. The only good thing that came out of phase four of marvel is probably Spider-man,Chang chi and maybe doctor strange. The series they released was all so weak except Wanda vision,Loki and again maybe moon knight and that is about it. The mcu has some big holes to fill because they have butchered Thor,but still can't wait for Thor 5. O yeah,and the only good thing about this movie was Christian Bale. It was a total waist of his talent as an actor. I could say the same about Chris Hemsworth and Nately Portman. Director,Taiki watiti(Sorry if I spelled that wrong) is great but this movie is a hit and miss.

Author: zedarif
Review: I love marvel movies or at least I used to!

Author: jszweep
Review: At times, you get very curious about some of the additional world building and hope they expand on that. But then they just forget about it and move in to the next thing. The film feels a bit rushed, and there is a higher amount of humor to this film that it feels forced at times. None of the actors do a bad job, in fact Bale's performance was amazing, and the plot is done well, it's more that the tone keeps flipping around and that what kills it for me. Overall, still a good addition to the MCU.

Author: adamthorn-31294
Review: I love marvel l, however that was slightly underwhelming. I found it good but nothing crazy. I think bale did a great job and there was enough comedy in it to make it funny, but it lacked seriousness and a good story. Marvel lacking lately they need to step back up.

Author: mhh-34576
Review_Title: Worst marvel movie yet by far.
Review:
Pardon my first trolling ever :-/
So glad I didn't waste a movie ticket on this and watched it with my sons Disney plus sign on. Disney execs and writers should maybe try harder on plot and dialog than on wokeness. The number of top tier talent in this film only exasperates how bad the plot / dialogue was. Thors pathetic self debasement combined with cheap meme humor and screaming goats that can be found on any social media outlet was overdone beyond belief. The only thing that brought this rating above a zero was Christian Bales excellent performance within a lost cause of a script. This was a movie worthy of a MST3K riffing and that's coming from someone who loves bad b space films like plan 9 from outer space.

Author: mdizzq
Review_Title: Good, but could have been even better
Review: Love and Thunder had a lot of potential and could've been one of the best MCU movies of all time, and while I found it enjoyable and fun, the humour could have been toned down and needed to be more balanced. The movie doesn't quite match up to Thor: Ragnarok, but it was still significantly better than Thor (2011) and Thor: The Dark World.

Author: danuribe-46612
Review: I've meaning to watch this film for such a long time since it was released. I just watched it today. Honestly, I always expect a lot from MCU movies because I'm such a big fan of the universe, however, this movie was a complete disappointment. The script does not match with the actors' personalities. The writers have taken comedy too far to the point where it stops being funny and enjoyable. I don't know what they did with Thor's character, they ruined his reputation completely. Hopefully, there are better times for MCU. The three stars are just because of Jane's struggle with cancer (well-thought).

Author: sophus-80147
Review_Title: It is what is good storie funny not to much
Review: Just a big pleasure watching. Of all the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) heroes, Thor's journey is arguably the most compelling. The god of thunder's transformation from a serious and somewhat egotistical warrior, to a heroic and charismatic goofball. Ultimately, Thor: Love and Thunder is the most entertaining Phase 4 movie to date. The plot is simple yet effective, the action is Brad Pitt-worthy, and the humor is on point. Chris Hemsworth, Natalie Portman, and Tessa Thompson have great chemistry and the film made me actually care about the relationship between Thor and Jane Foster. This is a must-watch for any Marvel fan.

Author: shahabss-71918
Review: This movie was like a children's program.

Author: ipekgul
Review: It was a perfect movie. Espeaclly Zeus's and Goats's scenes was the fun and hillarious of movie. I loved this movie. If it will be Thor's 5 movie please add the scenes like that thos scenes make the movie better and fun.

Author: starsinmyeyes-31901
Review: I had high hopes for this movie after the last installment of this series. I feel as though the movie start off strong and had a great balance of the funny moments with those that were serious. However, as the movie went on it went downhill.

Author: obuder
Review_Title: Is anybody still left from Marvel?
Review: You have to wonder if any writer that worked on the (Disney-less) Marvel movies is still working these days. This is utter garbage and has nothing to do with the quality stuff Marvel has produced in the past. The film has more in common with the Muppet Show then with Marvel movies.

Author: thell-09807
Review: This couldn't even been worse if they used x-rated parody director's. Sad to see how low-key disney can drop. This was a total destruction of marvel movies with Thor sequels, I only get the feeling they want to end everything as bad they can with the whole franchise. Author: frostytheth
Review: I love Thor and Thor movies he is one of my favorite marvel characters but I knew this movie was going to be mediocre. The story line was boring and the ending was kind of silly. The one thing I loved about this movie was the villain his character and image was really well done and I loved how it added a little bit of darkness to a movie that previewed to be so happy.

Author: rlhanso
Review_Title: Thank the gods I only paid $1 to see it.
Review: It's no Ragnorak. Having Taika Waititi, clearly, isn't enough to make a sweet film. But, then again, the Jane love story was never compelling enough to begin with for me. This film is beyond campy and the flow is awful. The jokes are forced and not nearly as well crafted as Ragnorak. Russell Crowe acts way below his ability and is no where near the star power Cate Blanchett brings to Ragnorak. If there is another Thor movie, I hope if Russell Crowe returns, he works on his comedic timing. Overall, I just didn't feel the acting is as nuanced as Ragnorak, which is surprising given the caliber of the primary actors.

Author: terencemiguel-45279
Review: Not sure why people are hating on this. This is my favourite Thor so far next to Ragnarok. It was very funny, I liked the romance, and the action. 11/10 I want more Thor!

Author: lucymchugh
Review: If you liked thor raganork, then you will love this. Bale in this movie is incredible and it's a really fun movie to watch. You don't need to have much previous knowledge of the MCU to jump in and enjoy.

Author: dale1379
Review_Title: Comedy Spoof of a Superhero film
Review: Throughout this entire film I felt like I was watching either an SNL skit featuring Jack Black as Thor, or a Wayans Brother's superhero spoof movie, and I felt the exact same way with Thor: Ragnarok. Even though I was personally disappointed with Ragnarok I went into this with an open mind, but lost count at how many times I shook my head during so many cringeworthy moments.

Author: valrogm
Review_Title: Guys, you don't want to watch this
Review: They call it a Thor movie, but it's completely something else. You don't get Thor, but a female Thor. Speaking as a male, I found Portman's transformation into a masculine body to be quite disgusting, To add further insult to male fans, the female Thor rescues the male Thor at the end. I'm not sure why the Director wants male fans to stop watching Thor movies, but he's definitely succeeded.

Author: torstenwohlberedt
Review: Thor: Love and Thunder is just a joke-train of bad placed very silly jokes.

Author: mariecre
Review: My family LOVES Thor and almost any Marvel movie, but they couldn't be serious with this one.

Author: kinkin199165
Review_Title: Negative example of less is more....
Review: Too much unnecessary jokes. Strange sudden change in mood. Might be it would be better another one write the plot for the director. Chris Hemsworth and Natalie Portman tried hard to save the film. Rich color used as usual.

Author: madsfalchmfh
Review_Title: So you thought you were watching a Marvel Movie?
Review: I used to be a big fan of the MCU back when it all really blew up with Captain America: The first Avenger and ironman. But since the Sequels and the Avengers ive grown tired of the Marvel formula. Granted, action packed, 75% CGI superhero movies with a splash of comedy and silliness is a blast for a while, but it gets old quick.

Author: laszlocsizmadia-58210
Review: Why did Thor's character have to be cast as an idiot!?!

Author: pringlepowell
Review: Firstly, this is an entertaining movie. That aside, I wondered if I was watching a rehashed 1990's romantic comedy rather than something belonging in the MCU. Granted there are some fantastic set pieces and battles, but unfortunately the storyline and humour level are way below what I was expecting, given the last Thor movie was Ragnorok (a riot).

Author: superpunch-07687
Review: The movie itself was alright but the jokes felt a bit forced and they could've done a better job of using Christian Bales's character, like they could've had more scenes with him without Thor or other characters being there.

Author: dancurtis-info
Review_Title: Bad, and not in a good way.
Review: This film is a step backwards from all previous Thor films in every aspect. The story clutches at meaning like a thumbless raccoon gathering apples with his tail on fire. The subtext is typical, mindless and utterly predictable. Moo. The costumes were designed by a sideshow barker. The meaning was as clear as a heavy lead curtain and the wit as sharp as a bowling ball: it hurts actually -before- it hits your toe. Cinematog-- oh you mean CGI, yeah we have that. Camera angles? Well, they're kind of boxy with mostly square angles and a round thing at the end.

Author: hoffmansarahe-00321
Review_Title: Badass and really fun, definitely worth a watch (or two, or three)
Review: So glad we got more Thor!!!!

Author: tniemy
Review_Title: Don't listen to haters. It's wonderful
Review: The use of color. The humor is over the top but amazing. How in the holy hell did so many people give this bad reviews with kid Thors slaying shadow demons through the eyes of their stuffed toys. Amazing. Christian Bake gave a hauntingly amazing performance. The only thing I can complain about is there wasn't more Guardians of Galaxy. Marvel let Waititi do what he wanted and he ran with it. The fact that toxic crappy fans got Marvel to not hire Waititi for another film infuriates me. It's a wonderful film with great depth. Natalie Portman was wonderful and her death was truly felt. Russell Crowe was halarious. It's all around a good film.

Author: alikmelnikovart
Review: If the Marvel movies from the early 2000s were too serious, then modern ones are reduced to the level of daytime animated series, jokes for the 10 years old kids without heat and emotions, a ton of graphics and costumes. There is nothing wrong with that, it's just that the concept itself looks not serious. Chris Hemsworth clearly lacks dramatic acting skills, Natalie Portman and Christian Bale shows why are they Oscar winners, for this cartoonishly comic movie their acting is top level. For a god-killing boogeyman villain, Christian Bale appears only in third part of the movie. This film was created as pure action entertainment, there is practically no depth in the plot.

Author: gurnug
Review: Be aware. It is more comic like than any other Thor before. Lot of humor is cringy, because Thor himself is cringy. Ton of pop culture references, especially 80s and 90s rock and heavy metal.

Author: horseshrink
Review_Title: Like a cheap kids TV movie
Review: Christian Bale provided the only redeeming acting.

Author: dcampenella
Review: I wouldn't call it the best Thor movie, ragnarok still holds that title, but it was a great movie in true form to the Marvel universe.

Author: hmoodcom
Review: The worst thing is the comedy in this movie and some hidden agendas as well. The writing was not as required. There are gaps in the film. You feel that the actual duration of the film is an hour and twenty minutes, the end of Marvel is imminent.

Author: pesmania
Review: Man I'm really gutted to say this .I had high hopes for this movie but it ended up being a an absolute joke of a movie. They made Thor look like jocke.

Author: tonytompkins96
Review_Title: Don't listen to the hate, this is terrific!
Review: Not understanding the hate this movie gets. It's fun, classic Thor moments, classic Thor humor, decent story, great visuals, and it all made narrative sense. No reason to call this movie a 3/10 or anything like that. Loved it and plan to watch it again!

Author: fuegokarakasis
Review: Well the first half was pretty enjoyable but the second half literally made no sense. Bale was great, Chris was as always great as Thor tho too goofy at some moments, Portman was boring like Tompson the King and the script was a bit of a mess with no heart and clear vision.

Author: mark_lissaman
Review_Title: Was hoping fur Ragnarok but was Ragnanot?!
Review: Far too many jokes which were repetitive and drawn out. Ragnarok had a good balance of Taiki Waititi and the MCU but this felt like it was trying to hard to be a Taiki film.

Author: russell_ellis
Review_Title: Enjoyable, maybe wait till on TV
Review: Yes this is enjoyable but has a few issues if youre going to pick holes.

Author: RyserSlycer
Review_Title: So much fun but add little to where MCU is headed
Review: The movie is so much fun, while it does not do or add much to where the MCU is headed but it still fun to watch, Taika Waititi presence as director really felt in this movie, there's his humor (sometimes too much), his romance, and his amazing story telling, I wish he would do one more Thor movie, to complete his trilogy, Chris Hemsworth on the other hand deliver his silly and funny and caring Thor which he brought from Ragnarok, while Natalie Portman and Tessa Thompson pretty much get sidelined, Christian Bale deliver his amazing acting as always and excels at it. Russel Crowe also does an memorable cameo, his role is more important than I expected and I love it. And I love how thor can change weapon between Mjolnir, Stormbreaker, and Thunderbolt (Zeus weapon). While the celestials does make a cameo they're pretty much useless. Look If you're tired of the continuous MCU story, Thor Love and Thunder gives you a break from that, I promise you will have a great time watching it. Now there's 2 post credit scene, the first one will get you excited, the other one not so much, but still it's nice that Taika Watiti added that. And that's my review of Thor Love and Thunder.

Author: bwvqbzzvd
Review_Title: Not as bad as lots of reviews say
Review: Yes the jokes may be corny in parts the story was sensitive and well told I don't think it deserves so many 1 stars so I'm evening it out with a 10 it's not a bad movie to watch as long as you remember that this movie is different to other traditional marvel movies but Thor movies were always more comedic it's a enjoyable movie to watch.

Author: nacelis
Review: Extremely empty and childish movie, the only good parts were with Bale. Last thor movie was a lot better, they just tried to use that marvel goofy "humor" the entire movie, and it just became very cringe.

Author: robtester-94113
Review: Disney's golden boy Taika Waititi literally saved the Thor franchise with Ragnarok. This, however, is dirge in comparison. The endless 'gags' consistently fall flat, the costumes and backdrops are over the top garish, the CGI is often woeful and there are so many plot holes worsened by the choppy editing.

Author: handaloo
Review: I've been a fan of the MCU since day one, and found Ragnarok to be a welcome addition and a refreshing tonal shift. However, as Hollywood does, following it's success they've just taken the comedy from that movie and absolutely saturated Love and Thunder with it.

Author: rikho-orariri
Review: I really enjoyed Ragnarok. That made me waiting this movie with hype. Plus, those trailers were awesome.

Author: artashestovmasian
Review: Please take the director's chair away from Taika Waititi.

Author: burt-julio
Review_Title: Entertaining, but a bit too much joking
Review: I really liked the movie but: It's storyline was good, but all the joking caused me to lose compassion for what was happening to key characters; the jokes also diminished the gravity of the battle scenes. If they scaled back the quips and projected a slightly stronger serious tone, then maybe the stakes of the story would've carried weight.

Author: averyad-42660
Review_Title: Its not worth spending money on it, but it's alright.
Review: Honestly, if you know what to expect. Its not that bad of a film, it's not that serious of a movie. Mostly when the serious parts are Christian bales scenes, that's literally 20 min of screen time it felt like. It was honestly wasted talent too, plus his scenes felt out of place too. Plus we never get to see him "butcher" any other gods. It was just too empty, mostly when Thor was starting to grow on me after the avengers movies. In my opinion they should've did a collab movie with guardians of the galaxy, where they all take on B/A aliens in space and protect the galaxy. That would've been better in my opinion. Overall, like I said. Don't spend your money and just wait till it's free. It's worth the laugh.

Author: jamesgillactor
Review: The movie is not bad but they tried way too hard to make it comedic and it's too much and doesn't fit the genre. Also the wokeness elements of this film are just destroying the film. We got a lesbian identifying as a man (king). We got aliens made of rocks who 2 men make a baby. Gross and stupid. We got Jane who becomes the Mighty Thor (a man character) stupid and illogical. Just make a good movie and don't try to please what you think you need to please. Men are men. Women are women. A super hero movie like this is not a parody. This film could have been so much better.

Author: sharkanana-854-78941
Review_Title: Bale and some humor give it some points...
Review: Tragic script and cut scenes eviscerate what could have been a legendary villain story.

Author: jonathonmohammed-33287
Review: Why does Marvel/Disney keep throwing lesbian/gay stuff at the general public? We all know it exists but this isn't for everyone. The jokes were mediocre. Guardians of the Galaxy could have been on longer. Zues was a written terribly. He is supposed to be the most awesome ot all Gods..I didn't get that at all. Ended up being a loser. Jane Foster got the closure we wanted for her character arc but with Valhalla bringing back Jane and Heimdal raises questions. I guess we shall see. Hopefully 2023 will bring better movies. I really wanted to enjoy this movie but the writing and direction was just not what I was hoping for. Taika Waititi is a talented actor/director but he could do better. Maybe if it wasn't for his or Disney's political stance I would enjoy the film more. Can we talk about Christian Bale. Holy crap his performance was incredible and honestly this movie didn't deserve him. My heart broke when his daughter died and then you felt peace when she was brought back. Then it raises more questions about Thors adopting of this child. How is she not only worthy but able to weird Stormbreaker? Wouldn't Stormbreaker be butt hurt about Thor having Mjornir again?? Very confusing. Would have rather seen Stormbreaker sacrifice itself to save Thor and company making Thor feel like crap about it but also reuniting with Mjornir properly. He just up and got his hammer back with no explanation. Just horrible writing all together. Marvel can do better.

Author: marko_skull
Review: Bad storyline with no intro at all. They just made up a villain with a fancy dark sword who came up from nowhere, Jane is suddenly waving with hammer like she is a goddess all her life and all that happens in first 15 minutes. I mean caman. As if they didn't even bother with the script. I knew they won't came up with nothing better after Endgame but this is truly disappointing. Not worthy waisting your 2 hours on this..

Author: fmrky
Review: Watching a movie called Thor Love and Thunder should be fun. And it was! Christian Bale was amazing! He definitely made it spectacular. Chris and rest of the cast made it fun and worth the escape. Not sure what other folks who didnt like it was hoping for. I think they may have issues with fun and being happy.

Author: mactrek
Review: Truly enjoyed this Thor movie, which harkened back to some of the comic book series. It was funny and irreverent, which sometimes is just what you need. I laughed, cried, and enjoyed the whole ride. I get that for some it might have been too goofy, but comic books and their movies will cover a variety of emotions, styles, and genres.

Author: anleifr-vanboxstael
Review_Title: My first Thor movie and I liked it
Review: I really didn't want to see this movie as I'm not a big fan of the MCU, but I ended up watching it with my brother and it was very entertaining! There are lots of good things in it, like amazing special effects, great casting, a couple of jokes, and a reasonable contemporary story. Don't hesitate when you don't know what to watch tonight!

Author: zacmelcher
Review_Title: Tried really hard to not take itself seriously
Review: It is a Marvel film so it still has awesome effects and action scenes. They tried really hard to make Thor feel like someone entirely different. From noble, clever, funny and out of place to an overly-sensitive idiotic meathead. It took the direction from Ragnarok and Endgame and drastically turned up the volume. In an effort to not take themselves seriously they turned the entire movie and character into a string of jokes and punchlines.

Author: sydneyledonne
Review_Title: Bale crushed it, the rest was lackluster
Review: The movie felt like it had no depth, and the only saving grace was Christian Bale. His performance as Gorr was terrifying, and his mission makes sense in the grand scheme of it all and I found myself rooting for him. The overuse of humor felt like a cop out for poor storyline and poorer script, but the most the humor brought was a dry chuckle or snicker. It was not actually funny, if you understand. Many of the "funny" elements got old fast.

Author: bisher-06990
Review: Not the best of the Marvel's Movie...without Christian bale the movie is a joke..he carried the whole movie. No big fight scenes..post credit scenes meeeeeh. If your children crying a lot just take them to the movie so you can have your 2 hours without stress.

Author: anthonymichael-93585
Review_Title: Mighty soundtrack, love, thunder, but inadequate comedy.
Review: While Thor: Love and Thunder certainly has the sufficient love and thunder to make this a worthy Thor movie, the comedy aspect lacks. Thor: Ragnarok, however, absolutely nailed it. Pure and simple, Thor: Love and Thunder was not as good as Thor: Ragnarok. It failed what Ragnarok did perfectly. My rating of 8/10 is generous. The comedy in Love and Thunder was trash upon garbage. The comedy is a new low for the MCU, and as a diehard MCU fan, the comedy aspect disappointed me, very much.

Author: nickyray-05243
Review: The movie straight up targets the attention towards a certain group only and favoring them. The script was very corny and emasculating towards Thors character and the mythology culture. They made the movie more as a Slappy comedy, rather then some of the maturity and serious aspect of the characters and culture. If they would of took some of the aspect how Thor 3 was, it would of been a lot better movie. They poorly jumped into certain senes without explaining the background of the situation and story. Overall they went to far over the top with the music and satisfying a certain group only, with trying to mold our kids generation as that future outlook.

Author: donnieojellig
Review: Christian Bales role as the villain in this movie in definitely the best part of it. There are lots of great scenery in this movie especially with IMAX. But the number 1 common complaint is the childish aspect of the movie.

Author: robertandrun555
Review:
Wtf did I just watch? Every second of the move is worse than the one before. I started with; wel
It's ok, ok it's kind a funny, ok a bit to much, no that's not good, really, somebody just kill me!! I don't know where to start. From mumbling and dumb Thor to fat and unfunny Zeus, that did not need an accent. Jealous wapens, I mean really, come on!!! Why, just why!!! And I'm only halfway through. Author: khugie-16570
Review: Thor love and thunder Is. Not. Funny. Period. Unless your main audience is a bunch of middle school kids, I do not understand the amount of crude and inappropriate jokes that are in this movie, from them talking about orgies to the full naked scene with everyone looking at Thor nude. Can you imagine the uproar if they pulled off that same scene with one of the female characters? How about we just don't do that stuff with anyone. Don't get me started with how fast Korg became annoying, sure I understand maybe the first part of him narrating Thors life but when it happens over and over and over in the movie it becomes unbearably annoying. I cannot understand for the life of me why Marvel thinks they have to make some crude or annoying joke every five seconds in this movie none of them are even close to funny and make you cringe. Hey, look they turned Thor into even more of a bigger idiot then he already was, I don't know how they pulled it off, but they found a way. For 99% of this movie's plot, it was to find Gorr and save the kids and bring them back to "New Asgard" as soon as possible, but guess what? Let's abandon that idea in the last 2 minutes of the film and have them fight some shadow monsters because now all the sudden we don't care about saving the kids. Oh, and yeah by the way Heimdall I guess has a 10-year-old kid which Marvel decided to tell us just out of the random with no backstory whatsoever. Out of all the movies I have seen in my lifetime I have only ever walked out during the movie twice, this being one of those times, I was not only bored halfway through, but I was annoyed beyond imagination with the crudeness and inappropriate jokes they have to make every other line. How in the world they managed to make a love story out of a magical hammer and axe I will never know, easy the dumbest story line I have ever seen. Just in case if you were not annoyed enough let's add two screaming goats to the cast (which is too loud for a theatre). This movie is crude, it's annoying, it's boring. If you want a 2-hour comedy then this is the one for you, if you are looking for a great immersive superhero movie then this is as far away from that as you can get.

Author: collinunruh
Review_Title: High Hopes, Sad Letdown (Spoiler Warning Posted in Review)
Review: Let me preface this by saying I am not a Marvel movie hater. I respect an enjoyable superhero film, and I was a large fan of Watiti's last Thor endeavor, Thor: Ragnarok. To keep things short and simple, I'll start with what most people were likely looking for in this Summer blockbuster. Love and Thunder has a notable amount of laughs, but is nowhere near as funny as its predecessor. Many of the jokes feel mild and lack buildup, so there isn't any genuine hilarity, short of a scene or two. The fight scenes in this movie are equally mild. There is a visually interesting fight scene at around two thirds into the film, but if you take away the way colors are used in the scene, it is a very generic fight. My biggest qualm with Thor: Love and Thunder was the disappointing climax; the final fight in the film felt small-scale and low stakes (more on that later). Everything shown in the final fight is done bigger and better in previous scenes in the film; ultimately, the most suspenseful battle in the movie is the one in the early moments of the film. Everything after that fight seems like a downhill slope: increasingly smaller and with lower stakes.

Author: Abbeee
Review: This movie got a lot of negative reviews because of the comedy but I believe this movie was a much needed break from all the heavy-emotional movies marvel has been putting out the last couple of years. Other than that, it was great to see Thor again! & to see him find a purpose again after all that he has been through!

But it's delivers!! In every way you want! Action, comedy, heart and a fine farewell.

Author: shampyon
Review_Title: Too much of a good thing
Review: Thor: Ragnarok revitalised the character after a lacklustre second instalment thanks to it's humour and willingness to embrace the absurdity found in the comics - grand space opera, weird creatures from the stars, and a sense of humour throughout. Thor: Love and Thunder pushes that just a little too far. The movie is essentially Thor's story filtered through the perspective of beloved supporting character Korg, but this is the movie's flaw. No sincere moment is allowed to stand without being undercut by a quip, a sight gag, a silly interruption. There's no emotional solid ground, so you can never become fully invested in the story. The cast is great, the characters are interesting, the setting is compelling, the concepts are intriguing, but the story's unwillingness to allow a moment of seriousness makes even the funny parts less enjoyable. It's not a bad movie, I had fun while I was watching, but you can tell that it could have been much better.

Author: shyrynyabgl
Review: Christian Bale is going from a DC superhero to an MCU villain, and Gorr the God Butcher is going to be one of Marvel Studios' more complex villains. Gore's purpose is understandable, and Waititi provides a sympathetic foundation for the character before turning him into a malignant menace to the world as the butcher of the gods, which is one of Thor: Love and Thunder's great strengths. And it leaves you with the question, do you hate or sympathize with Gower? Christian, like Hemsworth, is on fine character lines, playing Gore as a well-intentioned (albeit twisted) but increasingly corrupt zealot, and while Bill's emotional scenes are great, watching an actor who As an antagonist, it's even better.

Review: Is G'n'R coming out with a new album? Or why else did I waste 2 hours on a G'n'R commercial? The movie is all over the place, and nothing really sticks. The 80's heavy metal references were too obvious and one-sided. The random Greek Mythology inclusion was completely ridiculous and unnecessary, and the plot holes were plentiful. The cinematic excellence of the Marvel Cinematic Universe is over and has now been reduced to cheap slapstick humor. I've given it an extra point or two for a few really funny jokes.

Author: tomassolarem
Review_Title: Great Visuals but A Waste of Talent and a Terrible Script.
Review: If you plan on watching an MCU movie to laugh at the silly jokes over and over again, even at scenes where they shouldn't go, then this movie is for you. Expected much more from this movie. Thanks to this director, Thor's character has remained a buffoon, he constantly tries to make jokes out of context and the image of an epic superhero has faded. The script doesn't make much sense and it seems like it was written by a child. At times when it should be serious, they put some comedy out of place to force you to laugh. It's good to laugh from time to time but when dramatic scenes come they don't captivate you as they should be and you even hope they're going to throw another silly comedy at you. I hope that in the next movie it will be another writer, this character deserves a better story.

Author: kaninbagfra
Review: Poor Marvel. Reaching the top with extraordinary revenue and strong characters only to stumble down with no sense of direction or balance. It is, quite frankly, hard to watch. This colorful mess of a movie should not be a Marvel entry. The God of Thunder is one of the strongest and most feared deities in ancient Norse Mythology, and Marvel's portrayal of him needs to be closer to the ruthless warrior people he represents. The Thor we see in this movie is a domesticated, apologetic wimp. It makes me wonder who the MCU is catering to. I dare say, the majority of the fandom have little to no knowledge of the source material and won't spend money on seeing this type of movie. The colors were overexposed, the plot was only so-so, the writing was bad and I will not even dive into the extreme sexism in the Zeus-scene. The comedic reliefs were lame, while Christian Bale's Godbutcher was genuinely undervalued and wasted. I don't see the MCU recovering to its former glory after the less-than-mediocre installments post Endgame. Marvel has clearly chosen to focus more on identity politics than actual character building which ultimately is reflected in the box office.

Author: pedroob
Review: I'm a big fan of Marvel and Thor movies, and this is a complete disappointment. The poor direction, poor story, mainstream rock vibe and childish humor turns it into a complete comedy show. Thor is about story, culture, sprit and an engaging story that teases you into reading it. The last movies have been a complete disaster, there's no way to take this seriously. Thor can still have so much to tell, he has the perfect background to spark new creative stories, yet the director seems to try to prove the opposite, a tired fiasco. I hope Disney decides to revamp this in the future otherwise we are on the road to seeing another hero dead.

Author: louiseinck
Review_Title: Some Umbrella-Academy Vibes and a magnificent soundtrack
Review: The film is special in a way and certainly not for everyone, as it is very humorous and even gets silly at times. The style of the film reminded me of Umbrella Academy, Deadpool or The Suicide Squad, as these films also combine humor with violence. If you like these kinds of movies, you'll love this one too. Also, there's no question that the film's soundtrack is killer! The story is not spectacular but absolutely solid. The film doesn't quite come close to Thor 3, but as a Marvel, Deadpool, Umbrella Academy and Suicide Squad fan, I really liked the film overall!

Author: rockenenglish
Review_Title: Couldn't really care to what's at Stake, as the characters didn't
Review:
I'm no fanboy, but do always see every MCU movie at the cinema. Was expecting an epic action, dark, part romantic, humorous MCU movie with a kick ass soundtrack. All these were met, but delivered terribly bar GNR (had all their tracks in my head all day). I was psyched about Christian Bale as the villain, imagining a dark and sinister Gorr. But his character doesn't get to develop much in the story and any darkness he brings, the seriousness vanishes in the next scene with poor stupid humor. That is the biggest issue, the humor and attitudes of the characters really breaks up any seriousness of the fate of the captured. There are serious themes
such as cancer, faith, child kidnapping, love and loss and the extinction of all Gods, yet none of these seems like a major issue. More like a road trip with fun on the way and some extras being killed. Thor is still cool, badass and funny to an extent, but it all just needed to be toned down and less gimmicky. I guess my expectations were way off. My wife actually left half way to go shopping lol, luckily we had 2 for 1 tickets. Phase 4 is seriously lacking. Lastly the goats are f'n annoying.

Author: stanislavcom-37528
Review: What was that??)))) I've been watching "Torah" for two hours? This is some inflamed nonsense about the God of Thunder. The video sequence is excellent, but the script is generally needed. Marvel, do you really take people for idiots? Apparently yes. Otherwise, I can not explain this pun)))))The foregoing part, although it was rustic, was at least meaningful. And here, apart from the terrible "humor", I do not see anything that somehow made sense. One thing is good, Thor is in great shape, handsome. But he became too stupid. Unfortunately, Marvel is a thing of the past. After the "Final" is getting worse and worse. It is very sad.....

Author: markcgainey
Review: I want expecting much from this latest Marvel installment because they have been steadily declining in quality and this movie continues that downward direction. They tried way too hard to be funny and ended up making every character goofy and the storyline muddled. The plot was meh and predictable as well. The only value for the whole film was the lines that made me laugh. But after a while, it became distracting and redundant. Additionally, the insistence of the director to bring the woke agenda to the forefront, and this film ends up as a complete joke--unworthy of it's predecessors. I like to watch movies to escape reality--not to be reminded of today's political and cultural battles.

Review_Title: An Epic Fantasy Action movie with tons of laughs
Review: I loved the movie! It was fun, action-packed, with some cool Easter eggs and cameos, great visuals, and a fantastic villain. Chris Hemsworth, Natalie Portman, and Tessa Thompson did a great job in their characters as they always have. Taika Waititi did a great job over the whole film and in his role as the hilarious Korg. And last but certainly not least, Christian Bale was excellent as Gorr!

Author: ashleywiley
Review: I was super disappointed with this movie from the start. I tried sticking it in, hoping that maybe the movie would get better.... It didn't. I gave up after the first hour and even then, I had already started to tune it out before I turned it off. Lots of acting talent wasted all because Taiki Waititi wanted more screen time (and he honestly sucked). He should not have been allowed to make this movie and I really want to know if he was high while writing and directing this movie because there is NO way he watched the same movie that I did and thought it was good. There's just no way. I feel bad for anyone who actually paid to go see this movie in theaters. The somewhat funny but cheesy lines throughout the movie could not save this movie. It reminded me of one of those spoof movies that try WAY too hard to be funny. This was not supposed to be a comedy and somehow ended up being one.

Review: I enjoyed myself throughout the whole movie. It wasn't particularly moving in my opinion, but it was very fun to watch, which is what I expected and what I came to see. I thought it had good humor, was visually appealing, and had a fitting soundtrack.

Author: rabonyak
Review: Being the 23rd MCU film, not counting the myriad miniseries, it's difficult to find anything exciting about a new entry in the series. L&T seems more like a farewell to the Marvel Universe as it once was, especially since it is likely to be the final "solo" project of any of the original Avengers. It contains a lot of broad humor, some pathos with the villian, a lot of Easter eggs and in-jokes, and some decent set pieces. Unfortunately, it all seems as though everything was included in order to check boxes on a list. What it does, it does well, but there's nothing NEW. (After 23 movies, how can there be?)

Author: everydaythesunisnew
Review: Storyline is so boring and ridiculous, the parts that meant to be funny are not funny at all. For many times I almost left the theater in the middle of the movie. Rising the child of the guy who indirectly "killed" his love? Will you ever have Jane's dying face in your head every time you see the kid??? And...Voldemort?? Harry Potter?? These were what came into my mind during the movie because of the music/scenes/design. The parts with all these kids (some were not acting at all with no facial expression like they bet no one would notice as they aren't the main characters anyway) made me feel I'm watching a kid's horror movie.

Author: riktiga_jernet
Review: You got Christian Bale in your movie as the villain, which can't go wrong. He's one of the best actors living. That's terrific casting. You decide to barely have him in the movie. Instead you have a bunch of bad jokes and bad CGI. Compare this to Avengers (10 year old movie) and tell me this looks in any way better. No, "it's supposed to look like this, it's a comic" is not an excuse for how bad it looks. Most of the fighting is against faceless monsters who also are defeated WAY to easy. And some "sad" stuff which is completely smothered by all the cringe. This was a waste of time.

Author: kinglonnie-70622
Review_Title: MCU has been become cancerous to cinema
Review: I never went to film school and I don't consider myself a genie when it comes to understanding cinema, but I can just imagine how DAMAGING it is to the culture of cinema and their respective film makers and how easy it is to just put together a microwaved script, undeveloped characters, a few A list celebrities, and easily bring in millions at the box office. I've seen plenty of great comic book movies (Spider-Man 2, The Dark Knight) to know that the genre deserves so much more! In no way shape or form should comedy be the main genre in any superhero movie. Christian Bale was amazing in his role but I can't help not to take the stakes seriously as a "God killer" when all the movie did was make fun of everything. I mean come on...Thor kills ZEUS in 5 seconds?

Author: superhappyemailfun
Review: A lot of angry reviews from insecure teenage boys here, but don't let them fool you. They are angry because Thor isn't behaving according to their warped idea of what masculinity is. They don't seem to get that Thor's over the top masculinity has always been a joke. Anyone displaying such "masculinity" is doing so at least partly because of insecurities, that's the whole thing with Thor. That's what makes him fun and relatable, and it's why the Thor movies are lighthearted and don't take themselves seriously.

Author: liznavarro-28891
Review_Title: Bravo! Hilarious from start to finish!
Review: A great breakaway from the recent cookie cutter Marvel movies. Went with the entire family, including my 75 year old parents and my husband and teenagers, who are hard core Marvel fans. We all loved every minute of it. If you are looking for the typical intricate , intertwined Marvel storyline, this movie isn't for you. But if you want to be highly entertained by characters you love, you will enjoy every minute of it.

It's like they expect fans to just watch along every new set of episodes or movies unconditionally.

Author: ygzsnow
Review_Title: 1 for Gorr the God Butcher/Christian Bale!!!
Review: Marvel what are you doing?!To create a new Thor movie was ridiculous idea. You could make a series that tells exactly same story as this movie. You could use characters more efficiently and shape story more slowly. The humour rate in this movie was very silly, even in some very dramatic and tragic scenes there were jokes. This affected whole story and movie very negatively. I cannot believe some people say that this is the best Thor movie. Ragnarok is the best Thor movie and even one of the best Marvel movies. I didn't see that much Thunder but I see a lot of love. If u are really big Thor fan, then u should go and see this movie. But if like Thor but want to watch better things, then u don't have to go and see this movie. It effects MCU not much. The only thing about this movie was Gorr and Christian Bale. Another bad Marvel movie!

Author: parisbrunner
Review_Title: Thor : Laugh and Try not to sleep (3.4)
Review: Yeah that's how I would discribe this movie.

Author: saggingbagofnuns
Review_Title: Made me feel like a kid reading a comic
Review: This movie is so much fun, I had a smile on my face from the beginning to the very end. Not only is this movie funny but Bale is by far the most frightening villain in the MCU universe so far. The Thor romance resonates strong but and illustrates the current human condition of fear to love. It will be a shame if Waititi makes no other Thor movies because he uses Chris Hemsworth comedic skills so well. I do fear though that many movie viewers these days suffer that same fate as Gorr the God Butcher and do not know how to love, they feel hate is something of value. The negative reviews of this movie only serve to illustrate that people are ego tripping and can't appreciate beautiful things. I would love love love to see the supposed original 4 hour edit. Thank you so much Taika Waititi xo.

Author: noahcalloway

Taika Waititi just didn't showed backside of Hemsworth, this was showing the butt for every marvel fan. Very disappointed and can say directors like Martin Scorsese was right all along.

Author: dennisamesreiter
Review: Pretty crazy describes Thor: Love and Thunder pretty well. I was a bit overwhelmed at the beginning of the film and didn't really get into it until I found my way in. And with the humour, which is sometimes very crazy for some people, I could imagine it being too crazy. But it did pick me up.

Author: megseyo
Review: This movie is enjoyable. You can laugh all the time. You can say it, a comedy movie in a superhero disguise.

Author: bartschoevaars
Review_Title: I probably didn't get the idea ( joke) of this movie
Review: I really liked all the Marvel movies but this one felt like a big joke.

Author: kuchuryan
Review: The film is a visual feast, with stunning CGI effects and colorful costumes that evoke a retro sci-fi vibe. The action scenes are thrilling and inventive, especially when Thor and Jane team up to unleash their powers. The film also has plenty of humor, thanks to Waititi's quirky style and Hemsworth's comedic timing. The supporting cast is also great, with Bale delivering a menacing performance as Gorr and Portman proving her worth as a superhero.

Author: shanemitchelldesign
Review: Not sure why this has so much hate. Compared to Dr. Strange Multiverse this was an exceptional achievement. It's not as good as Thor Ragnarok but there are few Marvel films that are.

Author: Daniel_Dilyanov
Review: MCU fanboys/girls getting their panties in a twist. This movie was a charming adventure comedy. If not for the stumbling between comedic punchline and tragic elements, I would have given this an even higher rating.

Author: paulholborn-68003
Review: There are so many things wrong with this film.

Author: sotelocristianlopez
Review: I love Thor and I loved love and thunder but I had 2 issues with it. I felt mighty Thor was a bit wasted but had a good send off and with the girl I think it was good to see because now Thor has someone to love, even though they could have done that closure/happy ending with Jane. I also liked the comedy and the mood for the movie, but my only problem with it was that there wasn't enough Gorr and I didn't like that scene were all of the kids were fighting. I think if they had more time with Gorr and had Thor go wild and kill all of the shadow creatures instead of the kids I think the movie would have been perfect. I think though that people have been a little tough on the movie considering it was meant to be an action comedy like Ragnorok and I guess I understand when people judge the cgi but personally I don't really care about that stuff and just care about how entertaining it is.

Author: ramosmisael
Review: I really enjoyed watching this movie at the theater. There was action, comedy, the Guardians of The Galaxy and even some good emotional scenes. However, I think Gorr lacks a lot of character development. In the beginning, we see how Gorr lost his daughter and how he got the Necrosword. We then never come to see how Gorr butchered other gods, and how the Necrosword started to influence Gorr's behavior. We get very little screentime of Gorr being the God Butcher, which makes him look like a weaker villain than he really is.

Author: mirlohinovin
Review: This episode was really childish and I expected more from Marvel.

Author: pierreindc
Review: What a piece of crap. I admit not watching the entire movie, I stopped after 30 min. What is the point of such a parody?

Author: cetinerinc
Review_Title: No wonder why Robert Downey Jr left MCU
Review: After Disney bought out MCU, strong scenario and strong acting have gone. I think producers in MCU tried very hard on creativity until MCU becomes side product of Disney. Instead of making better movies afterwards, producers of MCU settled on big pile of money and spoiled by it. Love and thunder & Madness of multiverse are disaster so far. Congrats guys.

Author: JamesPromovies
Review_Title: Funny, enjoyable also a short movie
Review: Thor: Love and Thunder is a pretty funny film. But when I was watching it, It finished too quick. In my opinion, there wasn't enough action but a lot of comedy. I must admit that I enjoyed this but it shouldn't be Thor's movie.

Author: dpwillis-23634
Review: Just when you thought it couldn't get any dumber than the last one or the one before it, they outdo themselves yet again. I highly doubt that any of the writers or producers have ever even read a single Thor comic. The script is pedantic. It's a real shame too, because the comic book series was awesome. Instead of writing about Thor they write a Dumb and Dumber sequel with dumb jokes and buffoonery. The first Thor movie was pretty good and then the writers and producers got full of themselves and over dramatize everything. It's similar to watching Gilligan's Island but there are a lot of people wearing capes. If they do make another one, it would be great if they would completely lose the theater scenes. They're the worst. I have no idea how scenes that terrible make it to production.

Author: Chewdog
Review: The overall plot of the movie was fantastic but the humor throughout the movie made it an absolute cringe to watch. This movie does not compare to any of the MCU movies thus far. Imagine the momentary jokes in each individual MCU film. Now combine them all and times that by ten. Just when you think there is a moment of seriousness... nope. Think again. I feel if this continues in other MCU movies, it will be the downfall of Marvel as a whole.

Author: rred-38048
Review_Title: No idea why people are not liking it... I loved it
Review: Saw Thor : Love and Thunder, and felt that it was a really good movie. The jokes were not a lot, as against what people are saying. The acting by all cast members was amazing and visually it was spectacular. My suggestion for people would be to re-watch it with an open mind and it will surprise you.

Author: acfotiou
Review_Title: A movie that was probably more fun to make than to watch
Review: If you have watched the Lucifer series on Netflix, then you know what to expect from this movie. Like Lucifer, the Thor movies started with a more serious tone and adopted comedy in favor of suspense and drama over time. I can only guess why this happened in Thor: Love and Thunder. My guess is that the performers and crew had way too much fun making the film and forgot about the audience.

Author: brown-a45
Review: As my title says it's just alright, had high expectations for this film as the previous thor film was one of my favourites, some very good bits in the film and some very disappointing bits in aswell, Christian bale was good as normal probably a little bit under used in the film. Just Seems to me that Disney at the moment seems to be obsessed with making sure that all the genders and ethnicitys are covered in every film and TV shows rather than making films what film lovers and fans want to see. Hopefully Disney will start listening to real fans and film lovers rather than listening to executives who are trying there best not to upset certain groups of people.

Author: heliomcpinto
Review: You ruined the hole experience of this with the stupid dad jokes. Too much is too much. Get a grip. It was a shame for almost every actor there... Marvel has jokes and very serious stuff. Learn to separate.

Author: jkalandarov
Review: I guess everyone was expecting it would be a party of the year. But, it was not. The movie is more drama than action. Marvel introduced new characters and instantly killed them.

Author: a-taner
Review: The expectations were high, Thor Vol. 4 and there are the Guardians of the Galaxy in in? That must be a great movie. And on top of that, Taika Waititi again as director? Perfect!

Author: pedropatosantos
Review_Title: What was a fresh start became a joke literally
Review:
Everything has a correct dosage
Comedy also ...
Thor story is not a joke , is epic dramatic and heroic character...
This is really too much bad jokes.

Author: canaltinova
Review: Thor: love and thunder is a good movie. It's easy to consume and heartfelt at times but i think the expectations misguided the fans. It was promoted to be another thor movie were he finds who he is in the world but this is not that. It's a fun Taika Waititi flick that doesn't have a huge toll in the MCU. I honestly think it's not a movie to be criticized but just rather experienced. Giving a point to this movie is kinda unnecessary because it is not even taking it's own plot seriously. I really think that Christian Bale as Gorr is one of the more deep villians in the MCU and a character that should appear as a jester amongst gods because although he is poweful he is blinded by love and when he's weak, he begs for merciful acts in both the comics and the movie. I think it was pretty funny and so did the theater, the dose of the comedy is ok, maybe a little too much at times but it doesn't bother me. I really liked the small details like Nick Fury being misspelled on Thor's phone as Nick Furry or Korg's boyfriend's name being Dwayne, a reference to Dwayne Johnson aka The Rock. I am well aware that Ragnarok set the bar high for this movie and that is why most people were dissapointed. Honestly i think if there was no Ragnarok before this it would be received a lot better. Overall a enjoyable movie to not think about that much: 7.8/10.

Author: indiesoulmusic-48087
Review: I think the movie had some good jokes where I laughed quite bit. The story was interesting. But the jokes sometimes ruined the serious tone of film in a few critical moments of the story. Though the story was fun to watch it was also predictable, "Good guys search for bad guy, and defeat him by the end of the story". If you didn't like Thor Ragnarok, you definitely won't like this, because it is essentially the same thing repackaged. Overall I enjoyed the film even though the story was predictable, I'd recommend it to the general populace who don't really understand what makes a good film, 8/10.

Author: skmubashwir
Review: I was really excited to watch this movie. But, while watching, I felt I'm just wasting my time. I was really disappointed.

Author: cteng1204
Review: All in all, it was a decent film. But there's a lot happening at the beginning with the introduction of Gorr and the mashup of Thor and his heart break. The middle was a mess. Too funny for its own good, not serious enough when it was needed. Screaming goats tripped me out though. Turn off your brain to watch this one, otherwise you'll be scratching your head the whole time.

Author: davidjamesh32494
Review_Title: Jane Foster plot line completely unnecessary.
Review: Jane Foster becoming "Thor" felt very shallow. I was left with questions that I felt deserved more explanation. Christian Bale was phenomenal and engaging, but was otherwise rushed and underutilized. Russel Crowe was great. Hemsworth was funny but started to feel like a side character in his own movie by the end. The movie ultimately suffered from trying to do "too much". They would have benefitted if they would have scrapped the Jane Foster plot line completely.

Author: samuelraudasoja
Review_Title: Thor: Love and Thunder, another mediocre entry into the MCU
Review: Thor: Love and Thunder is definitely a continuation of Thor's franchise after Ragnarok and part of the MCU. Unfortunately, the sequel doesn't live up to its predecessor and can easily be called one of the more mediocre or less good Marvel flicks. In this review I will skip the plot summary l, as you can read that for yourself on Wikipedia or iMDb.

Author: richmonar
Review: Not that terrible, the problem is the new approach they took with an established character that people cared about and drastically changed his whole dynamic. Thor in this movie felt more like a Will Ferrell character and the movie felt like a parody of a Thor movie. The running jokes from the previous movie failed, goats didn't work and the movie had so many cringey moments. I did enjoy Bale's performance as the villain and wish we would have seen him slay gods. I also liked some of the side villains designs, I got a Jim Henson vibe particularly in the first 10 minutes. The rest of the cast did an average job, I guess it works as a goofball comedy.

Author: ethanarmstrongfilm
Review: I loved this film so much, comparing from the originals it was 1000% better but I felt like it was trying to copy Ragnarok and didn't work. I felt like some scenes were outstanding like the shadow planet and the kids fight scene. There was so many Easter eggs and I enjoyed that as well.

Author: doganfil
Review: Comedy (bad at that) overtook story progression. I honestly got up to the goats screaming part and couldn't watch any more. I heard that this is 1 of 20 times the goats are brought back so thankfully I stopped where I did.

Author: aidofar-30-835773
Review: This film tried too much to be funny at every occasion. It felt like Chris Hemsworth and Natalie Portman were treating it like an SNL skit. Only redeeming feature was Christian Bale.

Author: ciumasek
Review: Looking at the people reviews I dont know where did the imdb got the 6.5 average from? The movie is ridiculous and horribly disappointing which is what most of the fans think. Yet somehow it end up with rating which might suggest that its better than it is... when is not? As a Marvel fan I'm disgusted with what they did to this movie and all the characters. They made Thor look like complete idiot. The dialogues are so cheesy thats its painful to listen. Disney thinks everything needs to be thick and stupidid for people to like it... they should stick to making a movies about princesses for a 5 years old...

Author: midsummerseved
Review_Title: Does exactly what the title says!
Review: I can't knock this film, totally enjoyed it and will certainly be watching it again, it had its moments of being cheesy, but it fitted! Still laughed lots, the lineup was great, Christian Bale did a fab job, Russell Crowe was quite funny, and, bonus, you get to see Thor's naked butt!! Overall it was worth watching. Familiar faces, and some new ones thrown into the mix. Some nice flashbacks to the original films. CGI was, well, CGI! We all know what's real and what's not, but it was still well done. Will rewatch it after watching the first ones again. It certainly fitted in rather well with Ragnarok.

Author: addison
Review_Title: Among the very Worst of the MCU
Review: Don't get me wrong, this won't take the Crown to the Eternals, that's on another level. But this movie is BAD.

Author: sonnybarwick-26653
Review: I've thoroughly enjoyed the previous Marvel Studios Thor movies with Chris Hemsworth. That said, I eagerly awaited the release of "Thor: Love and Thunder." I'm utterly disappointed in the film.

Author: saklechahimank
Review: Thor's character had such a good premise to build upon after his disoriented mental state towards the end of Endgame, but nothing comes to fruition from it. Instead of showing Thor's transformation and vindication to being his best, he is brought down to the level of a puny god, with no such screen-time given to his transformation, which all of us were gapingly waiting for. And, the Lady Thor's origin story is also not at all worked upon, no wonder she dies at the end. And, the worst part is that even if you delete this movie from the Phase 4 movies, I don't think you would lose track of anything huge in the MCU universe, despite Thor being one of the biggest characters there is in Marvel. All in all, A MASSIVE DISAPPOINTMENT!

Author: nate-x-06673
Review: Bale was good in it, Hemsworth was good in it, everyone was good in it but it felt empty. Love the fact that they made gorr look nothing like the comics. Willing to send money on the special effects on Korg so Taika had a part and thor had a sidekick but cheap out on the main villian. It had its funny moments but why were the guardians even in this movies tasting? If you were late in the concession line you probably missed them. Probably a little disappointed that marvel continues the slow rollout of characterstoo. Starting to think marvel is more worried about pumping out cookie cutter movies than putting the effort into following what the guys who actually created these characters built. Up next Thunderbolts...with 6 characters with the exact same skill sets. Yawn.

Author: fatmachaudhry
Review: The plot was written horribly!!! This is just a 2 hour long waste of time. They add their dry humor in every dialogue because they know that's all their movie is worth. The girl (Jane) came out of nowhere and then named herself "Mighty Thor?!" Honestly, how uncreative do you have to be? The characters were just annoying and I hate the fact that they keep adding new so-called heros in the Marvel Universe. How about you focus on the ones you already have instead of trying to make 30,000 more. This movie was just totally dry as if it was made by a 5 year old. I'm really disappointed in Marvel and I'm just wondering who approved this movie. I won't be watching another Thor movie again, that's for sure!

Author: freddiejka
Review: I watched this in cinemas and i have never wanted to watch a movie again more in my life the villain was good the action was brilliant everything about this movie was amazing.

Author: antiharis
Review: Chris Harmsworth 4 outing as Thor is feel like the early dceu movies where everything is forced to packed on 2 hour run time. Chris hems worth was good but different

Author: shaner-83405
Review: For the first 10 minutes of this movie I didn't know what to make of it. It seemed like it was a joke, sort of silly, and then it would get serious. But it never did. It didn't even seem like it fit with the first Thor movie - it is night and day different. The screaming goats in this movie looked like they were bad special effects from the 80s. And really! Screaming goats...wow. There were also some hairy birds that Thor was fighting in a silly way - and those hair birds looked like something from the Muppets. I have to admit I didn't finish watching this because it was silly. Just a silly waste of time. The new Ant Man was also bad. Wow, MCU is done for.

Author: ionut_guru
Review_Title: Atention: May and will contain spoilers
Review: One of the best marvel villains in one of the worst marvel movies.

Author: ReallyKen10
Review_Title: And the award for the most wasted potential of the year goes to....
Review: Frustration. That's what I felt after watching this movie.

Author: salmanaleisa
Review: If you're one of those die-hard fans with 500 comics on your shelf and have watched every MCU movie 5 times, you might not like this, and that's okay. As a casual viewer that doesn't typically enjoy these movies I think this is one of the best Marvel films to date.

Author: superherorobotman
Review_Title: A joke that gave a chuckle... and that's it.
Review: Gorr the God Butcher was easily the best part of this film, and Christan Bale knocked his role out of the park. That being said, that might've been because his character had the most emotional baggage that wasn't ruined by awkward one-liners every 5 mins. His scenes also gave my eyes a break from the oversaturated color fest that overstayed it's welcome.

Author: benelashvili
Review: The funniest Thor movie by far, they really changed Thor from the first movies and made him much better in my opinion.

Author: gabrock-46663

Christian Bale's Gorr was creepy and scary in the best ways. The "short" runtime made the movie fast paced but it didn't feel rushed.

Author: bijlanitushar-81743
Review:
I personally think that it's not a Great move by marvel but yes there was an attempt to showcase Thor character in a different way,
coming to story, Thor already lost everything previously & now there was nothing to loose so Thor was like pretending to be a person who don't care but want to be one who cares in this film's 1st half 2nd half is full of Jane Foster & Gor, Christian Bale has done decent job portraying his character he had looked & act brutal & one can feel his presence all the time, where as Natalie Portman aka Jane Foster aka Mighty Thor is amazing in this film all points to her when she is on screen you can't look anyone else so this film's must have been "Mighty Thor & Gor the God Butcher"

Author: abakash92
Review: After endgame, i really wasn't expecting anything jaw dropping, all that's left was using dead meats and CGI and darn even that failed terrible for something that's from Marvel studio with 250 or some million $ budget.

Author: rudrudb
Review_Title: Overused humour, no villain character development and kind of feel too fast
Review: MCU is now using Thor as a joke now a days. Taika Waititi tried to repeat the magic of Ragnarok but badly failed. Just feel a too rushed movie. Gorr never felt like a dangerous villain in this movie. Overused comedy scenes even during the intense scenes.

Author: sanikabandkar
Review: Movie was great.. Cris Hemsworth was just way too amazing.. Loved the story but as an Avengers fan the movie could have been much better.. Cristian Bale's character Gor could have been used in a more serious kind of way i felt the character development was a bit less.. Natalie Portman was quite good as Jane Foster but her and thor's story was kinda predictable.. and yaa the other characters were almost good in short a good 1 time watch movie..

Author: christophereades-51233
Review: Worst Thor movie to date. It's like a corny parody of a Thor film.

Author: dskelecaster
Review: 8/10. Solid. A truly enjoyable summer popcorn movie. There was laughs, action, laughs, explosions, laughs, tenderness, laughs, screaming goats, and laughs! It doesn't have to be Endgame to be enjoyable. I thought it especially poignant when Thor truly meets his enemy with his heart.

Author: yrgzftkc
Review: Is this the perfect marvel film? No. Is this the perfect Thor film? Probably not but it is an incredibly light hearted film that deals with a handful of serious issues. It keeps us engulfed in a universe that Thor has never been given before masterfully created by the wonderful Taika Waititi. He has once again created a masterpiece that finds Its own way to grip an audience it is not the action masterpiece that is Endgame or the nostalgia trip that was no way home it is instead an amazing viewing experience that will have the audience laughing as well as crying and hearing some of the behind the scenes news it only adds to the enjoyment of this film. If you haven't it is definitely a one to watch film.

Author: tim_tokoragi
Review: Saw this with my other half & our 2 boys (6.5 & 9.5) a couple of nights ago & we all loved it; even my other half, who is generally not that interested in superhero movies.

Author: mattr-98256
Review: Thor has been far from the most serious of the Marvel characters. This film is an action, funny cheese fest with a decent sound track. Loved it and actually cried at one point which greatly amused my wife. The movie is total make believe treat it as such, go watch it and have some fun.

Author: rhdanzig
Review: Plenty of characters got almost no screen time.. that was my biggest issue.. and some got way more than most of us probably wanted. And yes there are scenes that are overly stupid...But. I was still thoroughly entertained...

Author: dancona
Review_Title: The worse Marvel movie I ever seen
Review: I had hard horrible comments about this movie. I decide to see it in streaming. Well, my friends were right. Here the thor character (and most others) is ridiculous. All the "supposed" funny lines are good for children under 10. It is a movie addressed only to children and in my opinion hurts Thor character. The director (and the writers) should take as example the humour from guardian galaxy that can be appreciated at every age. It is worrying this decision that could be interpreted like the decision to focus the Marvel movie target only on children like I'm noting with star trek saga. Also the use of children is typical of Disney movie: often inappropriate to be enjoyed from adults too.

Author: rjmullens
Review_Title: A weird mixture of a film
Review: Some nice moments and set pieces, a few laughs and good scenes, but ultimately far too much silly, almost slapstick comedy mixed with grief, loss and dying.

Author: rpeters-40824
Review: Not even sure where to start. I like the humor marvel adds to it's movies...it's quick one liners and such. They tried to make this a complete comedy? Made Thor ridiculous.

Author: ifroonaryok
Review_Title: Fun; but shouldn't have been a comedy
Review: It was a good movie. But there's so much wrong about this film like the fact that it's a rom-com. It shouldn't be a comedy with someone as dark as Gorr as it's villian. The movie felt too short. They definitely could've expanded the runtime by adding sequences of Gorr killing Gods since it really lacks that considering that Gorr's is literally called "The God Butcher". It was very strange and made zero sense for Mjolnir and Strombreaker to have feelings. And Gorr should've lived for at least one more movie. Christian Bale's performance was too good but unfortunately he didn't get as much screentime as he deserved. Overall, it's a solid, fun movie. But that's the problem, it should've been more serious. If that's not a problem, you will certainly enjoy Thor: Love and Thunder.

Author: josh-819-365498
Review_Title: Did they try to destroy a franchise on purpose ?
Review:
I seldom write reviews, if ever but ...
This is probably the weakest movie in the MCU so far.

Author: renebeydotcom
Review: Well, there's Guns and Roses anyway, give enthusiasm, script acting is not important. Bunch of kids who haven't listened to Guns on Roses in their life made a movie for them to have fun. The power of money to play even legendary actors like Christian Bale. 6.5 points social media manipulation power from imdb. What can I say, reverse evolution this is nothing else. What about the girl who kills a shadow warrior while she is jumping with a butterfly toy in her hand? Oh boy.

Author: lukeowens-00698
Review: In my honest opinion i think this is a solid 8, I like how they carried on Thors story from the previous films.

Author: ahussey-28811
Review: I heard bad things about this Thor movie, but decided to watch it on Disney+ streaming service. I sat through about 35 mins of this and then had to switch it off. I'm a big marvel fan but this movie is garbage. I love the Marvel characters and movies, but what happened here? There's no hook or storyline in first 5 minutes that every good movie has. Quite frankly what happens in first 30 is a wallowing mess!

Author: tonygiddings
Review: Honestly with a anti hero as deep as Gor it was a terrible display of depth, they essentially white wash him and downplayed his layers. The story line was ok but to completely disregard any real development of Jane coming into the powers of a god is lazy. 1 sec she's dead next she's a god, the movie felt sanded down to a easy digestible cinema experience. Boo.

Author: mooretrenton
Review: Thor love and thunder had major ups and downs. One of the major ups was how good the special effects and cji was. But personally the down for me was how corny some parts were like it sometimes felt like a DC movie. Another major ups for me was how good Christian Bales acting was for Gorr. But idk why the writers tried to make the comedy 10x better than Ragnarok. All and all Thor Love and Thunder is still a must see.

Author: taualopes
Review_Title: Thor: Love and Thunder is a beautiful movie, but it is cowardly when it comes to telling a good story.
Review: The 4th Thor solo film and the 2nd directed by Taika Waititi are among us and the result is disappointing. The film has no personality, it doesn't reach its full potential, it ends up being a victim of itself.

Author: mthulmes
Review: I don't know what to say, the whole thing feels like a parody. Script is terrible, the cast do what they can but it's just all over the place.

Author: daniel_pfeifer
Review: Watching this movie, trying to be emotional, serious and funny didn't work. The only thing I kept in my mind were the screaming goats. They would have been a 10.

Author: ysun-90051
Review: Lots of people think this is a terrible film. Yet I think it just brings back all the good memories of Jane and Thor, and literally puts a good end to the hero Thor.

Author: adenmparsons
Review: There isn't a whole lot to say about this film. There's a good amount to like about it. The electric guitar tracks are great and give the film a consistent vibe of childlike fun that compliments the action. The action itself is well done, the visuals are absolutely breathtaking and the comedy I found to be significantly better than Marvel's average attempt.

Author: kevinchch
Review: Humour taken too far, to the point it's cringe, conversations that don't make sense just to show how inclusive they are.

Author: vusimwelase
Review:
I am totally disappointed,
Actually this movie was supposed to be animated at least,
What a waste of time.

Author: gabriellucas-84424
Review: Thor Love and Thunder had 662 million world box office, but is it any good? Thor 4 presents' to us a poor story, full of awful jokes, an unconvincing villain and very little action. Author: corwin02
Review_Title: Saved by a half decent ending
