Author: john-chernesky
Review: Love the fun and lighthearted approach from Taika, but this story is devoid of any logic or reason. SPOILER.

Author: oprzychodzko
Review: It is worth to watch but it's definitely not as good as ragnarok but it can be quite boring at some points.this is my first review on this app so you don't have to trust me but please don't say I didn't warn you.

Author: htmmvycy
Review_Title: Critics are too harsh. This movie was loads of fun!
Review: Maybe I'm not terribly sophisticated as a moviegoer, but I just had a really good time with this movie. Christian Bale is tremendous, and has a little bit of Heath Ledger's Joker going on, which is just perfect in obvious ways. He really steals this movie, but that doesn't warrant an indictment on the rest of the cast who are also tremendously skilled and wonderful. Come in looking for a fun follow-up to Ragnarok and Endgame and you'll find it!

Author: darkcomichero
Review: I absolutely love everything Taika has done and Thor 3 is one of my favorite MCU movies - but this one has 3rd Act problems.

Author: edimus-02916
Review: Was this written by a 10yr old? Yes this is based on comic books but what happened here. My family and i enjoyed the MCU up until Endgame. Now its all been cringy bad humor and going down hill fast. This director and writer have to go. Disney has the money to put big names in the movie but that does nothing with horrible writing. I believe Stan Lee would be disgusted on what Disney has been doing to his creations. Taika should not allowed to be directiong anymore more future marvel movies. Disney what are we doing here? There is only one positive about this movie and it was the villian portrayed by Christian Bale. What a waste of a good character. Very sad to hear they keep this director on board for future MCU movies. Watch the movie but youve been warned.

Author: voncamacam
Review: I love the writing especially the cast, i would recommend this movie if you know the MCU timeline because if you don't it really gets tricky to understand certain parts like the why the Guardians of the Galaxy is with him or why was he fat in the beginning of the movie, that's just my opinion about it, it's still a great movie for some people and that's about it.

Author: ucgordon
Review: In "Jojo Rabbit" Taika Waititi (who wrote the screenplay and directed) takes an epic real horror story (WWII and the Holocaust) and narrows it down into a dark comedy about a boy and a girl leavened by episodes of fantasy farce (Hitler and Jojo) which are generally tightly controlled.

Author: leafcrash
Review_Title: Not as bad as the reviews say
Review: Christian Bale carried this movie. Wish he was given more screen time, his scenes and acting was phenomenal. If it weren't for him this movie would have bombed.

Author: machinehead_dp
Review: What else can I say about all the senseless negative reviews and criticisms? Not enough God butchering? Umm are you so dense that you want to see lots of irrelevant gods being killed on screen and waste of time to believe it? You want humor to be toned down and Thor be transformed into a wise King Arthur? You want Zeus to sound normal and serious? By the way I didn't see anyone laughing during the eternity finale. Not enough bale? Well the whole movie is about him, even the scenes he is not present in are about him. A convincing, serious villain to go with our light hearted Thors.

Author: stancolimorebg
Review: This was written from a 10 yr old for an audience of 8 yr olds.

Author: rmhaynes
Review_Title: How bad can a MCU movie get?

Review_Title: I can't believe my eyes on how people are so critical & critique with this movie, but not with Marvel movies like Dr. Strange: MOM, Morbius, The 2 Thor films & Eternals.

Author: jayborden-06046
Review: Great movie. Start to finish. Entertaining. Paced well. Tons of great jokes and references. Only reason people are hating is because it's not an MCU movie as much as a stand alone Taika-Thor movie.

Author: thetruthtolife9012
Review: I expected to be as great as the Doctor Strage 2022 but it turns out that this one is just a mediocore Marvel movie. The previous Thor movies are way better.

Author: alanmeggs
Review: The previous movie Thor: Ragnarok is comfortably one of the top tier MCU offerings. Primarily due the injection of some really excellent well written and performed comedy aspects. To me it seems that this new offering was determined to pile more and more comedy into it and as a result the movie is unbalanced and can't quite make its mind up what it is! There is still much to enjoy but there is a missed opportunity here. Thor comes across as a bit of a buffoon essentially. Natalie Portman is the heart and soul of the movie really and gives an excellent performance. Christian Bale is a menacing, scary villain but we don't see enough of him and the ending is rather contrived and poorly thought out! Tessa Thompson is underused too. As I said there is still much to enjoy but maybe next time a little less humour and higher stakes for our hero is called for!

Author: spiderfoxenator
Review: I mainly rated this 10/10 to help bring it's score back up-- not sure why it's getting so much hate. I enjoyed it, Christian Bale did an amazing job. Ragnarok is my favorite but this one was still good. It was way better than Black Widow, even though they are both 6.7 out of 10 at the moment. The Shadow Realm had really cool look to it. There are a lot of jokes, so if you prefer a more serious movie, this is not for you.

Author: masoomraza-68365
Review_Title: Thor The Dark World > Thor love and thunder
Review: Wasted my time ,energy and money on this one.

Author: trshimer-61816
Review: In many ways this movie kind of surprised me and my girlfriend. From the get go the film was mostly focused around making a fool of in our opinion one of the coolest/strongest marvel character, on muiltiple levels made him look like a fool. It essentially was a 2 hour film that made a joke of his character mixed with action. But the movie wasn't all terrible. It was enjoyable to some degree and made us laugh with as well many battle scenes that left us on the edge of our seats as well as the sweet ending that left us pondering what's to come next especially with all these new youngsters entering in... but overall we gave it a 6/10 because all though we would like to see Thor in a more serious role/being taken more serious the ending reeled is back in and gave us im enjoyment that the beginning didn't. Wasn't the worst MCU Movie but definetly no where near the best.

Author: brockparks
Review_Title: Great - I liked this better than Spider-man No Way Home
Review: Why all the hate? I'd heard a lot of mixed reviews and went into this with lowered expectations, but the film was fun and had a great mix of comedy and action (though yes, with a little more comedy this time, but it was a fun ba;ance). Chris Hemsworth is great as always and Natalie Portman provided her best performance in the MCU so far. There IS more comedy than usual, but Christian Bale's character is an interesting take with interesting effects and visuals and several scenes that were quite affecting (my wife shed a tear). Highly recommended - don't believe the haters! This has no more comedy in it than the Guradians of the Galaxy, with a similar tone, so if you liked those movies (or Thor Ragnarok), you will like this one, too.

Author: frankkelly05
Review: First time in a while I have watched a Marvel film and felt entertained. I don't need bloated back stories and convoluted plots, I buy tickets to be entertained and this does it well.

Author: Teeshan22
Review_Title: Filled with lame repeated jokes and a Ton of Guns N' Roses!
Review: Nowhere near compared to its previous movie; Ragnarok. Filled with lame repeating jokes, and a ridiculous plot. Uses more music than musical movies. Almost everything starts with a Guns N'Roses. Focuses more on side characters than the main hero. The visuals and cinematography were wonderful and had a great score.

Author: rrregimbal
Review: This is like the 3 Stooges made a Superhero movie. I'm surprised to see this from Marvel, it is by far worse than The Green Hornet movie. I grew up watching Adam West as Batman, hungry for film to catch up with comics and take Superheros seriously. No more "Biff! Bam! Pow!

Author: tptkst
Review_Title: It's cool but the Cgi it's bad
Review: As always, Cristian Bell is excellent, no matter what movie he is in, he is always a very good actor, but lately it has happened that the cgi looks very bad, the humor of Marvel is a lot and sometimes it bothers you a bit, but to see with your family is fine. I don't now how is the actor do Hercules but look pretty cool.

Author: irisha-62451
Review_Title: Fun movie compromised by pacing and wokeness
Review: I'm a big Thor fan and I love the earlier MCU movies. I was very excited for this movie. Visually it was great! Chris Hemsworth is both dramatic, jacked and funny. Sometimes, I agree that he was too goofy, but still funny. Christain Bale as Gorr the God Butcher was fantastic! Perfect role for him. Could have used more of him in this movie. His character needed more backstory to make me care more for his rage and to see his intelligence. The ending of the movie was perfect. Good message, warm and inspiring.

Author: contrasto
Review_Title: A boring, hard to watch, bland, uninspired subproduct
Review: It's beyond my comprehension how could a human write this abomination and believe it would work. Mr. Waititi has shown us possibly the lowest point in cinema history: this film can be described as 120 minutes of a desperate comedian trying their best to make us laugh with every single line. A plot that could be executed as a true menace for the entire universe, characters struggling with serious difficulties (cancer, inability to find one's self, divorce), a villain that could deliver so much more - thanks to Christian Bale's excellent acting -, ... Everything is simplified to a background as our hero has to flirt with his ex-hammer while his actual ex is quickly dying and the universe is under a serious threat.

Author: richardtfrey
Review_Title: Really funny, really enjoyed it and had some fun!
Review: My family and I really thought this was really funny! I also liked how it shows Thor growing as a man, from being reckless and arrogant in the first movies like a young adult, then growing through the years like his "20,30's" and now equivalent to a late 30's of someone who is lost about who they are and by the end has grown to be a father now and has kinda found himself and that really kinda reminded me of myself growing up (of course I got the dad bod and not the god bod lol) but it was nice to see for him. We had a great time at our local AMC!

Author: anasrafique-59355

Review:
Too sily, feels like it's own parody
Movie is okay. Christian Bale is awesome, Chris still can't act, but we never liked him for his talent, rest of the cast brings what they have to the whole movie is an average Disney factory work, everyone knows their job and they execute is as they should. The story has too many silly jokes. I know Waititi's style, but now he feels like his own parody. Like those Scream parody Scary Movies.

Author: stanleyigeorgiev

Author: ThisCare
Review: This Movie Is So Damn Short And I Don't Understand Why They Made It This Way, They Should At Least Make It 2 Hours And 15 Minutes Not 1 Hour And 30 Minutes(Without Music Of Beginning And Ending), For Me This Was A Very Heavy Movie The Should Make It 2 Hours And 30 Minutes To 3 Hours!!! Yes That Right Because We Didn't See Almost Any Thing From Gorr They Should Give Him At Least A Hour To Telling His Story And Some Of His Short Stories, Any Way Movie Wasn't That Bad It Was Funny For The Most Of Parts So This Movie Deserves A 10/6.7 Unfortunately We Saw Thor Solo Movie Meybe For The Last Time And It Wasn't A Very Perfect Movie.

Author: regmiprabin

Author: sethpackfan09
Review_Title: Funny parts but overall a dud
Review: I tried going in with an open mind and a fresh take as so much has happened since the last Thor movie. Needless to say, even with an open mind, I left very disappointed. The acting was dry, characters were stiff, jokes and comedy inserted in every line, way too much of certain characters while not enough of others, couldn't take Gore seriously as he is a discount Voldemort, and Thor himself was basically a laughing stock to the average Joe and kids in the film. It was hard to feel very little or any emotion for any of the characters and the trials that they were going through as there was no build up or chemistry.

Author: brpars
Review: Thor Love and Thunder is a very funny, at times touching, also beautifully shot film. As a fan of Marvel, I believe this movie is a worthy addition to the Thor movies and the MCU. I feel confounded reading some of the negative reviews. Rather I fully believe this movie will do well at the box office and most viewers, including fans of Thor, will enjoy rewatching it. My main criticism is that some of the side characters were underutilized. Still, within a massive film and MCU universe, they contributed a lot. Overall, this mighty film delivers as a summer blockbuster blast!

Author: hphomolka
Review: This is exactly what I was expecting. I was longing for more of of the witty jokes from the mind of Taika Waititi. Love and Thunder brings amazing action scenes, touching moments and great music.

Author: faboli-21831
Review: The dial-up-everything-to-11 approach does not a good movie make (Guardians of the Galaxy 2 had the same issues). The humor and characterizations are so over the top that it undermines any attempt at drama or tragedy.

Author: craigrmckendrick
Review_Title: Enjoy it for what it is.. Roll credits
Review: I know, I know... we're all waiting for the next Phase of the MCU to truly start and we all thought this would be more than a standalone... but you know what, go in expecting to have some fun and you'll enjoy it for what it is. Go in expecting the next AIW or Ragnarok and you're aiming way too high..

Author: gerryjo30
Review_Title: Disappointed but maybe there was method to the madness
Review:
Chris Hemsworth was excellent in his portrayal
of Thor and Natalie Portman was great as Dr Jane Foster however I thought the movie lacked the Marvel WOW factor, as in a thrilling story. There were no moments where I was sitting up or on the edge of my seat.... except when Tessa Thompson was on the screen, she is gorgeous !!! Christian Bale was very good as the villain and the special effects were outstanding but i was expecting a major visual change in Gorr once he possessed the necrosword. A few funny moments and emotional ones also which is why I was happy to see it. Only seen it once and you need to see all Marvel movies at least twice in case you miss something. For me personally, it's been Thor Like and Thunder, the only time I loved it was when I saw the beautiful Tessa. Just changed it to 5 stars.

Author: adresalabuleala
Review_Title: From epic god hero to goofy depressed dude with lightnings
Review: Thor movies used to be about saving the world in the most epic ways possible, but now the movie felt like I watched a parody of the originals. The entire movie is just a long joke and stupid memes. Thor, the character, not the actor, feels like an idiot. The actor did his best, it s not his fault that they decided he should be interpreting a goofy depressed Thor instead of an epic god hero. It s sad because the idea of the movie has much potential. Imagine a god killer fighting all the gods of the universe in the way marvel used to make movies.

Author: levzhi
Review_Title: Much better than what people make it out to be
Review: I get it, people wanted another Thor Ragnarök, they didn't get it, they're pissed. On the other hand, Dr. Strange Multiverse of Madness that had one of the worst chemistry between actors I've ever seen, horrible script, two of the most powerful characters in the MCU act like teenagers who can't fully control their powers, and it gets better reviews? The story was completely senseless and honestly the only redeeming part was the cameos we got to see, yet people rate it higher than Thor. This is an enigma to me.

Author: rashidrahil-53264

Author: moviegeeekk
Review_Title: a movie so banal in it's execution that you end up feeling bad for christian bale's gorr in particular.
Review: Thor's solo films have always been a mixed bag for the audience. Some people absolutely love the previous films, others who have possess a differing opinion. But Taika Waitits 2017 outing proved to be a successful attempt. The director returns again this time for "love and thunder" stating this film to be marvels first "love story" against the backdrop of one of its deadliest villains. However the film ends up not delivering any residue. A film that is so banal in its execution that it just makes you disappointed for christian bale who deserved a better mcu introduction.

Author: nicholaspark-22248
Review: Clearly, people are too hard to impress nowadays. Or DCEU has a massive comment writing budget.

Author: abdullahattar-53478
Review: Thor Love and Thunder is a normal marvel movie, it is certainly enjoyable and fun to watch, but it lacks that sense of suspense. The reason it gets a 7/10 is because you can't really go wrong with a Thor movie, but compared to the previous Thor movies, this one is more family friendly. If you're looking to enjoy an evening with some friends, then this movie will definitely do the job. But if you are a but marvel fan, you will notice it is not the same level as Spiderman FFH or Dr. Strange MoM.

Author: joeylaan-52776
Review_Title: Good comedy movie, bad Thor movie
Review: Christian Bale played the character of Gorr very good, but unfortunately Gorr was nerfed to the ground in this movie. He is supposed to be this all scary villian that kills gods, but we only saw him on screen kill 1 god.

Author: caleboriley
Review: The start was slow,Korg's recaps are funny and the GOTG were enjoyable after not seeing them since 2019. When Thor meets Jane Foster the movies starts to get good. Christian Bale and Chris Hemsworth are amazing at there acting. Korg is the best character and the Gods home scene was definitely the best. The ending sets up a good look ahead for the future of Thor.

Author: Fady_Shenouda
Review: Movie was really weak! Definitely poor script, poor dialogues, poor direction! Acting were below par, plot were nasty, even the jokes were lame.

Author: khadijar-11168
Review: This movie had some enjoyable parts but had a lot going on that took away from the movie as a whole. I really enjoy the comedy but I think Love and Thunder focused on it too much. Majority of the film was jokes and then it seemed like they tried to cram the import stuff into the last 30 minutes. Again, a fan of the comedy aspect but they could have focused more on the plot and everything going on while throwing in jokes instead of all jokes and throwing in plot.

Author: chevyholiday
Review_Title: Movie fought to be serious or funny
Review: Most of Thor's entry's have been a huge relief compared to dark world. I loved Ragnarok and Thor in endgame. Thor has had a great balance of seriousness and humor up until this point. This movie constantly fights with it self to be funny or serious at the wrong moments. Christian Bale did such a great job but was done dirty by inappropriately placed humor where it should have been a serious moment. Overall entertaining and would recommend watching it, you will laugh. But you will be disappointed in the plot, ending due to poorly placed humor and just a bad ending.

Author: roy-abraham
Review: The movie felt rushed and there wasn't enough time spent on Gorr & Thor Jane. The ending was underwhelming.

Author: jannik_halic
Review: Welcome change with a funny entertaining movie in an MCU that sometimes takes itself too seriously.

Author: teddyhaarz
Review_Title: Hilarious and well done for what it is
Review: Taika Waititi delivers another gem, but as always a unique one. This movie really shifts gears quickly between emotions, and when in doubt, screaming goats are always hilarious. They definitely skipped any type of Character development, but at this point, if you need it...come back when you're ready.

Author: oregonalberts
Review_Title: Empty. Best to turn on, walk away, and remember the old MCU
Review: Taika Waititi did what he could with what he was given yet the movie leaves the audience with a sense of "wow that was unfortunately unengaging..."

Author: AliceAddams13
Review: They need to stop trying to own everything. We should be able to vote to delete a company if it gets too big. I don't know why they started letting viago direct thor movies but it was their only good idea ever.

Author: silke-80295
Review: I Had my hopes up for this movie since i really like Thor and the MCU.

Author: creelhousehold
Review_Title: Genius. What more do you want?
Review: Funny. Goofy. Serious. Everything all in one. It's a movie about a super hero, it's not going to change your life. Just enjoy it and be happy it's not another same old story rehash.

Author: mattsal-70573
Review_Title: Good movie, everyone who thinks otherwise needs to pull their heads out of the clouds.
Review: Huge marvel fan, was very excited to see this movie until i started reading all the poor reviews. Went into it a little skeptical but ended up loving it. It was funny, the action scenes were great, the villain was great, the romance was there but not overwhelming. I don't know what everyone expects from a movie these days, but there is no reason to knock this movie. Thor has always been a jokester! The jokes had me and my wife laughing throughout the movie. Incredibly enjoyable!! Don't listen to all the chumps that were expecting to see the greatest movie ever filmed and were so disappointed that they felt the need to trash this movie in a bad review. Go see it and enjoy it!!

Author: tkilichowski
Review: I liked it - mostly because I'm fed up with how "serious" all of the franchize bacame. There are many funny moments in this movie, kind of self-parody sometimes. But GOATS - oh man - goats rule! My kids favourite element of this movie. Hilaroious idea and I'm kinda glad they pulled this off cause it looks like somebody - when writing the script - said "let's add screaming goats to this" - and someone else said - yeah - this is gonna be cool! And it is! The film is not very serious, even though mr Bale is really good at being evil. You can expect "Avengers assemble" stuff or you can just - for once - take the thing out of your bottom and enjoy the silly jokes and silly mood sometimes. It's fun. It's ok. Treat it as light entertainment and you'll like it.

Author: emyguest
Review: Time to take a break from Marvel. What a waste of talent with all these great actresses and actors! Is Disney trying to fit every single Hollywood movie star in one Marvel movie, or is the other way around!

Author: gldknmette
Review: Why Marvel phase 4 is so frustration. I didn't go to the cinema with much hope, but it still made me sad, I really wanted to see the cosmic court and its members in the movie. Unfortunately there was so much nonsense about the movie Living tribunal and the others that if they were in the movie they would have made a fuss and Laughs,I think they made such a ridiculous scenario,Thor 4 could really bring great success to mcu and this universe It would bring a different concept. This was just a comedy movie for kids...in short...it could have been the biggest drama&lesson in the history of mcu and the beginning of great things, but now everything is a joke.

Author: hersoe
Review: Normally i love Marvel, and their shenannigans, but this felt like a movie trying to be a Cartoon. There was a lot of cringy moments, but i'll give credit to the villain of the movie, which i wish had a little more depth. The outcome of the movie would have been better, had the rest of the movie been as Well written as the villain.

Author: imran-01500
Review: All the hate comments and bashings on this movie are groundless and meaningless. I don't know what the masses of audience expected, but this was basically Ragnarok 2, and Ragnarok was perfect. The only thing that is reproachable was the lack of tone and maturity, but its not an issue to be worries about. The movie was fun, fight scenes was coordinated well and CGI was on point. Plus, Christian Bale NAILED the role. Despite his relatively less screen time, It was sufficient to entertain me. Cool film.

Author: flintstonesnbedrock
Review: The comedy aspects were trying to rekindle the same type of movie Ragnarok was. However, it needed to be darker because it did the villain no justice. In order to make a movie great you need a great antagonist. That is why Thanos was perfect. Disney put too much of its "family content" spin on it. Only watchable as it ties into the overall MCU storyline.

Author: nbhse
Review: I haven't got the words for how bad this film was, ham acting, terrible embarrassing comedy moments... how did this raspberry slip through, Marvel has fallen take note from DC abandon the project before ridicule.

Author: jeff-hessid
Review: Im sure what happened with thor. It was way to much hidden wokeness and didn't really affect the mcu storyline as a whole. Hopefully the new thor will be better with a mew director.

Author: michaelforauburn
Review: The movie is entertaining, funny, and somewhat of a RomCom. I can guarantee that you will laugh at least once. The humor can occasionally be bland and Thor is turned into more of a comedic relief than previous movies. If you enjoyed Thor: Ragnarok, then you will enjoy the movie. If you don't, then you most likely won't like it. Overall, I give Thor: Love & Thunder a 8.5/10.

Author: Reality-Lasagna
Review: I created an imbd account solely to express my disgust in this film. Disney turns a classic marvel superhero into a bumbling twit with this awkward plot and brainless humor. This is not a marvel movie, this is a tedious family film. I did not laugh, I groaned and cringed - when "uncle Thor" leads an army of infants into the final battle, when yet another song from the same GNR album plays (did Disney buy them too??), when the post-credit "teaser" simply welcomes Jane into Valhalla - all I could do was shake my head. What actor would agree to be part of such a film after reading this embarrassing script? This movie is a disappointment to serious Marvel fans, and an insult to the memory of Stan Lee.

Author: sutherland-16240
Review: I usually appreciate Taika's humor, but it was a bit too much for the potentially good story line involving gods across mythos. It felt like two movies. Although there were some high points, I would give the first part a 1 rating. Once they reach the shadow realm, it becomes a much better film that I would rate at a 7. I was excited that different mythos would be represented and then disappointed in their depiction. Poking fun at deities is great, but the omnipotence city was too much like Mel Brooks's History of the World scene with Caesar. Christian Bale was outstanding as Gorr the God Butcher, but some characters (like all of the Guardians of the Galaxy) were unnecessary. Hopefully the third Guardians movie makes up for this poor showing in this film.

Author: kelvisss
Review: Give a freaking break the axe has feelings the needed to keep things more serious, I actually excited to see it and these last couple marvel movies have gone way down hill, stick to the comics more that's what we like, not all this bs your showing.

Author: aboljevic
Review: The entire movie seemed like a joke, nothing really connected or made sense, they just threw a bunch of stuff that they thought was "funny" or "cool" which just made it stupid. Most of anything in the movie was just made up in the movie, which is horrible to have. It makes a movie seem like they just made a sequel with no plan just for the money, which I'm very sure is what happened. It had no relation to anything else in marvel, it didn't build up on anything, the movie itself was just pointless and random. A wasted opportunity to build on Jane and Thors relationship, which wasn't that good in the first place. This could've gave a Jane a personality, but instead changed what little she had completely. Definitely the worst marvel movie I've seen, tied with multiverse of madness.

Author: patelnilay-61270
Review_Title: A beautiful* parody of superhero movies
Review: Well when I say beautiful, I'm not exaggerating. Can't believe they actually went to space to film this movie. The most immersive experience I've ever had at the teatres. Almost like I was travelling into the space myself.

Author: jamesblevins
Review: "Thor: Love and Thunder" (2022) careens about thematically and tonally for most of the film. For example, Thor is inexplicably clownish and stupid, in reacting to the maiming and near killing of the Lady Sif and then to the kidnapping of Asgardian children.

Author: katehanzek
Review: I stopped watching when they got to the gods' meeting or whatever the hell that was... The start was promising and then it turned into such a mishap of cringey jokes that never landed with poor acting (no chemistry whatsoever, Chris played a parody of Thor and Portman was so out of place it hurt my eyes) and over the top CGI which looked like a several teens had a field day.

Author: sfotoohiemail
Review_Title: Terrible humor, terrible story, terrible movie
Review: This was probably one of the worst marvel movies I've seen in a while. It seemed like in the last couple of movies they integrated comedy pretty well, but this movie didn't. Way too many jokes, some stuff didn't even make sense, like how thor could do half the stuff he did, but couldn't kill the "bad guy" of this movie (not tryna spoil)

Author: jacobssonhugo
Review_Title: A new level of marvel comedy.
Review: This movie reached a new level of marvel comedy which was forced into almost every intense scene in the movie and i could simply not take it seriously. Even though some jokes were funny, the excessive amount of them made it tough to watch.

Author: mabeln-23335
Review: The movie could have gone in so many other ways, and it did not live up to the hype. Very disappointed. Marvel has gone downhill since they killed off Tony. Would have rather slept.

Author: cloressa-40705
Review_Title: Tries too hard but okay if a movirE
Review: Typical Marvel movie but too many jokes that fall flat but are continually repeated.. Seemed all over the place. It was cute but not the same quality as the first Thor.. Christian Bales character was the highlight but totally misplaced and wasted on this film.. Didn't thick Natalie Portman character added anything to the film. Guardians cast were barely in it... Author: mikerawlings-69480
Review: OK so I signed up specifically to moan about this. I understand the 'leave your brain at the door' argument but ultimately the mediocrity of this film is hard to ignore.

Author: natalierowney
Review: I loved Ragnarok and it's still my favourite Thor movie. This one would be second. They recycle a lot of what worked in the last movie (eg similar tone and how they use the soundtrack), and don't introduce much new. I'm ok with that. They threw absolutely everything they had at Ragnarok, Immigrant Song was practically made for a Thor movie, so that is hard to follow up.

Author: digvijaykhatri-29064
Review: Great Movie. Watch with no expectations and this movie entertain you with jokes. Great direction, fantastic acting by all actors, perfectly balanced power levels of thor. At the end great movie to watch.

Author: rhinitownend
Review: What a mess of a film. The mishmash of ups and downs went from lame cringey comedy, overdone jokes (see: screaming goats that were honestly unsettling more than funny, and beating the dead horse of Matt Damon's cameo), horribly on the nose innuendos, terrible exposition, meaningless lines and horrible acting from Natalie Portman, to absolutely insane visuals, incredible creativity, criminally good acting from Christian Bale, heartwrenching themes and emotional depth that had me in shock.

Author: Scrooj
Review_Title: Lower your expectations and enjoy it
Review: It leans a bit too heavily into the Ragnarok style of humour with some forced comedy and yes, it is largely inconsequential to the rest of the MCU... However, there is still a lot to enjoy when you view this as a Taika Waititi film, and not a Marvel film. In this post-Endgame phase not every movie or show has to directly lead to another epic event, and this can certainly be enjoyed on its own if you don't go in with the high expectations of a Winter Soldier or Infinity War-level film. The stakes are much lower, so try to relish in the fun!

Author: DirtyMikeandtheBoys
Review: Not sure why all the hatred for the comedic elements in the latest Thor. Yes, I along with my family had many more laughs in this film than previous Thor movies. Why is this a bad thing? Personally, I found the last couple Thor movies far more entertaining than the first two. This latest film felt more along the lines of the Guardians of the Galaxy movies (who appeared in this movie briefly). Overall, great action, comedic elements and story. I hope they continue on this same path in any future Thor movies (same director also).

Author: artdominguez
Review_Title: Thor movies get funnier get over it n enjoy!
Review: People with bad reviews acting surprised of the humor of this movie should understand that every Thor movie has been more n more on the humor/sarcasm side! Even all the guardians n iron mans followed the same format! It's a great balance of action/humor/kid friendly movie! Marvel is for the family not some serious dark n boring Batman movie! (Except with bale being Batman of course)

Author: rslstickling
Review_Title: Not the best MCU Movie but get me excited
Review:
Was a good movie
Had a few laughs, but everyone thinks all the new MCU films is End Game quality.

Author: savjim-69709
Review: A disappointment I would say. It had the means with a great villain and Jane's character arc to be serious but we make another funny and a bit dumb movie. It had the potential to be something great but it was just mediocre. As a huge marvel fun, I am very frustrated. I think they are focused on making more than making it good.

Author: gilolive
Review: Ragnorak was my favorite Marvel, I was very excited but this thing was a woke mess that had empty hitting jokes and made Thor look like a bumbling idiot. Christian Bale and moments of Natalie Portman was the only good thing about this movie. 2/10. Held Taiki in high regard but not anymore, so much potential here that he ruined. Thor, dark world is no longer my least favorite Thor movie. Thank goodness GOTG crew was only in this movie for 2 minutes and he didn't have time to ruin that.

Author: milaoc
Review: The best part about this movie was Christian Bale. This movie literally felt like it was a spoof of Thor. To much humor to the point that it felt cringy. I'm a huge MCU fangirl and I feel like this movie was a letdown. I think the rest of the characters would have been great if there was a better script to work with. We've seen how well they've done before. I think the movie had great potential if there wasn't so much "comedy". Also when the children started fighting it felt like I was watching Spy kids. Which is nothing like the normal MCU movies. It's nice to have humor in the movie but the whole movie felt like a joke. If I could Unwatch it I probably would.

Author: elireynolds
Review_Title: This movie is the ultimate self aware super hero satire
Review:
This movie is a satire. It's not a marvel movie. It's not a rom com. It's not an action juggernaut. It's
a spoof of all the above. This is not a movie that doesn't take itself seriously. It's a movie that is seriously trying to not get made. Every scene and every joke is made with the intention of Disney/Marvel sitting it down. It's like the play in The Producers. It feels like Taika and company knew that this movie had no expectations and that marvel and its fans Will accept almost anything at this point. I love the romance angle being about the weapons and shunting every characters emotions off to the side just for Korg to over explain every detail so we can move onto the action. This movie doesn't care at all about what anyone wanted or expected. It serves one purpose: to question the validity of super hero movies and then amount of quality, attention, and detail it takes for people to actually be tricked into thinking they're good movies. This movie is the ultimate self aware super hero satire.

Author: zodiacfml
Review_Title: average everywhere except for the villain. pretty average for a Thor movie.
Review: As the movie dragged on, it starts to feel that the villain's performance is becoming too good/serious vs the rest of the movie. Towards to end, his face becomes more familiar.

Author: klnaco
Review: I have been a long time fan of superhero movies. I used to enjoy and looked forward to watching the new releases. But the turn that has been made to the focus being "tee-hee, ha-ha moments being the focus for the films is saddening. Just compare the original Thor and the second Thor film to what has been released in recent years is IMO appalling. Whomever started calling the shots at Marvel after the 2nd Thor film should be given a severance check and sent back to comedy central for their next big gig.

Author: rcholmes-57183
Review: After not really enjoying Multiverse of Madness at the cinema, I wasn't sure what to expect with Thor Love & Thunder, especially after Thor Ragnarok was so good. Thankfully I'd manage to avoid spoilers this time as knowing part of the story would have taken away from it. I wont say too much but I really did enjoy it, and felt it did move Thors story forwards.

Author: mark-wilson-208-608507
Review_Title: Thor has gone from a comic to a joke.
Review: A bit of comedy would have been fine, but Thor: L + T constantly goes for humour that i chuckled at only once or twice. Mostly just felt sad that it fell flat after growing up reading all his comics (and tons of others) and expecting a great adventure. Jane was mostly good as a high point, but the writing just made it a farce. Generally a well written show has a comedic relief character, but none of the characters displayed any gravitas, leaving nothing but a hollow waste of what could have been a great story. The cast had some great actors and I'm very surprised that after reading the script (that put Zeus in a mini skirt) that it passed the first read. I have to believe that a poor showing at the box office will cause a more impressive outing, as i would hate this slop to herald the end of Thor's adventures.

Author: hayleylousedx
Review: What has happened to Thor.

Author: hussainiscool-90374
Review: The story was good but.....Some comedy scenes after serious scenes was just so pointless...and gor should've been more powerful and there should have been a good fight between them, I mean the story was good but just some scenes were so useless...I mainly check the story which was good and Gor's story was good,but all thanks to taika that some scenes ruined the films rating 😉 , I was a thor fan for a long time, I still am but just the rating made me so sad I waited 4 years for it but it was disappointing, I'll give it a 7.5 out of 10, if gor was more powerful and some comedy scenes were removed then I'd probably given an 8.5 out of 10.....please change the writter in next thor if it comes, his direction was good but no need for him to writing.

Review: Overall the movie is good.

Author: nathanpeixoto
Review:
A not too serious Marvel Movie that really is interesting

Author: oaromaniuk-25940

Author: patriciadunning
Review: The bad reviews are for what? This movie has the death and war needed for seriousness mixed with comedy and jokes to keep your attention all the way through! This movie has all the stars and is nothing but fun!! Mighty Thor is awesome and has you cheering for her FINALLY, because she was a throw away character before. I loved it! Christian Bale is in a different role than ever seen, and Matt Damon didn't steal the movie! Russell Crowe was hilarious as Zeus. I don't know how anyone didn't love this movie... Tons of inside jokes and pure entertainment from beginning to end! Also the soundtrack is a greatest hits album!

Author: vaznt
Review_Title: This is why we love marvel movies.
Review: This title makes us remember, we like marvel movies because they are the interpretation of the comics to the cinema.

Author: gtp75
Review: Half of this film is silly and sometimes genuinely amusing. The other half potentially very moving. But together the halves don't work together and the film is a mess. Taika Waititi needs to go. Hate how he's made Thor a joke character. In the end it wasted the Jane story. In many ways this is reflective of the whole post-Endgame MCU - it cannot decide upon a tone. Dr Strange 2 was the same - the mishmash of ideas basically cheapened the more emotional moments. That film could almost be forgiven due to the covid challenges and enforced change of direction, but this had no excuse. Sort it out Kevin!

Author: arize-63364
Review_Title: The only good thing about this movie is Bale's and the little girl's acting at the end
Review: This movie is nighter entertaining nor good, if you are 15 and bellow you will probably enjoy it.

Author: fgedikoglu
Review: I can imagine that kids will like this movie so much and me as a kid would have liked it too. The movie is funny and the action is good but the story...mehh it could have been better. To compare Thor Ragnarok was way better but this movie was better than the first two Thor Movies.

Author: chaitukrishna
Review_Title: Looks Good but Does not feel Good
Review: Actually the trailers reduced my expectation in the first place but the movie itself killed my excitement.

Author: fjshark
Review_Title: Pretty good but maybe too much humor?
Review: I think the movie was like 7 out of 10 but felt they went too hard on the goofy aspect of it. I loved Thor Ragnarok and most of Taika's stuff (what we do in the shadows, our flag means death ect) but this was pretty meh to me. I never got a sense of how dark Gorr was or even the threat level of what he was planning. Like they hyped up so much how sympathetic but evil and dark Gorr was but I really didn't get that. I never felt like the kids were in danger or even the other gods were. I'm assuming in the cut scenes with Jeff Peter and Lena they got killed off by Gorr but wish I got a bit more of the gravity of what Gorr was doing n planning but it was a lot of funny stuff just maybe too much? Overall I loved the jokes and loved Natalie's Mighty Thor and the ideas in it just felt some things fell a little flat but pretty good movie.

Author: nuray_esmer
Review: It was a little different and enjoyable than the other films in the series. The Zeus scenes added a different joy to the movie. And the news that Hercules will be involved in the new thor episode, which has been eagerly awaited. But the efforts to show all the heroes of marvel as a whole series do not find their place. Each movie caused a discontinuity with the other movie. For example, Thor's ax is smaller in other series, and it has a series of negativities such as being big in this production. But when you try to watch every series like a new movie, this is the most enjoyable episode among Thor's series. Another issue that I will look forward to in the new thor series is walhala.

Author: correodepardo
Review_Title: Taika was trying to shine brighter than Thor.
Review: I just finished it and let me just tell you I'm confused, and Is not because the ending is confusing is just the decision making was like what? Also you can really see that Taika wanted the entire movie to revolve around him, that was a mess. But the final fighting scene I think is my favorite of all the avengers films the cinematography and CGI is just so good everything in the battle is perfect. Some things could have gone different, some things could have been explored more and some less. But bale, hemsworth and portman did an amazing job.

Author: PrettyLittleT
Review: This movie was just super fun and heartwarming, I dont understand all the bad reviews. In my opinion this was better than Ragnarok. The story was pretty solid.

Author: malcolmware-43168
Review: Big sigh this movies fails to tell a compelling story with the characters that are used in this film some of the scenes that deal with some serious issues hit home but for the most part the true meaning behind this film gets smothered with fart poop jokes that really was just a huge miss for me, this movie also ties into nothing you could easily not watch this film and still know what's going on in the mcu I would just skip this film and wait for something else.

Author: adrianhughes-50837
Review: Having read the comic series this was based on, a few years ago, I was really looking forward to this. If they had done it more like the comic, it could have been a pretty amazing epic movie. They decided not to, missing out certain details and events, that made it seemed rushed, and also made it heavy on the comedy. As a fun, family, movie, it was fine, but it was a wasted opportunity to make something that could have really stood out, and been much more memorable. The Korg character, was a sworn friend, to the Hulk, who was by side in the Planet Hulk series and after, and had nothing to do with Thor from what I remember. Seeing him, as funny as he is, just reminds me of how much they have completely flushed the Hulk down the toilet, after giving him some amazing stand out moments.

Author: jdickey-17006
Review: To preface I am a massive fan of Thor and the characters development from the first Thor to Thor Raganarok. Ragnarok gave us a refreshing new look at Thor in a comedic yet thoughtfully appointed way. So naturally my excitement for Taika Waititi's second installment in the Thor series was immense to say the least. However, after watching the film its hard to say that the movie was anything but a misguided sci-fi comedy filled with corny jokes and a wayward plot that felt like it was written by Lennie from of Mice and Men. The plot jumped from scene to scene with little to no explanation of what's actually going on. The movie felt crammed and void of any sort of depth what so ever. I legitimately think you could have made four different movies from this one film and they all would have been infinitely better. Not to mention the absolute waste of an incredible villain. The character Gorr the God butcher had so much potential, but lack of character development and childish plot destroyed all hope for this villain. Even with all the stupid jokes flying around this ridiculous movie Christian Bale still managed to give a good performance as Gorr, and is the only reason this movie is remotely enjoyable. Thor Ragnarok drew the perfect line between comedy and a meaningful plot filled with beautiful character arcs that actually contributed to the overall story. Thor Love and Thunder spit on that line while crossing it. This movie felt like Talladega Nights set in space, but with worse jokes. Overall, surprised I managed to watch this entire movie with majority of my brain cells still intact.

Author: azzamag
Review: I enjoyed this movie more than I think most people did the comedy was a bit overused with a bit too many jokes which could of been swapped for a bit more action, I know this film was built on expanding Thors arc from fat Thor after endgame but I really feel this movie contradicts thors previous journey seeing the ruthless revenge thirsty god who decapitated thanos go to someone making too many jokes while the fate of all gods and possibly the realms in his hands. I enjoyed Natalie Portmans performance as mighty thor but would've liked to see her in a more serious side even in just some parts, i also dont believe she should of died in the end of the movie and they could of figured out a way to keep her alive as she could've been a good part of the future MCU . Christian Bale did fantastic as Gorr The God butcher but was definetley done dirty with his lack of screentime. Tessa Thompson was good as Valkyrie as she was in the prior movie. Korg was overused and his jokes and overall atmosphere got old quite fast, overall I still enjoyed this movie as the music was fantastic and so was the color pallete. I think this movie is overhated but I still think it was a decent mcu movie beating most of the rest of Marvels Phase 4.

Ragnarok was able to play off the tone of its predecessors and flip the script, but this time it feels more like a repetition than anything new- lacking a good reason for this story to be told.

Author: JGMovieReview

Chris Hemsworth is as good as ever, Natalie Portman is really fun, Tessa Thompson plays Valkyrie entertainingly, and Taika as Korg has quite a few laughs but ultimately was just too many for me. Author: yjanjua
Review_Title: Is it only me, or was this a good film!
Review: I feel like it is only me who actually enjoyed this movie. I personally think this is one of the stronger phase 4 films compared to Black Widow and Eternals. It was meant to be a light hearted *jokey* kind of movie. Bale and Portman gave an outstanding performance, however the amounts of jokes in the film could have been less. The CGI was decent, and the overall pace didn't feel as rushed as the Multiverse of Madness. It showed a continuation from endgame (as Thor is with the Guardians of the Galaxy), which some of the Marvel Shows are lacking. The ending was very emotional, and the after credit leaves you excited for what's to come in Thor 5. This isn't a top tier marvel film however it definitely should be getting more love.

Author: jtcox-01459
Review: Seriously what do you expect from a movie titled Thor Love and Thunder. It's silly. I'll admit some jokes don't land but it's self aware enough that it almost knows it's being goofy. There's a dumpling god and a rock god sitting on a throne of scissors ffs. I'll admit the love ark between Jane and Thor could be seen from a mile away and it follows the whole "evil character possessed by an evil object" trope that the mcu seems to latch onto recently. But if you go into this not trying to nitpick every detail of the realism and humor of a story about a space viking you'll have a good time. Also Christian Bale as gorr is just great, 10/10 performance for him.

Author: glennberg-08117
Review_Title: If I could rate it a 0 I would
Review: My girlfriend and I are kinda big marvel fans, we're watching everything together and thor is lowkey our favorite one. I actually felt kind of sad when I watched it. How could it be so empty? It just feels wrong in every aspect. I don't know if the writers just gave up or anything. It's just not the marvel we all loved. I really feel like we're coming to the end of the marvel universe. The storyline has so much potential yet almost nothing happens in this movie. It feels like a cash grab. I love the fact that they did more with Jane but that's about it. It just isn't right. Cgi was terrible, they completely milked the laughing goats joke, they could've done so much with Zeus etc. Its felt like it was just a little short story about some kids that thor accidentally fell into. It was a complete waste of time and I'm very sad to see this franchise go down like this.

Author: KitLeonard
Review: The perception of "Love and Thunder" as a zany comedy is the problem; it's actually a serious, even sad, movie about loss and redemption just masquerading as a comedy. But that's the point: masks, masquerades. Waititi is taking the entire superhero genre down and smashing the "gods" within. When you get the seriousness of that intent you see the movie entirely differently: Jane's appearance as Mighty Thor masks her deadly illness; Thor's show-off persona is totally false, masking his broken, lost, true self. The gods - as personified by Zeus - are inward-turning frauds hiding from their true callings to protect and defend, and possibly deserving of Christian Bale's (brilliant) one man death squad. The sum of all this? Love alone will save you. So not "Ragnarok", not even close in artistic intent. All the "very very disappointed" reviews are possibly still looking at the veneer, at the masks of the genre. I have to fault the marketing of this as a zany comedy which has led to the disappointed expectations. But it's a serious film by a director with serious concerns about age and mortality. Watch it again with that in mind.

Author: tracksfields
Review_Title: Excellent film if you are looking for wacky and not Ragnarok.
Review: Great movie from start to finish. If you are astute and realize that right after the opening scene Korg says gather round and let me tell you a story, you realize that this is a story which is remembered and not taking place in the moment. Thus there are embellishments and silly moments which I thought were fantastic. If you're into goofy and campy this is the superhero film for you. If you want another Ragnarok then look elsewhere. I feel this movie and the second suicide squad are two of the campiest and "not to take seriously" superhero films ever made and they are so entertaining because of that. Take a break from the serious films to giggle like a kid at the silly ones. Especially when the silly ones are incredibly well done.

Author: ruslgrayson
Review_Title: Not unenjoyable but little substance even for MCU
Review: Bale was the best thing about this movie. I would have liked to have seen more of him as Gorr. I was happy to see Portman back, and she was great, but Jane Foster barely had any story. Having Cancer is not character development. The only reason she seemed to be there was to point out Thor's attachment issues.

Author: danielrfelice
Review: Let me say I've seen many terrible movies in my time. Total wastes of time that made me wonder what I was thinking, but this takes the cake! I've seen every MCU film and while none of them are what I would consider masterpieces, they are entertaining and I do enjoy them. All that being said, this was by far the worst of all of them. The jokes are so over the top and stupid it takes you out of the movie. I was glad to see Natalie Portman again but I feel that she was wasted in this movie along with Christian Bales great performance. Taika Waititi Should have stopped at Ragnerok as that had a much better balance of a good story, acting, and jokes. This was just too many jokes, bad CGI and bad over the top acting. After the first 15 minutes I wanted to turn it off. Don't waste your time with this film, much like with She-Hulk the MCU is really going down hill fast.

Author: dylanandkenobi
Review_Title: Thor : Love and Thunder review, NO SPOILERS
Review: Thor : Love and Thunder is good movie for viewers but I wouldn't call it a classic Marvel movie which makes Thor : Love and Thunder very unique. Thor : Love and Thunder has a good storyline and can produce strong emotions to the audience making it dramatic in certain places. Thor : Love and Thunder is a very dramatic movie but it can't be a Thor movie without some comedy moments, all comedy moments are placed perfectly in the storyline of Thor's latest adventure. The end of Thor : Love and Thunder should be on many watchlists and perfectly sets up for a thrilling fifth Thor movie, I can't wait for the fifth movie to come after Thor : Love and Thunder's ending.

Author: brendanlibby
Review_Title: This was a Good movie.... Ignore the want to be critics
Review: First of all I would like to say that this movie definitely deserves a higher rating... Does is deserve Best movie of the year? Of course not. Will the actors/actresses be receiving an Oscar for their performances? I highly doubt it. But does that mean it's a bad movie and that Taiki Waititi should be receiving all this hate? If you ask me Waititi did exactly what he was trying to set out to do. This is an Action-Comedy very much like the previous installment Thor Ragnarok which received very much praise. It had its amazing action sequences, maybe one to many corny one liners, a familiar but good story, and a great villian (Christian Bale can't fail). Chris Hemsworth did a phenomenal job as always. There isn't anyone out there who could take this role from him. Tessa Thompson was great even though she didn't have as much screen time but that was to expect with the return of a very special someone. When I saw Natalie Portman was taking on the role as the Mighty Thor I was very quick to jump to conclusions. I thought it was a horrible idea but Marvel once again proved me wrong. It was great seeing her back in action and glad she reprised her role once again as Thors one love Jane Foster. At the end of the day we got another follow up with the characters we have grown to love over the years with a lot of action, laughs and heartfelt moments. Now I am no critic myself and I haven't liked the recent movies Marvel has put out including Doctor Strange and the Multiverse of Madness but this one just doesn't deserve all the hate. Just because a movie isn't original and takes itself serious the entire time doesn't make it a bad movie. This is a movie about superheroes... Let's say that one more time.. SUPERHEROES!!!!! So if you are looking for something to pick apart for realism you should probably go watch a biography or documentary. Love and Thunder isn't a perfect 10 but a solid 7.5 in my opinion.

Author: kathyh-00037

Author: imtheaaron
Review: Well my wife didn't even like it and she is a huge Thor fan. I didn't like it, and I enjoyed Thor the Dark World....so...there's that. It was just too silly. I'm all about comedy, but it was just too over the top. The jokes played out pretty quick and just got annoying. Christian Bale was good. The story could have been good, at least most of it. But man the over-the-top silliness. It was almost like watching a Thor parody, like if the Scary Movie guys made a Thor movie. Some recycled jokes showed up that were funny in Ragnarok...you know...the first time we saw them. I feel like Ragnarok was so good because it was fresh, a brand new take on Thor, but that obviously has limits. Twas was my least favorite of the Thors...yep. I actually just re-watched Thor 2, aaaand I think it's better. In L&T's defense, I had very high expectations after Ragnarok, perhaps too high. Maybe I'll revisit it when it streams, but for now, nah.

Author: caldanataylor
Review_Title: A Self-Paradoy that Fails as a Movie
Review: The day before I watched this film, the teacher of a screenwriting class I was taking lectured about what a writer should not do when creating a movie. Let's just say that the writers of Love and Thunder did not pay attention because they broke pretty much all of the rules (in a bad way), producing this hot mess of a movie. The script is awful, Jane becoming the Mighty Thor relies on total randomness not previously set up in the universe, the tone constantly shifts between over the top violence and comedy, and the characters are not serious people. Christian Bale as Gor tries throughout the film but even he cannot save this movie from becoming a self-parody. I guess this is what happens when the studio rushes production and cranks up the absurdity to 1000. What a shame; I am a big Thor fan and really wanted this movie to be good.

Author: JPG208
Review: I watched Thor: Love & Thunder on Disney Plus (cause I didn't want to wast my money on going to the cinemas) and I was good. The Characters, the story & the Villain (Christian Bale) was the only good thing about this movie. The thing was went wrong was just the goddamn CGI. Some of the CGI was pretty clean to make it look like it was a good Marvel Movie, but unfortunately when I watched the scene were I saw the kidnapped kid's vision and I was so scared, it looked like he was on a FaceTime call which just looked so uncomfortable. I actually thought Marvel was joking about this scene as it got leaked on Reddit and people wanted to pretend that wasn't going to happen. I read other reviews about Love & Thunder on IMDB & Google and there was one on Google where someone mum said 'I took my son to see the new Thor as he loves Marvel and is a big fan of Thor, we both sat down and watched the movie and enjoyed the beginning. But there was a scene were we so a boy on the wall as Thor was talking to him, my son was very scared of what was shown on the screen, he asked me if we could go home and I said to him yes. We went back home and my son was crying cause of how scary and bad the Visual Effects were to this movie, Marvel Studios should really think about trying to not make the CGI look like a horror movie.' This movie was alright at some points but oh boy, Kevin Feige needs some help with producing in Marvel Movies.

Author: jggynz
Review_Title: Great movie that most people overlook because of the comedy
Review: Thor Love and thunder was a great movie for me and for majority of the story I enjoyed it even when it was dull it brought me back with stronger scenes but the problem that people have with it is that it's a marvel movie and people really only want it to be serious even though it's a comedy/action movie. The main reason I liked the movie so much was because of the symbolism and the accuracy to the comics with the main villain having a similar backstory to the comic version. It seems as though since it's a stage 4 mcu movie people immediately think it's bad without even watching it even though in my opinion it's one of the top 10 marvel movies out at this time. People should stop hating on a movie because of too much comedy even though the movie in question got more action focused when the action started and maybe people should actually pay attention to symbolism in movies Instead of always thinking like a brick wall.

Author: matt-22613
Review_Title: "So this is my wow. All gods will die."
Review: By the time the Marvel Cinematic Universe enters the homestretch of its Phase Four approach to its slew of movies and tv series, I would have thought they had already hit their stride. Phase Four has not been an impressive side of the MCU, particularly the movies that have made their way into theaters worldwide. Black Widow was a disappointment. Shang-Chi was fun, but Eternals was pretty forgettable. No Way Home kept nostalgia alive while Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness was terrible. But these are just the opinions of one guy who feels like Disney was starting to scrape the bottom of the barrel.

Author: zac-pay-95
Review_Title: Worth a watch, but not a rewatch
Review: I think comparing this movie to ragnarok is unfair to the merit of the contents, but while watching I couldn't help but feel as though the similarities to ragnarok made it less of its own. The action sequences were good, Christian Bale and Russel Crowe were fantastic, but the seemingly nonstop need to pack joke on top of joke, often at the expense of the movies more serious tone with Gor the God Butcher being a genocidal maniac, brought it lower than ragnarok in my book. Worth watching, but I wouldn't go out of my way to watch again.

Author: ethandavis-97302
Review: While this movie may have lacked some of the classic Thor elements, I still believe this was a good movie with a great ending. People that hate on this movie are discounting that it does everything that it should have to advance not only Thor's character arc, but King Valkarie's as well. It also introduces new characters like Zeus, Hercules, and Thor's adopted daughter. The ending provided great closure on both Jane Foster and Gore's story. Jane Foster's death was necessary to the advancement of Thor's character. Gore the God Butcher was one of my favorite MCU Villains because, much like Killmonger from Black Panther, he is just mourning the loss of his daughter and angry that his god didn't save her. In the end, I believe that this was a solid movie(especially compared to Thor: The Dark World)

The graphics and film photography were very good and Christian Bales portrayal of the villain were the highpoints in my opinion 👍 I think the director could have left out the dry humour jokes that we're littered in almost every scene it really spoiled what could have been a decent movie 🎬 overall very average.

Great film, most scenes felt like they had a purpose but also featured some light goofy humour, which is what separated the later Thor films from the series.

Review: Fort is such a great villain played by such a great actor. It's unfortunate the story had to be absolutely ruined by such a trash director. Thor goes from a star redeemed in the Infinity Saga back to a comic relief in a movie filled with unnecessary and disgusting sex/orgy/masterbation jokes and poor writing and acting. I was excited to see Zeus too and they managed to turn him into a sex craved slob who appears no mightier than a welfare bum. Truly unfortunate that such great characters like Thor, Zeus, and Gorr could be ruined by such awful writing and directing. Taika Watiti should never be allowed to help with a Marvel movie again.

Author: seanmathews1
Review_Title: A great First and Third act Let Down by the Middle
Review: There is a lot to really enjoy in Love and Thunder. Good villain. Jane is back. Interesting plot. And then in the second act it feels like the Santa Clause 3 with the tooth fairy and Father Time. Improbable things even for an MCU movie. Or maybe it felt more like the Lego movie with all the heroes in the great hall. Either way, it killed the momentum and made it a farce before act three where it came back down to earth. Bale was great. Portman was good as well. It's just unfortunate that odd story devices were introduced to the movie. Overall, not the worst Thor movie, but nowhere near the level of Ragnarok. Waititi might be getting a bit of a big head and taking his directing a little too far. Bottom line... if you like Thor you will find things to like. It's an enjoyable movie with many great parts. It just has parts that really drag it down as well.

Author: stenath79
Review: Great individual performances from the incredible cast but unfortunately the themes of mental health, relationships and grief which could have made this film excellent were completely lost in the shockingly bad gags every that seemed to assault you every ten to fifteen seconds. The Thor Ragnarok style humour is there but it's sandwiched in between so many puns, gags and dad jokes that it just becomes desperate. A real shame as I was so excited to see this... as stated previously Bale, Hemsworth, Portman and Thompson are excellent and there are some wonderful cameos from Russel Crowe and others but the script let them down. It's worth a watch if you're a Marvel fan but don't expect a masterpiece.

Author: bcuquet
Review: Let me get this out of the way: this movie dives deep into Marvel Comics lore with most of the plot being based on the fact that Gorr is trying to get to Eternity. (Eternity is a cosmic being that involves a very complicated storyline of comics.) If you do not want to continue to be immersed into complicated plots, do not go see this movie. If you want straightforward movies involving plots that are possible to truly happen, this is not for you. With that out of the way, Thor: Love and Thunder was a very good movie overall. Gorr the God Butcher was a great villain but I was disappointed that he only got 23 minutes of screen time. (That's about how long he really was on screen.) Mostly good jokes, maybe just pushed the humor a little too far. Post credit scenes set up reveals that set a grin on my face (Valhalla and Hercules)! 8/10 worthy movie. Go see it once, twice if you are a big Marvel fan. It's a movie that, unlike Eternals, is definitely possible to sit through.

And the relentless barrage of bad jokes did nothing to help advance the story or keep our attention. Zero desire to watch the next one as I can only imagine what the people at Disney will try on that take. And what is up with Cronk now having two dads and his entire species being male? What happened to his sister and mother? Please stop!!! And the Molnyer and Stormbreaker all of a sudden are sentient??? Give me a freaking break.

Thor looks like a adolescent moron, not the god that he is, even a melancholy one.

Author: mbrohl
Review: This movie is total crap. Whiny Thor is portrayed as a total buffoon. When did Marvel films decide their movies are now comedies ? Well placed humor is great but this tries way too hard to be funny all the time which makes it NOT FUNNY. I'm a Marvel fan but I HATED this movie. The new Marvel Universe has pretty much lost me. They used to be serious adventures with well developed characters and story lines. Now they just feel like a very expensively done bad sitcom. Come on Marvel get back to superheroes being superheroes not whiny little wimps crying over an ex girlfriend and acting like a child. It's a sad day when Peter Quill is the most mature character in a Marvel film.

Author: smoshsimpson
Review: Childish comedy in a movie with sex jokes. The Director was given way too much credit for one good movie and of course fails to deliver in this one. The villain is so limited from the childish story, bad humor and little screen time, it almost feels irrelevant to the story, which is a shame since he is a great character, delivered brilliantly by Christian Bale. It feels like they tried to make a kids movie and market it towards adults, but failed at both ends. A big Disappointment as a sequel to a good movie.

Author: stallardhailey
Review: The overwhelming amount of comedy forced into this movie resulted in a Thor that didn't feel like Thor. I'd call it a "feel good" and just that because unlike 90% of Marvel, it doesn't exceed good. The entirety of Marvel has made movies that encourage and allow a broad range of emotions and an escape from reality all while limelighting the super hero's and action. Lol Thor Love and Thunder got lost and then strayed far far away. My emotions were not brought out, but in, as I cowered over cringing at the script that had Academy award winner, Natalie Portman, delivering lines that belong in DC. Don't get me wrong some of it was humorous but the balance wasn't there. The dad jokes and dead humor every five seconds made it difficult to hear anything else. Guardians of the Galaxy is by far my favorite group in the franchise and that movie, my friends, is how its done.

Author: skilledinceptor
Review: I have to preface the review by saying that Thor: Ragnarok is one of my least favorite MCU movies. In that film, Thor completely shed the Shakespearean grandeur that was given to him by Kenneth Branagh, and the character transformed into a generator of quips. In some aspects, Love and Thunder doubles down on that, and it also does some things better. The end result is a serviceable product that can entertain you for two hours, but the character of Thor deserves so much more.

Author: andrewdonaldm
Review: The first time I saw Thor 4 I'd built up in my head what I wanted to see and I was disappointed. The second time I gave it another shot with a different perspective and it was way better. It's almost like the director is a Deadpool trickster making his own movie within a mega corporate movie franchise machine.

Author: romemajor
Review: His movie has to be in my top 10 greatest Marvel Studios movie of all time. First, I love how great everyone did in the cast and all who contributed to the film. Kudos to the spectacular actors and actresses and also to the director Mr. Taika Waititi, he really made the Thor series a colorful spectrum of amazing stories. Chris Hemsworth and Natalie Portman acting in their roles is really good but I think it would've been better is Tessa Thompson as Valkyrie has more significant lines. I really think that she's kind of underutilized in this film. Russel Crowe as Zeus is great. He portrayed the character as a kind of antagonistic, selfish, entitled way and it is really good. Christian Bale as Gorr the Godbutcher, one of the best Marvel Comic Villains, I can't even put it on words. His performance is phenomenal!! The movie adaptation of Gorr belongs to my Greatest Marvel Cinematic Universe Villains of all time!!! I also love the soundtrack of this movie especially the Sweet Child O' Mine that symbolizes a part of the plot. So sad that Jane Foster died, I literally cried on that part but she's on Valhalla now so a round of applause for her. The big reveal of Hercules hinting to be facing Thor in the future got me so excited. Overall, this is a heart pounding and tear jerking film that tells a story about love, sacrifice, and heroism in an spectacularly adventurous way. I LOVE IT SO MUCH. Thank you the people behind this movie because they really did a very great job.

Author: jace-77222
Review_Title: Love the Thor Story, but this was terrible.
Review: I love Chris Hemsworth as Thor throughout the MCU, but this movie was just abysmal. At no point was I invested in the movie whatsoever. The story was all over the place and I wasn't worried about any of the characters ... at all. Maybe watch on a streaming service if you have it, (and have 2 hours to waste), but don't pay for this and don't purchase a streaming service to watch this. Ever. I really wanted to like it. Worst Thor ever. Without exception, not even close. :(

Author: shortland-21034
Review: What a mess great cast, to much so called comedy story must have made a few of the cast cringe if they knew where they were in the relevance of the film taika ragnarok great this one poor was so looking to it ?.

Author: cw49327
Review_Title: Amazing movie, better than what people are saying.
Review: While not perfect, this movie was amazing. The first fight scene involving Thor on the world with the blue people (forget what they're called) and he destroys their temple was amazing, almost definitely my favourite scene in the movie. I loved the jokes and especially the soundtrack. Taika Waititi did amazing with this movie, and hope he's kept on in the MCU. There are people here claiming that there are too many jokes and it's more of a comedy (which is apparently bad ??), but I see that as a strong-suit here. I have to admit, when Jane passed away at the end I was crying in the theatre. It was very upsetting. Hopefully we see Mighty Thor return in another movie (maybe a rebooted avengers or something?). Overall amazing movie and can't wait to see it again!

Review: Way too sarcastic. Thor was a serious movie before. I don't know what's wrong with marvel, but they are getting worse day by day after End game. It's more of a comedy now. They are destroying every character. I was expecting a better movie, but disappointed.

I would normally have given this an 8, but I felt like countering some of the naysayers was worth the extra point. Well worth seeing.

Author: mandsarredondo
Review: Christian Bale was great but the beginning of the movie set a more serious tone that didn't match the rest of the film. Our theater room was full, yet, there were only three times people actually laughed. I was bored for the first half of the film, especially with Taika Waititi's repeated narrations. When the joke about the dramatization of Thor and Loki showed up I looked at my wife, wondering why Ragnarok's scene had been recycled. I guess it proves the director ran out of ideas.
