Author: topnotchremodeling
Review: In my pantheon of bad movies Thor: Love and Thunder will take its rightful place. A movie with cheezy lines intertwined with goofy scenes, even Thor's costume looks stupid like something you'd wear on Halloween. If you're going to watch that movie expecting to watch a comedy then you might like it because that's all it is. There's nothing thrilling, engaging or captivating about it. Very disappointed, we left before the end. It had a huge opening weekend but I wouldn't be surprised to see the sales dropping drastically next weekend!

Author: katherineprera
Review: This was by far one of the best mcu MOVIE EVER!!!!

Author: victorwoodward
Review: Very action packed, enjoyable movie. If you like Thor Ragnarok you will enjoy Thor Love and Thunder. Great casting, great cinematography, very humorous and overall really great. The pacing was a bit off though wish the movie went for at least another 30 minutes and a bit more of a bactstory to Jane Foster and Gorr the God Butcher.

Author: shaliniaguilera
Review_Title: Extremely needed, will watch again and again
Review: The world is exceedingly depressing right now. I found this film to be a balm for that as it followed Thor through his quest to find meaning in his life. The last roughly half hour or so tugged the heartstrings and the ending was so sweet. Very happy with how Jane chose her own way.

Author: alexcassidy-82342
Review:
Awesome Movie, very colourful and true to the comics. Not sure why everyone is complaining
about being bad. The movie is fun, vibrant and good to watch.

Author: dennyrogers-69221
Review: Good movie. Funny, lots action. Good actors, nice CGI. Original uniforms. I recommend. Go to the theater and have funny moments traveling in this Gods conflicts.

Author: manuel_oliva-37453
Review: A lot of people are saying "they destroyed Thor" and they are really, really mad... Almost like suggesting these Thor films were like The Godfather or some other real movies, with real writing and performances.

Author: systemryu
Review_Title: If you laft at fat Thor, you should enjoy this too....
Review: Ok, I'll admit this film was way more wackier than I expected. But I had a really good time and that should always be the priority for judging a film in my opinion. Don't forget, we had a fat Thor. This is just the next level. I laft a lot, the action scenes are cool and Christian Bale was really scary and so intense in his scenes 👏🏻!

Author: givememore-55666
Review_Title: Not as bad as everyone said
Review: First above all its another good Marvel movie. Not best, not even average, just good. I don't compare it to Ragnarok, Civil War, or Infinity War. I give it 7/10 because it is simple novie with few, great scenes. Bale is god here. He may say that he not like superhero movies, but I had big smile how he was playing with Gorr. In sometimes he looked like his ex-mate from Batman - Heath Ledger. He was crazy, he was mad man and I love it. One of best villains from Marvel yet, after Thanos, Killmonger, Green Goblin, Baron Zemo. He stands with such as good villains like Hela, Agatha Harknes and Mysterio (I don't put Loki here cause now he is more like antihero than villain). Shame that we don't get more than 5-10 minutes with Gorr.

Author: kandegirl
Review: I just saw this movie and I can honestly say it was terrible!! The attempt at comedy was terrible. The villain was terrible. The storyline was terrible!!! I loved Thor Ragnarok but this was nothing like that movie. Find something else to watch!

Author: thatbat
Review_Title: Irredeemable. Marvel is finished in the movies.
Review: Those are hard words for me to say. I spent decades buying comic books- all of the titles. Up until the late 90s, I had every edition of FF, Cap, Thor, Rom, Moon Knight, Batman, Green Lantern, Hour Man, Justice Society, Marvel Team-Up, Daredevil, X-Men. . . ALL Characters. Every month I would have 40 titles waiting for me at the comic store.

Author: ayushpanchal-94545
Review: The movie was empty in many sort of ways. The love theme in the title with the introduction of the Mighty Thor was not upto the excitement of the fans. Of course Natalie Portman was great at the role and the emotion at the end saved the part with some sentiments. Tessa Thompson as Valkyrie was really good.

Author: craenenhugo
Review:
When I saw this movie, been waiting for it quite some time, I couldn't keep from wandering if I was watching some kind of "fake version"..
Compared to almost all MCU movies, even though the actors are actually the real ones, this looks quite a lot like a B-movie (or a C, if that exists) ..
Terrible script, acting like people who almost had no experience, the story developing like a total joke instead of what we are used to from the MCU / Thor movies..
Really, a waiste of time that lasts 2 hours, and a total disappointment..
Whoever is responsible for this disaster, fire him/her/them !

Author: taki-rakovic
Review_Title: Not surprised and not even disappointed anymore.
Review: If you have no expectations this can be a 'good' popcorn movie. The humor and the action are there. That's it tho. It's also the reason why I don't like it and why I hate Ragnarok. They turned the entire Thor franchise into a big joke. There are no stakes, there is no drama, everything serious and Shakespearean that made the first two movies unique and interesting is gone. Chris Hemsworth was made for this role, he embodies Thor, but everything else was a complete dumpster fire. Christian Bale was also good as a villain & he stood out as one of the (rare) positive things in this.

Author: hugotendam
Review: I mean I enjoyed the movie. I dislike the pacing and the constant joking where it didn't fit. Marvel has really been sticking to this 'we have to make light of everything' theme for years and seems to be getting gradually worse and out of hand. There seemed to be a lack of balance there.

Author: gunnjohnson
Review: I loved the movie, I'd give it a ten star review but... king Valkyrie is a lesbian. And I don't support those people. If they had made her NORMAL I would give the movie 20 stars if their was an option. Thanks.

Author: pokemonvitan

Author: salecem

Review: Tbh when i went to watch this movie i didn't expect too much.. some action and funny scenes and i would be satisfied. But the movie is empthy there are too many unnecessary scenes.

Author: amymiley-70097
Review: Fun happy and made me tear up everything a Thor film should be great from start to finish loved every minute is it cheesy definitely but in the best way did not disappoint.

Author: Ewpxpx44
Review: Christian Bale was fantastic. And this movie could have been as well. But it seemed rushed. Would love to see the extended version. But in my humble opinion. It's still a fun movie. But it could have been a great one.

Author: xkdbqctv
Review_Title: Taika doing his thing and keeping Marvel fresh
Review: For me it just hit the right spot.

Author: nahcapuka

Review: It's good and funny and heart warming. Did people want more cancer? Want more gods dying? Want less jokes? People do not know what they want and get in their own way of enjoying 2 hours of entertainment. SMH at all you. SMH at stringer bell jr loving guns and roses.

Author: snehanewworld
Review_Title: Painful watch even for a diehard Marvel fan

Author: jondordix-27946
Review: I can remember when the mcu first began and our heroes were these epic brute badasses. Watching this movie I couldn't take a single character seriously (aside from Gorr who actually had a great performance). A movie CAN be too funny. I was more than disappointed. Come on Marvel you're beatin a dead horse...a really really dead horse.

Author: cymmjntt
Review_Title: I don't understand low rated reviews
Review: A lot of people are saying that the film is made to rushed, that some jokes are not even funny, that Gorr hasn't have enough screentime... Well I loved the film, I think the screentime is enough for Gorr. Great performances! In my opinion I think this one is the best Thor so far.

Author: playcffs
Review_Title: To me the best MCU movie
Review: I've never been a fan of Thor movies. Watched all of them because I like the MCU, but never really got into Thor that much. In this movie. Taika Waititi brings us a movie filled with is iconic humor, that he seems to purposefully take to far every now and then, by not taking it self to seriously, and I see how that can pass as something negative to the audience. Battle scenes are great and Bale's as the god butcher is brought to the screen in masterfully way.

Author: fahrenheitthefirst
Review: Eh Eh Eh listen up, i dont care what those "who think themselves as movie geeks" or whatever i dont give a FLARK, the movie is FUNNNNNNNN dont even read this review go ahead go watch the movie alone without any expectations dont expect it to be good DONT expect it to be bad, Watch the movie without any negative thoughts, come back and read this review after you have watched it....you gone yet GO AHEAD GOOOOO!!

Author: eric-nahinu
Review: Fun for the kids. For adults not so much. At first it's easy to think Christian Bale might be overacting and then as the movie goes on you begin to realize.. it's because everyone else is UNDER acting.

Author: robinkalden
Review: I don't understand people's beef with this movie. I don't love Jane Foster, and I think she has no chemistry with Helmsworth, but she's fine. There's some cheesy dialogue. Otherwise, it's funny, exciting, never boring. Christian Bale is incredible. Tessa Thompson is wonderful. Taika Waititi really knows what he's doing. I think Marvel fans need to understand that not every movie is going to be a 180 minute fight scene with 20 A-List actors?! And thank god, that would be so boring. It's a comedy film, which means that it will be generally tied up with a neat bow. Let's hope we don't see Natalie Portman again. I had fun, it's fun, chill out.

Author: krishnarajvtr
Review: The movie is pretty decent. I felt script of movies is the weak point and Taika Waititi tries to overcome it with the direction, he succeeded in it to sone extent. Some scenes made goosebumps in the theater. Bale nailed the characters of Gor and done a fantastic job. But felt sad that marvel didn't made a comic accurate look of for on the screen. Nowdays Vfx of marvel movies are upto mark I am totally disappointed with it. Over all good movie.

Author: dover-33818
Review_Title: Needs to come with trigger warnings
Review: I did not expect a marvel film to have cancer scenes and tragic death and was left really upset and depressed by the end of the film. The jokes while forced were still entertaining. The portrayal of Zeus was terrible. Christian bales performance was the best in the film.

Author: hasansybtmz
Review: I watched the movie months later and I hope someone mentioned the property at the end of the movie.

Author: tdchfxn
Review: Forget streaming platforms or the shift to other forms of media such as podcasts; Thor: Love & Thunder is what has ultimately ruined the cinematic experience. As everyone was exiting the theatre, I was delighted to overhear a group of high schoolers say that they will never sit down and watch a movie ever again. They seem to be a sharp group of kids.

Author: ngungungu-18848
Review: "Thor: Love and Thunder" has all the ingredients to be the best superhero movie: a simple righteous ideology, a classic male lead, humorous adventures, action sequences. Excellent action, good soundtrack, and especially, a great villain.

Author: ankitsinghrathore-70062
Review: One of the worst marvel movies ever. Totally disappointed. It feels like thor died in infinity war and never returned. This is not the thor we know, like at all.

Author: samuelcrompton
Review_Title: Choose what type of film this is
Review: Taika Waititi did a fantastic job at transforming the Thor solo films from forgettable and dull to the lively fun and enjoyable Ragnarok. Whilst this drastic change was very welcomed at the time, the idea for this film , including the casting of Christian Bale who is known for his intense and serious characters, doesn't match Waititi's style. The film had very contrasting scenes so close together, going from the wacky comedy the director is known for to very dark and intense ones straight afterwards, then vice versa all too quickly. Bale did a phenomenal job as Gorr, safe to say he is the best marvel villains to come out in phase 4 yet overall the film was too goofy for such an intense character as Gorr. Chris Hemsworth also did his thing and wasn't let down by his performance and Portman's character Jane Foster is no longer the boring side character to add a little spice. Sadly, although I love Korg, he had too many corny jokes that came quite tedious and a legthy amount of screentime for a side character especially compared to Valkyrie which was a shame as Thompson is great.

Author: nathanasher-62198
Review: Thoroughly entertaining and great fun! It's not an t art house drama as some dickheads were expecting giving 1-2 stars! Marvel purists? I love Marvel films and thought it was great. Must See. Don't listen to killjoys.

Author: animangalover
Review: This might be an unpopular opinion but Thor:Love and Thunder restored my faith in Marvel! As a Marvel fan of more than a decade I was so anxious about not liking this film because of my slight disappointment with Doctor Strange and The Multiverse of Madness and the general bad reviews regarding this 4th Thor movie but I actually loved it!

Author: zachnorth-04916
Review: This movie was a poorly paced bad joke... This is everything Ragnarok was right on the edge of being, all punch line with no set up. If this is acceptable as an MCU entry then Marvel has become everything it's critics have tried to make it out to be and lost the substance the fans knew it had...

Author: LisaImHauntingYou
Review_Title: Took my 8 year old to see this
Review: My 8 year old daughter loved the ending and so did I. It's one of the few marvel movies I would happily rewatch, and let my children watch. Though probably not the 6 year old just yet, there are a few violent scenes that I'm not comfortable letting a very young child watch. I've seen most of the marvel movies and definitely prefer the more light hearted entertaining movies like guardians of the galaxy, so if you like those then you will enjoy this one. A lot of the more serious movies I don't bother rewatching and just watch them to continue the story. The adult jokes in this are not understood by children at all, so that doesn't worry me. Like most marvel movies it's long and my daughter was getting fidgety near the end but managed to capture her attention again with more action and fun near the end. Overall a really fun movie.

Author: deepmndl
Review: Being a die hard fan of Marvel comics I'm totally disappointed with the storyline. Obviously too much extra comedy. C Bale's screen time is short by the perspective of gorr like villain.

Author: dskzcxww
Review: Maybe it's because I'm an old woman but I enjoyed this movie immensely. I saw Thor not as incompetent and emasculated but struggling with heart break, remedied in a heartwarming rather than predictable way. I agree the Mighty Thor arc detracted from the film, but not greatly. The film contains great elements of fun. Christian Bale, as always, was brilliant, and I disagree with the criticisms people have made that the ending was unbelievable (even in the context of a Marvel film) or wrong. Maybe being a parent gives me a different perspective on Gorr's journey. All up, my favourite Marvel film and I highly recommend watching it.

Author: scsemene
Review: I loved every second of this movie. It was never slow or boring. It made me laugh and cry, entertaining and endearing. There were nice surprises throughout, and it was the perfect mix of comedy and action. Definitely one of my faves!

Author: zisisp
Review_Title: Not as good as I expected
Review: Taika waititi ruined zeus and made the movie too funny but christian bale carried the whole movie with his incredible acting performance as gor. Natalie Portman was amazing as Jane foster and raised the level of the film in every scene she played. Finally the ending of the movie was amazing and promising for the upcoming movies.

Author: jwbrownsord-04060
Review: Overall Thor Love & Thunder was a fun experience. The movie oscillates between the romance between Thor and Jane and mission at hand to defeat Gor the God Butcher. The jokes are hit or miss with some jokes funny and other jokes that miss their mark. Set your expectations, and you won't be disappointed. Don't expect an epic battle between Thor and Thanos. This is a lighthearted story that moves slowly but eventually reaches its end with a few laughs along the way.

Author: glennhus
Review: Different is not always better. Sadly, this was almost like a bad try to make it more «funny», parody.or satire.

Author: jisalcido
Review_Title: Taika Tried Too Hard for Comedy
Review: Let me start by saying I love Taika Waititi. I think he's a comedic genius and has the intellect and vision to boot. What I really love is he has you smiling so much during any of his films, including this one. However, when things needed to get serious, you transitioned immediately from comedy into serious drama. There's no time to amp down or ramp up. Its just back and forth like a jester and Serena Williams in a tennis match. Waititi's JoJo Rabbit played on the comedic into the drama with such panache. I wish he did the same here. You were dealing with serious dramatic issues. Children dying, parent in agony, characters dying of cancer, and then the love story between Jane Foster and Thor.

Author: likelox
Review: First 5 & last 5 minutes where both heart breaking & heart warming, the rest of the movie however felt rushed & bit goofy . It's a 6/10 for me. As a Thor movie it's ok but for the last instalment of the Thor series I expected a bit better.

Author: judithallonby
Review_Title: Sometimes brilliant, sometimes fun, sometimes incredibly annoying
Review: Christian Bale's Gorr is phenomenal, creepy, scary, understandable, haunting, heartbreaking and the film needed more of him. A lot more.

Author: spudrick-96461
Review: This film sucks. The characters are all wrong. I made it less than 40 minutes. It's like someone had a fever dream and tried to write a thor movie. Just awful. How dare they even call it a marvel movie. Really bad acting in this movie. I love most of the thor movies but not this one. I am really disappointed in the direction marvel has chosen to take as of late. The acting and story reminds me of the plays Loki has put on. No magic in this movie just total crap. I really hope they fire some people and get back to making great movies. They have tons and tons of great material from the comic books and they need to go back to it. I bet Stan Lee is rolling over in his grave.

Author: shivanshbhardwaj-72035
Review:
Thor Love and Thunder ⚡ is an Average movie but you will love it..
It's good..
It have Ups and Downs..
Sad as well as 🤣 Funny..
Not so sad though..
I like the movie but not love it..

Author: jantaraadnan
Review: THIS MOVIE IS GORGEOUS!!! I WATCH THIS FILM AND EVERYONE TELL ME THIS MOVIE IS MID?? BUT I LIKE THIS MOVIE, ESPECIALLY JANE, AND THOR AAAAAAA!!!! IF YOU WANT TO WATCH THIS FILM, GOOOO THIS IS SOOOO GOOD.

Author: CarbonDioxideInhaler
Review: The story wasn't great and it felt rushed and empty. The part that felt the most rushed were the characters especially Gorr and Jane. Cgi was ok for the most part apart from a few scenes where it was just garbage. Fights were either very short or in dark places where it was hard to see what was happening. Soundtrack was pretty generic. Overall it was an ok movie with some problems that was relativly fun to watch.

Author: gwsartorias
Review: An absolute braindead movie. None of the "jokes" land, the CGI is abysmal, and the writing is some of the worst I've seen from Marvel. From the very beginning Thor is portrayed as a bumbling idiot of a God. Wether it be all of Asgards children getting kidnapped, or his girlfriend dying of cancer, there seems to be no care or emotion from anyone. They even play pranks on Thor as hes trying to calm the kidnapped children down. Korg goes from a funny one-liner in Ragnarok, to an annoying idiot who wont stop talking. Thor kills more gods than the "god butcher". Gorr's motives are lackluster and rarely shown. Thor finds one of his oldest friends dying and simply jokes about it.

Author: dodecameter
Review_Title: This movie killed the MCU for me
Review: Watching this movie is like eating Peeps: it's all air and no substance.

Author: davidoogah
Review: Gorr the god butcher performance was too good and very nice to watch but the movie was like a DC movie.

Author: rebeccaellam-18449
Review: A great movie for all the family. It is funny with a good plot, great actors and i loved the love conquers all theme. It wasn't all just fighting like some marvel movies.

Author: andinoray
Review: Great movie. Funny, heartfelt and action packed. Visually stunning and great humor. Very stylized and fun. Taika is a great director and also writes good scripts. Everything fell in place.

Author: tuurderuyter
Review: This is the first mcu movie that i watched that was so boring. The humor was bad everything felt rushed. Even thought Christian (gorr) did a great acting performance like always.

Author: noelfast
Review: Marvel movies have become so sloppy and more focusing on the funny parts. I know that it might be just Taika Waititis but he is also a director that I love. He is very good but I might believe that he is not the right one for Marvel and Marvels future. Since Ragnarok, the funny parts has been the more important parts wich I believe is a shame. I believe that previous Marvel movies has been very thougthful and not ending the plot in the movies but instead keep the story until the next movie which i think have been their strength. Thor: Love and Thunder though was just so stressed plotwise. Although my thoughts was the movie pretty good and entertaining but far from the previous ones.

Author: frost-42648
Review_Title: Over the top and eccentric, but it's SUPPOSED TO BE
Review: I loved it. Anyone who doesn't is taking it too seriously, kick back and enjoy the ride. Thor has never been better, his growth is unparalleled. From a juvenile in the first movie to the God he is now he has grown more in the last 10 years than he has in the last 3000.

Author: marcel_massoue
Review: A film that starts with a father endeavoring for his daughters life through the desert, who fails on his fundamental purpose, that as the plot moves forward you learn one of the main characters is developing an incurable cancer, all this franchised by the tradition of a pop culture superhero - Nordic divinity, it is impossible to conclude with a successful parody.

Author: asherennema-45463
Review: I wish we saw more of the guardians of the galaxy, who wouldn't, but the movie was interesting and funny, the screaming goats are just 👌. Glad to see Heimdall in Valhalla. Zeus and the other gods are pretty much how I imagined them, self centred and careless. Matt Damon being a bad actor and producer of Asgard is funny. Christian bale as Gorr was a good choice, I think he did well. Better then the multiverse of madness, but worse then Thor Ragnarok. Glad I saw it. 8/10.

Author: rpyliak007
Review: My review. A lot of jokes, fun and action. Great film. Recommend it for families.

Author: scgough
Review: I felt like this could have been a much better film if they just toned down the amount of quips and one liners littered throughout the script. It's like the writer(s) made a conscious effort to cram a wise crack or cheesy quip into every possible moment to see if they could get away with it.

Author: bzhao-95486
Review: Well the reviews of this film had been overwelmingly in the average to lower categories. It didn't have the greatest of plots but I tend to think about these marvel films to be like a bigmac as oppossed to an Gordon Ramsey made rump steak lunch. It had some great fun and nice action, the dolphin scene is escpecially breathtaking. The music was a great add on and like all mcu films, we got what we came for, a fun enjoyable experience. Hemsworth is still strong and the entire film had been fun and enjoyable, not too much too actually make it a GREAT film but like an evening at five guys, only haters will say they did not enjoy it. Overall, a nice film, particularly impressed by the theme music, the cgi and of course a perfect characterisation of Thor and Gorr by Hemsworth and Bale respectively.

Author: fewdaysapart
Review:
Finally got around to watching this movie. It felt like it was trying too hard to be funny. Every scene was trying to make a joke. With so many attempts to make jokes, it made the actual humorous moments less funny. If it would have been more serious with subtle jokes, that scene with Zeus, that would have been hilarious. Instead that scene just felt like more over the top silliness. It's truly sad what Marvel has become...
I don't blame the director for this monstrosity. I am sure he had the out of touch executives over his shoulders helping arrange the film. This would be an interesting film to see the Watiti cut. It doesn't hold a candle to Ragnarok.

Author: bamboo_liu
Review_Title: I like how the story end
Review: I like when Bad guy choose to save her daughter instead of killing the Gods. BUT there are some parts aren't very convincing. I feel they try to be funny. But it's just awkward.

Author: davidgale-92968
Review_Title: Swords, Sorcery, Live Action Heavy Metal
Review: Confused about all the anger and hate for this. I thought it was awesome.

Author: hisnameisoscar
Review_Title: Could have been so much more if only they'd take their time with the story telling.
Review: As my title mentioned, things seemed rushed to the point where a lot was happening with no time to process the emotions that the characters were going through, how they are dealing with said dealings. The story could possibly have been cut into 2 separate movies with ample time for the story to be more digestible and the buildup would surely have been worth it.

Author: mohammadakimul-40622
Review: Not as I expected. But it wasn't bad. It was a average movie. I think this movie should have been more long. Marvel could have showed more things.but overall it was average. If you ask me if it is worth the money. Well it depends on who is watching. Because everyone's test of movie's are not the same.

Author: khamazaspyan
Review: I expected that Thor: Love and Thunder to be better than Ragnarok, or maybe equal to it, but expectations were not met.

Author: tcole-00977
Review: Taika Waititi gave the Thor movies a real breath of fresh air with Ragnarok and the same spirit continues into Love and Thunder. This movie was a lot of fun, only complaint I have was that I would have loved to see more Christian Bale. Bale's performance sold the character of Gorr, an extra 10 or 20min on the runtime with more Bale would have been great. Overall great movie, love the direction Thor's character is taking.

Author: kaminskicaleb
Review: I usually rate marvel movies 9.5's or higher but from 2020 to now I've been rating them below 7.7 the only one that Executed really well Was Spider man no way home that was a 10 for me No uncalled for scenes but ACTUAL scenes that pertain to the plot of the the movie it. Thor Love and Thunder was a dishonor to the comics and the fan base and the only reason I gave it a 7 because of the spectacular performance Of Chris Hemsworth Natalie Portman and Christian bale and the visual effects but Would i suggest others to watch this movie? No.

Author: raphstamos
Review: Despite the cheesy-ness the action and plot were great; however Gorr killing the gods seemed rushed as we only saw 1 god die due to the hand of Gorr and he barely fought back. Jane's cancer felt very rushed and so did killing Zeus.

Author: bwsflash80
Review: Another movie about in which we see the same lame jokes as always. Sadly, some of these jokes are randomly inserted at times where the movie is about to have a solid serious scene. Of course, as with recent Disney/Marcel titles, the male hero cannot be the real hero in his own movie, see Dr Strange.

Author: ashishranjan-1509
Review_Title: Hope this is worst of all Marvel.
Review: Don't know what they were thinking while shooting this movie. Last time I thought Doctor strange is worst of all Marvel collection but this movie proved me wrong. It seems they don't know what to direct after Avengers. Worst script. Or they should give a disclaimer that this movie is made for 10 years old kids only. Utter nonsense in the name of frictional genre.

Author: penguinator-31522
Review_Title: Probably the worst movie I have ever seen.
Review: I came into the movie not being pretty neutral towards it, I was neither exited or thought it was gonna be trash. The movie started okay the very first fight scene with the music was pretty solid honestly, Thor jumping up and then coming back down looked really goofy and kind of bad but the rest was pretty cool until he was in between the two vehicle things holding them apart with his legs it ruined the flow of the fight because the scene went from being pretty cool to it being funny, and after that fight the movie kind of just downward spirals into becoming complete trash. Maybe I'm no the audience for the jokes but none of them in this movie where funny (I'm 17 idk if I'm the target for the jokes.) their was one or two which I laughed a little at but when it came to the tens of other jokes in the movie I either cringed or just didn't find it remotely funny, I did laugh quite a bit but almost never at jokes just cause of how dumb some parts of the movie are at times. Next reason is Amy Shummer is in this movie, thankfully not for long but she is here which was painful to see the only way the play scene could have been more of a waste of time and painful to watch was if James Corden ran on the stage to say something funny. Thank god he didn't or else I would have died from the cringe. Now back to the plot, Jane Foster just gets to wield Mjolnir? I haven't read the comics maybe that is how happens their, and if it is then it's still a pretty trash way to do it. She just says later in the movie, oh Mjolnir was calling to me, why? Why is it calling to here? Seriously is their a reason that is explained outside of this movie or did I miss something like why does it call to her just cause dated Thor years ago? Honestly just trash storytelling. Next is why is Zeus such a pussy like come on he was told that their was a decent threat to the gods just running around and was either scared or lazy I don't remember precisely, but like why all he has to do is tell the god, "Hey, guys lets get the thousands of us and spend a couple days going to this guy, kill him destroy the sword and then won't have to worry even a bit about any of it and we can live peacefully with no potential threat of any of us being murdered." Seriously if they just did this they might, and even this is pushing it, loose 1 or 2 gods. Ok so who cares Zeus doesn't even have to risk his life, he can tell the other gods to deal with the problem. This plot point of Zeus not wanting to deal with this problem is the worst part of the movie. It seriously baffles me that this is how it went down. A better way to do the whole city of the gods scene to confront Zeus would be, they go their and find out a ton of gods where slaughtered by Gorr because they were lazy and unprepared to fight and it's down to just a few gods like 4 or 5 with Zeus and their all terrified. It would make at least more sense and my way of doing the is kind of trash because at that point they should be scared so they are willing to fight to try and save themselves, but this way is far better than how it goes down. I honestly think this is one of the worst plot points I have seen in any type of media. Now for the rest of the movie, their is just so much pointless talking that I just couldn't care about at all this was a problem in the previous parts of the movie but after the Omnipicity scene it got way worse, In a good movie exposition is used to tell you important things that affect the plot or ongoing storyline, I don't think any exposition did that in this movie. I damn fell asleep from it being so boring, that should not be happening, a movie shouldn't be so boring especially a mainstream movie for just your average person to the point were I'm falling asleep. Now for the end of the movie Thor just seems weak as hell like when Gorr has them held by the tentacles or whatever your telling me he isn't able to even resist slightly at all, the dude is frozen their until Jane is almost choked to death and then he calls Stormbreaker. Also I don't think a movie could possibly build less suspense than this one for the final scene I was not worried at all for Thor or the children's lives and I was completely right because they all came out fine damn near without a scratch. Now for the very end of the movie why did it take so long for him to make his wish to Eternity like seriously bro had a whole like 30 seconds to say it but he is just chilling their until Thor is like "yo bro bring your daughter back because love bro", then Gorr is like "damn bro my bad that is a great idea my g imma do that." Then he brings his daughter back and dies right after. In conclusion worst movie I have ever seen, best parts are the songs, all of the songs used are great songs and went well with what was going on especially that first scene, using Welcome to the Jungle made the scene pretty hype. Aside from that Chris Hemsworth looks like a god, not gay but like damn bros arms are huge.

Author: mahikaamin
Review:
WARNING: SPOILERS AHEAD
I've been lucky enough to watch this movie twice now so I think I can express my opinion about it in a somewhat coherent way. I know it's got mixed reviews online but I think the movie has done what it's set out to do- align Thor's character development. Ragnarok saw Thor losing most, if not all, of what he loved- Odin, Asgard and even Mjolnir- and propelled his character in a new, fresh direction which is why it was so well-received by fans (and me too, it's my fav MCU movie). I feel that Endgame, however, set Thor's character back in terms of characterisation and development so this movie had to pick up the slack and sort of re-route it to a better path. It also provided context to Thor and Jane's backstory, propelled it forward and ultimately gave an end to that plotline.

Do they want to end the frenchise? Or is it marketing? But no. It's just a genius approach to cancer, where the narrative is made for children and adults too. The lack of Gorrs character development, makes it look like death is less strong and not that frightening, while bringing down gods to human level creates a feeling, that they are closer and you can be one too, which is proven in the film when the children and Jane became gods and battle with death. Also they made the post credit scene in a way in which is perfectly show that this film is just a "spinoff" for those who needs it more than you. Perfect narrative with perfect execution, digestible for children enough to understand and not be frightened, and heavyweight enaugh for adults.

I also liked the villain's backstory and how he did a full circle as a character. As for the final touch of the movie, I would have to pick the music that they used throughout the entirety of the film. All in all, I would say that Thor 4 is a good movie that everyone can watch and enjoy.

Author: SilenceYourCellphones
Review_Title: Christian Bale... and the other guys
Review: Christian Bale shouldn't have had to carry this movie like he did. I've seen great performances from Hemsworth, Portman, Crowe, Pratt, etc... and there didn't seem to be any chemistry between any of these characters. There seemed to be a desire to recreate the successful Thor: Ragnarok film, but with little success. Act I forcibly set up Thor attempting to "find himself" but there was no real follow through on that. Not to mention the lackluster attempt at a pseudo love story between Thor and Jane Foster, who hadn't made an appearance in the MCU for 11 years. There wasn't enough there for the audience to get really invested in that. Thankfully, Christian Bale and the third act saved this movie from falling into the "Shadow World" of dull mediocrity. Thank you Mr. Bale!

Author: carrieheaney-25467
Review_Title: I didn't hate it, but I didn't love it
Review: I am a huge MCU fan and I really wanted to love this, but it tried way too hard to be funny to the point it was cringey. There were some likeable moments and some parts that made me laugh, but after a while it felt as though I was watching a movie aimed at children and also written by children. Sadly, the once mighty Thor has become a joke, and has been deliberately weakened in order to build up the two other female characters in order to be woke and inclusive; It's ok! A powerful man can still rescue and damsel in distress, some of us still like that concept! Speaking of woke and inclusive, it tried too hard at that too, where it almost felt forced and was only included to simply tick a box. Didn't like the talking to his axe and hammer, just stop. Gorr was a brilliant dark villain but it felt like he didn't belong in this film. Such a shame as it could've been so much more, but it just felt a bit too silly.

Author: melliemore
Review_Title: Everyone's being a little too harsh...
Review: Compared to the rest of the Marvel movies and tv series' this is one of the better ones. We are in an "after infinity wars phase," there does have to be some build-up to a real bad guy and there does have to be some filler movies. If it was just action movie after action movie, you all would still hate Marvel and would complain they have lost their sense of humor. To me this movie actually felt whole, at the end the movie felt complete, unlike some other marvel content thats come out recently (i.e. Falcon and the winter soldier, multiverse of madness, and even moonknight). Thor has never been a serious character and we have to remember that, he is supposed to be silly. Similar to Shakespeare's plays Thor is the jester/the clown, he is there to break up all the darkness and distress. The first Thor movie was not serious either and guess what: the bad guy in that was a f'in tin-man! Gore is much better. My only criticism is that I wish they fleshed out his story a little more, showed him kill more gods in person and made it a little more, pun intended, gore-y. Do I think marvel need to lay out its timeline a little better and get to the point of phase four already, yes. Marvel is slacking in their game plan, don't take it out on Thor.

Author: koriellaaa
Review: This is my first official review on here and I feel like I had to make it, because while this wasn't my favorite marvel movie.... it was still miles ahead of the first two Thor movies- so why the heck are y'all rating it so low?! I gave it an 8/10 because I liked it well enough to give it a 9 but I knew that critically, it's more around a 7/7.5. Sure some of the jokes were a little cringe and overdone (lookin at you, goats screaming) but I got the sense that stuff like that was meant for a younger audience. I hate to break it to most of you, but superhero comics (and thusly their movie counterparts) were always meant to be geared toward about a 12-14 year old. My little sister loved the movie until she got online, seeing grown men complain about stuff that doesn't even matter lmao. No, the movie wasn't perfect and no, I'm not advocating for false positivity- but the sheer amount of hate I've seen for this movie seems very hive-mind generated. Like, shut up, oh my god. Maybe it's because I'm a woman and therefore my superhero movie opinions are automatically wrong (ha) but.... This fandom is starting to feel like Star Wars. They're not going to make the same movie over and over again; get over it!! Some are more serious and some are more silly. Ragnarok is one of-if not my-favorite marvel movie(s). Yes it balanced the jokes and action a little better. But this one is literally called "love and thunder" and I personally thought that meant it was SUPPOSED to be a little ridiculous.

Review_Title: The definition of a good superhero movie
Review: I really don't get most of the negative reviews. This is everything a superhero movie should be - it has creative action scenes with quality effects, a great cast, likable and entertaining heroes, an interesting villain (though he could have used some more screen time), and some solid emotional development, all without outstaying its welcome. Is it the best Marvel movie? No; however, it's incredibly enjoyable if you like Taika Waititi's sense of humor.

Author: andrewstewart-43755
Review_Title: Would Really Like To See The Movie Taika Was Trying To Make
Review: So much of the pacing felt rushed. Repeatedly we're thrown into the middle of a giant set piece or action scene with next to no build, and then tossed right into another without letting what just happened sit with the audience. Word is Taika's first cut of the movies was around 4hrs long. Disney mandated a two-hour cut. This was the result.

Author: mortonsam-49043
Review: Ragnarok was one of the funniest MCU movies, some would say it was the saving grace of the movie. The opposite is true with Love and Thunder. Not a single joke landed, not due to poor chemistry or delivery, but a feeling of forcefulness ruins each joke. It feels like Waititi heard the praises of his last movie and decided to run with that and that only. It doesn't work with this story. Balancing screaming goats with a lead who is dying of cancer is not a good idea. The greatest compliment to this movie I can give is Bale's performance as Gorr. Bale is terrifying, entrancing, and unhinged all at the same time. This greatness from Bale almost is a detriment to the rest of the film, as the tonal clash between the different plots is genuinely distracting. Nothing was more disappointing than Russel Crowe's character Zeus. I was stoked to see what angle they'd take with Zeus. Instead he's just a minor inconvenience on the way to Thor's inevitable victory. Hemsworth and Portman's chemistry is better than it was in any other Thor film, but that isn't saying much. The actors are giving it their all, and I don't blame them in the slightest for the outcome of the film. Instead I blame the 'comedy' writers who overkilled their roll in the writing process.

Author: HeavySpells

Review: Too many nerds on here that take superhero movies way too seriously downvoting this movie. This movie was super funny I was seriously laughing out loud. That's why guardians and avengers are so good, because they're funny, have amazing stories, and cool actors. Taika killed again. People downvoting probably don't even like Jo Jo Rabbit and are more into movies like suicide squad.

Author: jackjzusa
Review_Title: I Love how guardians adds a whole new theme to Thor universe
Review: Love and Thunder absorbs the energy of a relative who is going through a mid-life crisis. They are drawn to a variety of interesting hobbies, but most of them do not last. The impulsive motorbike either stays in the garage or returns to the showroom floor. Thor, as a character, continues to provide a shock of delight to the MCU whenever it is required. His character arc paved the way for him to branch out into various genres. Love and Thunder will remind you of fantasy adventure flicks like The Neverending Story, where the unbelievable may happen. At the same time, it may get in its own way by attempting to tackle as much as it does.

Review: I've loved Marvel superheroes since their film adaptation. Thor was my favorite comic personage. And it was very satisfying to finally see his hero prefer to be adapted to the cinema. Unfortunately, it has become so bad and has become more so bad as they produce a cinematographic adaptation. I keep wondering what happened. Before looking at it, I remember very well thinking that they could not do worse than the 3, and well yes.... Thor Love and Thunder had an exceptional cast and enormous means to succeed in making a film that would have marked the Heart. But they managed to lay us the worst Marvel movie I can remember. We are used to Marvel movies not being cinematic nuggets, but they have hit rock bottom here. Between The axe that throws Thor into jealousy because Thor is arguing with the hammer and the grotesque representation of Tanngrisnir and Tanngnjóstr; which, are the two goats that pull the chariot of the god Thor. Not making horror to their grandiose role in the life of the god Thor.

Author: fabrizio-damore
Review: The main character (Thor) has lost his majesty and has become a character with silly humor, low profile. Cheesy, suitable for a sit-com. Only the artificial applause is missing. Even the plot does not stand up very much and does not contribute to the story of the character. To be forgotten quickly. Obviously nothing to do with the Thor from Infinity War.

Author: weasal19
Review: If it wasn't for Bale this movie would have been a total flop. I actually can't believe that I sat through that whole movie to almost cheer for the bad guy. If Gorr had of triumphed it would have made a better ending then the ditzy ass thor they created; im pretty sure Thor got stupider with ever movie. After watching this I'm convinced that the marvel universe has really died with ironman sooooooooo sad. The only thing that has been refreshing in this new stage of the marvel universe has been the show Moom Knight, at least it had something new to offer compared to all the other shows and movies that have followed End Game. I seriously hope that there isn't another Thor to follow that greek tragedy.

Author: christian_kellner
Review: It was to much. And I really enjoy his humor in Ragnarok. There it was the perfect balance between humor and Story and acting. But this time it felt like he wanted to make this awesome humor twists (like with Jeff Goldblum and conversations between Hulk and Thor in Ragnarok) to make a Movie out of it. You couldn't take anything serious anymore. It totally lost the Drama structure, felt more like a Parody. But still.. 6/10 because it is enjoyable and I love the MCU building up again.

Author: faaalopez
Review: Aside from a few laughs there's not much but an empt soulless movie that lacks to capture the imagination of its audience. Movie Director decided to take Thor a different route but failed miserably.

Author: neca-for-president
Review_Title: Was it a joke about itself?
Review: Great cast, super creative, amazing reinterpretation of the villain but no story at all. Disconnected from the previous MCU movies not adding anything to the general storyline.

Author: arnoldfoppen
Review: Most terrible move of marvel ever , stupid humor. I love marvel but where did this go wrong. Its Thor is back being a child. Graphics where nice but the story horrible.

Author: mikedscott12
Review: So disappointed. Think this kills off the Marvel franchise. No points in listing where this film failed. First time I've walked out of a movie in a long time. Thank god we had a bottle of wine in the cinema or we would have walked out in the first 20 mins.

Author: chris-saaga
Review: Love it, hilarious and entertaining. Not gonna lie. It's everything and more you want & expect from Thor. Don't listen to the nay nays living to boo boo the sunshine for being too shiny and moonlight too bright.

Author: voicethatcarry
Review_Title: bad cut. wait for full release.
Review: Movie is 4 hours but they released terrible 2 hours cut. Scenes are empty, i was wat da hell just happened ? How they got here ? How mjolnir glued ? Wat are they fighting against ? Wats the purpose ? Where da hell thay guy came from ? Why god killer suddenly have lots of cuts ? Questions questions. Zeus scene soooo boring. It is really boring movie. Dont watch this crap. Just wait for full release.

Author: breethon
Review_Title: Loved Ragnarock. This one is bad.
Review: The goats - they were funny a few times after that it was way over done. Same with the rock guy. Reminded me of Jar Jar Binks in Star Wars. Terrible. Loved Natalie's performance.

Author: jonesbarron
Review_Title: Taika Waititi's Disney comedy special falls flat on its face
Review: Before you read on just know that I'm one of those people that believes Marvel has significantly overstayed its welcome in theaters for some time. However, I end up watching almost every marvel movie, due to my friends constant nagging about how I'm too good to join them and enjoy a lighthearted flick. So I had a "couple" beers before attending this movie in hopes that I'd be more open to the ridiculousness that I was about to encounter.

Author: mooredarian
Review_Title: Marvel and Disney should be ashamed...
Review: This garbage pale of a Saturday Night Live parody is easily the most ridiculous scramble of bad comedic timing, horrible dialogue, and piss-poor CGI that the MCU has ever released. Literally from the first 5 minutes I wanted to walk out of the theater. I gave it an hour and it didn't get better. Save your money, pretend this film doesn't exist.

Author: mcnairtitan
Review: This movie was very enjoyable. The kids loved it. But it doesn't belong in the MCU. I am a huge fan of the MCU and give the entire timeline a rewatch before the big team-up movies. But I will probably leave Thor 4 out in the future. It just undermines so many great things that took years to build up to in past films. Maybe there is a director's cut somewhere that explains some of this stuff but the end product I watched in the theater last night was borderline parody.

Author: stevensonkindles
Review: While it wasn't a total waste, it felt like they tried to hard to copy the energy and momentum of the last movie and failed miserably. Certain scenes felt like recreations and/or could have been left out and not missed. The music felt forced this go around, with the exact same fight stances making it feel like they used the same CG and just bit in a different cassette!

Author: satsjunk-637-707486
Review_Title: MCU Bosses must've asked their under 10s kids Script this and produce
Review: I don't normally leave reviews but felt the need to for this one..

Author: antoine-manolov-662-832861
Review_Title: Sadly its not a serious movie it more like a parody
Review: I know it doesn't deserve that rating but i kinda had fun i just wish it was a bit more serious. The acting was great as always but they really need to work it out for the future. They are just throwing projects after projects and i really expect more of them.

Author: mustang400
Review: Wasted performances from Christian bale and even Chris Henesworth. Seems all he did was bulk up for the role. Entire movies is a funny sequence and not in a good way.

Author: namite0001
Review: Objectively, I can see why folks may not say this is a strong movie, but as a queer person I just loved everything in this movie. Yes it wasn't the strongest, but I will be thinking of Tessa Thompson as Valkyrie for the next year now.

Author: benesimons
Review: Empty shallow and an absolute joke, they had the opportunity to make a good film here but chose to make it farcical. Thor and his constant one-liners, screaming goats that just annoy and endless puns with no content or grounding.

Author: jrmcl148
Review: I loved Thor in his previous movies and in the comics he was my favourite. Now they have turned him into a wimp of a God. Powerful speeches turned to nothing. Overdoing of the humor poor story the rock guy surely he's not gay. The last couple of MCU movies have been really poor. Marvel you need to life your game.

Author: joshuarowland1229
Review: Sex, screaming goats, joke, someone dies, repeat. That's the entire movie. What is going on with marvel? Christian Bale was the only good part of this movie. I watched this because my friends were trying to convince me to watch all the shows and movies because they all have there own "purpose" and to take them for what they are. Animations are really cool in this movie but every joke and goat scream made me want to turn it off. I genuinely felt like I was forcing myself to finish the film. I feel like they're condensing all these characters to the bare minimum just to keep the content machine rolling. I've been Marveled out for a while now and it just keeps getting harder to watch the next thing with everything I force upon myself. I really hope Black Panther lives up to the hype.

Author: thomas-lombard
Review: I liked just 3 things in this movie : the beginning with the Gardians of the Galaxy (1 point), the Guns (1 point) & the Roses (1 point).

Author: BDDuck
Review: I walked into this movie wanting to love it so badly.

Author: miklosschembri
Review: It was better for this movie to have had a different story then the story about Gorr. What is understandable is how the Gods part that being lazy and looking out of shape and scared so that I can close an eye. The part where they put the children in the movie looks to be forced and out of context, maybe to show that Asgard is growing again?

Author: magkev-37-721167
Review: I have just sent through this film and I'm so disappointed! Somebody needs to reign Taika Waititi in. A film with the occasional joke is good. A film that is a joke from start to finish is not! Thor has been made out to be a self-absorbed, unintelligent idiot.

Author: Mikegila
Review_Title: What a complete waste of time!
Review: Hands down Chris Hemsworth is the best person to play Thor. However, the last two movies weren't so good. Not because of the acting but because the writers/director/producer have changed for the worse. This film has completely made Thor look stupid/whimpish. The writing is horrible! They need to bring the originals writers back from the first film. No more directing from Taika Cohen (aka - Taika Waititi). Why does Natalie Portman call her self Mighty Thor? Why does she call herself Thor at all? There is only one Thor and its Chris Hemsworth. It really is too bad as this Thor in this movie is nothing like the comic books. Message to Chris Hemsworth if the following writers (Taika Waititi and Jennifer Kaytin Robinson) are back to write Thor 5 please tell Marvel/Disney you want either new writers or the orginal writers (Ashley Miller, Zack Stentz and Don Payne) from the first film. The first film was creatively done.

Author: Johnwilliamsburner
Review: Great, fun movie. The nerds will give it bad reviews because Luke skywalker didn't kill the bad guy or something.

Author: anulandar
Review: Sweet and funny and makes your heart hurt. Hemsworth is very very good in this one, and the direction is better than ever. The humor is okay, not better than Ragnarok for sure.

Author: gungortaner
Review: I think the audience for the movie are children and their parents. I expected a more serious film but its not. Some jokes' timings are not good, gorr tries to be serious but he can't. We never see gorr kill o god after the opening scene.

Author: vladq
Review: The background story is great! However, the actual implementation is too slobbery... ruins the whole thing. This is a child's movie, but it should have been a good comic movie!! 4 stars... unfortunately (I would very much like to give 10 stars)

Author: adil_al-duree
Review:
It's actually a good movie it's not bad as ppl describe it
Let's break down
Storyline 6/10 not the best one
CGI & Graphics 10/10 yeah Marvel got the best CGI
The villain 10/10 Christian Bale gave life to the movie he's the brightest thing u will see in this movie
Leading characters 8/10 Except for Zeus yeah he's bad
Music 8/10
Ending 10/10 The ending and Christian Bale the biggest reason's u should watch it
So far it looks like a very good movie so where's the problem yeah u guess it its the cheap Comedy who ruined the whole movie with the story
Comedy -10/10.........................................

Author: braden-04793
Review: This movie has great moments and great comedy, however a lot of scenes and story points in the middle feel odd, as well as an ending with a slight twist, that isn't all that. This shows promise for the future of the MCU but cuts branches down of what could've been in the future as well. I'd still rewatch and enjoy the movie, but all shock factor is gone after the first time watching it.

Author: sfrasineanu-05006
Review_Title: Aside from some visuals, it's as bad as reviewers here say.
Review: Just watched half of it and couldnt finish it.

Author: lemedeadagain
Review: Thor, the God of... wait, was he an Avenger or something?
